*Teleport out to prepare for the fight against Nezikchened, and return to the first room of the cave.
*Refill your bowl with sacred water, if needed. (Leaving the jungle has a chance to evaporate the water.)
*Use the golden bowl (be sure it is filled with sacred water) on the fire surrounding Ungadulu.
*Use the binding book on Ungadulu (careful not to left-click attack him).
*Defeat Nezikchened. (Lvl-187).
**Your prayer will be drained to 1/10 of your level at the beginning of the fight. If you take too long to kill Nezikchened, he will de-spawn and you must leave the circle and repeat the water & binding book steps.
**Ranged or melee with Protect from Melee activated is recommended, as he has high magic resistance.
*Talk to Ungadulu (careful not to left-click attack). 
*Exit, then summon and speak with Gujuo. 
*Use your bowl of water on the seeds.
*Cut some more reeds and attempt to refill the bowl.
*Call and talk with Gujuo.

Items needed: Radimus notes, ardrigal, snake weed, vial of water, means to cast any Charge Orb spell (double amount if choosing long/"good" path), an unpowered orb (two if choosing long/"good" path), blessed gold bowl, Yommi tree seeds, a lockpick, a rope, a pickaxe, combat equipment, food, prayer potion(s), Rune or Dragon axe (Any other axe will not work) and a machete. It is recommended to bring more than 1 lockpick if you can, in case you break it.
*Using the map above, collect the ardrigal (search the large-leaved palm trees) and snake weed (search one of the marshy jungle vines) if extra were not obtained during Jungle Potion. Mix them with a vial of water for a bravery potion.
*Drink the potion now to save space. Prepare to go through the cave again. You do not need the SMELL runes.
*Go through the cave to the chamber with the gem-pools where you found the binding book. Cast the charge orb spell on the north gate.
*Use your rope on the winch and climb down. Drink the bravery potion first if you haven't already
**If you forgot a rope, smash a barrel. A monster may spawn from the barrel.
**You can fall and will take a large amount of damage (10-20), so be sure your health is high.
**The rope is not needed for future visits; search the winch to find your rope again.
*Do not interact with the blue hat if you wish to choose the "good" path.
*Climb over the rocks to reach the bottom. You can again fall and take a lot of damage (40+).
*Kill each of the 3 different skeletons (Lvl-106, Lvl-100, and Lvl-92) to get the 3 crystal pieces.
*Use each crystal piece on the north-east furnace.
*There is 1 searchable mossy rock in the middle of this room. Use the heart on it.
*Run south-east and use the heart on the recess next to the barrier. Walk through the barrier.
*Push one of the boulders to the west and then talk to Echned Zekin. 
*For the "evil" short path:
**Climb back to the top of the ridge, equip the dagger, try to take the hat, and kill Viyeldi by attacking him during the dialogue. Your dagger will be glowing after this step. Make sure this is the case before you go back down the ridge.
**Warning: a level 187 demon will spawn as soon as this step is complete and drain your prayer points prior to the fight 
**Go back and push the boulder. The ghost will take the dagger from you.
**Defeat Nezikchened.
**Push the boulder.
**Fill your bowl with water and use it on your seeds if you haven't done so already.
**Note: Teleporting will evaporate the water! However, the water pool is now restored and you can get the water from there.
*For the "good" long path:
**Do not try to pick up the blue hat or talk to Viyeldi.
**Teleport out and bank if desired for traversing the cave again.
**Go back to the beginning of the cave. Investigate the fire wall to pass through.
**Use the dark dagger on Ungadulu.
**Head back into the cave as before, using another Charge Orb spell on the door.
**Push the boulder.
**Do not tell Zekin you lost the dagger; instead, cast the Holy Force spell to reveal his true form.
**Defeat Nezikchened.
**Push the far west boulder out of the way, and collect sacred water.
**Note: Teleporting will evaporate the water! However, the water pool is now restored and you can get the water from there.

*Skills needed: 45 Herblore (boostable) Use the germinated seeds on the fertile soil patch (8 steps north and 5 steps west of the pool). Note: It is possible to be unsuccessful when planting the seeds. Plant the seeds again until a sapling grows. If more seeds are needed, visit the cave and speak to Ungadulu for more.
*Once planted, the yommi bush will grow leaves. Use the sacred water on it and it will become an adult yommi tree.
*Use your axe on the adult yommi tree. Use your axe on the downed tree twice to make it into a totem.
** Warning The yommi tree will rot if you take too much time before carving it and you will need to redo the process, including getting sacred water.
*Lift it from the ground and you will now have a yommi totem in your inventory.
*If "evil" path was chosen:
**Turn on Protection from Melee  before  the next step, as you will take 4 hits without being able to move, eat, or turn on prayers - you can get hit for up to 72 damage all on the same tick. It is recommended to keep praying at all times.
**Use your totem on any old, brown totem pole.
**Kill the three skeletons that appear one at a time, then kill Nezikchened. Keep your prayer active after each skeleton dies, as Nezikchened will reappear and hit you four more times.
*If "good" path was chosen:
**Turn on Protection from Melee  before  the next step, as you will take 4 hits without being able to move, eat, or turn on prayers - you can get hit for up to 72 damage all on the same tick. It is recommended to keep praying at all times.
**Use your totem on any old, brown totem pole.
**Turn on Protect from Melee and defeat Nezikchened.
*Use your totem on the pole again.
*Gujuo will appear and give you a gilded totem. If he doesn't show up, swing the bullroarer.
*Collect 5 palm leaves for the Karamja Hard Diary if needed (you can drop and pick up the same palm leaf several times).
*Collect a vanilla pod for Recipe for Disaster if needed.

*Talk to Radimus at the Legends Guild (fairy ring ) with the gilded totem AND Radimus notes.
*Talk to Radimus again in the main guild hall and select four skills for training.
*Talk to Radimus one more time.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*In Seers' Village, go to the house immediately south of the anvil.
*Search the bookcase on the eastern wall to find a battered book.
*Read the book, then use a knife on it to get a Battered key.
** There is a knife spawn in the house north of the church if you forgot to bring one.
**Note: You'll need the book later, so don't get rid of it.
*Go to the building with anvil and open the Odd looking wall in the north (with the key in inventory).
*Go down the stairs.

*Go into the room to the north.
*Turn the water controls east of the water wheel.
*Turn the water controls west of the water wheel.
*Pull the lever by the water wheel.
*(Optional) Kill one of each of the Elemental to complete Kandarin Easy Task. For the Earth Elemental, you must defeat one of the actual Elementals walking around; the rock that turns into the Elemental won't count towards the requirement.
*(Optional) To obtain leather, search a crate north of the staircase in the middle room.
*(Optional) To obtain a needle, search the two stacked crates on the left as you enter the west room.
*Go to the eastern room.
*With a needle, thread, and leather, fix the bellows.
*Pull the lever by the bellows.
*Go to the middle room and search the boxes in the north-east to get a stone bowl.
*Go to the south room.
*Use a stone bowl on the lava trough to the south.
*Use the bowl of lava on the Furnace in the room.

*Go to the western room and mine an elemental rock.
*Kill the Earth elemental and pick up the elemental ore it drops (get 2 more ores if you are planning to do Elemental Workshop II).
*Use the elemental ore and four coal on the furnace in the southern room. You will get an Elemental metal.
*With the slashed book, go to the middle room and smith an elemental shield by using the elemental metal on the workbench.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Take all required items with you.
*Speak with Martin the Master Gardener in the Draynor Market. 
**Note: Do not pickpocket Martin or you won't be able to continue for 10 minutes of in-game time.
*Wait 5 minutes (Real World Time) and speak to Martin the Master Gardener again. 
*Now make your way to Fairy Nuff's grotto in Zanaris just north of the bank.
*Take Nuff's Healing certificate off the floor, right-click it and study it. (If lost, you can obtain another Healing certificate by searching the Potion shelves in Fairy Nuff's grotto.)
*Head to the south-west area of Zanaris, read the Rune temple sign just south of the Cosmic Altar.
*Talk to the Fairy Godfather in the throne room. 
*Talk to the Co-ordinator just north of the throne room. You can now use the fairy rings. 
*Talk to Fairy Fixit near the fairy ring west of the throne room.

*Now, equip your Dramen staff, and teleport using the fairy ring in this sequence:, , (You will not go anywhere),  - (Note: You can right click configure but you must have the Nuff's certificate in your inventory)
*Talk to Fairy Nuff and Fairy Very Wise in the NE corner of the area.
*Go back to Zanaris  and pickpocket the Fairy Godfather while he and his henchmen aren't looking.
*Go back to the hideout and give the Queen's secateurs to Fairy Nuff. 
**Note: Do not mix the magic essence potion before learning how to make it from the Fairy or it will not revive the Fairy Queen when used on her.
*Travel to fairy code . Wait here (2-5 mins) until a star flower has grown then pick it. (You must have Nuff's certificate with you for this to work.)
*Travel to fairy code . Kill a gorak and pick up its gorak claws. Goraks can be safespotted using some terrain. 
*Return to the hideout. 
*Talk to Fairy Nuff.
*Now use the star flower on your vial of water and grind the gorak claws to receive gorak claw powder, then use the two items on each other to make a magic essence potion.
*RIGHT-CLICK use the magic essence on the queen, laying on the stretcher near Fairy Nuff.
*Speak with the Fairy Queen to complete the quest.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Talk to Arianwyn in Lletya.
*(optional) Note to Ironmen:  if you do not have a death talisman, search the bookshelves for a book titled Prifddinas' history. You might need it later as part of the 50 items and this will allow you to potentially save time and a charge on your teleport.
*Wearing your mourner gear, talk to Essyllt under the hideout in West Ardougne (north-east corner of town). He gives you the new key.
*Run west through the cave, keep going until you find the dead bodies. There will be a cutscene.
*Search a guard corpse for Edern's journal.
*Follow the red line in the map to get to the black crystal.
*Use your chisel to chip off a piece.
*Return and talk to Arianwyn in Lletya to enchant your crystal.

*Go back to the Temple of Light.
*Take the eastern set stairs, that are directly in front of the entrance, to the middle floor.
*Head to the area indicated by the rope on the guide map and use your rope on the rocks.
*Drop your new key.
*Head to the area marked with mirror #1 just east of the stairs.
*Pull the crystal dispenser on the wall to reset the puzzle and then collect all of the items which includes mirrors and a .
*Place Mirror #1 to shine the light north.
* Mirror #2 points west.
* Mirror #3 points south.
*Place the . The light will turn yellow.
* Mirror #4 points east.
*Cross the gap to the other side. Use any agility boosts you have. You will have to cross this gap a second time later.
*Open the chest to obtain 2 mirrors and a.

*Reset the puzzle at the crystal dispenser and collect all items.
* Mirror #1 points north.
* Mirror #2 points west.
*Place the . The light will turn cyan.
* Mirror #3 points north.
* Mirror #4 points east.
*Place the . The light will turn green.
*Open the chest to obtain 2 mirrors.
*Do NOT reset the puzzle.

*Pick up the and replace it with  Mirror #5 pointing up (east) to the top floor.
*Climb the north ladder to the top floor.
* Mirror #6 points west. The light to the west turns blue.
*Go back to the middle floor and take the south stairs up to the top floor.
* Mirror #7 points down toward the middle floor. Long side of the mirror should be on east side.
*Climb to the bottom floor.
*Head to  Mirror #8, going through the eastern yellow barrier. Turn  Mirror #8 to point south.
*Go through the southern barrier and follow the path. Open the chest to obtain 2 mirrors and a .
*Go back through the southern barrier and rotate the mirror to point east.
*Exit through the eastern barrier.
*Do NOT reset the puzzle.

*Take the east stairs to the middle floor.
*Take out the and place the  instead. The light will now be yellow.
*Climb up the south ladder to the top floor.
*Rotate  Mirror #7 to shine the light south. This light should be red. Run south to mirror 8.
* Mirror #8 point down toward the middle floor. Long side of the mirror should be north side.
*Climb down the south ladder to the middle floor.
*Use the rope shortcut to reach the bottom floor.
*Head to  Mirror #9 and open the chest to obtain a blue crystal.

*Reset the puzzle
* Mirror #1 points north.
* Mirror #2 points west.
* Mirror #3 points south.
*Place the . The light will turn yellow.
* Mirror #4 points east.
*Cross the gap to the other side.
*Place the .
*Remove Mirror #4.
*Rotate  Mirror #3 pointing up.
*Use the south stairs to head to the top floor.

*Place Mirror #4 in the new position pointing south.
*Place the .
* Mirror #5 makes the western light point down. (Big part of mirror east)
* Mirror #6 makes the southern light point east.
* Mirror #7 points down. (Big part of mirror west)
*Go to the bottom floor.
* Mirror #8 points south.
* Mirror #9 points east.
* Mirror #10 points north.
*Open the chest to obtain 3 mirrors and a second.

*Reset the puzzle.
* Mirror #1 points north.
* Mirror #2 points down. (Big part of mirror south)
*Use the east stairs to go down to the bottom floor.
* Mirror #3 points west.
*Place the .
* Mirror #4 points the northern light up.
*Place the .
* Mirror #5 points the western light up.
* Mirror #6 points the eastern light up.
*Climb the east stairs to the middle floor.
*Place the . The light will turn yellow.
*Climb up the north ladder to the top floor.
* Mirror #7 points west. You should see the light turn red at the pillar to the west.
*Climb down the north ladder to the middle floor.
*Climb up the south ladder to the top floor.
* Mirror #8 points west.
* Mirror #9 points west.
* Mirror #10 points north.
*Cross to the north part of the top floor via the middle stairs.
* Mirror #11 points west.
*Place the . The light will turn blue.
* Mirror #12 points south.
* Mirror #13 points east.
*Go down the middle stairs twice to the inner part of the ground floor.
*Rotate Mirror #14 so it points west.
*Go through to the Death Altar.
*When you're ready to leave, make sure to turn  Mirror #14 back towards the entrance door, otherwise to get back in here you will have to go through the Underground Pass to get back.

*If you do not have a death talisman/tiara or catalytic talisman/tiara, refer to the full guide to get the 50 required items.
**Returning to Thorgel: go up the eastern stairs, then south and up the ladder to the top floor to return to Thorgel. Climb the stairs down to the altar twice.
*Make sure to bring your newly made crystal you obtained at the start of the quest.
*Enter the Death Altar.
*Use the uncharged newly made crystal on the altar.
*Use the charged newly made crystal on the black crystal on the top floor.
*Travel to Lletya.
*Talk to Arianwyn.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Talk to Larry by the penguin cage in the Ardougne Zoo. 
*Talk to Larry again.

*Travel to the dock northeast of Rellekka and speak to Larry to sail to the Iceberg.
*Use an oak plank on firm snow patch. 
*Use your spade on, or dig next to, the newly built hut to cover it in snow.
*Talk to Larry to enter the bird hide and PAY ATTENTION to this cutscene.
**Note: Take note of the 3 emotes the left penguin is doing (you will need this several times later, you can re-enter the snow bird hide to watch again before the next step if needed). If you moved onto next step, you cannot go back. You have to spend a lot of time guessing later.
**See the full guide for a reference of emotes.
*Talk to Larry. 
*Left-click Travel back to Rellekka using the nearby boat. 
*Talk to Larry on the dock.
*Read the clockwork book.

Items needed: A regular plank, a steel bar OR a clockwork mechanism, and a piece of silk, access to a Crafting table 3 or better in a POH.
*Go to your POH and use your Crafting table 3 to turn your steel bar into a clockwork mechanism. 
*Click on the table again and select clockwork toy and then clockwork penguin. 
*Return to Ardougne and talk to Larry. 
*Talk to Larry once on the iceberg.

*Return to Ardougne Zoo once again.
*Unequip both hands and cape slots and use the tuxedo-time option on Larry.
*Enter the penguin pen and talk to the penguin. (only one of them has the "talk-to" option)
**Use the 3 greeting emotes from earlier. Check your quest journal if you have forgotten, the emotes are noted in there. 
*Read the mission report and exit the pen.
*Talk to Larry to exit the suit.
*Talk to Larry about the mission report

Items needed: Clockwork suit, mission report, and ring of charos(a) or a raw cod
*Talk to Larry in Fred the Farmer's sheep pen in Lumbridge.
**Use the tuxedo-time option on Larry.
*Talk to the penguins who are disguised as a sheep.
*Do the greeting emotes.
*Exit the penguin suit by talking to Larry.
*Talk to Larry again so he teleports you to the Zoo. 
*Use the tuxedo-time option on Larry.
*Enter the penguin pen and talk to penguin. If using ring of charos(a), make sure it is equipped. Otherwise, use raw cod on Penguin. 
*Exit the suit by talking to Larry.
*Talk to Larry again.

Item needed: Clockwork suit. Already bring: 5 feathers, Swamp tar, Mahogany plank, Leather.
*Go back to Fred the Farmer's sheep pen.
*Use the tuxedo-time option on Larry.
*Talk to the sheep penguin.
*Talk to Larry to exit suit.
*Talk to Fred the Farmer. ( if you have not completed sheep shearer)
**Run north between the first field of cows and the mill toward the dairy cow icon on the map, and steal a cowbell from a dairy cow (right click) for later.
**Kill a chicken if you need 5 feathers.
*Get back into the Penguin suit and talk to the Sheep Penguin. 
**If you do not have swamp tar already, run to the Lumbridge swamp to grab some.
*Talk to Larry again to get teleported to the iceberg. 
*Talk to Larry once at the iceberg.

Items needed: Swamp tar, 5 Feathers, Lumbridge Mission Report, Ardougne Mission Report
*Use the tuxedo-time option on Larry
*Talk to KGP Agent north-west of Larry while in the penguin suit.
*Do the greeting emotes.
*Talk to Noodle.
*Talk to Noodle again to receive the ID card and a mission report. 
*Talk to KGP Agent.
*Click on the avalanche.
*Enter the first room to the west and talk to KGP Agent.
*Exit room through the west door and then through the north door.
*Walk north once outside to the agility course.

*Climb down the steps and into the water.
*Avoid the moving ice in the water.
*Climb the stepping stone at the end.
*Jump across the next stones until you reach an ice platform.
*After you manage to cross, continue on the path until you come to a shelf with icicles on it. Use the tread-softly option to get across. You have to repeat this several times at each shelf. If you fail, you will be hit taking a small amount of damage.
*Next, you have to climb up the ice using a 'Cross Ice' option. This can be very annoying, as you lose 2 hitpoints each time you fail, and the failure rate is surprisingly high. If you have only the minimal Agility — level 30, for example — a small amount of food may help.
*After that, you have a small cutscene of you sliding down a hill.
*Talk to Agility Instructor.
*Unequip the penguin suit and talk to Larry.

* Use the tuxedo-time option on Larry and re-enter the outpost.
*Talk to the KGP Agent by the control panel at the end of the main hall.
*Talk to Ping or Pong in the east room.
*Leave the outpost and head back to Larry.
*Unequip the penguin suit.
*Use mahogany plank on the leather to make penguin bongos.
*Use the tuxedo-time option on Larry.
*Re-enter the outpost.
*Talk to Ping or Pong again. 
*Use the Control panel in the main hall.
*Enter the War Room to the east.

*Kill an icicle-wielding Icelord (you will receive a bonus 40 Attack exp upon killing it.) and exit the pen using the door to the west.
*Use the chasm to the east of the room to return to the surface.
*Talk to Larry.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Talk to Thormac on the top floor of the Sorcerer's Tower south of Seers' Village. 
*Go to Seers Village and speak to a Seer. (Wait until the seer is done checking himself in the mirror.)  Be sure not to skip this step, as the scorpion in Taverly Dungeon is not accessible without first speaking to the seer.
*Scorpions can be caught in any order and there is no need to return between each catch.

*Note: You will need a dusty key if you don't have 70 Agility, make sure to grab it before entering the dungeon.
*Go into Taverley Dungeon, (South Taverley) and go to the poison spider area.
**If you need a dusty key head south to the Black Knights' Base and kill the jailer. Use the key on the jail cell and talk to Velrak the explorer. He will give you the key. Alternatively, a dusty key spawns deep in Taverley Dungeon, near the lava eel fishing spot south of the blue dragon area.
*Directly south of the level 80 Agility shortcut, search the old wall to enter a small room.
*Use the scorpion cage on the Kharid Scorpion. If you try to pick it up, it will sting you instead.

*Go to the Barbarian Outpost (a games necklace is helpful).
*Go inside the fenced in area near the entrance to the agility course.
*Go inside the building in the north-east corner of the area.
*Use the scorpion cage on the Kharid Scorpion. If you try to pick it up, it will sting you instead.
**Note: It is possible for the scorpion to be outside of the small room, in the Agility area, if someone has let it out.

*Go to the Monastery between Edgeville and Ice Mountain (a combat bracelet will take you right there).
*Climb the eastern ladder and go to the east side of the floor.
**Note: If the Monk stops you and says only members of the order may go upstairs, simply say that you want to join and you will be allowed to go upstairs.
*Use the scorpion cage on the Kharid Scorpion. If you try to pick it up, it will sting you instead.

*Return the full scorpion cage to Thormac.
*Congratulations, quest complete!
*Talk to Herman Caranos at the Piscatoris Fishing Colony (north of Fairy ring ); cutscene is optional.
*Talk to the Wise Old Man in Draynor Village.

*Return to the Colony and talk to the Wise Old Man.
*Kill the level 79 Sea Trolls and enter the Colony (collect 7 of their bones if needed).
*Talk to Herman (east building). Note: You will need to click inside of the building as clicking directly on Herman (or the Wise Old Man later) will make your character run outside the building to the north.

*Talk to Franklin Caranos near the entrance.
*Use a log on the firebox (not the furnace) and light it in the building with the Furnace symbol. (Franklin will give you a tinderbox if you speak to him again.)
*Use each of the five iron bars on the Metal Press.
*Use iron sheets to repair the western colony perimeter's broken walls. (Franklin will give you a hammer.)
*Talk to Arnold Lydspor in the bank. (He will give you a Small fishing net if you do not already have one.)
*Fish 5 fresh monkfish at the fishing spot to the north-west, you may need a few more if you burn some while cooking.
**Kill sea trolls when they spawn, as they will increase in difficulty. After 1-3 kills, the sea trolls only drop big bones and cannot be used in the next section of the quest.
*Cook the monkfish in the kitchen, south of the fishing spot. Note: you cannot bank with Arnold to make use of cooking gauntlets.
*Talk to Arnold.
*Talk to Franklin.
*Talk to the Wise Old Man and Herman in the far eastern building.
*Talk to Wizard Frumscone in the basement of the Wizards' Guild in Yanille.

*Talk to Malignius Mortifer south of Falador. He will give you a brown apron in order to be allowed entry to the Crafting Guild.
*Talk to the Master Crafter with dreadlocks in the Crafting Guild on the east side.
**If you brought soft clay, use it on the potter's wheel, then the potter's oven to make a pot and pot lid. If you brought a pickaxe, mine some clay and follow the step above.
*Use Pot and Pot Lid together to make Airtight Pot.
*Talk to Malignius Mortifer to teleport back to the Fishing Colony.

*Talk to Herman to begin the fight. 
*Kill the Sea Troll Queen. (Use Protect from Magic in Melee range, and use Ranged or Melee to kill her)
*Talk to Herman.
*Congratulations, quest complete!
**(Optional) Catch and cook a monkfish to complete a hard Western Provinces Achievement Diary task.

*Talk to Unferth in his house in northern Burthorpe with the catspeak amulet equipped and your cat with you. 
*Speak to Hild in the building north-east of Unferth's house.
*Hild requires 5 death runes to enchant the catspeak amulet.

*Locate Bob the cat using the catspeak amulet (a full list of locations can be found on the full guide page here) and talk to him by doing the following:
**The fastest way to find Bob, is go to the western Varrock anvil or the garden of the Draynor Manor and world-hop until you find him or you can use the steps below to find him legitimately.
**Right click on the 'Locate' option on the amulet in your equipped items.
**Click on the whiskers until the arrow and the eyes glow white.
**Follow the arrow until you find Bob.

*Talk to Gertrude in her house west of Varrock. 
*Speak to Reldo in the Varrock Palace library. 
*Find and speak to Bob the cat again.
**Bob may be in the same location you previously found him, so check there first.

*Go to Sophanem and speak to the Sphinx 
*Return to Unferth's house in Burthorpe and do the following:
**Use your rake on the patch and plant potato seeds in it and wait until they are grown. Your cat will notify you when they are done (the patch will take 15–35 minutes to grow).
**Make the bed.
**Use the logs on the fireplace. Then light the fireplace.
**Use the chocolate cake and bucket of milk on the southern table.
**Use your shears on Unferth to cut his hair. You will continue this animation until he becomes bald.
*Talk to Unferth once all the chores are done.

*Travel to Varrock and speak with the Apothecary. 
*Go to Unferth, unequip any weapons and equip the doctor's hat or nurse hat and desert clothing (top and bottom, make sure the clothing is white) and speak to him with a vial of water in your inventory.
*Locate Bob the cat again and talk to him. (Note that left clicking on Bob or Neite will interrupt the cutscene, putting you in Burthorpe but requiring you to find Bob and start it again).
*After the cutscene, talk to Unferth again.

*Head to Nardah, south of fairy ring, and talk to Awusah the Mayor. 
*Head to the house to the north and talk to Ghaslor the Elder. Make sure to receive ballad. 
*Head to the building north of the fountain and west of Ghaslor's house.
*Search the north-west cupboard for a torn robe top and bottom. Click here to continue when searching or you must search it twice.
*Use a needle and thread on the torn robes (make sure you grab both top and bottom) and equip them
*Telegrab the ancestral key on the table in the east side of the building.

*Follow the river north until you reach a dungeon's cave opening with a waterfall coming out of it. (Alternatively: Necklace of passage Eagle's Eyrie teleport and go south-west)
**Alternatively, take the carpet ride ride back to Shantay Pass, head east, cross the bridge, and follow the River Elid north to the red exclamation point.
**Pluck a Phoenix feather from a desert phoenix for a medium task in the Desert Diary. It is also used in The Golem.
*(You can find bronze arrows and a bronze pickaxe south of the cave entrance and a shortbow to the east)
*Use your rope on the root which overhangs the cave.
*Equip the robes of elidinis and use the ancestral key on the door.
**Note: If the door will not open, make sure you have both the robes on also you may have to talk to Ghaslor the Elder and attempt to open it again afterward.
*Head east to the three doors.
*Kill the white golem to the south which is weak to stab.
*Enter the room and clear the water channel via Thieving.
*Kill the Grey golem to the east which is weak to slash.
*Enter the room and clear the water channel with a pickaxe.
*Kill the Black golem to the north-east which is weak to crush.
*Enter the room and clear the water channel by shooting the target on the other side with a bow and arrow (37 ranged required).
*Go through the north door and talk to one of the spirits. 
*Head back to Nardah.

*Talk to Awusah the Mayor.
*Take the shoes by his door and use a knife on them whilst outside of the house to obtain sole.
*Head west from the Nardah General Store to a crevice. Make sure you have a light source.
*Use a rope on it and head through the door to the north.
*Talk to the Genie to the north . Visiting the Genie is a Medium task in the Desert Diary.
*Talk to Genie again.
*Head back to Nardah and use the statuette on the plinth in the Shrine to Elidinis north of the fountain.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Note: If you've already completed The Lost Tribe, you can get to Juna via the Lumbridge Castle cave. This negates the need for the Spiny helmet or Slayer helmet. Having a lit Sapphire lantern with oil saves time as well.
**Simply squeeze through the hole, run south past Kazgar, use your pickaxe on the hole to clear it and climb through. Run straight south and jump across the stepping stones. Enter the south tunnel.
*Talk to Juna in the Lumbridge Swamp Caves.

*Use a cut Sapphire on a Bullseye lantern frame.
*Light the Sapphire lantern with a tinderbox.
*Climb back up the rock to the north and then use the lantern on one of the Light creatures above the chasm.
*Mine a rock, use a chisel on it and climb down the rocks to the east.
*Talk to Juna.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Enter the ruined house in the south-west of Mort'ton. Search the shelf on the wall. Read the diary. After reading the diary, the quest is started and you are able to create Serum 207.
*If you didn't bring Tarromin potion (unf): Pick up the empty vials (can be filled in the house north-east) and search the smashed table for 2 grimy tarromin and one grimy rogue's purse.

*Make two Serum 207 by adding clean tarromin to a vial of water and then adding ashes.
*Use one dose on Razmire (afflicted) in the general store. (Recommended to not use official Mort'ton temple World 377 yet to not get interrupted talking to the NPCs, until the step with repairing.)
*Kill five loar shades and pick up their remains. Note: any shades that you killed before talking to Razmire will not count.
*Return to Razmire and give him the remains. He may require more Serum 207.
*Right click and open his General store, buy an Olive oil.
*Open his builders' store, buy 5 timber beams, 5 limestone bricks, 25 swamp paste and optionally a Flamtaer hammer.
*Use the serum on Ulsquire Shauncy, located in the house east of the general store. Talk to him with Loar Remains.
*Talk to him again and ask about the remains and the temple.

*Head north-east of Mort'ton and repair the temple until you reach 100% repair and at least 20 sanctity. (Recommended to use official world 377.)
*Light the sacred altar in the centre of the temple (or wait until someone else lights it if you don't have level 5 Firemaking)
*Use your olive oil on the flame to make sacred oil.
*(Recommended) Use Serum 207 on the flame to make Serum 208, which permanently cures NPCs.

*Use the sacred oil on a log to create a pyre log.
*Head west of Mort'ton general store, to any grouping of 4 stone funeral pyres. Use the pyre log, then Loar remains on a funeral pyre. 
*Light the funeral pyre. Note: This will grant 25 Prayer XP.
*Collect the reward.
*(Recommended) Use the Serum 208 on Razmire.
*Use the Serum 208 on Ulsquire and finish the dialogue.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Go to the Troll Stronghold, head south then downstairs into the kitchen (fairycode and enter from the back through the secret door where you freed the prisoners, or utilise a slayer ring and enter the mountain through the secret entrance, or Trollheim teleport and go west).
*Speak to Burntmeat. 
*Talk to My Arm, east of Burntmeat.

*Reach the Death Plateau. (Games necklace or minigame teleport to Burthorpe). There will be thrower trolls on the way there and on the plateau itself; protect from ranged.
*Use a bucket on the cooking pot in the middle of the plateau with 1 free inventory space to get the goutweedy lump.
**A bucket spawns south of the cooking pot, if you forgot to bring one.
*Go back to the Troll Stronghold and talk to My Arm.
*After he brings you to a new area, talk to him again.
*After reading the book he gave you, talk to him again.
*Use three buckets of Ugthanki dung and seven buckets of supercompost on the soil patch.
*Talk to My Arm.
*Talk to Captain Barnaby.

*Meet up with My Arm at Tai Bwo Wannai, east of the general store. Talk to him.
*Talk to Murcaily near the hardwood grove. Make sure you have at least 1 free inventory space. 
**If Murcaily cannot be found, log out and log back in.
**If you don't have 60% favour, raise it to 60% at least and talk to him again (you can't start the quest if you don't have 60% favour).
*After the cutscene speak to My Arm, you will take the boat back to Ardougne where you can access the bank.

*Prepare yourself for a level 75 fight and a level 172 fight.
*Go back to the roof of the Troll Stronghold by using ladder in the west room on the upper level where the Troll Generals are.
**Note: Obtain a spade from the Tool leprechaun if you do not already have one.
*Talk to My Arm.
*Give My Arm the tools he needs for farming in this order:
**Rake (if My Arm breaks the rake, pick up the pieces, reassemble it, and give it back to him)
**Supercompost/Ultracompost (Optional. If ultracompost/supercompost is not used, the patch may become diseased and will need to be cured. Regular compost has no effect.)
**Hardy gout tubers
**Seed dibber
**Plant cure (if patch becomes diseased)

*Talk to My Arm.
*Defeat the two monsters.
**Note: It is possible to dodge the Giant Roc's attacks by moving back and forth between tiles, but it is not possible to dodge its stun attack.

*Talk to My Arm.
*Give him a spade (if you don't have one, you can go back down and up the ladder to get the leprechaun to reappear). 
*Go back to Burntmeat in the kitchen.
*Talk to My Arm on the roof.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Travel to Burgh de Rott.
*Talk to Veliaf Hurtz in the pub basement. 
*Go south-east to the docks where there's a hut with a boat in it.
*Use a plank on the boat.
*Use a plank on the boat chute.
*Push the boat down the chute.
*Board the boat.

*Go north-west a short distance (still on the pier), search the floor then kick it down and climb down.
*Climb over the wall rubble and talk to any Meiyerditch citizen. 
*Talk to Old Man Ral to the north. 
*Climb up the ladder in the building south-west of Old Man Ral.

*Jump south to the floorboards.
*Jump east to the floorboards.
*Go to the north-east corner of the room, push the wall and go across the gap.
*Crawl under the wall to the north.
*Go north to the second room, look on the west side, push the wall and walk across it.
*Climb down the ladder.
*Search the table next to the wall, open the trapdoor table, and climb into it.
*Climb up the shelf.
*Crawl under the wall to the east side.
*Jump to the floorboards to the east.
*Climb down the ladder.
*Search the pots near the eastern door to get a door key and use it to open the door.
*Climb up the ladder in the room to the east.
*Jump south to the floorboards.
*Go east, south, west and climb up the shelf.
*Climb up the ladder.
*Jump south again to the floorboards.
*Climb down the ladder.
*Go east through the rooms and walk across the washing line.
*Climb down the ladder.
*Push the wall to the north and walk across the floor.
*Climb up the shelf to the north.
*Climb down the shelf on the north-eastern side, below the floor.
*Jump to the floorboards to the north-west.
*Jump to the floorboards to the north.
*Go north-west and then east (around a gap in the floor) and jump to the floorboards.
*Climb up the ladder.
*Search the western wall to find a ladder top.
*Climb down the ladder you came up, then repair the nearby broken ladder using the ladder top. Then climb down the fixed ladder. You are now in sector three.
*Open the door and go north and slightly west, then north to a house with a fireplace in it. (go up the ladder if you need a knife)
*Go west through the door into the next room, then north out of the house until you see a barricade.
*Go east past the sickle logo and the house directly south should have a ladder inside. Climb up the ladder.
*Jump to the floorboards to the east.
*Climb down the stairs.
*Go south along the eastern side of the stairs. Search the wall. Use your knife on the wall, then push it.
*Press the decorated wall on the northern side.
*Open the lumpy rug (south-east square of the green rug).
*Climb down the trapdoor to enter the hideout.

*Run north and talk to Vertida Sefalatis.
**Note: you may have to select chat option in order to receive the note from Vertida. Double check your quest log to make sure it's updated, or else you'll have to re-run the entire course again!
*Travel back to Burgh de Rott.
*Talk to Veliaf Hurtz in the pub basement.

*Travel to the Paterdomus Temple (fairy ring ).
*Talk to Drezel in Paterdomus, underneath the temple.
*Take the west exit, past the monuments.
**Optionally, with, instead exit toward Canifis and take the shortcut up the side of the temple.
*Search the bush in west of the steps leading to the temple.
*Wait for the cutscene to finish.
*Return to speak with Drezel. He will give you runes to use Varrock Teleport.
*Teleport or travel to Varrock and talk to King Roald in the palace. 
*Travel back to Burgh de Rott.
*Talk to Veliaf Hurtz in the pub basement.

*Return to Meiyerditch and speak to a Vyrewatch. 
*Talk to a Meiyerditch miner to get a pickaxe if you don't have one. 
*Mine the daeyalt rocks on the walls until you get 15 daeyalt ore.
*Use all 15 ores on the mine cart, then talk to a Vampyre Juvinate.
*Run to the Myreque Hideout, marked on the map to the right. Follow the blue path from north to south.
*Go south through 3 doors and up the ladder.
*Jump to the floorboards to the east, climb down the stairs and enter the hideout.
*Talk to Vertida. 
*Climb down the ladder, out the door, run south and climb over the wall rubble where you came in to Meiyerditch.
*Run south and climb up the floor.
*Run north up the slope and climb down the ladder.
*Search the rocky surface.
*Go north through the barricade.
*Climb up the ladder.
*Run north along the wall and climb up the ladder.
*Climb down the next ladder.
*Climb the castle wall to the north.
*Run west along the wall clockwise and talk to Safalaan. Make sure you have 4 free inventory spaces.
*Run west along the wall clockwise until you see a sickle logo on the walls on the north side of the castle.
*Use the papyrus on the charcoal for the first sketch.
*Run west counter-clockwise and do the same for the west sickle for the second sketch.
*Wait for the cutscene to finish.
*Run west counter-clockwise and do the same for the south sickle.
**Note: use Protect from Melee when the cutscene begins to avoid taking damage from Vanstrom Klause. Prayers activated before the cutscene will be deactivate when you are attacked.
*Let Vanstrom attack you five times, which will knock you out.
*Go back and finish your final sketch.
*Talk to Sarius Guile if she didn't automatically talk to you when Vanstrom knocked you out.
*Speak to a nearby Vyrewatch and use the mine technique to get back to the base.
*Walk to the house directly south-west of the house with the ladder leading to the Myreque Hideout. It contains a fireplace and a portrait on its south wall.
*Use your knife on the fireplace for a message.
**Note: if needed, there is a knife spawn upstairs.
*Use your knife on the portrait for a large ornate key.
**Note: if you don't automatically obtain the key, inspect the portrait.
*Return to the Myreque Hideout.
*Talk to Safalaan. . Afterwards, give him the message.

*Exit the base, climb up the stairs, jump the gap, then climb down the ladder
*Travel north towards the mine until you find a bright, red and yellow tapestry inside a building adjacent to the Eastern city wall.
*Slash the tapestry with your knife.
*Walk through it and use the large ornate key on the statue.
*Open the door, climb-down the staircase and use Telekinetic Grab on Haemalchemy volume 1.
**Note: If needed, runes for Telekinetic Grab can be found in the Broken rune case.
*Return to the base and talk to Safalaan one final time and give him Haemalchemy volume 1.

*Travel back to Burgh de Rott.
*Talk to Veliaf Hurtz in the pub basement. 
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Speak to either dwarves on either side of the White Wolf Mountain. Note: Starting on the west side makes travelling by foot easier.
*If you need garlic, go to Seers' Village and take it from the house south-west of the bank (it spawns on the table).
*Bring a spade and make your way to McGrubor's Wood (either enter through the back or teleport to fairy ring  if you completed at least half of Fairytale II - Cure a Queen) to gather 3 red vine worm. You can collect them by checking the vine just west of the fairy ring .
* Either walk south to Hemenster or teleport to the Ranging Guild via your combat bracelet and go north-west.
*If you don't have a Fishing Rod, purchase one from Grandpa Jack for  in the house outside Hemenster entrance.
*Enter Hemenster with the Fishing pass in your inventory.
*Put a Garlic in the pipes to the north. Make sure to finish the dialogue.
*Pay Bonzo 5 coins. Wait for the Sinister Stranger to move away from the pipes. Start fishing and wait for the contest to end.
*After winning the contest, make your way back to the dwarf and show him the trophy.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Talk to Gertrude. 
*Pick up doogle leaves from behind Gertrude's house and use them on your raw sardine to make seasoned sardine.
*Go to Varrock Square's newsstand and talk to either Shilop or Wilough, you need 100 coins. 
*Go to the Lumber Yard north-east of Varrock and climb-over the broken fence.
**Chop down a dying tree to complete an easy Varrock Diary task.
*Go up the ladder in the middle of the Lumber Yard.
*Use a bucket of milk then use a Seasoned sardine on Gertrude's cat.
*Try to pick her up again then go down the ladder.
*Search the crates with a yellow "Search crate" option and a yellow "Mew!" above them until you find Fluffs' kitten. (Searching the same crate repeatedly will not work.)
*Go back up the ladder and use Fluffs' kitten on Gertrude's cat.
*Return to Gertrude.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

Players may wish to grab a jug of water from the cooking shop in Yanille if they do not have one to avoid a trip to Al Kharid.
*Talk to Brother Omad at the Monastery south of Ardougne. 
*Go west of the monastery, slightly south-west of the Clock Tower, to a perfect stone circle, enter it and go down the ladder in the middle.
*Follow the first path south and pick up the Child's blanket.
*Return to Brother Omad and talk to him twice. 
*Go north and talk to Brother Cedric, who is directly south of the Ardougne Zoo, near the well.
*Talk to him again to give him a jug of water. 
*Speak to him again and give him the logs or plank.
*Return to Brother Omad.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Speak to Edmond. 
*Speak to Alrena inside or near the house.
*Take the Picture of Elena off the table in the house.
*Speak to Edmond.
*Use 4 buckets of water on the mud patch behind the house (between the cabbages and potatoes).
*Dig with a spade on the softened ground.
*Go south to the farthest pipe.
*Attempt to open the grill.
*Use a rope on the grill.
*Speak to Edmond.
*Put on the gas mask and climb up the pipe.

*Go east and speak to Jethick; he will give you a book. 
*Go north to the house against the wall (next to the rotten apple spawn).
*Attempt to open the door.
*Speak to Martha Rehnison or Ted Rehnison in the house.
*Go upstairs and speak to Milli Rehnison.
*Go south of the town square to the large building along the southern wall with an "X" on the doors and a staircase inside going down. Attempt to open the door.

*Go to the large main building on the north side of the town square, north of the manhole.
*Talk to the Clerk in the main room. 
*Speak to Bravek. 
*:He will give you a scruffy note for a hangover cure.
*Use the hangover cure on Bravek; he will give you a warrant.

*Return to the Mourner house, the one with "X" on the doors and the stairwell.
*Search the barrel west of the staircase for a small key.
*Go downstairs, enter the cell, and speak to Elena.
*Return to the town square, go down the manhole, through the sewer, climb the mud pile, and speak to Edmond at his house.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*To begin speak to Elena in East Ardougne (directly west of shortcut log). 
*Speak to Jerico in the house just south of the northern Ardougne bank (The house with pigeon cages in the backyard).
*Search the cupboard to obtain bird feed (click continue or the bird feed won't be added to your inventory).
*Grab a pigeon cage from the backyard (note: if you are planning on doing One Small Favour, grab an extra 5 pigeon cages).
*Go south-west of Ardougne Castle and speak to Omart.
*Go north to the small watchtower along the wall, in front of the gates to West Ardougne.
*Stand in the corner where the two spiked fences meet.
*Use bird feed on the watchtower fence.
*Click open on the pigeon cage in your inventory.
*Equip your gas mask.
*Run south from the watchtower and speak to Omart. After a slight delay, you will arrive in West Ardougne.

*Head around the headquarters to the north-eastern area with the vat and mangle.
*Squeeze through the fence into the backyard.
*Pick up the rotten apple.
*Use the rotten apple on the cauldron.
*Go back through the fence.

*Go to Nurse Sarah's house, south-west of the West Ardougne church.
*Search cupboard in northern part of the house for a medical gown.
*Equip the medical gown, go back to the headquarters and open the door.
*Go upstairs and kill a mourner. A key will automatically be placed in your inventory.
*Use the key on the gate to get into the caged room.
*Search the crate third from the left on the northern wall to find Elena's distillator.
*With 3 empty inventory spaces, return to Elena and give her the distillator (via Ardougne Teleport, Skills necklace teleport to the Fishing Guild, over the wall by Kilron, or via the sewers from the Plague City quest).

*Go to the Chemist in south-western Rimmington (you can take a ship from Captain Barnaby at the Ardougne Dock directly to Rimmington for 30gp or use a teleport as the vials won't break upon teleportation anymore)
*Speak to the Chemist. He will give you the touch paper.

*You will find Chancy, Da Vinci and Hops around a fire outside the Chemist's house.
*Give Chancy the . 
*Give Da Vinci the . 
*Give Hops the . 
**If you happen to give the wrong item to one of the henchmen you must then give the rest of them an item and talk to each one of them in Varrock before being able to give them the correct items again.

*Teleport or travel to Varrock.
*Travel to the fenced area to the south-east of the bank (south-eastern Varrock). The guard will search you, but you will be able to pass freely with the plague sample and touch paper in your inventory.
*(Optional) Speak to Asyff, the Fancy dress shop owner, in the building south-east, to get a free priest gown (top and bottom) and equip it. Alternatively, purchase a priest gown (top and bottom) from him and equip it.
*Go to the Dancing Donkey Inn.
*Talk to Hops, Da Vinci and Chancy to get the vials back. Make sure you have the free inventory space.
**Do not pass back through the gate or your vials will be confiscated by the guard and you will have to get new samples from Elena again and continue the quest from that point.
**If you must pass through the gate to retrieve the plague sample or papers, you can drop the vials at the gate, quickly run to Varrock east bank for the items, and run back to pick up the vials.

*With your Priest gown equipped head to Guidor's house in the south-east of the fenced area.
*Speak to Guidor, tell him Elena has sent a sample that needs to be processed. 
*Return to Ardougne and speak to Elena.
*Go to the of Ardougne Castle and speak to King Lathas. 
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Speak to Grish located in Jiggig west of the Gu'Tanoth and south of Castle Wars (east of fairy ring ) and offer to help. 
Grish will give you two Super restore potions and three Cooked chompy birds.
*Speak to Ogre guard to the east, he will remove the barricade to gain access to the Zogre-infested area.
*Climb over the crushed barricade and run east to a set of stairs going downwards, go down these stairs.

*Run north-west to an area with a blackened floor, a short cut scene will begin.
*Search the skeleton next to the Broken Lecturn. A Zombie will appear and attack, kill it to obtain the Ruined backpack.
*Open the Ruined backpack to obtain a Dragon inn tankard, some rotten food and a knife.
*Search the broken lecturn for the Torn page (make sure you keep this).
*Attempt to search the coffin west of the Skeleton, and then use a knife on it.
*Attempt to open coffin (may take a couple of tries), search the coffin for the Black prism.

*Go to the Dragon Inn in Yanille and use the dragon inn tankard on the bartender. The Minigame Teleport to Nightmare Zone can take you here quickly.
*Speak to Zavistic Rarve in the Wizards' Guild in Yanille (if you don't have the required level to enter, ring the bell out front). ( if you have started Hand in the Sand)

*Speak to Sithik Ints in his bed in the upstairs bedroom in the guest house north of the Wizards' Guild 
*Search the drawers, cupboard and wardrobe for Book of portraiture, Necromancy book, papyrus, charcoal, and a Book of 'H.A.M'.
*Read all three books.
*Use all three books on Sithik.
*Use Papyrus on Sithik.
*Use portrait on Sithik.
**Note: He must appreciate the "honesty" of the portrait, not the "truth". More papyrus can be found in the drawers.
**Note: The portrait's examine text must say "A classic realist charcoal portrait of Sithik."
**Note: The odds of getting the correct portrait seem to be drastically reduced with a very low Crafting level (1-10). 20+ is recommend to speed up the process."
*Go to the Dragon Inn in Yanille and use the Dragon Inn Tankard, then the portrait on the Bartender.
*Speak to Zavistic Rarve while holding the Necromancy book, Book of 'H.A.M', the tankard and the signed portrait. or  if you have started Hand in the Sand.

*Use the Strange potion on the Cup of tea on top of Sithik's drawers.
*Go downstairs and back upstairs.
*Speak to Sithik, obtain answers to all three questions in order to make Relicym's balm and Brutal arrows.

*Return and speak to Grish . He will give you an Ogre gate key to access the Ceremonial chamber.
*Talk to Grish again "There must be an easier way to kill these Zogres" to learn how to equip Composite ogre bows .
*Prepare to fight Slash Bash (level 111). If you are using an comp ogre bow instead of Crumble Undead, follow the "optional" steps below.

*Chop an Achey Tree for logs.
*Use a knife on the achey tree logs with wolf bones in your inventory, and select box number (2) to create an unstrung comp bow.
*String the bow with bow string to create the finished bow.

*Either buy one from the Grand Exchange or make it yourself by adding Rogue's purse to a Vial of water and then add Snake weed. It is not needed for the quest but giving it to Uglug Nar will allow you to purchase Relicym's balm from his shop if needed in the future.

*Cut down Achey Trees for Achey tree logs.
*Fletch the logs with a knife into Ogre arrow shafts.
*Add feathers to the shafts.
*With a hammer in your inventory use nails on the Flighted ogre arrows.

*Head back down into Jiggig.
*Travel west until you reach two sets of doors.
*Go through both doors and go down the stairs.
*Follow the chamber to the end and search the stand.
*Kill Slash Bash and collect the Zogre bones and Ogre artefact that he drops.
*Return and speak to Grish. 
**You can now sell the Black prism to Zavistic Rarve for 2000 coins or Yanni Salika for 5000 coins, after the quest.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

Tip: Nettle tea can be made in advance to save time later on.
*Pray at the Ectofuntus 7 or more times and talk to the Ghost disciple to get enough ecto-tokens for the quest.
** Bring 8 worth of bones/buckets/pots instead of 7 so you have enough ecto tokens to get back into the city. Otherwise you have to go through Port Phasmatys again.
*Talk to Velorina inside Port Phasmatys in the house just east of the gates to begin the quest. 
*Talk to Necrovarus back at the Ectofuntus.
*Talk to Velorina again. 
Tip: if you need a bowl, buy one from the charter ship before leaving. There is a water source south-east of Fenkenstrain's Castle.

*A few steps east of Slayer master Mazchna in Canifis is a patch of nettles. Wear your gloves and pick at least five: the nettle water can easily boil over, especially at low cooking levels.
**Make one extra nettle tea for Skippy and the Mogres miniquest, if desired.
*Combine the nettle with the bowl of water, and cook it over a fire (there is a dead tree just south-east of the slayer tower). Do not drink the tea.
*Head north-west to the old crone's house by the water, just east of the Slayer Tower.
*Talk to the old crone east next to the slayer tower with nettle tea in your inventory. 
*Put the tea in the porcelain cup and add your bucket of milk to the tea, then talk to the old crone again.

*Repair the model ship by using the needle on it. This will use up the silk and a thread.
*Head to the wrecked ship on the coast north-west of the Ectofuntus and directly north of the farming allotment.
*Climb up a ladder to the ship deck. Then, climb another ladder to get to the ship quarterdeck.
*Wait for the wind speed to drop to low, and search the mast multiple times to find out what colour the three components of the flag are.
*Dye the model ship's flag the right colours, mixing dyes as needed (use the dye on the toy ship and select which part to dye).
*Head down one level to the ship deck, talk to the Old man. 
*Use the key on the closed chest inside the captain's quarters to receive the first map scrap.
*Climb down to the lowest level of the ship and get ready to fight. Search the chests until you are attacked by a giant lobster (level 32). Kill it, then search the chest it came out of to get the second map scrap.
*Climb back up the ladder and proceed to the north-west side of deck where there is a gangplank you can walk out onto some rocks.
*Jump along the path of rocks. At the end, there will be another chest with the final map scrap. (Save some run energy as some rocks take 5% energy)
*Fit all the map pieces together to get a completed treasure map.
:Important: Make sure you have a spade and treasure map in your inventory, or you will not be able to complete the next part and will waste your 25 ecto-tokens.

*Head back inside Port Phasmatys again, and go south-east onto the docks. Take the small rowing boat to Dragontooth Island which is south-east at the docks.
**If you have a ring of charos (a), it will only cost 10 ecto-tokens by using the (Charm) option when speaking to the ghost captain. 
*Once there, use the map to find the treasure starting at the statue (or use the image on the right to find it). Dig with your spade, and you will find the book of haricanto.

*Return to Port Phasmatys.
*Talk to Ak-Haranu around the docks. 
*Talk to Robin in the inn. He'll challenge you to a game of Rune-Draw. Beat him four times (in total, does not need to be consecutive) so he owes you 100 coins.
*He'll give you the signed oak bow to repay the debt.
*Take it back to Ak-Haranu for the translation manual.

*Ask the ghost innkeeper if he has any jobs for you. He'll give you a bedsheet. 
*Use bucket of slime on the bedsheet to dye it (can be bought from trader crewmembers at the docks to the east) and Wear it.
*Talk to Gravingas, the ghost activist protesting just inside the town's gate. He'll ask you for 10 signatures. 
*Ask ghost villagers around town for signatures with the bedsheet equipped. You can alternate between just two ghosts for all the signatures. If one asks you for ecto-tokens, you can ignore them and ask the other, or you can pay if you have tokens to spare. 
*With all 10 signatures, show the petition to Necrovarus.
*Take the key Necrovarus drops and head upstairs. Use the key on the door and enter the room. Take his robes from the coffin.

*Return to the old crone. 
*Head back to the ectofuntus and talk to Necrovarus. Once you've spoken to Necrovarus, you will be able to enter Port Phasmatys freely.
*Enter Port Phasmatys one last time and talk to Velorina.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Speak with Caroline in Witchaven. 
*Talk to Holgart (right next to Caroline) and give him the Swamp paste.
*Right-click Holgart and select the Travel option to travel to the fishing platform.
*Pick up the Broken glass on the floor (hut to the west).
*Go to the north-east corner of the platform and pick up some Damp sticks.
*Climb the ladder right next to the sticks.

*Go inside the cabin on the west side of the platform and talk to Kennith.
*Go back down the ladder to the sea level.

*Travel or speak with Holgart for a trip to a remote island.
*Talk to Kent.
*Talk to Holgart again to go back to the Fishing Platform.

*Speak with Bailey in the southwest cabin for an Unlit torch.
*Use the Broken glass on the Damp sticks to dry them.
*Rub the Dry sticks together to light the torch.
*Go back up the ladder.
*Go talk to Kennith again.
*From outside of the cabin, kick the badly repaired wall to make an opening.
*Talk to Kennith again.
*Just outside of Kennith's cabin, activate the crane controls to rotate it (a cutscene will play if you've followed the steps correctly - make sure you've talked to Kennith after you've kicked in the wall).
*Go back down the ladder to the sea level.
**Tip: Before leaving, you can catch a fish with a small fishing net on the downstairs platform to complete a task for the Ardougne Medium Diary.

*Speak with Holgart again to return to the shore.
*Report to Caroline.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Speak with Sir Tiffy Cashien in Falador Park. 
*Go talk to Sir Amik Varze in the White Knights' Castle on the west side of the . 
*Report back to Sir Tiffy. 
*Head back to Sir Amik and talk to him again. 
*Report once more to Tiffy. 
**: If you want to pay 10k coins for the Commorb.
**: If you have the required materials to make the Commorb.
*Use the "contact" option on the Commorb.

*Head over to Taverley Dungeon.
*Follow the dungeon north, then east and then south, down to the Black Knights' Base.
*Talk to Lord Daquarius in the south-western most room.
*Kill a level 33 Black Knight; Daquarius will automatically speak to you once a knight is killed. You must finish this dialogue before speaking to him again!
*Talk to Lord Daquarius again.

*Talk to the Mage of Zamorak (or  if Temple of the Eye is completed.) in Varrock at the  Altar of Chaos.
**If you have not yet started the Enter the Abyss miniquest, you must first talk to him in the Wilderness north-east of Edgeville. He will then tell you to talk to him in Varrock.
*Speak to him again to give him the 20 rune or pure essence.

*Head to Canifis and Savant will call you. (fairy ring )
*Use the "scan" option of the Commorb near the bank in Canifis to unveil Solus Dellagar.
*Have a look at the item list in the table below to find Solus Dellagar's location. Scan with the Commorb at the location.
**Keep tracking down Solus Dellagar by following the item clues until you get the 20 noted pure essence. There are 7 locations in total that you will visit.
**Note: On the fourth scan location, Solus will ward the player off with a strong cast of Flames of Zamorak, dealing a high percentage of your current Hitpoints total. This damage will not kill you and Savant will teleport you back to Falador. 
**Note: On the sixth scan location, Solus will summon a level 32 Black Knight that attempts to kill the player. Be prepared for this, however it is not necessary to kill this Black Knight.

*Head to the rune essence mine by talking to one of the teleporting mages.
*Kill Solus.
*Head back to Falador and talk to Sir Amik Varze in the White Knights' Castle.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

Items required: any axe
*Talk to Olaf Hradson west of fairy ring . 
*Chop the windswept tree up the mountain to the east and just north of the fairy ring and obtain Windswept Logs.
*Take the logs back to Olaf.

Items Required: tinderbox

Recommended: stamina potions, super energy potion
*Travel to Rellekka and talk to Ingrid Hradson who is near the well (water drop on map) (Enchanted Lyre or Fremennik sea boots 1).
*Talk to Volf Olafson who is outside the helmet shop to the north.
*Return to, and talk to Olaf (Teleport to a Fairy Ring, or use the agility shortcut to the East)
*Use the damp planks on the fire pit (embers) next to Olaf.
*Talk to Olaf again.

Items required: spade, weapon, armour, food

Recommended: agility potions, stamina potions, super energy potions
*Return to the tree and dig next to it.
*Go all the way east in the tunnel and then north.
* (Optional): Kill a brine rat here to complete a Fremennik Medium Diary achievement (requires 47 Slayer).
*Kill a skeleton fremennik and pick up the key it drops.
*Search the picture wall to the far west.
**East, North, West, South, and then the very bottom ("Confirm").
*Search the wall again to walk through.
*Pick up two rotten barrels and six ropes in the next room.
*Go to the bridge to the north-east and use the barrels on the missing portions; a higher level Agility helps (If you fall, you will need to go through the cave again.) (Recommended: stamina potions.)
*Open the gate.
**Pick the shape that matches the loop part of the shown key. If you fall after opening the gate, you will need to retrieve a new key.
**If you fall off the bridge after opening the gate, you have to reobtain a key to open the gate in the middle again.

*Search the chest located in the old ship and kill Ulfric (level 100, uses melee).
**The safespot for Ulfric is the dirt north of his grave stone
*Search the chest again.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Talk to Mord Gunnars at the most northern dock in Rellekka to be taken to Jatizso. 
*Talk to King Gjuki Sorvott IV in the checkered floor room. His cat will intervene.
*Use the raw tuna on the King's cat.
*Speak to the King.
*Give him the required ores.
*Take all four pieces of the jester outfit from the chest behind the king's throne.
*Quick travel back to Rellekka via Mord Gunnars at the docks to the south.

*Quick travel to Neitiznot via Maria Gunnars on the docks next to Mord.
*Remove anything from your weapon and shield slots and put on the Jester outfit (hat, boots, tights, top)
*Speak with Slug Hemligssen north of the bank. 
*Talk to Mawnis Burowgar in the building south of the bank.
**During the cutscene, follow the commands Mawnis gives using the right-side panel.
**Pay attention to the dialogue during your performance because there will be questions before the reward.
***
***
***
*Return to Slug Hemligssen. He will give you 2500 coins. ,

*Speak to Mawnis Burowgar again without the Jester Outfit
*Speak to Mawnis Burowgar with the ropes, split logs, and knife in your inventory with at least one empty inventory slot.
**If you do not have split logs, chop Arctic Pine trees until you have eight logs and use them on the Woodcutting stumps just east of the bank.
**If you are crafting your own shield, then cut two extra logs now.
**If you do not have any rope, kill yaks outside in the yak pen and spin their hair in the south-easternmost building.
*Speak to Thakkrad to learn how to repair the bridges.

*Travel north, across the rope bridge and repair the broken bridges on the east and west sides of the island (right-click option to repair).
*Talk to Mawnis Burowgar.
*Quick travel back to Rellekka via Maria Gunnars at the dock to the south-west.

*Quick travel to Jatizso via Mord.
*Speak with King Gjuki Sorvott IV in the building west of the bank.
*Tax the shop keepers of Jatizso:
**Hring Hring must pay 8,000, he is in south-western most house.
**Skuli Myrka must pay 6,000, north from Hring.
**Vanligga Gastfrihet must pay 5,000, north from kings palace. (Offer to pay her taxes for her; this provides the capability to trade in black market yak goods after the quest.)
**Keepa Kettilon must pay 5,000, east from Vanligga.
*Talk to King Gjuki Sorvott IV.
*Collect taxes from the following people for 1,000:
**Hring Hring.
**Raum Urda-Stein in the same house as Hring Hring.
**Skuli Myrka.
**Keepa Kettilon.
**Flosi Dalksson in the same house as Keepa Kettilon.
*Speak with King Gjuki Sorvott IV.
*Quick travel back to Rellekka via Mord.

*Quick travel to Neitiznot via Maria.
*Speak with Spymaster Slug Hemligssen again.
*Equip only the jester outfit again.
*Speak with Mawnis to induce another Jester cutscene.
*Speak with Slug once again. 
*Ferry back to Rellekka and then to Jatizso.
*Speak to King Gjuki Sorvott IV to obtain the royal decree (1 inv spot needed, otherwise you have to repeat dialogue).
*Travel back to Neitiznot and speak with Mawnis. (Don't forget to take off the jester outfit)
*Buy yak-hide armour (top and leggings), along with the Neitiznot shield from the Grand Exchange, or for Ironmen:
**Kill three yaks and take their hides.
**Have them cured by Thakkrad Sigmundson for 5gp each.
**Use thread and needle on the hides to craft a body and leggings.
*Speak with Mawnis, who will instruct you to craft a shield. For Ironmen:
**Grab two Arctic pine logs, one bronze nail, a hammer, and a rope.
**Use these items on the stump in the middle of the village.
*Speak with Mawnis again.

*Equip the Neitiznot shield and combat items to fight the Ice Troll King.
**Equipping it is actually not required to enter the cave, or to fight the king, but it will heavily reduce damage, thus it is highly recommended.

Make sure to equip the Neitiznot shield.
*Use Protect from Melee while running to the east side cave entrance of the farthest north isle.
*Enter the cave to start a cutscene.
**Talk to Bork Sigmundson to obtain 10 Tuna, 3 Prayer potion (3), and 3 Strength potion (4). If you do not have enough inventory space when you request the items, you will not be able to obtain them again.
*Kill ten trolls, you will see a message saying "You have defeated enough trolls to attack the King."
*Turn on Protect from Missiles before crossing the bridge.
*Turn on Protect from Magic for the duration of the fight. Kill the troll king. DO NOT use Protect from Melee because King will use the long distance attack as Dad does.
*Decapitate the troll king's corpse.
*Return to Mawnis Burowgar.
Optional: Make sure to claim the prayer potions from Bork Sigmundson at the entrance.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

Grab all the required items at the start. You do not have to make bank trips during this quest.
*Speak with Gossip outside of Sinclair Mansion. 
*Speak with the guard in the courtyard to the north.
*Break into the Smashed Window on the East side of the mansion.
*Grab the Scrap paper in the dining room next to the fire place .
*Go up the stairs to the and then to the library in the centre.
*Take the Address Form off the table and read it.
*Search the bookcase on the Western wall for a Black knight helm.
*Return to the guard via the smashed window.
*Speak to him, using all three options so that he takes each of your three items
*Speak with the Gossip using all three options.

*Travel south to the Seer's Village courthouse. (South-East of the bank).
*Speak to Anna. 
*Walk down the stairs to begin the trial.
For this part you need to speak to the Judge in order to call next witness and then speak to the witnesses to ask them questions.
*Call the Dog Handler as a witness. Ask him about the poison.
*Call the Butler as a witness by speaking to the judge. Ask him about the dagger.
*Call the Maid as a witness. Ask her about the night of the murder.
*Ask the Maid (or anyone else) about the thread.
(If done correctly Anna should be pronounced not guilty and balloons will fall.)
*Exit the courtroom by clicking on the gate.
*Speak again with Anna in her cell.

*Head east around Camelot Castle, past the gate and to the north-east. Search the statue to start a cutscene.
Clicking anywhere will end the cutscene and you will need to go through it again.
*Speak with Merlin inside the cell. 
*Reach for the vent at the north of the cell.
*Use Telekinetic Grab on the guard fixing his hair outside the cell
**You can speak to the knights in the cell to receive a lockpick or runes for telekinetic grab.
*Use the Hair clip or lockpick on the door to start a puzzle.
**To complete this puzzle, you must set each of four tumblers to the correct height. The most foolproof way to do this (not necessarily the quickest) is to set all tumblers to the lowest height, and try the lock. If a tumbler shows a green circle, do not change that tumbler anymore (red and blue circles can be ignored). Increase the height by one on each other tumbler and try again. Continue until the lock unlocks. This method will take at most six attempts.
*Climb up the staircases until you reach the top floor.
*Search the table.
*Choose the round purple box second from the right.

*Talk to Wizard Cromperty in Ardougne to receive an Animate rock scroll.
**You might already have the item in your bank from the quest One Small Favour. However, you must still talk to Cromperty. Be sure to go through all dialogue or else you will need to speak to him again.
*Travel to the Black Knights' Fortress west of Edgeville/north of Ice Mountain. (Amulet of glory or combat bracelet (Monastery) provide convenient teleports)
*Equip the bronze med helm and iron chainbody, and enter the Black Knights' Fortress through the Sturdy door on the south wall.
*Equip full black armour and push the wall to the north.
*Climb down the ladder.
*Free King Arthur from his statue (requires the granite).
*Talk to King Arthur to give him the bronze med helm and iron chainbody.
*Return to Camelot and speak to King Arthur in the castle by the round table.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

Grab all the items needed for the quest before you start. You do not need to make bank trips during this quest.
*Travel to Miscellania (Either go to Rellekka middle dock to travel by sailor or fairy code: )
*If you do not have flowers yet, buy some from the Flower Girl in the castle courtyard for 15gp.
*Speak with King Vargas on the of the south-west castle. 
The next part of the quest varies on which character is chosen by the player. Press the appropriate button.

*Speak with Princess Astrid in the room directly north of the King. Continue to speak with her each time the dialogue box closes, until the dialogue is just "Good Day".
**"Archery is a noble art!"
**"He's been very helpful"
**"Hahahaha"
*Use the flowers on the princess (You will not get them back)
*Now use the dance emote inside her room
*Keep speaking with her, choosing the flattering options (see below) until the dialogue is just "Good Day".
**"That sounds like a good idea."
**"What happened next?"
**"I'm quite fond of it myself"
**"And what a great bard he makes!"
**"I suppose you don't have much opportunity to."
**"It's a lovely little country."
*Use the bow in your inventory on her (you will not get it back)
*Speak with her again
*Use the blow kiss emote
*Repeat the agreeing process once more until she calls you "Dear" or "Darling"
*Use the blow kiss emote again
*Use the ring in your inventory on her (you will not get it back)

*Speak with Prince Brand in the room directly south of the King. Continue to speak with him each time the dialogue box closes, until the dialogue is just "Good Day".
*After he recites the poem select "Be still, my heart"
*Use the Clap or Cheer emote in his room
*Keep speaking with him, agreeing with everything he says. Eventually the dialogue will just be "Good Day".
*Use the flowers on the prince
*Repeat the agreeing process
*Use (do not eat) the cake on him
*Repeat the agreeing process
*Once the dialogue goes "Hello, dear." and "Hello Darling." use the blow kiss emote in his room
* Use your ring on him and he will agree to marry you (silver and pineapple rings do not work)

*Exit the castle and head east, across the bridge to the other castle. It's advised to clear the weeds from the herb and flax crops outside the main gates of the Miscellania castle every time you run past to save time on gaining favour which you need later on in the quest. If doing this, players can expect to have around 60% favour by the time they will need to gain the remaining favour.
*Speak with Queen Sigrid upstairs
*Return west and speak with King Vargas
*Return east and speak with the Queen again
*Go back again and speak with Prince Brand in the room south of King Vargas to receive the Awful anthem
*Speak with Advisor Ghrim who is next to the King to turn the Awful anthem into a Good anthem
*Take the Good Anthem to the Queen to the East to get the Treaty
*Take the treaty back to King Vargas
*Leave the castle and head north to the anvil symbol
*Speak with Derrik with an iron bar in your inventory  to receive a giant nib
*Use the giant nib on the logs in your inventory to create a Giant pen
*Return to the King

*Rake the herbs and flax outside the palace walls. (World hopping does NOT reset the patches, however weeds respawn in approximately 1 minute.)
*Mine coal on the north side of Miscellania.
*Chop maple trees in the centre of Miscellania.
*Fish tuna, lobsters, or swordfish by the docks of Miscellania.

*Speak with King Vargas once at 75%
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Talk to Ava in the west wing of Draynor Manor and complete the dialogue. 
*Go to the undead chicken farm west of the Ectofuntus with your ghostspeak amulet and ecto-tokens (or materials for them), and talk to Alice. 
*Keep talking between Alice and Malcolm in the cow pen 4 times until she tells you to go to talk to the old crone for an amulet.
*Run west of the farm until you reach the old crone's house just east of the Slayer Tower.
*Speak twice to the old crone to receive a crone-made amulet. 
*Speak with Malcolm to give him the Crone-made amulet. 
*Speak with Malcolm again.
*After the cutscene, speak to Malcolm who will now sell you two undead chickens for 20 ecto-tokens.

*Take your 5 iron bars, hammer, and two undead chickens back to the west wing of Draynor Manor and speak to Ava.
*Speak to the Witch in the north-west corner of Draynor Manor (inside the building).
*Speak to the Witch again to receive a selected iron.
*Take the selected iron to the centre of the Rimmington mine, face north, and use the hammer on it.
*Return to Ava and give her the magnet.

*Talk to Ava.
*Use your axe on an Undead tree (not Dead tree). You can exit through the door of the east room. (An Undead tree is found in front of the manor, has a yellow examine option.)
*Talk to Ava again. She will instruct you to go to Turael with the Mithril axe and Holy Symbol to exchange them to a Blessed axe. NOTE: If you dont do this step, Turael might not have the 4th chat option available.
*Talk to Turael, the Slayer master in a house in south-eastern Burthorpe. 
*Talk to Turael again to receive the Blessed axe, provided you have a Mithril axe and a Holy symbol in your inventory. 
*Return to the mansion and cut the undead tree again.
*Bring the Undead twigs to Ava.
*Talk to Ava again, and she will give you garbled research notes that you need to solve.
**To translate turn off all the green orbs except for the 2nd, 5th, and 9th (left to right, see image)
*Talk to Ava again.
*Combine the solved notes with the polished button and the hard leather.
*Give the container to Ava.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Travel to Uzer via the necklace of passage teleport to Eagle's Eyrie and run south-east. You can alternatively use a fairy ring and go north-east.
*Pick up and read the Letter west of the broken clay golem
*Talk to the golem. 
*Use four soft clay on the golem. If you chose to bring a pickaxe and a bracelet of clay, clay rocks can be found to the north-west, near the shore. The phoenix can be found there as well. 
**Optional: Mine 5 clay for easy Desert Diary, and steal the Desert Phoenix's feather while nearby.
**Optional: Catch a Golden Warbler near the Desert Phoenix with a Bird Snare (requiring Level 5 Hunter) for an easy Desert Diary task
*Talk to the golem again.

*Pick a black mushroom near the stairs east of the golem before heading down (or downstairs at your right).
** Use the black mushroom on the pestle and mortar to get black dye. You can do this later if you don't have your pestle and mortar.
**Note: Take an extra black mushroom if you plan on completing Shadow of the Storm soon afterwards.
*Climb down the stairs in the ruins.
*Take the strange implement from the north-western room. 
**Note: Keep the strange implement if you plan on completing Shadow of the Storm soon afterwards.
*Speak to the Golem again 
*Take and read the letter west of the Golem.
*Head to the most north-eastern part of the Digsite, near the large buried skeleton, and talk to Elissa. (make sure to read the letter if no 3rd option is seen)
*Head to the Exam Centre just south of the Digsite.
*Search the bookcase in the south-east corner and read Varmen's notes.
**Note: If you have not repaired the golem up to this point, or read Varmen's Notes the curator will not speak to you about the quest.
*Talk to Curator Haig Halen in the Varrock Museum about the statuette.  ( if Bone Voyage is started)
*Pickpocket him for the display cabinet key.
*Head upstairs, and open the second-most western case in the northern-most row. You will get a statuette.

*Return to the Kharidian Desert (fairy ring ), or teleport to Eagle's Eyrie with Necklace of passage.
*If you still need the Phoenix feather, run north to the clay rocks east of River Elid and grab a feather from the Phoenix.
*Return to the ruins of Uzer where you started the quest and again go down the stairs.
*In the centre of the room will be four alcoves. Place the statuette in the empty one.
*Turn the statues until they all point north.
*Go north, through the double doors.
*Optional: Use your chisel and hammer on the throne for 2 sapphires, emeralds, and rubies.
*Otherwise, immediately go back through the south portal.

*Go back upstairs and talk to the golem.
*With an empty vial in your inventory, grind the black mushroom using a Pestle and mortar.
*Use the phoenix feather on the black dye to make a phoenix quill pen.
*Talk to the golem
*Use the phoenix quill pen on a piece of papyrus to get the golem program.
