*Use the strange implement on the golem then quickly use the newly acquired golem program on the golem.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Travel to Entrana (speak to monks on second most northern dock in Port Sarim) 
*Talk to Auguste on Entrana north of the Herblore shop (3 times) 
*Use the papyrus with the ball of wool.
*Use the unlit candle on the balloon structure.
*Talk to Auguste again.
*Talk to Auguste again with the two papyrus and a sack of potatoes in your inventory.

*Go slightly south of Auguste and fill up the sacks with sand.
*Give Auguste a yellow dye, a red dye, ten silk, a bowl, and eight sandbags.
**A bowl spawns in the house east of Auguste on the 
*Bring twelve willow branches. They can be purchased from the Grand Exchange or trimmed with secateurs by using them on the grown sapling given by Auguste or another willow tree you've grown. Do not clear the stump, or cut down the tree until all branches are obtained.
*Use the branches on the balloon frame on the nearby platform.
*Obtain ten normal logs and a tinderbox.
*Talk to Auguste

*Drop a sandbag.
*Burn a log.
*Relax 9 times.
*Pull the red rope.
*Relax 2 times.
*Pull the brown rope.
*Relax 5 times.

*Burn a log.
*Relax.
*Burn a log.
*Relax 10 times.
*Burn a log.
*Relax 5 times.

*Relax 7 times.
*Pull the red rope.
*Pull the brown rope.
*Relax 3 times.
*Burn a log.
*Relax 4 times.
*Pull the brown rope.

*Talk to Auguste.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Talk to Father Reen outside Al Kharid bank. 
*Travel to Uzer via the magic carpet south of Al Kharid (or use the necklace of passage teleport to Eagle's Eyrie and run south-east). You can also use a fairy ring and go north-east.
*Talk to Father Badden near the ruin entrance.  Be sure to have Silverlight in your inventory.
*Pick and use a black mushroom (or black dye) on Silverlight to dye it black (you can find some beside the staircase).
*Go down the stairs and grab a copy of the Strange implement in the north-west corner of the ruin.
*Talk to Evil Dave in the dungeon wearing your 3 black items and your dyed Silverlight.

*Talk to Denath on the other side of the portal. 
*Talk to Jennifer to get a demonic sigil mould. 
*Talk to Matthew. 
*Go to any furnace and smelt a demonic sigil (use silver bar on furnace and select 'demonic sigil').
*Your black outfit can now be discarded and replaced with combat gear (keep Silverlight with you).
*Head back to Uzer and talk to the clay golem outside about last night. 
*Search the nearby kilns for a book (there are four kilns – the last two are on the east side of the ruin, and by the magic carpet).
*Read the book, and take it to Matthew on the other side of the portal
*Go north and talk to Denath. (or  during the ritual). Write down the incantation he tells you as it is used twice during the quest.
*Complete the circle and click the sigil in your inventory to chant the incantation (unequip the Silverlight if nothing happens).
*TAKE THE DEMONIC SIGIL DENATH DROPPED ON THE FLOOR. (If you do not, you will have to create another Demonic sigil)
*Enter the portal to exit the room and take Tanya's sigil.
*Tell Evil Dave to return to the lair  – you should have 4 sigils now.

*Talk to Father Badden outside.
*Convince Father Reen to join the ritual. 
*Talk to the golem, he will refuse to help. 
*Use the Strange implement on the golem to reprogram him.
*Talk to the golem again to make him enter the dungeon.

*Talk to Matthew to start the incantation, say it backwards. 
*Kill Agrith Naar with any weapon, but the final blow must be with Silverlight. The demon will heal if you run away as the final blow is being dealt.
*Unequip Silverlight.
*Choose your reward to finish the quest.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Talk to Captain Lawgof by the Coal truck mining site west of Seers' Village. 
(Fairy ring code, run east and squeeze-through the loose railing and continue west. Alternatively, use a skills necklace teleport to the Fishing Guild, run west and then north.)

*Pick up the hammer in the house to the east if you do not have one.
*Fix the six bent railings of the west and south sides of the fence.
*Talk to Captain Lawgof.
*Go to the tower south of the gate.
*Climb up two ladders and take the Dwarf remains.
*Talk to Captain Lawgof.
*Run south (or teleport to the Fishing Guild) and enter the cave at the south-east corner of the Fishing Guild.
*In the cave, go as far north-west as possible. In the northwesternmost room, search the northernmost crate by the east wall to find Lollk. You don't need to finish the conversation. 
*Talk to Captain Lawgof. 
*Use the toolkit you got from Captain Lawgof on the broken multicannon next to him. (In this order:)
**Use the hook tool (right) on the spring.
**Use the pliers (middle) on the safety switch at the bottom.
**Use the tooth tool (left) on the gear located at the bottom of the hammer.
*Talk to Captain Lawgof. 
**Note: This conversation must be completely finished.

*Go to the Dwarven Black Guard camp north-east of Falador / south of Ice Mountain / west of Barbarian village.
*In the outpost, talk to Nulodion. He is in the house on the west side of the mining camp.
*Return to Captain Lawgof, bring Nulodion's notes and your cannonball mould with you.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Talk to Lazim north-east of the quarry. 
*Bring him 32 kg of sandstone, it doesn't have to be all at once. You can break down big pieces with a chisel.
*Use your chisel on the sandstone (32 kg).
*Place the base on the flat ground.
*Repeat the process for a 20 kg body.
*Use your chisel on the statue.
*Talk to Lazim and pick any head (remember which head you picked).
*Mine two 5 kg pieces of granite (not sandstone!). (Ironmen: Mine a 3rd piece of any size for King's Ransom)
*Make the head you chose (if you don't make the head you chose, you will have to make another head). The other 5 kg granite piece is used later.
*If you did not bring clay or coal, mine some now.
*Talk to him and you'll fall into a temple.

*Talk to Lazim.
**If you climb up the ladder and up the sand pile next to the statue now, you'll be able to exit and enter the temple from any outer room on the bottom floor later.
*Use your chisel on the fallen statue four times to get all its limbs.
* Talk to Lazim again to retrieve the statue head.
*Take-sigil from the pedestal south of Lazim to get the M sigil.
**Skip this step and come back after the next if you have no inventory space.
*Go around all the rooms through the outer hallways and pick up the R, K and Z sigils. The matching limbs are automatically used and consumed to open the doors.
*Go to the centre room after collecting all four sigils
*Try to open the doors to place the sigils. Make sure to complete each dialogue.
*Climb the ladder.

*Use soft clay on the pedestal. (Cast a fire spell on the frozen fountain if you still need a water source.)
*Use a chisel on the 5 kg granite.
*Place the new stone head in the pedestal. The original head will be slightly too small. The new head should fit perfectly and trigger a cutscene (Make sure to finish dialogue).
*North-west: use your bread or cake on Pentyn. 
*North-east: cast wind bolt, blast, wave, or surge on the furnace.
*South-east: light the 6 braziers with the appropriate fuels.
*South-west: cast fire bolt, blast, wave, or surge on the fountain.
*Pass through the magic barrier and climb the ladder. (If you can't pass through barrier, talk to Lazim)

*Cast crumble undead on the boneguard.
*Climb down the stone ladder to the south.
*Turn on Protect from Melee and talk to the new boneguard. 
*Take 3 sandstones from the rubble pile.
*Use a sandstone on the southern wall, then use your chisel on the wall. Repeat to completion.
*Talk to the boneguard again.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Go to the Exam Centre south of the Digsite. (Varrock teleport then run east; or use a Digsite pendant/ teleport and walk south towards the exam centre; the Senntisten teleport from the Ancient Spellbook is quite close, and can be used from a Portal Nexus in a POH)
*Search the most north-eastern of the south-eastern bookcases to find a beaten book.
*Read the beaten book, then read the scroll.
*Keep the book.

* Head back to the Anvil building in Seers Village and enter the odd-looking wall and down the staircase to the workshop.
**using the battered key (Elemental Workshop I) (to re-obtain search the north-eastern bookcase in the house opposite to get both the key and book)
* Go north to the water elemental room and search the machinery to the west to get a key.
**Note: You must read the scroll obtained from the Beaten Book to search Machinery or the option will not appear.
* If you didn't bring 2 elemental ores with you, go west and get them by killing 2 Earth elementals (Mine the Elemental Rock for them to spawn).
* Go south from the centre room and smelt your ores into bars, at the furnace.
* Go down the hatch in the centre room with the key in your inventory.

*Take-from the schematic crate to the south, take both schematics.
*Go back upstairs and use one bar on the workbench to make a crane claw. Note: Don't accidentally let it create more than one.
*Return downstairs to the two crane levers and pull the western one to lower the crane.
*Use your claw on the old crane.

*Climb the stairs to the south-west to get on the catwalk.
*Open the junction box to the west.
*Click the pipe ends, not the pipe, to connect them as shown.

*Search all crates on the ground floor and the catwalk of the workshop until you find the following. IMPORTANT: Be sure to read the Crane schematic and Lever schematic, or you will be unable to find all the pieces.
**Pipe
**Small cog
**Medium cog
**Large cog 
* On the north side of the catwalk use the Pipe on the broken piping.
*On the east side of the Ground floor use the cogs on the pins on the side of the machine that looks like a wind tunnel as shown.
**Small cog on upper left pin
**Medium cog on lower left pin
**Large cog on right pin.
*Pull the old lever to the right.
**Note: The repairs are now complete. You will no longer need to head up to the catwalk again.

* On the south side place an elemental bar on the jig cart. (under the elemental claw)
**Note: Crane controls in case you get stuck:
**Raise/Lower crane: western lever
**Rotate crane: eastern lever
**
*First, use the western lever (by the schematics crate) to raise the crane.
*Use the eastern lever to rotate the crane.
*Use the western lever twice to lower the crane into the lava and back up again.
**At this point the elemental bar should be orange.
*Use the eastern lever to rotate the crane over the cart.
*Use the western lever twice to lower the bar onto the cart and release it.
*Pull the lever just north of the claw controls to move the cart.
**Note: The lever in front of the yellow sign moves the cart to the next station.

*Pull the western-most lever - in front of the press station - to flatten the bar once the cart has stopped.
**Note: At this point the elemental bar should be flattened.
*Pull the yellow sign lever again to move the cart to the next station.

*Pull the northern-most lever.
*Turn the corkscrew lever twice.
*Pull the northern-most lever again.
*Turn the west water valve twice so that the valve opens and closes. The tank will fill.
*Turn the east water valve twice so that the valve opens and closes. The tank will empty.
*Pull the northern-most lever.
**Note: At this point the elemental bar should be blue.
*Turn the corkscrew lever twice.
*Pull the northern-most lever to close the door.
*Pull the yellow sign lever again.

*Pull the east lever 
**At this point the elemental bar should be white.
**Note: The machine may need to be turned off and back on again for the bar to turn white.
*Pull the east lever again to stop the fan.
*Pull the yellow sign lever again.

*Take-from the jig to get a primed bar.
*Head down the stairs to the north-west.
*Go through the east door. 
*Use your primed bar with the extractor gun.
*Operate the Extractor hat with the bar placed under the gun.
**Note: Your magic level will be drained by 20.
*Take-from the extractor gun to get a primed mind bar.
*Go up both spiral stairs 
(Note: Make sure you have the beaten book in your inventory. If you only have the slashed book you will automatically make a mind shield and not the mind helmet.)
*Use your primed mind bar on the workbench to smith a mind helmet.
*Congratulations, quest complete!
*Speak to Ur-tag or Ambassador Alvijar in the north-east part of Dorgesh-Kaan's middle level.

*Head to the south-west corner of the city's middle level.
*Enter the doorway with the transportation symbol on the minimap.
*Walk south on the tracks and talk to Tegdak.
*Dig up artefacts from the ground with the trowel (there are six artefacts total).
*Use artefacts on the specimen table to clean them.
*Talk to Tegdak. Zanik will automatically follow you after (if you don't have a follower already).

*Make sure Zanik is following you.
**If Zanik is not following you, head back to the cave and talk to her.
*Talk to the Goblin scribe in the house west of Ur-tag where you started the quest.
*Speak to Oldak in the north-west corner of the city's lower level (there are stairs down in the house west of the scribe) to teleport to the Goblin Village.

*Talk to General Wartface or Bentnoze. A cutscene will start.
*Run south to the ladder, stay behind the houses on the west side to not get hit.
*Climb up and kill the H.A.M. Mage and H.A.M. Archer, you must use magic or ranged. Throwing darts can work, only if you use the "long range" combat style. If you forgot a magic or ranged weapon, a crossbow and 50 bronze bolts spawns just to the west of your character upstairs.
*Talk to General Wartface or General Bentnoze to receive ancient mace and two goblin warriors

*Go to the Lumbridge Swamp Cave entrance (outside by the giant frogs in Lumbridge Swamp) 
*Talk to one of the goblin sergeants.
*Read the following steps before doing them as this next section is time sensitive.
*#Enter the caves then climb down the nearby ladder.
*#As soon as you're down, talk to the sergeants and tell one of them to wait. 
*#Run to the room and enter.
*#Wait for 2 guards to pass.
*#Tell your sergeant to wait in the room. 
*#Run up to the boxes to trigger a 3rd guard and run back to the room so he doesn't see you.
*#After the 3rd guard passes, ask your sergeant to follow you again. 
*#Walk (do not run) to the end of the tunnel and the final guard will attack your sergeant.
*#Climb down the ladder to fight Sigmund - Use the Ancient mace's special attack ONLY AFTER he starts using prayer to disable it for the entire fight.
*Defeat Sigmund.
*Untie Zanik.
*Congratulations, quest complete!
**Optional: Ride the train to Keldagrim to complete a hard task of the Lumbridge & Draynor Diary.

*Head to the entrance of the mountain camp east of Rellekka or north of the fairy ring.
*Take the path north, past the guard, and use your rope on a boulder you can push to get around.
*Head into the camp and talk to Hamal the Chieftain.  (or  with The Fremennik Trials completed)

*Dig some mud from the mud pond south of Hamal's house.
**If you do not have a staff, go north of Hamal's house and take a pole. Keep this throughout the quest.
*Go north, following the path along the lake westward.
*Use the mud on the tall tree then climb it. You do *not* need to do this again for subsequent climbs.
*Use your pole or staff on the clump of rocks to pole vault over.
*Use your plank on the flat stones. Keep this throughout the quest.
*Listen to the shining pool. 
*Use your plank on the flat stone to return to shore.

*Talk to Hamal the Chieftain about the people of Rellekka. 
*Search for Svidi between Rellekka and the entrance to Keldagrim. 
*Go to Rellekka and talk to Brundt the Chieftain in the longhall. or  if Lunar Diplomacy started/completed.
*Return to the Mountain Camp, and enter the large tent south-west of Hamal the Chieftain.
*Use your pickaxe on the Ancient Rock located in the southern tent to get half a rock.
*Take this back to Rellekka, and talk to Brundt the Chieftain   or  if Lunar Diplomacy started/completed, who will give you the guarantee of safe passage.
**(optional) While you still have your pickaxe, mine some coal in the Rellekka mine for a Fremennik diary task. (requires completion of The Fremmenik Trials)
*Take the guarantee to Svidi. You do not need to check on Svidi afterward.
*Return to Hamal the Chieftain.

*Talk to Hamal the Chieftan again, this time about food supplies. 
*Talk to Jokul just north of Hamal. He will tell you of a White Pearl plant that is very hardy.
*Travel to White Wolf Mountain (Keldagrim minecart system if The Giant Dwarf is completed, or Gnome glider if The Grand Tree completed.)
*Equip gloves and pick-from the thorny bushes by the gnome glider.
*Eat the white pearl you picked to get the white pearl seed.
*Speak to Hamal the Chieftain to give him the white pearl seed.

*Speak to the shining pool again (remember to use the pole/staff and plank).
*Cross the gap back to shore without the plank, as this will put you closer to the cave.
*Follow the northern path east to a cave.
*Chop down the trees blocking your path (make sure you are facing east) 
*Enter the cave
*Talk to The Kendal. 
*Kill The Kendal. He can be safespotted utilizing skeletons around the room.
*Take the corpse of woman 
*Return to Hamal the Chieftain. 
*Gather 5 muddy rocks from around the camp.
*Talk to Ragnar near the tall tree by the lake to get Asleif's necklace. 
*Return to the shining pool and bury the corpse on the island.
*Use the muddy rocks on the burial mound.(You make the mound by burying the corpse on the island.)
*Congratulations, quest complete!
*Talk to Sanfew (top floor of the Taverley herblore store), or if you have completed Zogre Flesh Eaters).

*Climb to the top of Trollheim, using the agility shortcuts if you can to save time, and enter Eadgar's Cave (see map for path alternatives).
*If you have not yet freed Eadgar in the troll stronghold's prison, pickpocket (30+ ) or kill Berry the northern sleeping troll guard and use the cell key 2 on Eadgar's cell. Check your Troll Stronghold quest log and there will be a line that will either say "I've rescued Godric" or "I've rescued Godric and Mad Eadgar" to make sure.
*Speak with Eadgar in his cave. 
*Go to Burntmeat's Kitchen, which is at the south end of the middle floor of the stronghold.
*Talk to Burntmeat.
*Return to Eadgar and speak with him.

*For the secret door path, Slayer ring teleport to the Fremennik Slayer Dungeon or use the Fairy ring with (code ) to teleport outside the Dungeon entrance.
*Head north-east to a narrow passage, climb over the rocks, and go through the secret entrance to the north.
**If you have not yet freed Eadgar in the troll stronghold's prison, pickpocket (30+ ) or kill Berry the northern sleeping troll guard and use the cell key 2 on Eagdar's cell. Check your Troll Stronghold quest log and there will be a line that will either say "I've rescued Godric" or "I've rescued Godric and Mad Eadgar" to make sure.
*Head to Burntmeat's Kitchen, which is at the south end of the middle floor of the stronghold.
*Talk to Burntmeat.
*Go speak with Eadgar, whose cave is at the top of Trollheim.

*Travel to Ardougne Zoo, talk to Parroty Pete and ask him both questions. 
*Use vodka (right click it to avoid accidentally drinking it) on the pineapple chunks.
*Use alco-chunks on the aviary hatch (west side of parrot cage).
*Do not drop the parrot or it will fly away and you will need to retrieve it from Eadgar.
*Talk to Eadgar in his cave at Trollheim about making the fake human.
*Go back to the Troll Stronghold. You may skip this and use the parrot on your way back to Eadgar in the next section if using the agility way.
*Run north and go down both flights of stairs.
*Use the parrot on the rack north of the cells.

*Talk to Tegid in Taverley south-east of the Herblore store for a dirty robe. 
**Pick up 10 Grain just south-west of Tegid if you need them. 
**Kill 5 chickens on the way at Tenzing's house if you need Raw chicken.
*Pick a thistle in one of the grass patches near Eadgar's cave entrance. It is very small and coloured the same as the grass. Zoom in close on each patch to find a green flower around the patch of grass. It can be hard to see. Note that it only spawns in one of the patches of grass at a time.
*Enter Eadgar's cave and talk to Eadgar.
*Light a fire with your other log and cook the thistle on it to make a dried thistle. (You may also use one of the fires near the trolls to the west.)
*Use the pestle and mortar on the dried thistle and add it to a ranarr potion (unf).
*Talk to Eadgar.
*Retrieve your parrot from the rack in the troll stronghold.
*Talk to Eadgar.
*Give the fake man to Burntmeat.
*Search the kitchen drawers by the south wall to obtain a storeroom key.

*Go down the nearby stairs inside the kitchen to the storeroom.
*Sneak to the back and take goutweed. Note:

Run to the tile next to the goutweed; clicking on the goutweed to move to it will get you stuck on the guard.

You will take 0-6 damage if caught during the puzzle. Protect from missiles will negate this.

::It is highly recommended you take 2 extra goutweed for Dream Mentor and Dragon Slayer II. You can only get one Goutweed per trip.

If you stand on the same tile as the door (where you end up when you select -Open Door-) and -search- the Goutweed Crate just before the two Guards meet right below (south of) the door you can run straight through, depending on how the trolls are synced, which can be slightly off on some worlds. 

::Another method is to start on the door tile like before and -search- Goutweed, just as the darker troll with a shield (slightly south-west of the door tile) makes its turn on the south-eastern corner of its square route (if you fail, remember which troll hit you and gauge the timing during your next try. 

Flick Protect from Missiles to avoid damage from the sleeping Guard. If you can't make it all the way in one go, use this same method of standing in the doorway & timing your run to the final hiding spot, tile just east of the goutweed crates.

*Return the goutweed to Sanfew. 
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Talk to Commander Veldaban in Keldagrim, just west of the bank. This will begin a cutscene (note: If you click the east side of the bridge directly as the cutscene begins your avatar will migrate east during the cutscene). 
*Buy 3 beers from the pub south of the drunken dwarf's house if you don't have them already. 
*Speak to the drunken dwarf in the middle of East Keldagrim (north-east of the kebab shop, there's a bar south). 
*Talk to him again and give him a beer.

*Speak to the rowdy dwarf outside the East Keldagrim pub, he will request a random item. Get it and bring it to him. (If you buy it at the Grand Exchange, use the free minecart transport north-west in the GE.)
*Travel to the tunnel under White Wolf Mountain (Optional: Buy White Wolf Mountain ticket (100 coins) from Keldagrim Cart Conductor to travel to the White Wolf Mountain tunnel. Use the south minecart track.)
*Talk to Khorvak in the pub under White Wolf Mountain .
*Give a dwarven stout to Khorvak. (If you didn't bring a dwarven stout, pick up the dwarven stout spawn from table in pub.)
*(Optional) Buy a Keldagrim ticket from the Cart Conductor under White Wolf Mountain for 100 coins (50 if Ring of charos is used) to get back to Keldagrim, or teleport to Blast Furnace minigame.
*Talk to Gauss in the bar south of the bank (western side of Keldagrim). Give him cheers with another beer.

*Go to the "Kelda Hops Patch" just south-east of the bank. Speak with Rind The Gardener, or you will receive a message that you should ask for permission before using the patch.
*Plant the kelda seeds (there is a rake south of the patch).
*They will grow in 15–20 minutes and cannot die. You will get a chat notification when ready (you can be logged out while waiting).
*Harvest the kelda hops.

*Go upstairs in the East Keldagrim pub.
*If you did not bring ale yeast, buy ale yeast from Blandebir for 25 coins (empty pot spawn can be found near the vat). 
*Add to the vat in this order:
**2 buckets of water.
**2 barley malts.
**Kelda hops.
**Ale yeast.
*Wait 15–20 minutes for the notification again.
*Turn the valve and use an empty beer glass on the barrel.
*Return to the drunken dwarf's house, north-east of the Kebab shop, and talk about the Red Axe.

*Talk to the southernmost cart conductor in south-eastern Keldagrim. 
**Only one of them will let you ask about the closed-off tunnel.
*Talk to the director of the mining company you joined in The Giant Dwarf, which is located upstairs in either the west or the east marketplace (Palace). If you don't remember which company you joined just go from director to director. The only one with time to speak with you is yours. 
*Return to the minecarts and ride the southernmost cart (no ticket necessary, but need both hands free).

*Search the box.
*Use the dwarven machinery.
*Set up the path shown in the "Part 1" image and click OK.
*Ride the cart, collect more stones from the box.
*Return on the cart to the start point, then input the next path.
*Collect the stones and return again.
*Input the third path to move on to the next room.
*Listen to the conversation, crawl to the other side, and leave.
*Complete the puzzle in the same manner as the first one.
*Search the crates and bookshelves until you've read 3 documents relating to the Red Axe, then continue into the next room.
*Complete the puzzle in the same manner as the previous ones.
*Watch the cutscene.

*Buy a kebab from the kebab shop and a beer in the pub (both in East Keldagrim) if you don't already have them.
*Talk to Commander Veldaban (west of the bank).
*While in the pub (in the east side of Keldagrim) drink your beer and eat your kebab.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*(Have at least 1 free inventory space. Using a gnome glider to travel to "Gandius" is the fastest way to get there, but this requires 30 Agility to cross a shortcut. Moving your player-owned house to Brimhaven is another fast transport option.) Talk to Mosol Rei outside of Shilo Village. 
*Go to Trufitus at his house in eastern Tai Bwo Wannai (quest icon on minimap). Fairy ring  is nearby.
*Use the wampum belt on him.

*To get to Ah Za Rhoon, after giving Trufitus the wampum belt head east then slightly south to the log crossing near the crashed Gnome glider, cross the log then proceed south to the dark rocky area on the minimap. It is fastest to teleport to the Emir's Arena via the ring of dueling, and then use the nearby gnome glider to Gandius.
*Use your spade on the mound of earth.
*Use a lit torch or candle on the fissure, then use your rope on the fissure. (Note: You will lose whatever light source you decide to use on the fissure.)
*Search the fissure (32 Agility) to climb down and follow the cave south until you reach the stream.
* Use your chisel on the stone at 4 to receive a stone-plaque. Read it.
*Search the cave-in at 2 to enter a new cave. 
*Search the loose rocks at 6 to find a tattered scroll. Read the scroll.
*Search the sacks at 7 to find a crumpled scroll. Read the scroll.
*Search the ancient gallows at 8 to get the Zadimus corpse. 
*Teleport out, or head back to the first area via the Cave in at 2.
**If you went back to first area, leave by crafting the broken table at 3 into a raft, or by searching the rocks at 5. You will take heavy damage if you fail the search rocks at 5.
*Return to Trufitus and use the 4 items you have collected on him.
*Head west to the Tribal Statue near Trufitus' hut and bury the corpse.
*Use the bone shard on Trufitus.

*Head south-west to Cairn Isle, west of Shilo Village, near fairy ring . Climb the rocks, requiring 15 Agility, and then cross the bridge. 
*Search the well stacked rocks on the northern side of the island, and then enter the crevice, requiring 32 Agility. (If you can't get in the cave it is because the scrolls haven't been read). 
*Head south and search the dolmen (Note: Make sure you have at least 3 empty inventory slots or you will have to come back with Charcoal and Papyrus to get the notes).
*Use a chisel on the sword pommel.
*Use bronze wire on the bone beads.
*Teleport out, if you do not have either fairy rings or you have not completed The Grand Tree, climb up the rockslide nearby to escape the cave. You will take up to 10 damage if you fail to climb the rocks.

*Prepare for the fight against Nazastarool. Crumble Undead is useful alongside Protect from Melee.
*Head south-east from fairy ring to the north-eastern dot on the Karamja map above.
*Search the unique bright green palm tree from the north side to find two doors.
*Search the doors to find the keyhole.
*Use your chisel on the bone shard to make a bone key.
*Equip the Beads of the dead then use the key on the doors.
*Open the ancient gate (while wearing the beads of the dead necklace), then climb down the rocks.
*Run west, south, then south-west through the dungeon to reach a pair of doors.
*Use 3 regular bones on the doors. (Note: Be sure not to bury them.)
*  *Note* if you have forgotten your bones you can kill the skeletons for the bones, do not kill the zombies as they will turn into a cloud of green gas.
*Search the dolmen, then defeat Nazastarool in his 3 forms. If you click away from the dialogue at the end of each form, click on the dolmen again to resume the other phases.
**Use Protect from Melee or stand behind the dolmen to safespot him.
*Take the Rashiliyia corpse.

*Return to Cairn Isle (fairy ring ).
*Go through the well-stacked rocks.
*Use the corpse on the dolmen.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Talk to Brundt in the longhall to start the quest. (Fairy ring and run south-west to Rellekka), or  if started or finished Mountain Daughter
*The trials may be done in any order, however this quick guide will show you the fastest order.

*Talk to Manni the Reveller while in the longhall. 
*Take the keg of beer and challenge Manni to a drinking contest. You will lose. 
*If you did not bring a beer, grab the beer tankard now.
*Talk to Sigli the Huntsman outside, near the entrance of the longhall, to obtain the Hunters' Talisman. 
*Talk to Olaf the Bard just east of the longhall. 
*Talk to Olaf again. 
*To get a lyre, either make it yourself (Requires    and 6 free inventory spaces) or kill Lanzig (1/17 drop rate). Killing lanzig takes longer on average. You must enchant it either way.
**Option 1: Making the lyre yourself (Items required: Axe of any kind, knife)
***Walk to the Swaying tree that is east of the entrance to Rellekka (north-west of the Golden Apple Tree at ) at the rare trees icon. Chop a branch and fletch an unstrung lyre.
***Talk to Lalli to the south-east of the Swaying tree, ask about the other human. 
***Talk to Askeladden just outside the longhall entrance to get a pet rock.
***Pick a cabbage, potato, and onion from the farming patch in the south-east corner of Rellekka.
***Return to Lalli, and offer the pet rock.
***Use the cabbage, potato, onion, and pet rock on Lalli's Stew (cauldron).
***Talk to Lalli again to get the golden fleece.
***Spin the golden fleece on a spinning wheel and use it on the unstrung lyre. (See the next section to spin the wool)
**Option 2: Killing Lanzig (takes a long time with bad luck)
***Lanzig lives in a hut just east of the entrance to the longhall. Kill Lanzig until he drops the lyre (1/17 drop rate). Safespottable at the firepit or outside his door.

*Teleport to Camelot or walk to Seers' Village.
*If you are making the lyre yourself:
**Spin the golden fleece into a ball of golden wool while in Seers' Village (upstairs in a house south of the bank).
**Use the golden wool on your unstrung lyre.
*Go to the Seers' Village pub and talk to the Poison Salesman to buy a low alcohol keg for 250 coins. 
*Buy a regular beer if you forgot to take a beer tankard.

*Use a Rellekka house teleport to return, or simply walk back. If walking, left-click on your talisman to check if The Draugen is nearby on your way. If so, kill him.
*Use the beer, or beer tankard, on the council workman by the bridge south of Rellekka to obtain strange object.
*Go north across the bridge, then walk a bit west until you see a small narrow path heading south into the water. (The large rib cage sticking out of the water on the left side of the bridge)
*Use your raw shark/manta ray/sea turtle on the strange altar to enchant your lyre.
*Follow your talisman by left-clicking on it and kill The Draugen now if you haven't already. Appears as a grey butterfly prior to locating the correct tile. 
*Once done, head back into Rellekka and talk to Sigli at the entrance.
*Head to the outside of the longhall to the pipe on the eastern wall. Use a tinderbox on your strange object and use the lit strange object on the pipe.
*Enter the north-eastern back door of the longhall, walk onto the stage, and play your enchanted lyre.
*Exit the back door, enter the main long hall, and take a keg of beer off the table.
*Use your low alcohol keg on the keg of beer.
*Challenge Manni to a drinking contest again.

*Talk to Sigmund The Merchant in the market west of the longhall. 
*Talk to the Sailor on the docks to the north-west. 
*Talk to Olaf the Bard just east of the longhall. 
*Talk to Yrsa at the clothing store west of the market. 
*Talk to Brundt the Chieftain in the longhall. or  if you are doing or have finished Mountain Daughter
*Talk to Sigli the Huntsman just south of the longhall. 
*Talk to Skulgrimen in the hut just north of the longhall. 
*Talk to the Fisherman north of the market. 
*Talk to Swensen the Navigator in the building south of the market. 
*Talk to Swensen again. 
*Climb down the ladder and take the South, West, East, North, South, East, then North portals. Climb up the ladder.
*Talk to Peer the Seer just north-west of Swensen. 
*Talk to Thorvald the Warrior in the hut just north of the longhall. 
*Talk to Manni the Reveller in the longhall. 
*Talk to Thora the Barkeep in the longhall. 
*Talk to Askeladden in front of the longhall, pay him 5,000 coins. 
*Head back and talk to (in order): 
**Thora
**Manni
**Thorvald
**Peer
**Swensen
**Fisherman
**Skulgrimen
**Sigli
**Brundt
**Yrsa
**Olaf
**Sailor
**Sigmund

*Go to a bank (The Seers' Village bank is close) and deposit all of your items (you cannot have any weapons, armour, or runes).
*Bring equipment for the fight:
**A dramen branch (Note: Requires and must have started Lost City), celastrus bark (requires ), or a goblin paint cannon
**A knife (optional - only bring if you are not using a goblin paint cannon)
**A stat boosting amulet
**A Combat bracelet
**Plenty of food, potions, and rings of recoil
*Talk to Thorvald just north of the longhall. 
*Climb down the ladder. If you have a knife and dramen branch, cut it into a staff and equip it. You can also use celastrus bark to fletch a battlestaff.
*Fight the first 3 forms of Koschei the Deathless without weapons, armour, or runes. (You can pray flick him for the first 3 forms, but be careful as dying in these forms is dangerous for Hardcore Ironmen AND Group Hardcore Ironmen). Do not go up the ladder after completing the 3rd form - it is safe to die from the 4th form.
*You can choose to let the 4th form kill you (this IS safe for Hardcore Ironmen AND Group Hardcore Ironmen as Koschei will not actually finish you in this form; the player will faint and wake up upstairs rather than being killed), or you can kill it (slower to this and not necessary).
*Talk to Thorvald again.

*Talk to Peer the Seer south-west of the market. 
**He will deposit all your items except anything that is unbankable. (you cannot progress through this part of the quest if anything in your inventory is unbankable).
*Open the west door to his house, read the riddle.
*Each line of the riddle gives you one letter of a four-letter word. See the table below for the first riddle line and the related answer.

*Open the door again and climb-up the ladder.
*Search/study these objects to get a bucket, red disk, wooden disk, jug, and red herring:
**South-western cupboard (bucket)
**Unicorn head (red disk)
**Bull head (wooden disk)
**Southern chest (jug)
**Northern bookcase (red herring)
*Use the red herring on the cooking range.
*Use the sticky red goop on the wooden disk.
*Open the trapdoor on the east side, climb-down the trapdoor, and use the two red disks on the abstract mural.
*Return upstairs and use the bucket on the tap by the cooking range.
*Use the full bucket on the jug.
*Use the jug on the drain.
*Use the 2/5ths bucket on the empty jug.
*Refill the bucket.
*Use the full bucket on the 2/3rds jug.
*Use the 4/5ths bucket on the northern chest with the scale.
*Fill the vase with water and add the lid.
*Use the sealed vase on the frozen table.
*Use the frozen key on the cooking range.
*Climb-down the eastern trapdoor and you can now open the door to leave.

*Talk to Brundt the Chieftain.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Find the Dwarven Ferryman. Either enter the tunnel and subsequent cave just south of the Polar Hunter area (fairy ring ) OR go to northern part of Keldagrim and use the Travel option on the Dwarven Boatman.
*Talk to the Dwarven Ferryman (not the Dwarven Boatman) and use the ring of charos (a) or use the Travel option to go across the river.
*Run north and east across the bridge and west past the second wooden bridge to talk to Dondakan. 
*Go to western Keldagrim and talk to the Dwarven Engineer in the Trading Consortium's palace smithing shop.
**Note: The Dwarven Boatman (near the Dwarven Ferryman) will take you quickly to northern Keldagrim and back.

*Go to the Ice Mountain entrance of the Dwarven Mine and talk to Rolad in the east house (chat will disengage once then re-engage).
** (Optional) Purchase the ammo mould from Nulodion here
*Go down the trapdoor to the Dwarven Mine. Complete the following in any order until you receive the respective pages:
**Kill Scorpions for book page 1.
**Search the mine carts for book page 2.
**Mine any rocks except Adamantite or Coal for book page 3.
*Talk to Rolad. (chat will again disengage then re-engage)
*Read Dwarven lore in its entirety and keep it for later.

*Go back to the Keldagrim mines and talk to Dondakan.
*Use a gold bar on him.
*Go to any furnace and use a gold bar on the furnace to make a golden cannon ball. Edgeville is recommended for easy fairy ring or Keldagrim minecart access.
*Use the golden cannon ball on Dondakan to receive a Schematic.

*Read the Dwarven lore book to receive the base schematics. 
*Go back to the Dwarf Engineer at the Western Trade Consortium to get the Schematics.
*Use your gold bar on the nearby anvil to make a gold helmet. 
** (Optional) Smith the gold helmet in the wilderness Resource Area to complete a Wilderness Diary Medium Achievement.

*Go to the pub in the White Wolf Mountain passage and speak to Khorvak. 
*Assemble the schematics per below to get the completed Schematic:

*Equip your Gold helmet and pickaxe and prepare to kill a level 75-125 Arzinian Avatar.
*Talk to Dondakan with the schematics.

*Mine 6 OR 15 Gold ore (keep them in your inventory. If you aren't going to get 15, just get 6 as there is no benefit before 15). Getting 15 reduces the boss's level from 125 to 75, so this is recommended for lower-level players. 
*Go to the centre of the area.
*Go through the first set of flames.
*Talk to the second set of flames.
*Kill the Arzinian Avatar. It will be either Arzinian Avatar of Magic (if your highest combat stat is a melee stat), Arzinian Avatar of Ranging (if your highest combat stat is Magic), or Arzinian Avatar of Strength (if your highest combat stat is Ranged). Choose combat equipment and prayers accordingly. See Arzinian Avatar for more details.

*Talk to Dondakan.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Speak to Advisor Ghrim. (fairy ring code )
*Talk to Princess Astrid or Prince Brand (depending on who you married), watch the cutscene.
*Talk to King Vargas. 
*Talk to Gardener Gunnhild by the flax patch next to the castle entrance.
*Talk to Queen Sigrid. 
*Talk to Matilda in/around the southern building inside the castle's walls.
*Talk to Queen Sigrid. 
*Now is a good time to gear up at the bank at the north part of Etceteria as you won't be coming back here until after the boss fight. Don't forget to take an antipoison to help with the fight. Also take 5 coal or have at least 5 empty spaces. Note: Do not waste time trying to mine coal near Miner Magnus, as you don't actually get any resources. An area to mine coal is provided later on in the quest.

*Talk to King Vargas.
*Talk to Advisor Ghrim. 
*Talk to the Sailor at the Miscellania docks. 
*Talk to King Vargas with one open inventory slot to receive a scroll proving you are Regent of Miscellania.
*Enter the dungeon, down the ladder in the courtyard (along the castle's south wall).
*Talk to Donal in the pub. 
*Go north, take a pick (on the rock next to the dwarves) if you need coal.
*Use the mining prop on the crevice and proceed through the crevice.
*Take an engine and put the 5 coal in it.
*Take the following from the crates:
**2 beams.
**3 pulley beams.
**1 rope.
*Use a beam on a pulley beam to get a long pulley beam; use another regular beam on it to make a longer pulley beam.
*To the broken scaffold add:
**A pulley beam.
**A longer pulley beam.
**A pulley beam.
**A rope.
*Take:
**1 beam.
**1 rope.
*Add a beam to the platform.
*Put the engine on the engine platform.
*If you haven't yet, add your five coal to the engine.
*Use the lift and take the plank.
*Enter the tunnel, run east, and use your rope on the rock.
**Keep running and make sure to continue through your character's dialogue.
*Take the diary from the fire remains.
*Use your plank to cross the rocks, be sure to collect all diary pages by searching the four additional fires through the cave.
*Continue running and avoid the steam vents as they will damage you.
*Read the diary and continue through the crevice, watch the cutscene.
*Talk to Armod.

*Follow the passage north and enter the crevice at the end of the passage
*Kill the Giant Sea Snake. Use protect from ranged prayer and attack at a distance (magic preferred).
*Take the heavy box.
*Leave the crevice of the boss room and climb up the rope for a shortcut back to Etceteria castle.
*Talk to Queen Sigrid to receive a letter and 20000 gold. (You need two free inventory slots.)
*Talk to King Vargas.

*Talk to Kangai Mau in the Brimhaven food store. 
*Take a ship to Ardougne using the port near Brimhaven (for the Karamja easy diary) and head west of the ship to the GPDT depot, located to the south of the eastern bank.
*Investigate the most north-eastern crate for the address label.
*Use the label on the crate located 2 tiles to the south of the first crate.
*Talk to a GPDT employee. 
*Go to West of the Ardougne Market, to the mansion with two fountains and speak to gardener, Horacio.  
*Speak to gardener Horacio again.   Horacio will tell you that the password to the lock is Handelmort's middle name.
*Go to the Estate Agent house directly south of the mansion.
*Pick up the Guide book and read it to find the name. Your quest checklist will now show KURT.
*Head to the house with the checkered floor north-east of the Ardougne market. 
*Talk to Wizard Cromperty., or  (if you have completed the medium or higher Ardougne diaries)
*Go west 2 doors and enter the password KURT. (Caution: If you click too quickly it will say "This combination is incorrect.)
*Right-click Investigate the stairs, requiring 21 Thieving, then climb them.
*Search the chest on the top floor for the totem. (Make sure you finish the dialogue.)
*Return to Kangai Mau.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Speak to the Dwarven Boatman. ( then go through the tunnel to the south west. Once inside proceed through the Cave Entrance directly ahead between the two statues. ) 
*Finish the conversation with Commander Veldaban. 
*Talk to Blasidar the sculptor on the east side of Keldagrim, south of the kebab shop.

*Talk to Vermundi, the silk trader in the eastern market. (Big building east side of river, silk icon) 
*Talk to the Librarian in the library, located at the north-east corner of West Keldagrim. 
*Climb any bookcase to find a book on costumes known as the 'Scholars Guide to Dwarven Costumes'.
**Note: If you weigh 30 kg or more, you will be unable to climb the ladder.
*If you didn't bring coal, mine in the north-east corner of East Keldagrim or purchase from Ordan in the Blast Furnace.
*Talk to Vermundi again. 
*Use your coal and logs on the spinning machine next to Vermundi then light it with a tinderbox.
*Talk to Vermundi again and pay 200gp for exquisite clothes. 
*If you didn't bring the 3 Sapphires, they can be purchased from Hervi at the Gem stall just to the north of Vermundi.
*While here, steal from the baker's or crafting stall for completion of a task in the Easy Fremennik Diary (optional)
*Talk to Saro at the anvil south-west of the bank in West Keldagrim. 
*Speak to Dromund in the house just north of the bank.
*Take the left boot when he isn't looking.
*Go outside behind his house and telegrab the right boot through the window when he isn't looking.
*Talk to Santiri at the weapon shop in north-western West Keldagrim. 
*Use your 3 sapphires on the axe (now in your inventory) and talk to him again. 
*If you have not completed The Knight's Sword Quest then you must speak to the librarian and then to Reldo in Varrock Library.
*Talk to Thurgo at Mudskipper Point, and give him an iron bar to repair the axe. ( May need a redberry pie if Thurgo has not received one recently).
*You will be given the option to immediately return to Keldagrim; do so.

*Once in Blasidar's house, talk to Riki the sculptor's model to give him the clothes, axe and boots.
*Talk to Blasidar. Watch the cutscene.

Lazy tip: rather than go back and forth you can just fill your inventory with say copper, and get a new task before closing the dialogue until you get copper.

*Go to the upper floor of the market and talk to the secretary of any company except the Red Axe. . Ensure you perform tasks only for the company you choose, as the progress for each is separate. Buy the ores from Ordan in the Blast Furnace to save time.
*Offer to help them. The secretaries require you to retrieve ores (cannot be noted). Be sure to read the dialogue to know what ores you need or fill your inventory with about 5 of each.
** You CAN keep all ores/bars in your inventory noted and exchange them at general store downstairs.
** You can also fill up your inventory with one type of ore, and speak to the secretary to ask for a task. If they ask for another type of ore, just click on the secretary again without accepting. Repeat this until they ask for the type of ore you are carrying (this will often take longer than just making trips to retrieve whatever is asked)
* A hidden scoring system determines your progress with a company; each ore delivery completed gives 20 points, while failing or refusing a task subtracts 2 points. Once you reach 75 points, you can deliver metal bars for the director for 12 points each; 100 points is required to progress through this section.
**Note: Don't refuse tasks, if you don't like the task click on the secretary again for a new task before closing the dialogue. Refusing too many tasks will gradually reduce the hidden score and you will have to do more tasks to make up for it.
** Players who join The Purple Pewter can get a head start of 20 points if speaking to the Purple Pewter Secretary whilst wearing a full set of H.A.M. robes.
*Talk to the director after making enough progress and complete a few tasks for them. 
**Note: The directors require you to retrieve bars (cannot be noted). Be sure to read the dialogue to know what bars you need or fill your inventory with about 5 of each. The dialogue closing trick from the secretary DOES NOT work here! Instead, click on the director before advancing the chat window.
*After enough tasks, the director asks whether you've considered joining their company or states that you don't need to be doing running errands for them anymore. Join the company. 
*Tell the director that Blasidar sent you, offer your support. 
*Go back and talk to Commander Veldaban west of the bank, he will ask if you want to attend the meeting. You may choose not to.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Talk to Ellamaria at the garden east of Varrock Palace. 
**Optionally you could place your compost early in the 2 empty plant pots north to save inventory spaces after speaking to Ellamaria.
*Talk to Ellamaria again to obtain the trolley. 
*Talk to the Wise Old Man in Draynor Village north of the bank with the ring of charos. 
*Quiz answers:
**Show them a range of colours so that they can come to a compromise.
**Take his generous gift even though you have no need for it.
**It's absolutely, unquestionably the most interesting thing I've ever done!
**Put on the silly helmet and jump into the cannon.
**You of course Pkmaster0036, no one could ever challenge your greatness!
**Ask me nicely and I might consider it.
**No, especially not that wise old man, who doesn't look at all suspicious.

*See to the survival of your crops as you see fit.
*Always have on you: a rake, seed dibber, spade, secateurs, watering can, gardening trowel, and ring of charos(a). You may use the tool leprechauns by the patches.
*Equip the ring of charos(a).

*Talk to Elstan. 
*Grow marigolds in the patch (Ultracompost highly recommended).
*Once grown, give them to Elstan for the delphinium seeds (You can continue the quest before finishing this step.)

*Talk to Lyra. 
*Grow onions (both patches reduce chance of failure).
*Once grown, talk to Lyra for the orchid seeds. (You can continue the quest before finishing this step.)

*Talk to Kragen. 
*Grow cabbages (both patches reduce chance of failure).
*Once grown, talk to Kragen for the snowdrop seeds. (You can continue the quest before finishing this step.)

*Talk to Dantaera at the Catherby farming patch. 
*Travel to Ice Mountain, next to Edgeville Monastery.
*Use secateurs on the White Tree located on the northern part of the Ice Mountain.
*Put the White tree shoot in your plant pot and water it.

*Talk to Brother Althric at the Edgeville monastery. 
*Run over to Edgeville and throw the ring of charos(a) down the well.
*Go back to the monastery and pick 4 seeds from the red, pink, and white roses.
*Retrieve your ring with a fishing rod (this could take a few tries) or return to Fenkenstrain's Castle if you destroyed it.
**(Optional) Use the sink in the house west of the well to refill your watering can.

*Talk to Bernald (in the fenced in area beside the bar), while wearing ring of charos(a). 
*Use 1 plant cure on the vines.
*Talk to Bernald again.
*Talk to Alain (with the Ring of charos UN-equipped) by the Taverley tree patch. 
*Crush rune/pure essence with a hammer then grind the shards with a pestle and mortar.
*Add this to the other plant cure and use it on the vines.
*Talk to Bernald to get the vine seeds.

*Return to Elstan north of Port Sarim. Pick the marigolds and give them to Elstan. . 
*Return to Lyra north-west of Port Phasmatys . You do not need to harvest the onions.
*Return to Kragen north of Ardougne . You do not need to harvest the cabbages.
*You may come back to these steps if the crops are not yet grown. Depending on what growth tick you planted on, your plants should be 80-90% grown by the time you reach this step (see "growth timing" under Mechanics on the Farming page).

*Fill the 2 large stone pots with compost. *Note that using the Bottomless Compost Bucket does not work here!
*Plant yellow orchids in the east pot, and pink orchids in the west pot.
*Plant all acquired seeds in the palace garden according to their labelled plots.
**Plant the White tree in the centre patch.
** The White tree takes a long time to grow. You can reduce the time you must wait if you plant the tree just before a growth cycle.
*Talk to Ellamaria for the trolley if you haven't already.

*Use the trolley on the statue of a king (southern statue just outside Lumbridge castle gates).
**If at any point you logout or lose your trolley, speak to Ellamaria to get another.
*Push (or big push) the trolley east over the bridge then place it on the northern plinth in the garden.

*Use the trolley on the statue.
*Watch the cutscene.
*Push the trolley north through the gate then place it on the southern plinth in the garden.

*Wait until every plot is fully grown (takes 10-15 minutes).
*Once fully grown, talk to Ellamaria.
*Talk to King Roald. 
**Make sure you have the ring of charos (a) equipped when talking to King Roald or he will not follow you.
*Watch the cutscene. 
**Warning: Interrupting the queen after the cutscene will cause it to play all over again!
*(Optional) Pick some fruit from the white tree to complete a Varrock medium task (will take a few minutes to produce fruit).
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*From Varrock, head north-east towards the Digsite talk to Launa by the rift. 
*Enter the rift with your rope.
**Note: This will generate a cut scene. Do not click outside of the text boxes as you will return to the surface.

*Use weapons from the rack to kill monsters until rage bar is full. (Logging out will reset the rage bar)
**Anger sword - kills Angry unicorn.
**Anger spear - kills Angry bear.
**Anger mace - kills Angry giant rat.
**Anger battleaxe - kills Angry goblin.
*When your rage bar is full you'll get a cutscene (this gives 40 Attack experience!).
*Head east to the next cave.

*Look inside the dark holes, some will have a fear reaper.
**You cannot search the same hole repeatedly. Search the holes going clock-wise for as many rotations as it takes to get your kills.
*Kill 5 or 6 reapers to get a cutscene.
*Enter the black hole to the west.

*Defeat confusion beasts until you find the one that takes damage. The "fake" ones give combat XP on missed hits and will vanish after 8 hits.
**You can disengage a beast by running to the opposite end of the room.
**If you're attacking a fake one, you can swap to a fast attacking weapon to kill it faster.
** If you quickly swap after attacking one(darts/knife), you can check for 2 fakes and only have to hit one of them 8 times
*Repeat until one door remains to get the cutscene.
*Enter the remaining confusing door.

*Kill all the hopeless creatures 3 times each.
*Cross the bridge and prepare to fight Tolna (3 level-46 monsters).

Note: You must finish the final cutscene/dialogue before attacking the heads or you will be returned to the entrance!
*Kill the 3 heads.
**Use Protect from Missiles to take no damage if ranging, or Protect from Melee to take no damage if meleeing (if low level).
*Talk to Tolna.
*Talk to him again on the surface.
*Congratulations, quest complete!
**Note: Re-enter the rift once you've completed the quest to complete a task from the Varrock Medium Achievement Diary.

*Find and read the book Soul journey in the Arceuus Library. fairy code CIS.
*Talk to Aretha at the Soul Altar. 
*Go to the Arceuus church east of the library and climb up a staircase to get inside.
*Climb down the inner staircase to the courtyard in the centre.
*Dig anywhere to get the Damaged soul bearer.
*Speak to the Key Master, who is found in Cerberus' Lair within the Taverley Dungeon.
*Receive the Soul bearer.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Talk to the Wanderer north-east of Sophanem (see picture) and ask why she has a problem with your cat. 
*Talk to the Wanderer again to give her a tinderbox and waterskin(4). 
*Touch the door of the pyramid where you wake up.

*Navigate by clicking the minimap to automatically avoid the traps.
*Jump the pit (20% minimum energy required, higher Agility increases your chances).
*Go west and open the door.
*Click on the large golden bird to reset the puzzle until it lands on the solution shown in the image on this page. Then click the tiles indicated on the picture.

*Drop your cat and talk to the Sphinx, ask for help. 
*Riddle answer: 9. (if you give the wrong answer your cat will disappear)
*Talk to the High Priest to the south-west.

*Return to the pyramid (right-click door and open) and jump the pit again to trigger the next flashback.
*Open the western door (directly south of you) and take the canopic jar back (you can only pick up the correct one).
*A level 75 or 81 enemy (see the guardians in the info box above) will appear, kill it and take the jar.
*Leave the room and jump across the pit.
*Jump back across the pit.
*Solve the western door puzzle and drop the jar where you found it.
*Leave the room again and jump across the pit once more.
*Exit the pyramid via the entrance ladder.

*Talk to the High Priest. 
*Go to the house south of the church and talk to the Embalmer to give him the linen, salt, and sap.
**If you don't have a linen, go north-east to the Spinning Wheel and talk to Raetul to buy linen for 30 coins.
**If you need a pile of salt, it can be found by using an empty bucket on the pond north of Sophanem and then using the full bucket on the suntrap east of the Embalmer.
*Go east and talk to the Carpenter. He will take your willow logs and give you a holy symbol.

*Enter the pyramid (right click, open door).
*Jump the gap again to trigger the 3rd flashback.
*Enter the east door and use the holy/unholy symbol on any sarcophagus. Exit the room.
*Jump back across the pit and enter the eastern room again.
*Kill the level 91 Possessed Priest.
*Talk to the High Priest.

*Exit the pyramid.
*Talk to the High Priest in the temple.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Enter the top floor of the Watchtower.
**It is possible to use another player's Watchtower portal to get here. Use World 330 (House Party) to find a host, look for the "Yanille portal".
**Otherwise, use the Nightmare Zone teleport in the Grouping/Minigame teleport tab or use fairy ring . Climb the trellis outside the Watchtower and climb up the ladder to the second floor.
*Talk to the Watchtower Wizard. 
*Climb down 2 ladders and search the far north-west bush to find fingernails.
**Kill a giant bat in the Yanille dungeon for bat bones if needed.
*Talk to the Watchtower Wizard.

*Talk to Og north-west of Yanille to receive Toban's key. 
**Fairy ring and head west. 
**If you use a ring of dueling, teleport to Castle Wars and head south past the bridges and then north-east until you find a tribe of ogres.
*Head south and get onto the island by using a rope with the branch (not the tree) of the long-branched tree that is west of the island.
*Talk to Grew. 
*Enter the hole south of Gu'Tanoth (the "Tunnel to Toban" on map above, dungeon icon south of Jiggig, and north-west of some ruins).
**To get there, use a Feldip Hills teleport and run north, use fairy ring  or use a ring of dueling teleport to Castle Wars and run south past Jiggig.
**Pick up the death rune south of the hole if needed.
*Kill Gorad and take his tooth (be sure to have room in your inventory or you won't receive the tooth).
*Talk to Toban. 
*Talk to Toban again with dragon bones in your inventory to receive Relic part 3.
*Search the chest and take Toban's stolen gold.
**Take the rope if you need a second one.
*Talk to Grew back on the Jangerberry island.
**Take some jangerberries if needed.
*Go back and talk to Og.
*Talk to the Watchtower Wizard, who will put the three relics together and give you an ogre relic.
**Take the lit candle if a light source is needed.

*Enter Gu'Tanoth via the path on the north-east corner of the hills, then head west towards the gate. Enter by talking to the Ogre Guard with the ogre relic in your inventory.
*Go south-east to the market in the central area and steal a rock cake from the counter on the southern side. 
** If you need a pestle and mortar and a vial, buy them from the Ogre merchant before stealing the rock cake. 
*Go back to the upper walkway, then head around south until you encounter guards at a battlement. Climb the battlement. 
*Talk to the guard again with the rock cake in your inventory.
*Head north-east and attempt to jump the bridge, then agree to give the guards 20 coins. 
*Talk to a City guard. 
*Talk to a City guard again with a death rune in your inventory to receive a skavid map.
*Return back across the bridges, over the battlement, and through the north-west gate where you entered the city.
*Walk east, then turn south towards the second city gate. 
*Enter the Skavid caves just north of the gate.
*Speak with the scared skavid. 
*Exit the cave, and speak with each regular Skavid inside the following 4 caves:
**East of Gu'Tanoth outside the city around the east side of the mountain.
**North-east of Gu'Tanoth along the main entrance path.
**North of Gu'Tanoth and south of the cluster of trees.
**North of Gu'Tanoth south of the west gate to Yanille. Grab one nightshade.
*The following responses should work. The first part is what the Skavid says. You must respond with the second part:
**Tanath gor...Nod
**Bidith tanath...Cur
**Gor cur...Ar
**Cur bidith...Ig
*Exit the cave and go south to the Eastern City gate. Click on the gate to give a gold bar to the guard and gain access to the gate.
*Continue past the gate and across the bridge into the cave. Speak to the Mad Skavid, who will say one of these options. Repeat with the second part again.
**Ar cur...Gor
**Bidith ig...Cur
**Gor nod...Tanath
**Cur tanath...Bidith
**Bidith tanath...Cur
**Tanath gor...Nod
**Cur bidith...Ig
**Gor cur...Ar
*Take another cave nightshade. Make sure you have two of them. You can hop worlds for the second one.
*Leave the way you came in (do not climb down the hole).
*Return to the Gu'Tanoth market.
*Use one nightshade on one of the Enclave guards (be sure to complete the dialogue).
*Enter the cave and watch the cutscene.
*Teleport out or run north to the exit.

*Go back to the Watchtower wizard and talk to him.
**If needed, fill a vial with water at the fountain in front of the watchtower.
*To a vial of water add in the following order (do not use the ground bat bones first or the water will evaporate and you will need more bones):
**Guam leaf – to make a guam potion (unf)
**Jangerberries (make sure to use, not eat)
**Ground bat bones (make sure to use, not bury)
***Use pestle and mortar on the bat bones now if you haven't already
*Talk to the Watchtower wizard again, with the unfinished potion in your inventory.

*Prepare to defend yourself against the various ogres and a blue dragon in the Ogre Enclave. Don't forget your anti-dragon shield.
*Return to the market square of Gu'Tanoth.
*Use your nightshade on an Enclave guard to enter the cave again.
*Use the magic ogre potion on all 6 ogre shamans to get the 3rd crystal.
**The pouring animation is a stall, activate protection from melee before using the potion to avoid taking stacked hits from the demons and dragons in the area.
*Right-click mine the Rock of Dalgroth in the centre of the Enclave for the 4th crystal.
*Talk to the Watchtower wizard and return the crystals. (Leave the room and return if crystals remain on pillars before you have placed them.)
**NE: Magenta
**SE: Grey
**SW: Yellow
**NW: Cyan
*Pull the lever to the west.
*Congratulations, quest complete!
*To start, talk to Hetty in her house in Rimmington.

*Kill a rat in the archery store directly west of Hetty to get a rat's tail.
*Buy an eye of newt from Betty for 3gp.
*Run to the chapel south of Port Sarim. Kill a giant rat and take the raw rat meat. Run back to Hetty's house. Use the raw rat meat on the fireplace. If you accidentally cook the meat you can re-cook it on the fireplace again to burn it.
*Pick an onion from the field north of Rimmington.

*Talk to Hetty while carrying all four items.
*Drink from the cauldron.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*To begin the quest use the fairy ring code to teleport to the lighthouse. Alternatively, one could teleport to the Barbarian Outpost using a games necklace or Grouping teleport then hop over the rocks to the north to reach the lighthouse. 
*Talk to Larrissa. 
*Run east to the second bridge, use a plank on it.
*Jump the bridge and use a second plank on it.
*Head over to Barbarian Outpost, enter the Barbarian Outpost Agility arena and talk to Gunnjorn for a key. In order to enter the arena, you need to have completed the barcrawl miniquest.
**While at the outpost, prepare for the battle against the Dagannoth and Dagannoth Mother.
**(Optional) Complete a lap of the Agility course to complete a medium Kandarin task.
*Talk to Larrissa again.
*Go to the roof of the lighthouse and use the swamp tar, tinderbox, and molten glass on the lighting mechanism.
*Climb down to the basement, use 1 of each elemental rune, any sword, and any arrow on the strange wall.
*Open the eastern strange wall of the doorway, climb down the ladder and talk to Jossik.
*Kill the level 100 Dagannoth then the level 100 Dagannoth Mother by using any elemental magic attack from the table below.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*You'll get a rusty casket after you defeat the Dagannoth Mother. 
**Go to the 2nd floor[US] of the lighthouse and show it to Jossik to finish the quest. (Note: If your inventory is full when killing the Dagannoth Mother you will not receive the casket. Instead, go and talk to Jossik upstairs who will say he picked up the casket after you left it on the ground.)

*Talk to Vanstrom Klause in the Canifis pub (near the staircase). 
*Grab the 6 wooden planks, 10 coins, a hammer, all the steel weapons and nails, and fill your Druid Pouch if you haven't done so already before teleporting!
*Travel to Mort'ton (Mort'ton teleport, Minigame teleport to Shades of Mort'ton, Barrows teleport,  with 50 Agility,  and get Swamp Boaty, or run from Canifis)
*Talk to Cyreg Paddlehorn (east, by the boat). 
*Board the boat. (Be sure to have filled your Druid Pouch before attempting to board the boat!)
*Go north and climb the tree rope bridge.
*Repair the bridge.
*Continue north and talk to Curpile Fyod. 
**Check the spelling of your answers before choosing them.

*Go north and enter the wooden doors set into the hill.
*Head north-west following the eastern wall to the north west until you find an alcove. Enter the cave entrance in the southern wall of this alcove.
*Talk to Veliaf (no chat options needed).
*Talk to everyone else (no chat options needed).
*Talk to Veliaf (talk to him and give him your steel weapons).
*Kill the level 97 Skeleton Hellhound (you can safespot the hellhound by luring it to the north-east side of the room, to the right of the north barrel or below the north-east bed shown in the picture on the right).
*Talk to Veliaf, ask how to get out. 
*Go back by entering the cave entrance and search the wall to the north.
*Climb up the ladder in the north side of the room.
*Talk to the Stranger in the Canifis pub (the one sitting in the chair where Vanstrom Klause was).
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Talk to Eluned. 
*Talk to Arianwyn in Lletya.
*Teleport to the Outpost using your necklace of passage.
*Go to the Arandar Pass gate, west of the Outpost, and kill a mourner (this will drain your stats including hp to 20).
*Take everything it drops (7 items), and hold onto them.
*(Optional) Use a Ring of Dueling teleport to Ferox Enclave and drink from the Pool of Refreshment to negate mourner potion resetting stats and hp

*Make your way to Tegid by the Taverley lake, and talk to him.
*Search his laundry basket to get Tegid's soap. 
*Use the soap on the bloody mourner top with a bucket of water in your inventory to clean it.

*Teleport to Lletya using the teleport crystal.
*Talk to Arianwyn.
*Talk to Oronwen who is directly north-west of the teleport crystal's destination. 
*Give her the silk, bear fur, and trousers.
**Buy dyes here if needed, you'll need more than 1 of each if you miss the target later on.

*Go to West Ardougne.
*Equip the full mourner outfit.
*Enter the mourner HQ in the north-east corner of West Ardougne.
*Go down the trapdoor and talk to Essyllt in the basement. (2 free inventory spaces needed)
*Talk to the gnome on a rack. Select the chat option about being tickled and toad crunchies. 
*Use the feather on him.
*Release the gnome and talk to him with soft leather, a magic log, and either toad crunchies or premade t'd crunch.

*Go to the Feldip Hills swamp (east of fairy ring ) or the less dangerous swamp south-west of Castle Wars (north-east of fairy ring )
*Use the desired dye on an empty ogre bellow, then the dyed ogre bellows on a swamp toad to get a coloured toad (at least 1 of each colour).
*Re-dye one sheep in each group their respective colour.
**Go to a coloured sheep herd north of East Ardougne used in the Sheep Herder quest.
**Use the respective coloured toad on the fixed device and equip it.
**Select the Aim and Fire attack style.
**Use the controls to aim at a coloured sheep and fire the fixed device.

*Talk to the head mourner, Essyllt.
*Take the rotten apple, located north-west of the Mourner Headquarters by squeezing through the gap in the western fence.
*Talk to Elena west of Ardougne log balance shortcut, you'll be given a sieve.
*Go to the apple orchard to the north-west, west of the Combat Training Camp. (Teleport to The Outpost with a necklace of passage to get there quicker.)
*Pick up an empty barrel inside the orchard and use it on one of the Rotten Apple Piles.
*Use your barrel of rotten apples on the apple press (slightly west of the rotten apple piles) to mash them.
*Use your barrel of naphtha on your mushed apple barrel (in your inventory); then, use your sieve on it.
**See the full guide if you do not have a barrel of naphtha.
*Use the toxic naphtha on a range, not a fire. Make sure you have two open inventory spaces to receive both toxic powders.
**There is a range in the mourner HQ that you can use to save time.
*Add the toxic powder to grain sacks to poison any 2 of the food stores in West Ardougne. The closest 2 are:
**The western room of the main building north of the town square.
**The church south of the town square.
*Talk to Essyllt.
*Talk to Arianwyn in Lletya.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

* Talk to the guard out front of Sinclair Mansion and agree to help. 
* Go north-west and investigate the sacks in the shed, take 4 flypapers.
* Go inside the mansion and take the pungent pot and criminal's dagger.
* Investigate the smashed window on the eastern side for the criminal's thread.
* Search the barrels in the bedroom owned by the following two suspects to get 2 silver items.
** If the thread is red, search the barrels belonging to Bob and Carol.
** If the thread is green, search the barrels belonging to Anna and David.
** If the thread is blue, search the barrels belonging to Elizabeth and Frank.
* Go to the kitchen and fill your pot with flour from the barrel.
* Use flour and flypaper to dust each silver item and the dagger.
* Use the silver items' prints on the dagger's print until you get a match. Remember who it is.
* Talk to Gossip outside the front gate of the mansion and ask who he thinks is responsible. 
* Talk to the poison salesman in the Seers' Village pub, ask who he sold poison to. (Select Murder Mystery quest) (Be sure to not select the Fremennik Trials option.) 
* Talk to the person whose prints matched, ask why they bought poison. 
* Search the item they say they used the poison on.
** Anna - Compost heap
** Bob - Beehive in cow pen
** Frank - Family Crest, east of the front door
** David - Spiders' nest, upstairs between the two rooms with three beds each in them
** Carol - Kitchen drain, west of the front door
** Elizabeth - The fountain
*Drop the silver necklace (if you took it from Anna's barrel) before talking to the guard if you want to keep it, you can't get it back afterward.
* Talk to a guard. 
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Talk to Gertrude. 
*Talk to Phingspet or Grimesquit in the Varrock Sewers.
*Catch 8 rats by having your cat chase nearby rats.
*Talk to the sisters again.

*Talk to Jimmy Dazzler in the house west of the Ardougne pub.
*Read the directions to arrive at the mansion. 
**Guards will notice you by proximity and line of sight. Nab all 6 rats without being caught. (Being caught does not reset the rats)
*The garden
**Go west then north around to the back of the mansion. You will spawn here after being caught.
**Climb the trellis to the upper floor.
*Upstairs
**Catch 1 rat in the NW room.
**Sneak into the NE room.
**Wait in the NE room until either one of the guards is on the porch and the other at the end of the hallway or until both guards step out onto the balcony, then run to the SE room.
**Note: If the guards don't step out at the same time, try hopping worlds. Look for one with them in sync.
**Catch 2 rats in the SE room.
**Climb down the ladder.
*Downstairs
**The SE and NE room will have 3 rats combined, catch them.
*Climb back down the trellis to return to Ardougne OR use any teleport. (Your character will say "Good job puss, I think that just about wraps things up here." once you have caught all the rats.)
*Talk to Jimmy Dazzler.

*Talk to Hooknosed Jack in South-east Varrock near the Varrock rat pits manhole. He will make you the rat poison.
*Run south to the abandoned building and climb up the ladder.
*Use your rat poison on your cheeses and use them on the 4 rat holes.
*Talk to Hooknosed Jack. 
*Talk to the Apothecary south-west of Varrock Square. [ if Dragon Slayer II or A Tail of Two Cats is completed, or if One Small Favour is started but not yet completed.]
*Return and talk to Hooknosed Jack.
*Head back to the top of the abandoned building.
*Pick-up, and then use your cat on the corner hole in the wall.  
*Use fish on the hole in the wall (not on your cat) to heal your cat as it fights.
**If you have access to raw karambwanji, they may be used to heal your cat and preserve inventory space during the quest.''
*Talk to Hooknosed Jack.

You must have started The Giant Dwarf in order to get to Keldagrim.
*Head to Keldagrim (trapdoor in north-western part of Grand Exchange, or minigame teleport to Blast Furnace.)
*Talk to Smokin' Joe east of the Keldagrim mining shop in east Keldagrim. 
*Use weeds on a pot and light it with your tinderbox.
*Drop your cat or kitten.
*Use the smouldering pot on the rat hole just east of Smokin' Joe.
*Try it again and accept your cat's help (don't forget to wear the catspeak amulet).
*Talk to Smokin' Joe.

*Head to Port Sarim
*Climb down the nearby manhole to enter the rat pits
*Talk to Felkrash in the east room.
*Exit the rat pits and talk to The Face.

*Head to Ali (or Badir) the Snake Charmer in Pollnivneach (just south of the pub).
*Put a coin in his pot and talk to him. must ask about charming 
**If you already have a snake charm from The Feud, you will not receive another one.
*Return to the Port Sarim manhole. Don't go down.
*Remove items from your hand slots
* Click the Snake charm to open the interface.
**There are eight pages, select one note from each page and move to the next one: D, G, E, F#, for the fifth page, also select "raise one octave" from the top left corner "D", B, C#, A.
*Press play at the top to begin a cutscene.

*Return and talk to Felkrash in the rat pits.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Take a rake and a seed dibber from the leprechaun if you haven't got one already.
*Talk to Pirate Pete on the dock north-east of the Ectofuntus, decline the money. 
*Finish talking to Captain Braindeath. Make sure you have at least one inventory space available to get the Blindweed seed (don't cancel the dialogue after the cutscene).

*Leave the building to the south, down the stairs.
*Go south past the zombies and plant the blindweed in the south-eastern-most patch.
*Wait about 5 minutes (or a few seconds) for it to grow. (Warning: Nearby Zombie swabs can attack low and mid-levelled players. You can simply log out while waiting.) You'll receive an in-game message when it finishes growing. Pick the plant.
*Talk to Captain Braindeath.
*Climb-up the ladder in the south-east corner of the big room.
*Put the blindweed in the hopper (next to the pressure barrel) in the north-west corner of the room.

*Talk to Captain Braindeath. You will automatically get a bucket in your inventory if you don't have one.
*Leave the building using the stairs to the south, head west to the bridge, and open the gate north of 50% Luke.
*Head north to the water source on the map, and fill the bucket with stagnant water.
*Return to the brewery and add the stagnant water to the hopper. (Ectophial and talking to Pirate Pete is faster than walking back.)

*Talk to Captain Braindeath.
*Fish 5 sluglings. Fishing spots can be found east, south-east, and west of the farming patch. (Note: do not untangle the Fishbowl and net, if you do then use one on the other to retangle.)
*Put the sluglings in the pressure barrel by the hopper.
*Pull the lever.

*Talk to Captain Braindeath.
*Talk to Davey in the room to the west, with all the bunk beds. (Note: He will only bless the wrench if you have 47 or more Prayer points)
*Use the holy wrench on the shaking brewing control.
*Kill the level 150 Evil spirit. (Can be safespotted)

*Talk to Captain Braindeath. (Complete the dialogue or the fever spider corpse won't drop)
*Climb down the nearby ladder.
*Kill a fever spider (can be safespotted by standing north-west of the ladder) 
* Put its body in the hopper on the top floor.

*Talk to Captain Braindeath.
*Collect some 'Unsanitary Swill' from the output tap (south end of the brewing machine) using the bucket used for the stagnant water.
*Give it to Captain Donnie outside, amongst the protesters.
*Talk to Captain Braindeath.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Talk to Councillor Halgrive outside the East Ardougne church. Ensure that you have at least 1 empty inventory slot. 
*Talk to Doctor Orbon in the church. 
*Put on the plague jacket and trousers and go to the enclosure north-west of the Ardougne north bank.
*Pick up & wield the cattleprod next to the incinerator.
*There are sheep to the north-west (blue), north (yellow), east (green), and south (red) of the incinerator.
*Prod one sheep of each colour through the gate.
** Blue sheep
** Yellow sheep
** Green sheep
** Red sheep
*Feed your sheep sheep feed until they're all dead.
*Pick up the bones and use them on the incinerator.
*Return to Councillor Halgrive to complete the quest.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Talk to Sir Tiffy Cashien in Falador Park to get a Commorb v2. 
**Note: Savant will contact you through the Commorb v2 multiple times throughout the quest to scan your surroundings and/or provide hints.
*Talk to Col. O'Niall on the north-east dock in Witchaven. 
*Talk to the following people in Witchaven in any order:
**Talk to Brother Maledict (church)
**Talk to Mayor Hobb (most north-west building) . After Savant prompts you, scan with your Commorb v2.
**Talk to Holgart (green shirt, north-east of quest icon, by the boat to the Fishing Platform)
*Talk to Col. O'Niall again.

*Climb down the Old Ruin Entrance (Dungeon sign) west of Witchaven.
*Push the false wall on the east wall by the entrance (red on minimap).
*Follow the path to the imposing door, using the shortcut if able, try to open it.
*Scan with the Commorb v2 to acquire the door transcription (make sure you have one free inventory space).
*Pick up a dead sea slug just west of the imposing door. (If you do not pick up the dead sea slug, you will not be able to talk to Jorral).
*Talk to Jorral in the outpost (necklace of passage) north-west of Ardougne. if Making History has not been started.

*Talk to Col. O'Niall.
*Talk to Brother Maledict.
*Go to the mayor's house and search the study desk until you get a page.
*Talk to Ezekial Lovecraft in the fishing store (make sure you have one free inventory space).
