*Talk to Col. O'Niall (make sure you have 3 free inventory spaces)
*Use swamp paste on one of the fragments. Savant will stop you.
*Talk to Jeb (near Holgart) and travel to the Fishing Platform.
*Talk to Bailey on the south-west part Fishing Platform, give him the dead slug.
*Use the sea slug glue on a fragment, then solve the puzzle.

*Right click the pages and select shape-options on the pages to shape essence into air, water, fire, earth, and mind.
**Note: It is possible and likely to fail and break the essence.
*Use the chiselled stones on their respective Runic altar. It is recommended to bring extra rune essence in case they are destroyed.
**Air: the Air Altar is south of Falador
**Mind: the Mind Altar is north of Falador (just below the Wilderness)
**Water: the Water Altar is south of Lumbridge (next to the shack to Zanaris)
**Earth: the Earth Altar is north-east of Varrock (you can use balloon transport system if unlocked)
**Fire: the Fire Altar is west of the Emir's Arena in Al Kharid (you can use ring of dueling)
***Note: It is possible and likely to fail this step as well.
*Use the handmade runes on the imposing door in the cave underneath Witchaven. Make sure to bring the Commorb with you.
*Kill the level 62 Slug Prince, only melee can damage it and it drains your Prayer points.
**Note: It is possible to safespot with a halberd
*Talk to Sir Tiffy Cashien. 
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Equip all ghostly robes, the ring of visibility and a Ghostspeak amulet.
*Talk to the ghost of General Khazard, north of the log balance, south-east of Rellekka. (Fairy ring if 48 agility, otherwise  is faster) 
*Talk to Sin Seer in Seers' Village. She is upstairs in the spinning wheel house. You need an empty inventory spot and 40 coins. 
*Return to General Khazard.
*Talk to the ghost Scout east of Tai Bwo Wannai, south of the hardwood grove. (Fairy ring  and run north-east) or Tai bwo wannai teleport and run east.
*Talk to the ghost Scout south of the Gnome Stronghold entrance. Use a Spirit tree or a Necklace of passage to the Outpost.
*Talk to the ghost  Scout in the area between Falador and Draynor Manor. Use an Explorer's ring 2 or better to teleport south of him.
*Talk to the ghost Scout south of Shantay Pass. (Fairy ring  and run east)
*Return to General Khazard.
*Prepare for battle against a level 160 Bouncer (You need to have the severed leg in your inventory to enter the wall)
*Enter the Goblin Cave east of the Fishing Guild.
*Run to the north-east area and enter the crack in the southern wall.
**You cannot use prayer in this cave.
*Lower Bouncer's health to 0 and your character will automatically throw the severed leg.
*Congratulations, miniquest complete!

*Talk to Yanni Salika in Shilo Village (north of the bridge at the quest icon). 
*If mining your own gems, do this now at the Shilo Village Mine.
*Talk to a Jungle forester south of Shilo at the tree line (make sure to have 1 free inventory space to receive blunt axe). 
*Travel tip: Use the minigames teleport to Pest Control, then leave by talking to the Squire to the north and you'll be at Port Sarim. Or you Can use the Rat Pits teleport to Port Sarim, if you have completed Rat Catchers.
*Talk to Brian in the Port Sarim axe shop. 
*Talk to Aggie in Draynor Village. 
*Talk to Johanhus Ulsbrecht near the prison inside of the H.A.M. Hideout. 
*Talk to Fred the Farmer NE of the H.A.M. Hideout at the Sheep Shearer quest start point. (4 if you haven't done Sheep Shearer)
*Prepare a bowl of hot water and take a pot in the Lumbridge Castle kitchen if needed. Gather 3 steel bars if not already carrying.
*Talk to Seth Groats in the chicken farm east of River Lum.  
*Talk to Horvik at the armour shop in Varrock. Give him 3 steel bars. 
*Talk to the Apothecary in Varrock south of the western bank. 
*Travel tip: amulet of glory to Edgeville, run south or use a skull sceptre.
*Talk to Tassie Slipcast in the Barbarian Village at the pottery icon on the minimap. 
*Travel tip: teleport to the Mining Guild using a skills necklace.
*Talk to Hammerspike Stoutbeard in the most western portion of the Dwarven Mines (SW of the Ice Mountain entrance). 
*Gather one harralander, two guam leaves, and one marrentill.
*Travel tip: If you have 10 Construction you can use Taverley teleport
*Pick up the cup of tea from the house north of Sanfew, then drink the tea to obtain an empty cup, if you haven't got one already.
*Talk to Sanfew on the top floor of the Taverley herblore shop about initiates.  (2-2-3-1 if you have completed Eadgar's Ruse)
*Add your bowl of hot water to a teacup. Add a harralander, 2 guam leaves, and a marrentill. The empty bowl can be dropped afterwards.
*Travel tip: Ring of dueling to Al Kharid, then use the gnome glider to White Wolf Mountain.
*Talk to Captain Bleemadge on top of White Wolf Mountain at the gnome glider icon on the minimap. 
*Talk to Arhein on the Catherby docks south of the bank. 
*Talk to Phantuwti Fanstuwi Farsight in the building north of the Seers' chapel. 
*Travel tip: teleport to the Fishing Guild using a skills necklace.
*Enter the Goblin Cave south-east of the Fishing Guild. Go to the most NE room. Right-click and search the sculpture.
*Travel tip: Ardougne Teleport
*Talk to Wizard Cromperty in NE Ardougne at the transportation icon.  (  if you have completed the Ardougne Medium Diary)
*You can take the hammer and chisel south of Cromperty if you didn't bring your own.
*Travel tip: Fishing Trawler Minigame Teleport
*Talk to Tindel Marchant on the Port Khazard south dock. 
*Travel tip: fairy ring teleport  or ring of dueling to Castle Wars and walk SE
*Bring your cut gems, two of each: opal, jade, sapphire, and red topaz (can be mined with 40 Mining at Shilo Village) if you have them, otherwise, bring some gold in case you crush a gem in the upcoming step. 
*Talk to Rantz in the eastern Feldip Hills at the quest icon on the minimap. 
*Talk to Gnormadium Avlafrim west of Rantz.  (at the gnome glider icon on the minimap)
*Search each landing light, cut the gem, and put the cut gem back. If you crush a gem, the gnome will sell you up to 2 new ones for 500 coins.

*Talk to Gnormadium Avlafrim. 
*Talk to Rantz. 
*Travel Tip: Watchtower teleport run north-east. Monastery Teleport via Ardougne cloak or use Port Khazard Teleport from Lunar Spellbook, or use the minigame teleport to Fishing Trawler or fairy ring and run south
*Talk to Tindel Marchant. 
*Talk to Wizard Cromperty in Ardougne.  ( if you have completed the Ardougne Medium Diary)
*Take 5 pigeon cages (south of the north Ardougne bank) if needed, and get ready to fight Slagilith.
*Return to the fishing guild cave, stand in front of the sculpture and read the animate rock scroll.
*Kill the level 92 Slagilith (weak to Pickaxes and Crush attacks, can be safespotted with magic).
*Read the scroll again to free Petra. Make sure you finish the dialogue with her, or else you won't be able to make progress.
*Talk to Phantuwti Fanstuwi Farsight in Seers' Village. 
*Climb to the roof of his house search the weather vane, use a hammer on it and search it again for 3 parts.
*Use each part on an anvil while holding a bronze, iron, and steel bar. There is an anvil north of his house.
*Put each part back on the vane.
*Talk to Phantuwti Fanstuwi Farsight. 
*Talk to Arhein in Catherby. 
*Talk to Captain Bleemadge on White Wolf Mountain. 
*Talk to Sanfew in Taverley.  ( if you have completed Eadgar's Ruse)
*Travel Tip: Use a Skills Necklace to teleport to the Mining Guild or use the Combat Bracelet to teleport to the Edgeville Monastery
*Gather combat gear and a weapon for killing Hammerspike's gangsters (Combat levels 44, 48, and 49)
*Go and talk to Hammerspike Stoutbeard in the Dwarven Mine.
*Kill his gang members, then talk to him again.
*Talk to Tassie Slipcast in Barbarian Village. She will give you clay. Spin it into a pot lid, then fire the pot lid in the pottery oven.
*Use the pot lid on an empty pot. This is found in the house to the north.
*Talk to the Apothecary with the pot lid and a pot.  ( if you have completed A Tail of Two Cats)
*Bring 5 pigeon cages for the next step.
*Talk to Horvik in the Varrock Armour shop. 
*Talk to Horvik again. 
*Talk to Seth Groats at the Lumbridge chicken farm.
*Talk to Johanhus in the H.A.M. camp. 
*Talk to Aggie in Draynor. 
*Talk to Brian in Port Sarim. 
*Talk to a Jungle forester south of Shilo Village. 
*Talk to Yanni in Shilo Village, wait for the dialogue to finish. 
*Congratulations, quest complete!
*Speak to Lucien in the Flying Horse Inn in the north-west corner of East Ardougne.

*Enter the temple directly south of the Ranging Guild by climbing down the ladder.
*Go west down the stairs, slash the web, and take the boots of lightness (light source and knife or slash weapon required).
*Go back upstairs, then through the north gate with the Pendant of lucien equipped.
*Cross the lava bridge wearing the boots of lightness (weight must be -1 kg or less or you will not be able to cross and take 20 damage from falling), open the Large door, and take the lever.
*Cross the lava bridge again and attach the lever to the lever-bracket on the wall a bit west of the ladder you climbed to enter the dungeon.
*Pull the lever after attaching it. You will receive the prompt: "You hear the clunking of some hidden machinery."
*Go through the south gate and follow the path.
*Search chests along the icy path to obtain ice arrows. 16 with Ava's device and 60+ Ranged is enough.
**Note: It is possible for the arrows to be in the same chest multiple times in a row. It is therefore recommended to search the chest again right after getting an arrow loot.
**Note: You must search every chest after finding arrows to reset the chests, hopping worlds at 1 chest no longer resets them.

*Go back through the north gate with the Pendant of lucien equipped.
*Continue straight north to a small room containing a lever.
*Right-click the lever and search for traps. (Requires 42 Thieving) Then pull the lever.
*Go west then north through the doors.
*A Fire Warrior of Lesarkus will spawn in the room upon attempting to enter the second door.
*Kill him with your ice arrows.
**Use protect from magic to take no damage.
*Give Winelda 20 unnoted limpwurt roots all at once.
*Optional: follow the path to its end and take the shiny key to access this dungeon from McGrubor's Wood.
*Push the wall to the north leading to a room full of Guardians of Armadyl.
*Pick the good or evil path.

*Remove your Pendant of lucien and talk to a Guardian of Armadyl. 
*Enter the building west of the Grand Exchange wearing your Armadyl pendant and kill Lucien (level 14).

*Take the Staff of Armadyl from the table, you may have to kill a level 43 Guardian of Armadyl.
**The guardian can be easily safespotted behind a chair.
**Make sure to take the staff.
*Enter the building west of the Grand Exchange and give Lucien the Staff of Armadyl.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Talk to the High Priest in Sophanem. 
*Go to the most north-eastern building in Sophanem and talk to Jex. 
*Climb-down the ladder in the building, then the trapdoor.
*Follow the red line on the map to the ladder. Protection from magic is recommended. It is also recommended to turn off auto-retaliate in the combat tab.
*You will encounter one scarab trap via this path. BE HIGHLY CAUTIOUS as triggering it would drop you to a multi combat lower level.

*Search Kaleef's body.
*Read the parchment.
*Talk to Maisa to the west. 
*Speak to Osman in front of the Al Kharid palace. 
*Travel to Sophanem and speak to Osman again outside the gates. 

*Navigate the tunnels to the ladder again.
*Kill the level 191 Giant scarab. 
**If you decide to mage the Giant Scarab, it can be safespotted by standing near Kaleef's body, use Protect from Missiles. Note: The Giant Scarab can still spawn mages and riders that can attack you which you should be highly careful of. The Giant Scarab CAN extinguish bullseye lanterns; bring a tinderbox.
*Talk to Osman.
*Pick up Keris if you wish (needed for Desert hard diary).
**(Tip: Do not teleport out if you wish to complete a task for Desert hard diary, instead return to the maze and kill a Locust rider with the Keris.)
*Return to Sophanem and talk to the High Priest.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Walk to or use the Necklace of Passage to teleport to the outpost north-west of Ardougne.
*Talk to Jorral. 
*Complete the next 3 segments in any order.

*Talk to the Silver merchant in the East Ardougne market. 
*Dig with your spade to find the chest buried north of Castle Wars.
*Open the chest with the enchanted key to get a journal.

*Equip your Ghostspeak amulet and talk to Droalak outside the Port Phasmatys general store.
*In the building east of the general store, directly south of the pub, give Melina a strung sapphire amulet.
*Talk to Droalak to receive a scroll.

*Go to Rellekka and talk to Blanin east of the longhall.
*Talk to Dron north of the longhall. Answers:
**Quick answers: 
**He wields an iron mace in battle. 
**He eats rats for breakfast. 
**He eats kittens for lunch. 
**He eats bunnies for tea. 
**His favourite drink is red spider blood. 
**He is 36 years, 8 months (21 days) old. 
**He studies the Fifth and Fourth ages. 
**His house is on the north-east side of town. 
**His brother's name is Blanin. 
**His pet cat is named Fluffy. 
**5 plus 7 is 12

*Talk to Jorral, back at the outpost, with the scroll and journal.
*Talk to King Lathas, located on the of the Ardougne Castle. 
*Talk to Jorral, back at the outpost.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Speak to the Lumbridge Cook. 
*Speak to him again with items in inventory. 
*Enter the door behind the Cook and watch the cutscene.

*Inspect the dwarf.
*Go to the Rising Sun Inn in Falador and talk to Emily or Kaylee. Pay her (Ring of Charos (a) persuades her for free) to learn how to make Asgoldian ale. 
*Use coins on your Asgarnian ales.
*Go to the tunnel under White Wolf Mountain.
*Talk to "An old Dwarf" (Rohak) and give him Asgoldian ales until he agrees to make a dwarven rock cake.
*Talk to him 3 times and he will place a dwarven rock cake on the table. (His name will change to Rohak)
*If you have ice gloves, equip them and pick up the cake. Otherwise pick up the cake with regular gloves then kill an icefiend (at Ice Mountain) to cool the cake. If you forgot to use the ice gloves, you can drop the cake, equip your ice gloves, and pick the cake back up to cool it.
*Give the dwarven rock cake to the dwarf in Lumbridge.

*Inspect one of the goblin generals.
*Go to the Goblin Village and climb down the ladder in the north-east building.
*Talk to the Goblin Cook (Mudknuckles)., then talk to him again and give him the charcoal. 
*Talk to the Goblin Cook again. 
**Slice an orange and add blue, green, or purple dye.
**Use spice on a fishing bait.
**Use a bucket of water on bread.
*Talk to the Goblin Cook again. 
*Give the slop of compromise to the generals in Lumbridge.

*Inspect Pirate Pete.
*Talk to the cook in the next room about protecting the pirate. 
*Go through all 5 chat options. 
*Use your pestle and mortar on the raw cod.
*Use your knife on the bread and make breadcrumbs.
*Talk to Murphy in Port Khazard. 
*Talk to Murphy again.

*Equip your fishbowl helmet and diving apparatus, agree to go diving.
*Pick some kelp.
*Go north and talk to Nung.
*Go west and pick up 5 rocks, then enter the cave.
*Kill 5 mudskippers (level 30/31) for 5 hides.
*Talk to Nung twice.
*Enter the crab pen, kill at least one crab and take its meat (acquire multiple in case the fishcake is burnt).
*Use your pestle and mortar to grind the kelp and crab meat.
*Talk to the Cook in Lumbridge about freeing the pirate again. 
*Use the ingredients (ground cod, breadcrumbs, ground kelp and ground crab meat) on each other then cook the fishcake.
*Give the fishcake to Pirate Pete in Lumbridge.

*Inspect the Lumbridge Guide. 
*Talk to Wizard Traiborn on the of the Wizards' Tower. 
*Talk to him again to enchant the egg by identifying 3 mystery NPCs. 
**Man with ponytail and book - Reldo
**Ghostly green woman - Velorina
**Man with desert robes and white beard - Ali Morrisane
**Elf - Islwyn
**Man with purple shirt - Unferth
**Man with brown vest - Professor Gronigen
**Woman with pink top - Gertrude
**Woman (green witch) - Hetty
**Man (hooded) - Pirate Pete
**Man with a crown - King Lathas
*Talk to him again to enchant the milk by answering trivia. 
**Defence requirements to wear a Mystic hat - 20
**Ingredients in a cake - Flour, egg, milk
**Combat level of Goblins near Lumbridge - 2
**GP to bribe an Al Kharid gate guard - 10
**What doesn't lie between Morytania and Asgarnia - Keep Le Faye
**Gold ring is to 5 as a holy symbol is to - 16
**Glass vial is to 33 as a glass orb is to - 46
**Guild closest to Fishing Platform - Legends'
**Bar west of Pollnivneach - Bandit Camp
**The River Salve runs from - North to south
**I can hear howling in one direction and buzzing in the other—where am I? - Catherby
**If I'm going to need glass, first I will need - Sand, bucket, soda ash, glassblowing pipe
**Which tower is closest to the Crafting Guild - Dark Wizards' Tower
**Take the number of fire runes required to cast Fire Strike, and multiply by the number of air runes used to cast Wind Strike before adding the number of earth runes used to cast Earth Wave - 10
*Talk to him a third time to enchant the flour with a memory test. 
*Take a screenshot of the items and then close the interface via the X button to answer the questions.
*Do not use the ESC key to close the interface as it will reset that portion of the test!
**Which item began with the letter 'm'? - Mind Talisman
**Which of the following items were NOT shown to you? - Trout
**How many weapons were you shown? - Three (Maple Longbow, Magic Shortbow and Black Longsword)
**How many types of rune were there? - Two (Fire Rune and Chaos Rune)
**Which items were amongst those you were shown? - Book of balance (noted as Guthix Prayer Book,) Magic Logs, Pike
*Use one of the ingredients on the cake tin, then cook the raw cake.
*Give the cake of guidance to the Lumbridge guide.

*Inspect Evil Dave
*Talk to Evil Dave in Edgeville (down the trapdoor). 
*Talk to Doris upstairs.
*Use your cat to catch hell-rats (right-click chase on your cat). Using a fully grown cat is much more efficient, but using a kitten still works.
*Collect spices from hell-rats. There are 4 spices to collect: yellow, orange, red, brown. Collect at least 3 doses of each.
*Now find the perfectly spiced stew with the right quantity of all 4 colours of spice.
**Figure it out one colour at a time by adding different quantities of a colour and giving the stew to Evil Dave. When he says "...I think you've got the amount of one spice right..." you know the correct dose for that spice (be sure to finish the dialogue with Dave, otherwise you will not be able to give him the stew in Lumbridge).
**Start by adding 1 dose of a colour to a stew, and if that isn't right add 2 doses of that colour to a stew; if 1 or 2 doses are not right, you know 3 doses is the correct dose for that colour.
*Give Evil Dave the completed stew, then give him that spicy stew in Lumbridge.

*Inspect Skrach Uglogwee. 
*Talk to Rantz . (You can use the fairy ring code and run east)
*Go south-east and talk to Rantz by the coast. 
*Use your woodcutting axe on the fallen tree twice.
*Talk to him again. 
*Get some raw chompies if needed.
*Go to Karamja and find the tree with an arrow in it (small tree on the coast, just south of transportation icon west of Tai Bwo Wannai).
**You can use the fairy ring code  and run north along the coast to the west to find it
*Light a fire next to the tree, use your iron spit on a raw chompy, then cook it.
*Board the ogre boat. 
*Talk to Rantz south-east near the coast. 
*Collect a bloated toad from the nearby swamp.
*Make sure your ogre bellow has at least 1 charge remaining
*Get a rock from the mine by Rantz' cave.
*With the rock and ball of wool in your inventory, use the ogre bellows on the bloated toad for a balloon toad.
*Drop the balloon toad and kill the Jubbly with ogre arrows. You may have to attempt multiple times.
*Cook the Jubbly on Rantz's spit-roast.
*Give the Cooked jubbly to Skrach Uglogwee in Lumbridge.

*Inspect Sir Amik.
*Ask the cook how you helped Sir Amik Varze. 
*Use milk on cream.
*If you need a pot of cornflour, grind raw sweetcorn in a windmill and fill a pot with it.
*Add the pot of cornflour to the milky mixture.
*Pick a vanilla pod in the Kharazi Jungle (SW of the pool used in Legends' Quest), add it to the cornflour mixture.
*Talk to the Wise Old Man in Draynor, ask about strange beasts, then the Evil Chicken. Make sure you finish the dialogue or you will not be able to proceed.

*Use a raw chicken on the Evil Chicken shrine in northern Zanaris (where you arrive from the swamp.)
*Run north past the dragons and kill the Evil Chicken, pick up its egg and add it to the brulee.
*Kill a black dragon, there is a safespot to the east, pick up the dragon token.
*Grind a dramen branch with a pestle and mortar to make cinnamon, add it to the brulee.
*Return to Zanaris through the southern portal.
*Equip ice gloves then rub the token. 
*Give the Brulee supreme to Sir Amik in Lumbridge.

*Inspect Awowogei.
*Travel to Ape Atoll, equip a monkey greegree and M'speak amulet.
*Talk to Awowogei south of the temple.
*If you need a banana and monkey nuts, buy them from the food store now.
*Talk to any of the 3 monkeys in the north-west corner of the temple. 
*Use your Banana and Monkey nuts on any of them. (Ensure you use both your Banana and Monkey nuts on them or else the Tchiki nuts will not appear on the bush.)
*If you already have a gorilla, ninja, and zombie monkey greegree then skip this part.
**Buy 3 blank monkey talismans from the rune store.
**Kill a monkey archer in the market and take its bones. (Protect from Missiles)
**Kill a Monkey Guard in the temple and take its bones.
**Kill a zombie monkey under the temple and take its bones.
**Bring the bones and talismans to Zooknock at the end of the Ape Atoll Dungeon.
*Note: You should take at least 3 snake corpses, red bananas, and tchiki nuts in case you burn the stuffed snake (use the drop trick for the nuts and the banana).
*Travel to Crash Island and climb down the pit. Kill some level 84 big snakes for their corpses. (Recommended to pray melee before descending into the pit)
*Return to Ape Atoll and find the red banana tree north-west of the big gate (by the shore).
*Equip your gorilla greegree and use a rope on the tree to get some red bananas.
*Equip your ninja greegree and enter the Ape Atoll agility course.
*After swinging the rope, enter the hole and pick some tchiki nuts.
*Grind the tchiki nuts, slice the red banana, and add them to the snake corpses.
*Equip your zombie greegree and enter the temple dungeon.
*Go down one of the ramps and enter the crack in the wall between the two ramps.
*Lay your stuffed snake on the rock to cook it (requires 70 cooking).
*Give the cooked stuffed snake to Awowogei in Lumbridge.

*You will need 175 Quest Points and complete Desert Treasure I and Horror from the Deep before entering the portal.
*Remember, you can bank between every kill. Enter the portal and defeat without prayers:
**Agrith-Na-Na – Range or melee it, wear dragonhide.
**Flambeed – Mage him with water spells + snare. He can unequip your weapon, unless you are wearing ice gloves.
**Karamel – Run into melee distance and use fire spells. Ranged and melee work as well, but are less accurate. She will lower your stats frequently. Bring at least 2 restore potions. If going melee, use super combat potions
**Dessourt – Mage (air spells or Iban blast) or range him. Snare will help.
**Gelatinnoth Mother – Bring runes for all 4 elemental spells, a melee weapon, and a ranged weapon. Aim for high range defence without sacrificing too much magic attack.
**Culinaromancer – Attack with whatever you can hit hardest with. Most of his damage comes from a magic attack that hits at a flat 1-in-3 rate, so your magic defence is irrelevant.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Talk to Asgarnia Smith in the Bedabin camp by the magic carpet with at least one inventory slot free. 
*Go to the Digsite Exam Centre and talk to Terry Balando. 
*Talk to him again for a translation. 
*Talk to Asgarnia Smith in the desert. 
*Talk to him again. 
*Run south to the bandit camp and buy a drink in the pub for 650 coins. (If you are wearing any saradomin or zamorak items e.g. unholy blessing, remove them now so you don't get attacked by the Bandits) 
*Talk to the bartender again. 
*Talk to Eblis in or just outside of the small rectangular building east of the bar. 
*Deliver all the required items to Eblis by using them on him (items can remain noted), then talk to him again.
*Go south-east to the mirrors, and talk to Eblis there.
Collect the 4 diamonds, they may be obtained in any order.

*Equip your facemask and enter the Smoke Dungeon west of Pollnivneach and east of the mirrors
*Light the 4 standing torches, one in each corner of the dungeon, and open the chest in the centre to get the key before any of the torches burns out.
**Starting at the NE corner with 100% run and then onto SE, NW and then SW, you can make it to the chest without stamina or energy pots.
*Use the warm key to open the gate to the east.
*Kill Fareed to get the Smoke diamond. Protect from Melee is strongly advised and attacking with water spell or any range arrow.

*Talk to Rasolo outside the house south of Baxtorian Falls. 
*Go to the most southern tent in the Bandit camp. Bring antipoison, food, and 20+ lockpicks (you can bring noted ones and coins to exchange with Tiles in Bandit camp's general store, 5 coins for each lockpick).
*Unlock the secure chest (the 3 locks must be picked consecutively, it can take upwards of 100 tries to open the chest and is dependent upon Thieving level).
*Give the gilded cross to Rasolo. Even if your inventory is full, the cross will instantly be swapped for the ring.
*Equip the visibility ring and climb down the ladder east of Rasolo in the fenced area.
*Run through the dungeon, kill Damis in his 2 forms and pick up the shadow diamond (his second form drains player's prayer rapidly, it is advised to safespot Damis, this can be done by hitting a bat or rat and stacking npcs behind). Kill a Shadow Hound to complete a task in the Hard Kandarin Diary. 
**Note: If you run too fast and too far out of Damis' range, he will vanish once more into the shadows. If this happens, go back into the maze where you first enter the large area with Damis' spawn. He will re-appear in the form he disappeared in, with hitpoints reset to full.

*Give a cake to the Troll child north-west of Trollheim by right-clicking and using the cake on the troll child.
*Talk to the Troll child. 
*Enter the ice gate and kill 5 ice trolls.
**Note: You won't need to kill the trolls again if you teleport out and come back
*Enter the cave.
*Follow the path then kill Kamil (it is advised to approach with protect from magic to force him to teleport into range, then protect from melee, and manually cast your spells).
*Continue west and follow the long icy path.
*Wear spiked boots and climb the ice ledge, follow the new path.
*Go through the gate and smash the trolls frozen in ice by using your fire spell on each of them. Talk to them for the ice diamond.

*Talk to Malak in the Canifis pub. 
*Travel to the Draynor Sewer and give Ruantun a silver bar for a silver pot.
**You can go upstairs in Morgan's house and search the cupboard to get garlic if needed. Grind your garlic with a pestle and mortar to receive garlic powder. 
*Take the silver pot to the High Priest in the Entrana church and he will enchant it.
*Talk to Malak (He will damage you for five hitpoints here, but he cannot kill you).
*Add spices and garlic powder to the pot of blood.
*Prepare for a tough boss fight (combat gear, high healing food).
*Go to the Morytania Graveyard north of Castle Drakan (see map).
*Pour your pot of blood on the tomb and defeat Dessous
**Dessous has 99 Defence and 150 defence against slash and is generally very strong against melee. Recommended to range/mage him.
**You can avoid taking damage by alternating between protection from melee and protection from range each game tick. (Note: if you leave the fight you will need to make a new pot of blood but you keep your blessed pot)
*Return to Malak and claim the blood diamond.

*Go south-east of Eblis and place a diamond in each of the pyramid's obelisks.
*Enter the pyramid from the top.
*Run through each floor and don't stop or a trap may send you back to the start. Traps may still trigger regardless. Beware Mummies and Scarabs as they can hit over 20.

*Talk to Azzanadra at the end.
**Praying at the altar twice after completing the quest will unlock a hard task in the Desert area.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Climb down the trapdoor behind the Canifis pub.
*Search the wall and enter the cave entrance just south-east.
*Talk to Veliaf Hurtz.

*Talk to Florin through the gate to Burgh de Rott.
*Put a piece of food into the open chest, then open the gate.
*Talk to Razvan near the pub. 
*Enter the pub, climb over the broken wall, then use your pickaxe on the rubble blocking the trapdoor.
*Climb down and mine the rest of the rubble. Anything you drop in the basement will be lost upon leaving.
*Use your spade on the remnants to fill the buckets. There is enough here to fill five buckets.
** Upon mining the rubble, you will find a plaster fragment and a dusty scroll.
** The items dug up can be safely dropped, unless you need the nails.
*When finished, use the buckets of rubble on the rubble pile outside the pub.
*Talk to Razvan again. 
*Talk to Aurel in the general store to the north-east. 
*Climb up the ladder right outside.
*Use 3 planks and 12 nails on the broken roof of the store.
*Climb back down and Use 3 planks and 12 nails on the damaged wall of the general store.
*Talk to Aurel again to get a crate. 
**Tip: If you are asked for items you aren't satisfied with before receiving the crate, you can disrupt the dialogue by walking away to re-roll the requested items.
**If you weren't able to bring all of the items, head to a bank now to get the remaining items for this section.
*Add 10 bronze axes, 10 raw mackerels or 10 snails (depending on what is asked), and 3 tinderboxes to the crate.
*Talk to Aurel.
*Talk to Cornelius in the bank. 
*Use a hammer with 2 planks, 1 swamp paste, and 8 nails on the broken bank booth
*Use a hammer with 3 planks and 12 nails on the damaged wall outside.
*Talk to Cornelius to recruit him.

*Talk to Razvan. 
*Repair the furnace to the south-east. Use your steel bars, then coal, then tinderbox on the furnace.
*Talk to Gadderanks in the general store.
*Talk to the Vampyre Juvinate in the store.
*Talk to Wiskit.
*Kill Gadderanks and the 2 juvinates (you'll need a silver weapon or Wolfbane dagger or Efaritay's aid to damage them).
*Talk to Gadderanks.
*Talk to Veliaf Hurtz.

*Talk to Veliaf Hurtz in the hideout where the quest started. (The room under the Canifis pub)
*Talk to Polmafi Ferdygris.
**Highly Recommended : Give Ivan Strom some food (he only takes snail, salmon, slimy eel, or stew) and steel armour (he only takes a steel med helm, steel chainbody, and steel platelegs) before leaving.

*Talk to Ivan Strom to go on a simplified version of Temple Trekking and take either the short or long route. (you can't bring a pet - it must be banked!)
**Route 1 features two level 75 Vampyre Juvinates, whereas route 2 features 4 level 50 Juvinates.
*Kill the Vampyre Juvinates before they can kill Ivan Strom.
**Tip: Alternate your attacks between them so they stay focused on you. Also, it may be possible to talk to Ivan to prevent the vampyre from attacking him
*After you're done escorting Ivan, talk to Drezel in the underground temple for a key. 
*Use the key on the keyhole on the eastern wall and climb down the trapdoor.
*Search the bookcases in the hidden room until you find The sleeping seven (The title of the book at the top when reading it is "The Sleeping Seven"). Read it.

*Return to the room under the Canifis pub, then go to the blockaded cave entrance just south-east of the wall.
*Use a hammer on the wooden boards and enter the cave.
*Use your soft clay on the coffin to make a rod mould.
*Go to any furnace with your mould, a silver bar, a mithril bar and a sapphire, and craft a silvthrill rod. (Fairy ring for Edgeville Furnace.)
*Cast Lvl-1 Enchant on the rod.
*Use the rod on the well underneath the Paterdomus Temple (where Drezel was) with a rope in your inventory. (Nearest fairy ring )
*Return to the Burgh de Rott pub basement with the Rod of Ivandis (it must be in your inventory, not equipped), then speak to Veliaf. 
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Talk to Sylas by the POH portal in Taverley. 
*Talk to Grimgnash the griffin on the NE side of White Wolf Mountain (see map). 
*Steal a feather from next to his nest.
*Return to Sylas and give him the feather.

*Go to the stone tower south of the Mind Altar.
*Climb over the crumbling wall on the East side (58 Thieving)
*Talk-into to the drain pipe. Then talk into it again 
*Climb the beard and talk to Rupert the Beard. (59 Agility)
*Climb down the beard and talk to Miazrqa behind the tower.

*Enter the basement of the witch's house next to the POH portal in Taverley.
*Go to the piano on the southern wall, play the notes E-F-E-D-C on the right side (upper), then A-E-G-A on the left side (lower).
*Search the piano.
*Add the Shrunk ogleroot to your unfinished potions (52 Herblore).
*Go through the south door on and drink a shrinking potion by the mouse hole.

*Climb up the nails to the north-east.
*Climb up the nails to the south-west.
*Climb up the nails to the south.
*Climb down the nails to the north-east.
*Climb up the nails to the north-east.
*Take the pendant.
*Travel back to the tower and give the pendant to Miazrqa.
*Talk to Rupert.
*Optional: You can talk to Miazrqa and Rupert again to unlock extra humorous dialogue.

*Give Rupert's helmet to Sylas.
*Plant and water the beans in the plot south-west of the Taverley tree patch (45 Farming).

*Climb up the beanstalk (59 Agility). You cannot climb with a follower/pet, even if it's in your inventory.
*Defeat Glod and pick up the golden goblin.
*Talk to Sylas.
*Use a shrinking potion on the beanstalk then chop it down (71 Woodcutting). Be careful not to drink it!
**If you're stat-boosting make sure you use the shrinking potion before you stat boost - an animation plays and this could cause your stat boost to expire
*Talk to Sylas.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Talk to Brother Tranquility on Mos Le'Harmless near the dock. (Finish the dialogue, or you will be teleported back to Mos Le' Harmless)
**When doing the Hard Morytania Diary task, plant watermelon seeds now to be able to harvest them at the end of the quest.
**Beware of aggressive Level 57 zombie pirates throughout the island.
*Leave the windmill and head north, pull on the statue and climb down.
*Equip your diving apparatus and fishbowl then descend.
*Repair the stairs at the end of the tunnel and climb up.
*Climb up the ladder then peer through the peephole.
*Return to Brother Tranquility, talk to him to be transported back to Mos Le' Harmless, then talk to him again there.

*Go to the Edgeville Monastery and search the bookcase in the south-west corner of the . (This is a good time to bless your symbol if it isn't already, see Brother Jered)
*Read the book.
*Equip a Holy Symbol and return to Mos Le' Harmless.
*Talk to Brother Tranquility to return to Harmony Island.
*Right click the book "recite prayer" inside of the windmill.
*Talk to Brother Tranquility.

*Talk to Dr Fenkenstrain (jail on the top floor of his castle north-east of Canifis).
** To get to the jail take the stairs to the east or west.
** Walk through the metal gate.
** Go up the ladder.
*Equip your Ring of Charos, keep it equipped through this section.
*Talk to Rufus in Canifis (food store). (until you receive a wolf whistle and a crate part)
*Make 10 wooden cats on a clockmaker's bench in your house (10 planks and 10 furs).
*Build a crate next to Dr Fenkenstrain, add a false bottom (4 planks and nails), and fill it with the wooden cats.
*Blow the wolf whistle.
*Rufus will appear and will give you a Shipping order.
*Put the Shipping order on the crate.

*Return to Harmony Island and enter the windmill basement.
*Talk to Dr Fenkenstrain.
*Equip your diving equipment before leaving the windmill and go north to the shipwreck.
*Search the locker for a fuse. Climb the ladder and get a tinderbox and a keg. 
*Go south a bit to the monastery and use the keg and fuse on the door. Light the fuse.
*Enter and kill 4 Sorebones for a Cranial clamp, Brain tongs, 3 Bell jars, and 30 Skull staples.
*Climb-down the ladder in the mill and talk to Dr Fenkenstrain.
*Climb up and talk to Brother Tranquility, prepare for the fight.

*Return to the Harmony island monastery and Confront Mi-Gor to start the fight against Barrelchest.
**You must wear your fishbowl helmet and diving apparatus.
**Each attack will disable your prayer and remove a few prayer points.
**When adjacent he will only attack with melee.
**Re-enabling prayer after each attack will prevent you from taking any damage.
**Alternatively you can leave the monastery and re-enter; the boss will get stuck and can be safespotted from the entrance.
*Talk to Brother Tranquility.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Talk to Rat Burgiss at the crossing south of Varrock. 
*Kill 5 Outlaws just west of the Grand Exchange (from Grand Exchange, use the tunnel and walk south) and collect 5 rat's paper. 
*Fill the folder with 5 papers.
*Return the folder to Rat Burgiss.
*Talk to Surok Magis in the Varrock library (the northern-most room in Varrock Palace). 
*Read Sin'keth's diary.
*Enter the Chaos Altar and use the wand on the altar with 15 chaos runes in your inventory.
**To avoid entering the wilderness, see an alternative entrance in the full guide.
*Return to Surok Magis with the infused wand and an empty bowl. 
*Talk to Rat Burgiss. 
*Talk to Zaff. 
*Talk to Surok Magis. 
*Bring King Roald to low health (2 hitpoints or less) then operate the Beacon ring. Your chatbox will show "Now would be a good time to summon Zaff!" when the ring is ready to be operated. (Instanced)
**Take the Dagon'hai history from the north-east bookshelf to bring to Historian Minas for 5 Kudos after the quest.
*Talk to Rat Burgiss.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Speak with the Observatory professor. 
*Give the Observatory professor the three planks, bronze bar and molten glass (speak to him 3 separate times each time).
*Speak to the assistant.
*Go up the east hill and down the stairs.
*Once downstairs, search all the chests until you find the goblin kitchen key (most commonly found in south-eastern part when you go down the stairs, don't skip the dialogue once you find the key or you will not pick it up. If not found in the two chests directly south-east from the stairs, it is guaranteed to be in the last chest in the dungeon. The other chests will contain poisonous spiders.).
*Head north from the entrance in the dungeon, then go west to the kitchen gate and prod the sleeping guard, then kill or trap him.
*Open the gate and inspect the goblin stove.
*Go back and speak to the professor with the lens mould in your inventory.  He will give back the needed molten glass for the next part. 
*Use the molten glass on the lens mould.
*Speak to the professor to give him the lens mould and the observatory lens. 
*Head back into the goblin dungeon.
*Run past the kitchen and climb up the stairs in the south end of the dungeon. (During the cutscene, DO NOT CLICK on anything in the observatory or you'll have to restart the cutscene)

*After the cutscene, talk to the professor upstairs and view the telescope. 
*Talk to the professor and identify the constellation you saw (see table below). Note: You do not get the reward until you talk to the professor after you have looked into the telescope.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Talk to Abigale in the south-east corner of Lumbridge Swamp and offer your help. 
*Take the boat to the south-west.
*If needed, take a bucket from the fountain to the west.
*Head to the west of the manor.
*Use the bucket on the barrel of rainwater to empty it.
*Take the manor key from the bottom of the empty barrel.
*Enter the manor doors using the manor key.

*If needed, take the knife from the table.
*Attempt to open the door with the pink knob to the north.
*Take the note on the ground next to you and read it.
*Go to the room south-west from the entry hall, and use the knife on the painting with the gloomy valley on the east wall.
*Search the slashed painting to obtain a ruby key.
*Go to the room south-east from the entry hall. If needed, take a tinderbox from the shelves.
*Use the tinderbox on the four unlit candles throughout the eastern room.
*Use the tinderbox on the barrel with the fuse.
*Exit the room to trigger the explosion.

*Re-enter the south-east room and climb over the damaged wall.
*Head north, then west, and click "observe" on the tree across from Lacey.
*Pick any chat option the Killer gives you; the answer does not matter.
*Take the note and read it.
*Play the notes D-E-A-D on the piano in the north-eastern corner of the manor.
*Search the piano to get an emerald key.

*Return to the mansion via the damaged wall.
*Open the door with the green knob north of the entrance, west of the door with the pink knob.
*Attempt to open the door to the west with the Bandos godsword inside.
*Take the note and read it.
*Head through the south-eastern room with the damaged wall to the room north of it. Use the knife on the unlit fireplace.
*Search the fireplace and enter the following gems in this order: Sapphire – Diamond – Zenyte – Emerald – Onyx – Ruby.
*Search the fireplace again to get the sapphire key.

*Open the westernmost door with the blue knob in the room where you slashed the painting.
*The killer will hide in wardrobes and throw knives. The player can know which wardrobe the killer is hiding in by looking for a brief black shadow surrounding the wardrobe. You must push the mirror and have it face the wardrobe before a knife is thrown. Repeat this until a cutscene.
*After the cutscene, take the killer's knife, wield it and attack Abigale.
*Attempt to exit the room.
*Talk to Mandy outside the manor.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Talk to the Zealot outside the mine. 
*Pickpocket him for the zealot's key.
*Climb over the cart to the south and crawl-down the cart tunnel.

*Run directly west through the cave and crawl-through the cart tunnel.
*Re-enter the cave via the southern entrance.
*Descend the nearby ladder.
*Go down the ladder directly east.

*Avoid touching mine carts.
*Go south along the moving cart's tracks using the alcove for cover, then slightly west.
*Climb down the ladder.

*Pick a glowing fungus. Don't take any random events that teleport you out of the mine from now on or your fungus will turn to ash.
*Go NW and place the fungus in the searchable cart.
*Go NW to check the points settings. (Board on a wall)

*Write down which levers need to change to match the correct setting to get to the ladder in the top-right corner.
**The initial configuration will be different for each player. See pictures for the correct configuration and labels on each lever.
*Go south-east and pull the needed levers (between A-E).
*Go north-west and pull the needed levers (between F-K).
*Return to the point settings and click start.

*Leave the cave by going back the way you came
**Go up the ladder by the glowing fungus spawn.
**Go north past the haunted cart, then the first wing east, climb up the ladder.
**Go west, climb up the ladder.
**Go west and exit the cave.
*Crawl-down the Cart tunnel to the north
*Climb down the nearby ladder.
*Go NE and climb down the ladder by the door.
*Go west then north and climb down the ladder.
*Search the cart for the fungus and take it. Do not drop until you have completed the quest!

*Climb up the ladder and start saving your run energy after you turn the water valve in the next step.
*Go all the way east then south past the moving cart.
*Climb down the ladder.
*Head south and use the Zealot's key on the water valve.
**Note: If you forgot a chisel be sure to grab the one near the lift before you open the valve; you won't have enough time to pick it up while running there.
*Quickly run to the lift and take it down.
*Go south then East and down the stairs.
*Go through the door.
*Pick up the innocent-looking key to start the boss fight.
*Kill Treus Dayth. It is recommended to pray Protect from Missiles throughout the fight. A good way to fight this boss is to run near him after attacking; the goal is to force him into the north-eastern corner. Once this occurs, run west to the end of the detached northern shaft and attack him from a distance. This prevents him from teleporting around the mine while also negating crane damage, which should make the fight easier.
**Note: If you teleport away, you will have to get another Glowing fungus. 
**Note: If you die, you cannot get the Glowing fungus back from your grave in the flooded area. This is not a safe fight.
**Note: If you are following the Optimal Quest Guide, using Crumble Undead is the most effective way to kill this boss.
*Pick up the key 
*Go back up the eastern stairs.
*Go west and down those stairs. You will need the Glowing fungus to act as a light source.
*Open the door and cut the crystal outcrop to the south-east with your chisel.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Talk to Guildmaster in Champions' Guild. 
*Talk to Oziach in Edgeville. 
*Talk to Guildmaster in Champions' Guild. Make sure you get the maze key by asking about Melzar's map piece, and also ask about Thalzar and Lozar's map pieces as well as where to find the right ship. 
*If you don't already have an anti-dragon shield, speak to Duke Horacio.
*Map pieces can be obtained in any order.

*Talk to Oracle on Ice Mountain. Make sure you have talked to the Guildmaster about where the Thalzar's map piece is. 
*Enter the Dwarven mine and use silk, lobster pot, unfired bowl, (make sure to right click) wizard's mind bomb on the magic door at the north-east side of the mine. You should automatically enter the door.
*Enter the magic door, open the chest, and search the chest to receive a map piece. Press space or ensure that you finish the dialogue. (Re-entry doesn't require the re-use of the items if you make a mistake.)

*Once you've gotten the Maze key from the Guildmaster head to Rimmington.
*Enter Melzar's Maze.
*Kill the small zombie rat with a long tail to get the key and enter the north-western door and climb up the ladder.
*Kill the ghost wearing a hood, a tube top, and no cape to get the key and enter the second door from the north on the eastern wall and climb up the ladder.
*Kill the skeleton with the round shield to get the key and enter the westmost door on the southern wall and climb down the ladder 3 times.
*Kill the zombies to get the key and enter the blue door.
*Kill Melzar the Mad to get the key and enter the purple (magenta) door.
*Kill the lesser demon to get the key and enter the green door. (Can be safespotted by luring him to the magenta door)
*Open and search the chest to receive a map piece.

*Go to the jail in Port Sarim.
*Either kill Wormbrain with ranged/magic/halberd and telegrab the map piece or pay him 10,000 coins for it. Make sure you have talked to the Guildmaster about where the Lozar's map piece is. 
*After obtaining all 3, combine them by using them on each other.

*Grab 3 wood planks, 90 steel nails, a hammer, and 2,000 coins out of the bank.
*Talk to Klarense in the southern docks of Port Sarim by the Void Outpost boat and pay him 2,000 coins. 
*Go on board, climb down the ladder and repair the hole 3 times.
*Talk to Ned in Draynor Village with the map in your inventory.

Warning: if you leave Elvarg's cave for any reason you will need planks and nails again to re-repair the ship; however, if you complete the optional task of opening the wall south of Elvarg's cave, you will gain access to the lair easily through the Karamja volcano dungeon and without the need to travel to Crandor again.
*Prepare for the fight. Make sure you have your Antifire potion and Anti-dragon shield with you.
*Return to the boat you previously repaired in Port Sarim. Board the ship and talk to Captain Ned. 
*Climb on top of the volcano and enter the hole. (After the cutscene climb back out of the hole for a Karamja medium task.)
**(Optional) Before teleporting out, head south from Elvarg's cave and open the wall to unlock another Karamja medium task.
*Head south and kill Elvarg. Depending on your level, you may flinch Elvarg in the south-east corner of her cave for a long, but safe fight. You will automatically collect her head as proof of your victory.

*Talk to Oziach in Edgeville.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Talk to Sir Amik Varze on the of the western section of the White Knights' Castle in Falador. 
*Head to Black Knights' Fortress with an iron chainbody and bronze med helm.
*Equip iron chainbody and bronze med helm, and enter the fortress through the sturdy door (toward the south, on the left stretch of the hallway).
*Push the wall in front of you and climb-up the ladder twice.
*Climb-down the ladder to the south, go through the eastern door and climb-up the ladder.
*Climb-down the eastern ladder, go south through the door and climb-down the ladder.
*Listen-at grill on the eastern wall.
*After going through the conversation, go back to the entrance using the same route.
*Go through the eastern door into the dining area (you need to finish the conversation with the guard. You can kill any black knights attacking you to chat to guard, but can rush through the chat to avoid combat). 
*Run north and climb-up the ladder, run east and then south, and push the wall.
*Use cabbage on the hole. BE CAREFUL NOT TO EAT IT.
*After your character mentions that you should return to Falador, do so and talk to Sir Amik Varze.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Talk to the Mage of Zamorak in level 4-7 Wilderness near the river (Cannot be wearing a non-Zamorak God item).
*Talk to the Mage of Zamorak in the Altar of Zamorak in south-eastern Varrock. (Note: If you have started (but not completed) the quest Wanted!, you'll be given an additional dialogue option at the beginning where you will have to select what to discuss with the Mage. ) Be sure to have a free inventory space for the scrying orb!
*Go to the nearby runeshop and teleport to rune essence mine. (Aubury)
*Go to the bottom floor of Wizards' Tower (fairy ring ) and teleport to rune essence mine. (Archmage Sedridor)
*Go to north-eastern Ardougne and teleport to rune essence mine. (Wizard Cromperty)
*Talk to the Mage of Zamorak in the Chaos Temple in south-eastern Varrock.
*Talk to him again to complete the miniquest.
*Talk to him again about the dangers of the Abyss. 
*Congratulations, miniquest complete!

*Talk to Fred the Farmer north of Lumbridge. 
*Fred takes the 20 balls of wool.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Talk to Fred the Farmer north of Lumbridge. 
**He will give you shears if you do not have them.
*Enter the sheep pen to the east, connected to his house and shear sheep for 20 wool.
**[[File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png]] Ultimate Ironmen: You can deliver the balls of wool in several trips. You do not have to deliver all 20 at once.
::Note: You cannot shear Rams or "The Thing". If you attack a ram and cannot kill it, run out of the pen until it stops targeting you.
*Go to the of Lumbridge Castle.
*Click on the spinning wheel in the southern room to spin the wool.
*With 20 un-noted balls of wool, return to Fred the Farmer.
*Talk to Fred the Farmer and hand them in. 
*Congratulations, quest complete!
*Talk to the Odd Old Man in Silvarea, north-east of Varrock, north of the Digsite, during the conversation he will mention boiling the bones in vinegar..

*Talk to Fortunato located in Draynor marketplace and buy 8 jug of vinegar.
*Use all of the jugs of vinegar with all the pots to make 8 pots of vinegar. If intending to do Rag and Bone Man II, buy 27 more (35 total) jugs of vinegar to save time.
*Use all of the bones with your pots of vinegar to get 8 bones in vinegar.
*Withdraw a tinderbox and either 8 logs or an axe
* With the logs in your inventory, return to the Odd Old Man
*For each bone in vinegar do:
**Place a set of logs on the pot-boiler next to the old man.
**Use a bone in vinegar with the pot-boiler.
**Light the set of logs with your tinderbox.
**Wait 12 seconds until the fire is consumed and remove the pot from the pot-boiler. (Alternatively, hop worlds after lighting the logs for them to be finished when you log back in)
*Talk to the Odd Old Man.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Speak with Ceril Carnillean ( of the house south-west of East Ardougne castle) 
*Enter the Ardougne Sewers east of the clocktower (south of Valve 3)

*Talk to Clivet 
*Go back outside
*Turn Valve 1 RIGHT
*Turn Valve 2 RIGHT
*Turn Valve 3 LEFT
*Turn Valve 4 RIGHT
*Turn Valve 5 RIGHT
*Head back to cave, board the raft, and talk to Alomone.
*Kill Alomone and loot the Carnillean armour from the chest.
*Board the raft again and run back to the Carnilleans house.
*Talk to Butler Jones and then Ceril Carnillean(quest incomplete!)
*Search the cupboard in the room upstairs east of the staircase to find the evidence.

*Talk to Clivet to receive a bottle of poison 
*Turn Valve 1 RIGHT
*Turn Valve 2 RIGHT
*Go to the basement of the Carnilleans house (ladder)
*Use the bottle of poison on the cooking range.
*Talk to Ceril on the .
*Talk to Clivet.
*Turn Valve 3 LEFT
*Turn Valve 4 RIGHT
*Turn Valve 5 RIGHT
*Go back to the cave and board the raft.
*Talk to Alomone.
*Go back to the Carnilleans' house.
*Talk to Butler Jones.
*Go in the basement and search the crate for a Chest key.
*Go up the ladder and stairs and knock on the wall in the east room, and go up the ladder.
*Unlock and search the chest to find the scroll.
*Return to Alomone.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Travel to Port Piscarilius by talking to Veos at the northernmost dock of Port Sarim just south of the pub. (Use amulet of glory to travel to Draynor Village then run around the wall to the west of the village to the docks)
*Once there, talk to Veos again to start.
*He will give you an enchanted scroll.
*Use your feather on the enchanted scroll to get an enchanted quill.
*Visit the following districts and speak to their respective store owners about their city:

*Return to Veos in Port Piscarilius after speaking with all store owners. 
*Use your Games necklace Wintertodt Camp teleport and run south until you reach the dark terrain with purple crystals, then east. Alternatively, if you have access to fairy rings, use code .
*Activate the mysterious orb in your inventory while near the Dark Altar, east of Trossa and the fairy ring.
*Return to Veos . 
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*To start, talk to Brother Kojo at the Clock Tower. Note: if he gives you a Watch speak to him again
*Go down the ladder in the middle room.
*Follow the path to a hub with four doors.

*Head through the south-eastern door.
*Walk down the passageway until you see some Ogres.
*Pick up the red cog.
*Head back to the ladder.
*Climb up to the and use the red cog on the red spindle (located on the column beside the ladder, facing north).

*Go outside of the Clock Tower and head east to where Brother Cedric is (South of Ardougne zoo).
**If you did not bring a bucket of water or ice gloves for the next section, take the bucket nearby and use it on the nearby well.
*Go down the ladder east of Brother Cedric. 
*Follow the tunnel to the end.
*Push the wall to get inside and pick up the blue cog.
*Climb up the ladder.
*Head to the centre room of the Clocktower and climb the staircase to the .
*Use the blue cog with the blue spindle (the spindle on the south side of the column).

*Head back to the basement and go through the north-eastern door 
**Go as far east as you can, to the fire.
*Use the bucket of water with the cog or simply wear your ice gloves to pick up the cog. Make sure to finish the dialogue or you will not pick up the cog.
*Head back to the ladder. (Do not climb up the ladder)
*Use the black cog with the black spindle. (In the basement of the Clock Tower on the east side of the column).

*Head through the north-western door.
*Pick up the rat poison to the north-west.
**Take an extra for Ratcatchers if not already completed.
*Head to the end of the tunnel 
**On the north wall of the dungeon rat cage are two levers.
*Pull the levers up to open the rat cage.
*Use the rat poison with the food trough.
*Wait until all the rats have died.
*Head through the western gate.
*Pick up the white cog 
*Climb-up the ladder.
*Head inside to the top floor.
*Use the white cog with the white spindle at the top of the clocktower (the spindle on the west side of the column).

*Head back down and talk to Brother Kojo for your reward.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

Items required: None
*Talk to the monk outside of the Paterdomus Temple, which is east of Varrock. (You can use fairy ring code  and then run west and climb the shortcut to arrive there quickly).

Items required: bow string, Mithril 2h sword or 3 mithril bars and a hammer
*Go to Doric's house north of Falador.
*Use the mithril 2h sword on Doric's Whetstone to make a slender blade.
*Attach the bow string to it to make the bow-sword.

Items required: Bow-sword, large pouch
*Head back to the monk. 
*Use the orb on the Large pouch.
**[[File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png]] Ultimate Ironmen: The Large pouch is lost upon death if the orb is inside it. Use the orb on the pouch only after 'banking' for Entrana.
*Bank your weapons and armour.
*Go to the Law Altar through the Abyss.
*Exit the portal and head to the church on Entrana.

*Use the pouch on the church altar and wait for the cut-scene to finish.
*Talk to the High Priest.
*Head back to the monk in Paterdomus.
*Search the Dead Monk.
*Go back to Entrana and speak with the High Priest. (Rat Pits Grouping teleport will take players to Port Sarim. Requires Ratcatchers quest. Players can also use the Minigame Pest Control teleport which is very close to Port Sarim)
*Head to Falador Park and talk to Sir Tiffy Cashien. 
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Speak to Sir Amik Varze on the of the western section of the White Knights' Castle. 
*Bank all equipped items and inventory.

*Speak to Sir Tiffy Cashien in the park to begin test. 
*5 of the following 7 puzzle rooms will appear in a random order. You will always fight Sir Kuam Ferentse.
**Sir Kuam Ferentse
***Pick up the Steel warhammer and equip.
***Defeat Sir Leye. Prayer is allowed.
**Lady Table (statue room):
***Quickly look for the colour (bronze, silver, gold) that only has three statues.
***Check which weapon is missing from that colour. (sword, halberd, axe, mace)
***Select the one that was added after the time is up.
***OR, simply take a screenshot to figure out which statue is missing.
**Sir Ren Itchood (standing on a crate):
***Ask for the clue to the door.
***The answer is the first letter of each sentence.
**Sir Tinley:
***Left-click on Sir Tinley, finish the conversation. Press nothing until he speaks to you again.
**Sir Spishyus (Grain, Chicken and Fox):
***Grab chicken and cross. Unequip the chicken and cross back over.
***Grab grain and cross. Unequip grain and pick up the chicken. Cross back over.
***Unequip chicken, grab fox and cross. Unequip fox and cross back over.
***Grab chicken and cross and unequip chicken.
***Walk to the door.
**Ms. Hynn Terprett (sitting on throne):
***"Death sentence" riddle – Fed to wolves
***"Husband and daughter" riddle – 10
***"Identical stones" riddle – Bucket A (32 degrees)
***"Fingers on left hand" riddle – 0
***"Which is true" riddle – Three False
**Miss Cheevers (Bookshelf room):
***First door:
****Starting from the south-western corner, search:
*****The most south-western bookshelf for a knife.
*****All four of the most southern shelves with vials, take all of them.
*****In the north-eastern corner, search the middle-sized crate next to the chest for a cake tin.
*****All four northern shelves for the remaining vials, take all of them.
****Take the spade from the table and use it on the bunsen burner.
****Use the spade on the door.
****Use cupric sulfate on door.
****Use a vial of liquid on door.
****Open the first door (do not walk through).
***Second door: (Note: Nitrous oxide and tin ore powder resemble an empty vial!)
****Use a vial of liquid on the cake tin. You may need to get another vial from the south shelves.
****Use gypsum on tin (you may need to Use another vial of liquid on the tin after.)
****Use tin on a key on the ground by the entrance portal.
****Use cupric ore powder and tin ore powder on the tin.
****Use tin on Bunsen burner.
****Use knife on tin.
****Use key on door and exit.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Talk to Lokar Searunner on the western most Rellekka docks. 
*Speak to Brundt the Chieftain in the Longhall for a seal of passage. 
*Return to Lokar Searunner. 
*Climb the ladders, and board the pirate ship. Talk to Captain Bentley about sailing to Lunar Isle. 
*Speak to Captain Bentley again.
*Climb down the nearby south stairs through the door, talk to 'Birds-Eye' Jack.
*Climb back up the stairs and talk to Captain Bentley again. 
*Climb back down the stairs and return to 'Birds-Eye' Jack again.

*Talk to 'Eagle-eye' Shultz at the very front (north-end) of the ship.
*Talk to the Cabin boy up one deck from the captain (south).
*Talk to 'Beefy' Burns on the lowest level of the ship.
*Talk to 'Lecherous' Lee at the very top-rear of the ship.
*Talk to First mate 'Davey-boy', on the deck level, south room.
*Climb back up to the top, talk to the Cabin boy (2 inventory spaces required).

*Use the emerald lens on the bullseye lantern you brought. Light it with your tinderbox.
**If you didn't bring a lightable lantern, you can make lamp oil in Rimmington and add it to the bullseye lantern (unf) given by the Cabin boy, after using the emerald lens on it. If you lose your emerald lens for any reason, you can ask the Cabin boy for another one.
**If you still own a sapphire lantern from the Tears of Guthix quest, you can use the emerald lens on the sapphire lantern.
*Use the lantern on the following objects, and rub away the symbols:
**Cannon: Eastern cannon a few steps away (same level as Cabin boy).
**Wallchart: Climb down the stairs, southern-most room (on the wall north of the big table).
**Chest: Lowest level of the ship, northern chest.
**Support pillar: Also lowest level, just north of Beefy Burns, the cook.
**Crate: Directly east of the cooking range.
*Talk to Captain Bentley.

*Climb down the ladders and walk into the city (there will be a small cut-scene).
*Run out of the city to the south-east part of the island. Talk to the Oneiromancer.
*Kill Suqah (safespottable), until you've received a suqah tooth. Keep any hides you get as drops (you will need a total of 4 hides later in the quest, which you can also collect later).
*Return to the city, northern section. Enter the chicken house and talk to Baba Yaga (1 inventory space required). 
*Exit the house and use the vial on a nearby water source.
**Add the Guam leaf and marrentill to your vial.
**Ironmen: If you have guam and marrentill to get rid of, now is a good time do so for Herblore experience (~10,000 xp/hr). Destroy the vial after creating the guam-marr vial, reobtain one from Baba Yaga, and repeat.
**Grind the Suqah tooth and use it on the vial to complete the potion.
*Return to the Oneiromancer with the potion.

*Use your Dramen staff/staves on the following altars in order:
**Air Altar (south of Falador).
**Fire Altar (north of Al Kharid entrance of Emir's Arena).
**Water Altar (Lumbridge Swamp).
**Earth Altar (north-east of Varrock).
*Travel back to Lunar Isle and give the Lunar staff to the Oneiromancer. Do not forget to bring your seal of passage.

*In the north-eastern part of the isle, climb down ladder to the Lunar Mine.
*Mine a stalagmite for 1 lunar ore. Grab three extra ores to save time during The Fremennik Exiles quest.
*Smelt the ore at a furnace or superheat the ore to receive a lunar bar (closest furnace and anvil is in Rellekka).
*With a hammer, use the bar on an anvil to make the helm.
*Go back to the Lunar Isle.
*North-west in the city, talk to Pauline Polaris (1 inventory space required) Note: The chat options appear in a random order when guessing her real name. First guess must be Pauline. Pick the option that says "Jane Blud-Hagic-Maid." 
*South in the city, talk to Meteora.
*Kill Suqahs until one drops a special tiara. Keep up to 4 hides the Suqahs drop. Make sure you have at least 4 hides.
*Give Meteora the tiara.
*South of the bank, talk to Rimae Sirsalis about ceremonial clothes. 
*Talk to Rimae Sirsalis again, she will tan your hides. 
*Craft a Lunar torso, trousers, gloves and boots from your hides.
Lunar ring location.png location]]
*Centre of the city, talk to Selene. 
*Exit the city and run south then west past the two bridges. With your spade, dig up the blue flowers furthest west to receive the lunar ring. (You must click continue on the chatbox!)
*Give the Oneiromancer all your lunar gear. She will then give you all the items back, if you do not have 11 inventory spaces free, you CANNOT continue.

*Use the Waking sleep vial on the kindling you received.
*Get your combat runes and supplies and wear all your lunar items (but do NOT bank your seal of passage). 4 inventory spaces are required.
*Enter a long building on the western side of the village that has a ceremonial brazier and a staircase inside.
*Light the ceremonial brazier then use the kindling on it.
*Talk to the Ethereal Being.
*If you logout during the dream state you will have to speak to the Oneiromancer again to retrieve the Waking sleep vial and kindling.

*Step on the south-western yellow platform.
*Talk to Ethereal Fluke.
*He will call out a number, you need to make the dice add up to the number he called. Roll the dice for the numbers in the answer that are not on the dice. E.g. for number 12, roll any dice that are numbers 4, 5 or 6.

*He will teleport you back to the centre area after 5-6 correct answers.
*Talk to the Ethereal Being.

*Step on the south-eastern purple platform.
*Talk to Ethereal Numerator.
*Click on the numbers to complete the patterns:

*He eventually teleports you back to the middle.
*Talk to the Ethereal Being.

*Step on the north-eastern blue platform.
*Talk to Ethereal Perceptive. If you don't have an axe, he'll give you one. 
*Run west and chop 20 logs, depositing them on your log pile.
*He will teleport you once you've won the competition.
*Talk to the Ethereal Being.

*Step on the north-western grey platform.
*Talk to Ethereal Guide.
*Cross the chasm by jumping on the correct combination of Dream Puffs. Keep a note of the correct steps!
*Once complete, talk to the Ethereal Being.

*Step on the eastern grey platform.
*Talk to Ethereal Expert and start the race. 
*Turn on run, and keep it on while jumping the hurdles.
*Jump over the Hurdles. If you fail 3 times you will lose the race.
*After you have won talk to the Ethereal Being.

*Step on the south-eastern green platform.
*Talk to Ethereal Mimic. 
*Click on him, then copy the emote that he performs. He teleports after each correct emote.
*After 5 correct emotes, he'll teleport you back.

*Talk to the Ethereal Being to begin the final fight. 
*Kill Me (level 79, safespottable).
**You cannot equip any different equipment when fighting Me, however you can bring combat runes to make the fight drastically easier. A tome of fire or any shield slot item can be used if equipped before entering the dream.

*Read the lectern to return to Lunar Isle.
*With the seal of passage equipped or in your inventory talk to the Oneiromancer.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Travel to Lunar Isle.
*Enter the mine in the north-east area of Lunar Isle.
*Crawl through the cave entrance ( Quest minimap icon).
*Talk to the fallen man, follow the dialogue and close the interface when it appears.
*Feed him 4 food, starting with one you have seven of, while cycling through your different foods. Avoid using the same food twice in a row.
*Talk to him again. 
*Feed him 4 more food as before.
*Talk to him and keep reassuring him with positive responses until he sits up (cutscene).
*Feed him 6 more food.
*Talk again multiple times using positive responses until he stands up (cutscene), and once more after he stands up.
*Talk to 'Bird's-Eye' Jack in the bank. 
*Select the following equipment (if your combat level is determined by your melee skills):
**Dragon med helm
**Abyssal whip
**Ahrim's robetop
**Ahrim's robeskirt
**Ranger boots 
Use NPC Contact spell to make sure you get the right things for him.
If your combat level is determined by your magic level,  use robin hood hat, dragon chainbody, black d'hide chaps, infinity boots and ancient staff. For  ranged  use splitbark helm, Karil's leathertop, Torag's platelegs, adamant boots and magic shortbow.
*Return and talk to Cyrisus for a cutscene. 
*Use the remaining food on him.
*Talk to him again multiple times, giving positive responses until you receive a cutscene. If you don't receive it, feed him a couple more times.

*Talk to the Oneiromancer at the Astral Altar for a dream vial. 
*(Optional) Change your spellbook as necessary if you wish to use magic in the final fight.
*Fill the vial with water, add a goutweed.
*Use your hammer on an Astral rune, then grind the shards with a pestle and mortar.
*Add your ground astral rune to the dream vial to complete the potion.
*Prepare for 4 fights. Prayers and emergency teleports won't work. Do not bank your seal of passage; not even 'Birds-Eye' Jack will serve you without it yet.

*Light the Ceremonial Brazier in the dream hall building.
*Talk to Cyrisus. 
*During the fight, you can leave at any time by using the lectern, although this will force you to re-battle any defeated bosses.
**Kill The Inadequacy
**Kill The Everlasting - can be safespotted by the lectern to the north
**Kill The Untouchable - can be safespotted by the lectern to the north
**Kill The Illusive
*Return to the Oneiromancer. 
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Go to the Exam Centre.
*Ask an examiner about an exam. 
*Go to the Varrock museum and talk to Curator Haig Halen. He will give you a Sealed letter. 
**(Optional) Steal a cup of tea from the tea stall if you don't have one already. (This is a Varrock easy diary requirement)
*Go back to the Exam Centre and talk to an examiner. The chat options do not matter; you will fail the exam regardless.

*North of the exam centre at the hilltop with the blue urn, search the second bush to the right of the blue urn to find a teddy bear.
*Take the panning tray.
*Talk to the panning guide to give him a cup of tea.
*Pan the water at the panning points until you find a Special cup (browse through dialogue if stopped – referred to as "Shiny Cup" in dialogue). If you need an opal continue panning until you get one.
*Steal from the workman near the panning points until you get an animal skull and specimen brush.
*Run north to the female student with blonde hair and pigtails on the north-west end of the dig and give her the "teddy" by talking to her twice.
*Run east to the student with a beard and a reddish-orange shirt and give him the Special cup by talking to him twice.
*Run south to the student in a green shirt and give him the Animal skull by talking to him twice.

*Return to an examiner. – You should receive 'Level 1 Certificate'
*Talk to all 3 students again.
*Return to an examiner to take the second exam.  – You should receive 'Level 2 Certificate'
*Talk to all 3 students – the female student will demand an opal (can be obtained by panning). Talk to her two times.
*Return to an examiner for the final exam.  – You should receive 'Level 3 Certificate'
**Save all of your certificates to hand in to Curator Haig Halen at the Varrock Museum in exchange for a fruit blast, a required item for Recipe for Disaster subquest Another Cook's Quest or a chocolate cake.

*Back at the Exam Center, go in the western room and search the cupboards on the north and south walls to get a rock pick and a specimen jar, respectively.
*If you haven't already, steal a specimen brush from the Digsite workman.
*Use the trowel on the soil in either level 3 digsite until you obtain an ancient talisman. Note: This step can take several minutes depending upon luck.
*Talk to Terry Balando in the exam centre.
*Use the invitation on any Digsite workman except the one by the western winch.
*Use a rope on the western winch, then climb down. 
*Pick up one of the arcenia root in the room, search the bricks to the east, then climb back up.
*Walk north-east to the northern winch, use the rope on the winch, and climb down.
*Talk to Doug Deeping about the rocks. Climb up the rope.

*Walk to the tent to the south (marked with the orange vial), unlock the chest with the Chest Key and search to obtain chemical powder.
*Use the trowel on the closed barrel to the west of the tent.
*Use a vial on the barrel to get an unidentified liquid. If dropped, it will deal 25 non-fatal damage, and destroy the vial requiring you to re-open the barrel and collect more.
*Grind the charcoal with your pestle and mortar.
**If you don't have charcoal, search the tray a few steps north.
*Return to the exam centre and use the chemical powder and the unidentified liquid on Terry Balando (Note: make sure you right-click the liquid otherwise you'll empty it).
*Mix the nitroglycerin and ammonium nitrate together to create mixed chemicals, then add ground charcoal and finally arcenia root to produce chemical compound.
*Climb down the western winch.
*Use the compound on the bricks (not the rocks).
*Use your tinderbox on the bricks.
*Enter the large chamber, take the stone tablet. Low-levels should be wary of Level 22 skeletons.

*Use the tablet on Terry Balando.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Talk to Reldo, located in the library in Varrock Palace. 
*Check the bookcase with a bright blue book in the top shelf, and read the book.
*Talk to Reldo again.
After this point, you must choose to join either the Phoenix Gang or the Black Arm Gang. (Tip: Join the chat-channel "osrs soa" to find a partner before deciding.)

*Take your half of the shield to Curator Haig Halen, located in the Varrock Museum.
*Trade your half of the certificate with your partner. (Ironmen: Use the certificate halves on your partner)
*Use both halves of the certificate on each other to make a completed certificate.
*Take the certificate to King Roald in the castle to receive your reward.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*1 hammer (required for all facilities)
*10 oak planks
*2 iron bars
*25 nails
*1 tinderbox
*2 logs
*3 soft clay
*1 bucket
*2 ropes
*5 planks (Obtainable in the camp)
*Speak to Curator Haig Halen in the Varrock Museum.

*Go to the canal barge north of The Digsite and speak to the barge foreman.
*Speak to the sawmill operator in the Lumber Yard. 
*Bring the sawmill proposal to the sawmill operator in the Woodcutting Guild. 
**If you don't have the requirements to enter, just try and open the eastern gate of the guild to complete this step.
*Bring the sawmill agreement back to the Lumber Yard's sawmill operator.

*Speak to the barge foreman.
*Right click the Board option on the barge guard.
*Speak to the Lead Navigator. 
*Talk to Jack Seagull in the Rusty Anchor Inn in Port Sarim. or 
*Return to the northern part of the digsite and board the boat through the barge guard.
*Talk to the Lead Navigator.
*Speak to the Odd Old Man at the limestone mine to the north. You can get there by deboarding the boat and walking west, north, then east.  He will give you the Bone charm.

*Speak to the Apothecary in Varrock. Bring your two bottles of vodka and your Marrentill potion (unf)
**Chat options depend on quests completed. Pick Talk about something else., then pick Talk about Bone Voyage.
*Speak to him again, selecting the same chat options as before.
*Return to the Lead Navigator to give him the potion of sealegs.
*Speak to the Junior Navigator to give him the bone charm.

*You will have to steer left or right using the controls on the interface. The progress bar will indicate how far you have to go to reach the island.
When the top arrow tilts to the left, click on the right arrow.

When the top arrow tilts to the right, click on the left arrow.

Changing the height of the sails will alter how drastically the boat shifts from side to side. Having the boat's sails as large as possible when going in a straight line will allow for a more consistent travel route.
*Once the progress bar is filled, you will arrive at Fossil Island.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Speak to Tomas Lawry outside the Port Piscarilius bank. 
*Head south and speak to Robert O'Reilly in the house directly west of the bridge. He will ask for a stew. A stew can be made with raw beef and a potato purchased from Kenelme directly west along with a bowl from the general store south-east.
*Enter the manhole to the east marked by the [[File:Dungeon map link icon.png]] icon, cross the bridge a bit to the south, continue west.
*Speak to Devan Rutter, near the fish stall. 
*Optional: Trade the General Store Shop Keeper in The Warrens for an easy Kourend & Kebos Diary task.
* Return to the surface from the way you entered and murder Conrad King (non-combat) on the dock on the southern side of the Piscarilius Foodhall (the largest building). Pick either option.
*Go back down the manhole and enter the tent.
*Speak to the Queen of Thieves.
*Exit the sewers and travel south-west to Kingstown and enter the house immediately north from the entrance (south of the [[File:Rare trees icon.png]] icon), and climb the stairs to the .
*Picklock the chest in the east side of the room to find a letter. (You may have to click the lock multiple times)
*Return to Tomas Lawry. 
*Return to The Queen of Thieves (now called Lady Shauna Piscarilius).
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Speak to Lord Kandur in the house west of the Vinery (Xeric's Glade teleport on talisman). 
*Speak to Chef Olivia in Lord Kandur's kitchen.
*Head to the Arceuus Library (fairy ring code, or games necklace to Wintertodt Camp) and speak to Galana. (north-east wing, )
*Speak to Galana again. She will tell you where to find the Varlamore envoy book. This is random for everyone.
*Read the Varlamore envoy book.
*Enter the Crabclaw Caves south of the Woodcutting Guild marked by the [[File:Dungeon map link icon.png]] icon. Kill a sandcrab for easy diary while here. (Rada's blessing, Skills necklace teleport, Xeric's Talisman to Xeric's Look-Out, or Veos ship/charter ship to Land's End)

*Navigate to the end of the caves and climb down the tunnel at the end.
*Speak to Artur Hosidius.
*Kill the Sand Snake (level 36).
*Search the chest.
*Return to Lord Kandur Hosidius and talk to him.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Speak to Dimintheis (south-east Varrock). 
*Speak to the brothers in any order. 
**Avan is located in the Al Kharid mine, north of Al Kharid. 
**Caleb is located in Catherby, in the building north-east of the bank. 
**Johnathon is located upstairs in the Jolly Boar Inn, north-east of Varrock. 
*Return and speak to Dimintheis with 500,000 coins. 
*Congratulations, miniquest complete!
