*Speak to Captain Tock just south of the entrance to Falador farm. 
*Speak to Captain Tock on the single dock just west of Rimmington. 
*Upon arrival to Corsair, make sure to speak with Ithoi the Navigator first or else the other npc chats will not work correctly. Find Ithoi by travelling west along the beach. Climb the stairs of the southernmost building on the beach.

*Speak to Arsen the Thief (upstairs in the first house west off the docks). 
*Speak to Cabin Boy Colin (in the same room as Arsen, just east). 
*Speak to Gnocci the Cook (upstairs in the building just north-west). 
**Grab the tinderbox next to him if you don't have one.
**Grab the spade found directly south of his hut (right by the tree near the water) if you don't have one.
*Speak to Captain Tock back on the boat (cross south gangplank) to receive the ogre artefact. 
*Speak to Chief Tess in the Corsair Cove Dungeon (dungeon entrance is just west, in the middle of four small pillars) . 
*Dig by the lump of sand next to the tree where Gnocci the Cook fished in the cutscene. (see image) 
**Three steps east of the tropical tree found west of the fishing spot.
*Use the telescope on the deck of Ithoi the Navigator's hut.
*Return to Gnocci the Cook and speak to him.
*Speak to Arsen the Thief.
*Speak to Cabin Boy Colin.

*Speak to Captain Tock. 
*Speak to Gnocci the Cook. 
*Speak to Arsen the Thief. 
*Speak to Cabin Boy Colin. 
*Speak to Ithoi the Navigator. 
*Speak to Ithoi the Navigator again.
*Use your tinderbox on the driftwood under his hut.
*Speak to Ithoi the Navigator again. 
*Speak to Captain Tock. 

*Head west again and kill Ithoi the Navigator (level 35).
**Use protect from magic to take no damage.
*Speak to Captain Tock.

*Talk to Alec Kincade outside the Myths' Guild (Spirit Tree to Feldip Hills) to start the quest. 
*Talk to Dallas Jones at the Karamja pub at Musa Point. The fastest way there is to take the boat from Port Sarim.
*Go to Elvarg's Lair under Crandor and talk to Dallas Jones (shortcut via the volcano on Karamja).
*Right-click use your pickaxe on the Northern wall in the room you defeated Elvarg, then enter the tunnel. (Marked on minimap red wall line)
*Investigate the Ancient Mural to the north. A level 100 spawn will attack you. Kill it.
*Investigate the mural again.
*Talk to Dallas Jones.

*Head to Fossil Island in the basement of the House on the Hill and talk to Dallas Jones. 
*Find the missing 24 map pieces and use them on the map in the middle of the room. Note: You can hand your pieces to Dallas to save inventory space - Hand in 8 map pieces within the house before heading outside to save time.
**Search the open chest north of the map for 5 pieces. 
**Go upstairs, search the open stone chest on the north wall for 3 pieces.
**Go outside, search the Fungi just north of the staircase for 4 pieces.
**Search the Hook briar south of the house for 7 pieces.
**Run to the east, search the mushtree for 5 pieces.
*Talk to Dallas Jones and solve the map puzzle. 
**Pieces can be clicked to rotate them, and also dragged to swap them.
*Talk to Dallas Jones again.
*Talk to Jardric at the museum camp.

*Bring 8 oak planks, 10 swamp paste, 12 nails (more may be needed as you may bend them), a hammer (must be a regular hammer), and a saw to the west side of the island (on the coast just south-west of the "Mushroom Meadow" Magic Mushtree) and build a rowboat.
*Talk to Dallas Jones and board the boat. 
*Head north-west from the boat to the ruined courtyard, and climb up the western stairs.
*Climb down the trapdoor to the south, down the staircase to the north, and north down another staircase.
*Talk to Dallas Jones.
*Search the skeleton to the east and read Aivas' diary.
*Talk to Dallas Jones again.

*Find Bob the Cat using your Catspeak amulet (e) and talk to him. (Fastest way is to go to anvils in west Varrock and hop worlds)
*Talk to the Sphinx in Sophanem. 
**The sphinx will enchant you. You can now talk to cats without the catspeak amulet!

*Bring your seal of passage and make sure you have 1 free inventory space! Note: You can still use the bank run by 'Bird's-Eye' Jack without the seal; however, it is needed to speak to the Oneiromancer.
*Head to Lunar Isle and talk to the Oneiromancer. 
*Crush the astral rune with a hammer, then grind the astral rune shards with a pestle and mortar.
*Make a dream potion by filling the dream vial with water (sink west of bank in town) and adding your goutweed and ground astral rune.
*Gear up for a fight, light the Ceremonial Brazier (located in the largest building on the island), and use your Dream potion on the flame.
**You may leave to prepare by using the giant history book at the entrance, then rejoin the fight at any time by talking to Bob again.
*Talk to Bob and Not Bob, then exit out of the dream to gear up if you are not fully prepared. This also allows you to clear out the tinderbox and fill up with combat supplies.
*Re-enter the dream by talking to Bob outside the brazier, and then head through the barrier and kill Robert the Strong.
**He can't be fought with ranged or magic, bring melee gear and a crush weapon.
**He can hit heavy damage through Protect from Missiles but it reduces damage taken. Using chivalry or piety is recommended to speed up the fight, as the most challenging part about this fight is lasting long enough through the damage taken.
**When he shouts, run behind one of the pillars to avoid his special attack. If it hits you, it can deal up to 60 damage and will knock off your prayers.
**Super combat potion, an inventory full of food and a prayer potion are highly recommended. Do not underestimate this fight!

*Talk to Bob again.
*You now need to collect the four parts of the key to open the door on Lithkren.

*Head to the south-eastern coast of the Kharazi Jungle and down the staircase into the maze. Turn off Auto Retaliate.
*Navigate to the centre of the maze and take the key piece.
**Avoid spikes and traps with thieving and agility.
**Use protection prayers to protect from the golems' attacks.
***Red: Melee
***Green: Ranged
***Blue: Magic
*Once you have taken the Dragon key piece, the plinth can be used to transport you out.

*Talk to Reldo in the Varrock Castle library. 
*Search the second bookcase from the north on the west side of the central row (see this image).
*Talk to Reldo again. 
*Go to Port Phasmatys and speak to Sarah, west of the bank.
*Bring a dragonstone, 2 molten glass, a glassblowing pipe, and a chisel to Ava in Draynor Manor. 
*Use your glassblowing pipe on your dragonstone and use the inert locator orb on Ava to get a locator orb.
*Head to Mort Myre Swamp and use the locator to find the buried key piece. Bring food as the locator hurts you every time you use it.
** The location is random inside the swamp. Each time you use the locator it will tell you which direction to go.
** Start at and feel your locator device. (Unlike in the picture, canifis code is CKS not CKR)
** If you get north-east, it will always be the lone purple spot that you need to cross the bridge to get to.
** If you get south-west, south, or south-east, go to the centre of the subdivided area and scan again. For example, if you got west, go to the centre of the blue subdivision and scan there again. If you get west again, you've narrowed it down to a single dig spot.
*Dig up the dragon key piece.

*Ask Brundt the Chieftain in Rellekka about the dragonkin fortress. or  if you don't own a seal of passage or  if you haven't started the Fremennik Exiles quest, whichever refers to the fortress.
*Prepare for a fight with Vorkath. See Vorkath/Strategies for recommended setups.
**Super antifires and Anti-venom+ potions are highly recommended.
**Set your quick prayers to protect from Magic and your best ranged attack prayer to allow easy re-enabling prayers.
**Elite Void Knight equipment together with a crossbow and ruby/diamond bolts is recommended.
**Turn off run to make evading the fire barrage special attack easier. Use Ctrl+click on tiles to run to that tile whenever necessary.
*Talk to Torfinn on the dock to the north to go to Ungael. 
*Kill Vorkath.
**Before the fight, put on Protect from Magic and drink your Anti-venom+, Super antifire, and Ranging potions.
***Make sure to re-pot during the fight, Super antifire and anti-venom has a short duration (both 3 minutes).
**Vorkath has several different regular attacks, including a melee attack. The two important ones are:
***Orange fireball shot into the air - Move at least two squares away from your current location.
***Pink fireball shot at you - Your prayers will be knocked off, turn them back on (using quick prayers).
**After every six regular attacks, Vorkath will use one of his special attacks:
***He will spit acid all over the crater and start firing fireballs very rapidly at your current location. Find a straight line clear of acid spots and walk back and forth along it to avoid the fireballs. See the Vorkath strategy page for advanced tactics.
***He will hit you with Dragonfire barrage, freezing you in an ice block. He will then summon a Zombified spawn that slowly walks to you, if it reaches you it will deal 30 damage. Kill it before it gets you, using Crumble Undead will guarantee a one-hit kill. You will stay frozen and Vorkath will stop attacking you until you kill the spawn or it reaches you. A possible strategy is to bring a slayer staff and setting the auto-cast to Crumble Undead, to reduce the need to click as accurately right away.
*After you kill him, climb over the ice chunks in the north of the crater (if required you can teleport out to restock for a dungeon part, Vorkath will remain dead). 
*Walk along the path to the north-west of the island and enter the cave.
**There are venomous spiders inside, don't forget your Anti-venom+.
*Pull the lever in the south-west section, then run to the room on the east wall before the timer runs out (you must have at least 15% run energy).
*Search the stone chest for a dragon key piece and an ancient key.

*Enter the crypt whose entrance is found in the southern part of the Graveyard of Heroes. Follow the dirt path south to a small building.
**Caution: The crypt is full of powerful aggressive skeletons and zombies that attack with all three combat styles.
*Head to the bottom of the crypt and inspect the tomb to find the puzzle.
*The solution to the puzzle is different for everyone. Refer to the table below to solve this puzzle.
**"The one from [Location] sat at the north of the table": Place this statue north.
**"Opposite the one with [Weapon]": Place this statue south.
**"The one with [Weapon] asked the .....": Place this statue west.
**Place the final statue east.
*Search the tomb to get the Dragon key piece.

*Go to the Ancient Cavern (use a Games Necklace to teleport to Barbarian Outpost and run south to the whirlpool).
*Descend the stairs and run south to another set of stairs which lead to the to the mithril dragon area.
*Run west and open the mithril door in the middle of the area (with the three mithril dragons clumped together). You need the ancient key to open this door.
*Cast Fire Wave or Fire Surge on the three dragon heads.
*Leave the room and go east down the staircase, and then go to the south-western area of the caverns, and climb up the rough hewn steps there.
*Use one of the anvils here to forge the dragon key.
*Return to Fossil Island and use the Rowboat to Lithkren (west of Mushroom Meadow Mushtree). Return to the area where Dallas Jones is.
*Use the Dragon key on the ancient doors.
*Enter the doors and head up north and speak to Dallas to start a cutscene.
*After the cutscene, make sure to finish the dialogue with Jardric and Bob.

*Travel to Varrock and speak with King Roald about the dragon threat. 
*Speak with the following rulers "about the dragon threat" in any order:
**Sir Amik Varze in Falador 
**King Lathas (King Thoros after Song of the Elves) in East Ardougne 
**Brundt the Chieftain in Rellekka or  if you completed The Fremennik Exiles, whichever refers to the threat.
*Return to Varrock and enter the dining room north of the throne room. 
*Make sure to talk to Bob after exiting the dining room.

*Return to Rellekka and take the boat back to Ungael by speaking to Torfinn.
*Hold off the assault on your ship for 4 minutes.
**Click leaks to fill them.
**Click fires to douse them.
**Click injured Fremennik warriors to heal them.
**Click damaged masts to repair them.
*There is a checkpoint after defending the ship from the assault.
*Put on your dragonfire protection.
*Make your way towards Varrock's grand ship, fighting a red dragon, iron dragon, and brutal green dragon on the way.
*Kill the two green and two blue dragons battling the Varrockian soldiers.
*There is a checkpoint after killing these four dragons. If necessary, teleport out and prepare for the next wave.
*Kill the black, steel then brutal red dragons that arrive on the ship one at a time.
**When Galvek does a casting animation, run away from your current location.
*There is a checkpoint after killing the brutal red dragon. If necessary, teleport out to prepare for the next three dragons.
*Kill the mithril, adamant then rune dragons that arrive on the ship one at a time.
**When Galvek does a casting animation, run away from your current location.
**These three dragons have a melee, ranged, magic, and dragonfire attack.
**The adamant dragon also has two special attacks:
***A ranged attack with the Blood Forfeit effect (hits through Protect from Missiles).
***A poison attack that splashes and lands on nearby squares dealing lots of damage.
****It is recommended to use Antidote++ or other poison immunity to minimise this damage.
**The rune dragon also has two special attacks:
***A ranged attack with the Life Leech effect (hits through Protect from Missiles).
***An electric attack that hits nearby squares and arcs around the player, dealing rapid damage.
****It is recommended to wear Insulated boots to minimise this damage.
*There is a checkpoint after killing the rune dragon. Teleport out and stock up for the final battle.

*Kill Galvek - he has four phases that have 300 hitpoints each.
**Keep avoiding his ground-targeted fireballs.
**Turn your prayers back on after his pink dragonfire knocks them off.
***Setting your quick prayers to Protect from Magic and Eagle Eye/Rigour is beneficial to counter this attack.
**Use Protect from Magic in phase 1, use Protect from Missiles in phases 2, 3 and 4.
***Phase 1: Drops eight fire traps- don't get near them or you will be hit for all your health. Stay along the north side of the ship, one square directly south of Galvek, and run two squares south from your location to avoid the fireball, and return to your original position once the attack has failed to hit you.
***Phase 2: Launches transparent projectile which drains stats, especially run energy.
***Phase 3: Summons waves from either the north or south end, avoid them by standing in the gap. Turn off auto retaliate to not get pulled away from the gap.
***Phase 4: Launches earth projectiles. Avoid these or you will be bound, and probably die.

*Return to Alec Kincade outside the Myths' Guild. 
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Go to the house west of the The Cloak and Stagger tavern in Shayzien. (Xeric's Talisman - 1. Xeric's Lookout and run north-west)
*Speak to Phileas Rimor, and agree to help him. 
*Gather a ranged weapon, a melee weapon (a pickaxe counts as a valid melee weapon), and runes to perform any magic attack if you have not already.
*Go to the Arceuus Library (Fairy ring or Lovakengj Minecart Network) and speak to Archeio to teleport to the Library Historical Archive.
*Speak to Pagida, and agree to be teleported into the Tower of Magic prison. 
*Push the strange device all the way west. From the north side, attack the device using magic.
*From the south side, attack using melee. (Note: Make sure your NPC attack options are not set to hidden, or the Attack option will not appear!)
*Push the strange device all the way east. From the south side, attack using ranged.
*Investigate the skeleton in the northern cell.
*Return to the quest start and talk to Phileas Rimor (Xeric's Talisman - 1. Xeric's Lookout and run north-west).
*Go north-west to the War Tent in the south-west corner of the Shayzien Encampment. Go upstairs and speak to Lord Shiro Shayzien.

*Travel to the summit of Mount Quidamortem. (Lovakengj Minecart Network or Xeric's Talisman - 5. Xeric's Honour if it is unlocked) or Fairy ring (if unlocked)
**(Optional) Speak to the Mountain Guide to unlock quick travel to and from the mountain.
*Speak to Historian Duffy. (near the water symbol on the minimap) 
*Use a rope on the crevice on the western side of the mountain, and enter the crevice. Go around to the south, not through the middle. (near the ! symbol on minimap)
*Mine the Boulder.
*Push the Boulder.
*Attempt to pass the magic gate, and kill the Corrupt Lizardman.
*Pass through the magic gate and inspect the Unstable Altar.
*Hop worlds after you finish the dialogue to quickly leave the cave.
*Speak to Historian Duffy again.
*Go back to the unstable altar in the cave.
*Speak to Duffy and then Gnosi near the unstable altar. Make sure to speak to them BOTH.
*Speak to Lord Shiro Shayzien back at the war tent. (Fairy ring  or the Lovakengj Minecart Network)
*Return to Phileas's house and walk inside to get dialogue. He will not be there.
*Return to Lord Shiro Shayzien once more.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Speak to Garth .
*Travel to the Myreque Hideout in Meiyerditch, the following method can be used to arrive there quickly:
**From the Theatre of Blood, go through the western exit into Meiyerditch.
**Speak to a nearby Vyrewatch and ask to be sent to the mines.
**Mine 15 Daeyalt ores and place them in the nearby minecart. After this, speak to a Vampyre Juvinate to leave. If you have no pickaxe, talk to a miner to obtain a bronze one.
**You will appear up on the surface. On the right is a map of the route to take to get to the hideout; follow the blue path down to the leftmost green dot.
**Climb up the ladder in the house with the green dot, jump east to the floorboards, and climb down the stairs into the house with the rightmost green dot.
**Walk south-east and push the wall to pass through.
**Press the decorated wall and then open the lumpy rug south-east of it to reveal a hidden trapdoor.
*Climb down the trapdoor and speak to Safalaan in the north part of the underground base.
*Return to the Theatre of Blood.

*Attempt to climb up the rubble west of the bank, within Ver Sinhaza.
*Speak to Harpert west of the bank and pay him 1,000 coins .
*Climb the rubble.
*Climb the steam vent directly to the north-east when it is inactive.
**Players may take damage from the boiling hot steam that comes out from the vents. Some food may be necessary for lower level players.
*Run to the north and jump off the roof.
*Continue north and climb up the third vent.
*Run east and climb up and down the roof section to cross the gap.
*Run east and then south to the red window, look through it. (Be sure you complete the dialogue once the cut-scene is finished, otherwise your quest log won't update. Your health will be restored upon completing the dialogue.)

*Return to Safalaan using the method listed above and speak to him .
*Speak to Flaygian Screwte .
*Speak to Safalaan.
*Go to Serafina's house.
**Upon exiting the hideout, push the wall, climb up the stairs, jump the gap and then climb down the ladder.
**Head north through the first three doors in a line, then head west until you reach the Meiyerditch wall.
**Head north-west to reach a broken fountain.
**Climb down the stairs of the house south of the fountain.
*Speak to Safalaan.
*Search the crates and barrels around the basement to obtain mysterious meat, mysterious herb, a vial and a pestle and mortar (the last two being optional if you brought them with you)
**If you didn't bring a vial of water, fill the vial at the broken fountain upstairs.
*Use the mysterious herb on the vial of water.
*Use the pestle and mortar on the mysterious meat.
*Use the mysterious crushed meat on the unfinished potion.
*Use the finished potion on the door.
*Speak to Safalaan .
*Make the potion again, but this time use the ingredients on the vial of blood instead of a vial of water.
*Use the blood potion on the door, open and search the chest to receive the old notes.
*Talk to Safalaan with the notes .

*Return to the Myreque hideout and speak to Safalaan to start a cutscene.
*Defeat the abomination. (Note: Complete the post-fight dialogue until the point where the Myreque leave or you'll have to return to the Hideout.)

*Teleport to Burgh de Rott, and take the boat to Meiyerditch.
*Head to Old Man Ral's house in the centre of southern Meiyerditch. Enter the secondary Myreque base via the trapdoor in the north room.
*Speak to Safalaan.
*Speak to Vertida Sefalatis.
*Read Flaygian's notes.
*If you haven't made another Rod of Ivandis, you can now return to Veliaf Hurtz at Burgh de Rott hideout to reclaim it.
*In Old Man Ral's basement, search the nearby crates to find a silver sickle (b) and a chain.
*Attach the emerald to the sickle to create an emerald sickle (b).
*Then, cast Lvl-2 Enchant on the emerald sickle, or use an enchant emerald or jade tablet on it.
*Finally, use the chain on the enchanted emerald sickle or the Rod of Ivandis to create the Ivandis flail.
*Speak to Safalaan.

*Go to the Theatre of Blood (run east of Old Man Ral's house and go through the Ver Sinhaza castle walls) and speak to Kael Forshaw by the noticeboard. 
*Defeat Ranis Drakan.
**Ranis Drakan is level 233, and can only be harmed by the Ivandis flail. He will use melee and magic attacks that can hit up to 20. He can also cast Blood Barrage, which can heal him for half of the damage dealt. Occasionally, he will charge an attack and explode, hitting up to 30. The damage can be reduced by running away from him when he is charging the attack.
**After he reaches 65% and 25% of his health, he'll summon two level 87 vyrewatch and will fly airborne. He will regularly launch blood bombs at your current square, which can hit up to 30; you can simply walk backwards one square to lure the vyrewatch to the affected square, so the bombs hurt them instead.
**After killing them, he will go berserk and attack the player. During this last phase, his attacks are much faster and accurate, but only have a max hit of 6. Using Protect from Melee will easily defeat him in the last phase.
*Speak to Kael Forshaw again.

*Speak to Safalaan, found in the hideout under Old Man Ral's house.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Talk to Burntmeat located in the Troll Stronghold kitchen (stairs to the south after entering)., or if boosts are being used.
*Talk to My Arm located by the herb patch on the roof of the Troll Stronghold (ladder up to the west or Agility shortcut.
*Talk to Larry (Fairy ring code  then run to the transportation symbol on the coast to the north, east of Rellekka), or  if you no longer have the clockwork book
*Talk to Larry again., or  if you no longer have the clockwork book
*Board the boat.

If you did not bring a rope, search the wrecked boat for one. Take a pickaxe too as you'll need it later.
*Attempt to mine the cave entrance (do not use your boost yet if you brought one)
*Climb up the rockslides nearby (boosting to 68 Agility if necessary), and use a rope on the tree.
*Climb the rope and cross the ledge.
*Climb the last rockslide and pass the fallen tree.
*Talk to Boulder. 
*Sneak in via the broken fence just east. Prepare to run past a lot of angry trolls.
*Go south along the city's edge, then west. Once you reach a small alleyway to the north (see image), recover your run energy if necessary.
*Run to the bucket spawn and stand there for a moment.
*Click on the 'little boulder' just north of you, and right before reaching it, click on the hole all the way to the north to climb down.
*Once descended, quickly go south and pass through the narrow gap. DO NOT climb up the ramp.
** This acts as a checkpoint once knocked out upon re-entering the gap in the fence.
** Note: If you stop moving before the checkpoint, the trolls will catch you and you will spawn outside of the city.
*Empty your hands and swim further into the cave while avoiding the first set of trolls' stones.
*For the second set of trolls, the final troll will throw rocks, creating stepping stones. When the troll begins throwing, move one tile forward, making a path of 5 stones to the edge of the water. Click one tile toward the cave exit as soon as the throwing animation starts until the path is finished.
**If you fail, you will be sent back to just before the second set of trolls.
**The rocks don't need to be in a straight line, they only need to go out 5 spaces and be adjacent to each other so that My Arm can cross.
*Mine the cave exit (boosting to 72 Mining if necessary).
*Talk to Mother.
*After Snowflake leaves, pick all possible options.
*Talk to My Arm.

*Talk to the Wise Old Man in Draynor Village.
*Build the coffin next to the Wise Old Man.
*Speak to the Apothecary in Varrock.
**Chat options depend on the quests the player has completed. Pick "Talk about Making Friends with My Arm."
*Talk to the Wise Old Man back in Draynor Village.
*Take the Old man's coffin.

*Return to Weiss by travelling with Larry's boat.
*Go through the cave entrance.
*Talk to My Arm by the north entrance.
*Talk to Odd Mushroom.
*Talk to Snowflake.
*Fight Don't Know What. Use Protect from Missiles and damage him with melee or Ranged.
*Fight Mother. Activate Protect from Missiles. Grab a bucket from the pile and use it on the large barrel of water. Then use the bucket of water on the Fire of Domination to extinguish it, which then makes your attacks effective. Mother will stun the player and drain some Prayer points if able to get into melee range, therefore it's preferred to fight back with Ranged while running from Mother. He can also be safespotted by trapping him east of the staircase and standing immediately south of the stairs in the western-most square.

*Talk to My Arm.
*Talk to the Wise Old Man, and then Snowflake.
*Pick up goat poo in the north-east building to get goat dung. (Buckets of water can be found in the building and emptied)
*Talk to Snowflake.
*Read the Weiss fire notes Snowflake gives you.
*Talk to Snowflake.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

***Rune Mysteries
***Shilo Village
****Jungle Potion
*****Druidic Ritual
**Eadgar's Ruse
***Troll Stronghold
****Death Plateau

*Any pickaxe
*Chisel
*Any axe
*Dark totem
*Dense essence block
*
*Fishing rod
*Sandworms
*Combat equipment
*Celastrus sapling

*Hans: Take the red chair from the Duke's room. He will sit on it next to the fountain.
*Count Check: Talk to the smithing apprentice for some golden rings.
*Gillie Groats: Talk to Bob and he'll shiftily give you an amulet of duplication in exchange for spreading the word about his shop. She will duplicate herself.
*Fred the Farmer: Dig up the pear tree in the castle courtyard to obtain a pear tree sapling. Spades can be found nearby should the player need one.
*Doomsayer: Speak to Party Pete in the Falador Party Room to receive a knight summoner. Give the knight summoner to the Doomsayer.

*Talk to Lady Vulcana Lovakengj in the Lovakengj Assembly building to the west of the southern bank. (Xeric's Talisman, Xeric's Inferno) 
*Go to the Wintertodt camp (Games necklace teleport).
**Talk to Ignisia in the north-east of the camp if you haven't previously done so.
*Talk to the dwarf Undor inside the camp. 
** If he tells you to talk to the "Fiery lass" Talk to Ignisia just to the north east, before returning to him.

*Go to The Forsaken Tower to the east of Mount Karuulm, west of Lovakengj (north-east of fairy ring, Battlefront Teleport or Skills necklace to Farming Guild).
*Inspect the Display Case.
*Go down the ladder behind the Display Case and open the north-eastern door.
*Search the north-north-east crate for a generator crank.
*Inspect the steam generator in the south. 
**Start the generator.
* Inspect the Power Grid. 
**Align the Power Grid as shown below.

*Go up the ladder and then into the northern room. Search the cupboards for a tinderbox, 5-gallon jug, and 8-gallon jug.
**Fill the 5-gallon jug with coolant through the coolant dispenser in the west.
**Use the 5-gallon jug on the empty 8 gallon jug.
**Fill the 5-gallon jug with coolant.
**Use the 5-gallon jug on the 8 gallon jug.
**Empty the 8 gallon jug (right-click check).
**Use the 5-gallon jug on the empty 8 gallon jug (there should be 2 gallons in the jug).
**Fill the 5-gallon jug with coolant.
**Use the 5-gallon jug on the 8 gallon jug.
**Fill the 5-gallon jug with coolant.
**Use the 5-gallon jug on the 8 gallon jug.
**You should now have 4 gallons of coolant in the 5-gallon jug. Use it on the furnace coolant west of the furnace, then light the furnace with the tinderbox.
*If doing the diary task, smelt the adamantite bar now.

*Go upstairs.
*Open the door, then take the notes from the eastern cupboard.
*Take the cleansing fluid from the northern table. The position will be random for everyone. Look at the notes to see the riddle: the fluids are listed in order of 1-2-3-4-5 (e.g. if cleansing fluid is the second potion mentioned in the fourth sentence, it is number 5).
**Warning: If you choose the wrong potion, you will take high damage (25+) and become poisoned. This can be avoided by logging out before advancing the dialogue.
*Use the cleansing fluid on the refinery to the south, then activate it

* Go up the ladder.
*There are four discs. In the following order, remove a disc from a pylon and place it on another pylon:
**From West (W) to East (E)
**From W to Centre (C)
**From E to C
**From W to E
**From C to W
**From C to E
**From W to E
**From W to C
**From E to C
**From E to W
**From C to W
**From E to C
**From W to E
**From W to C
**From E to C
*Go downstairs and get Dinh's hammer from the display case.

* Return to Wintertodt Camp.
*Use the hammer on Undor.
*Return to Lady Vulcana Lovakengj.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Speak to Mori in the centre of Arceuus. 
*Head south-west to Kourend Castle and speak to Councillor Andrews on east side of the . 
*Return and speak to Mori. 
*Walk north-west to the Tower of Magic west of the Arceuus Library and speak to the Tower Mage outside the doors.
*Enter the tower and defeat the 5 Tormented Souls.
*After the fight, head upstairs.
*Speak to Asteros Arceuus.
*Head to Mount Karuulm. (Fairy ring code )
**[OPTIONAL] If you are planning to do the Kourend & Kebos Diary, bring a pickaxe and mine an Iron ore from the Mount Karuulm Mine to complete an Easy task.
*Go to the centre of Mount Karuulm and activate the elevator.
*Speak to Kaal-Xil-Dar.
*Exit to the south and head to the grave located south-east of the mountain, just west of the Battlefront. It is south of the water source. (By the Battlefront teleport tablet or Arceuus spell location.)
*Inspect the Ancient Grave then follow the tracks, searching bushes and plants nearby to where the tracks end.
*Eventually you'll reach the hiding spot of the Trapped Soul. Defeat it.
*Return to Mount Karuulm and speak to Kaal-Xil-Dar once more.
*Head to the Dark Altar north of Arceuus (fairy ring code, or use a games necklace teleport to Wintertodt then run south) and inspect the rocks that surround the altar until you find a device; it will automatically be destroyed upon being found.
*Return to the Tower of Magic and head upstairs, talk to Lord Trobin Arceuus.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Inspect the dwarf in Lumbridge Castle's dining room.
*Go to the Rising Sun Inn in Falador and talk to Emily or Kaylee. Pay her to learn how to make Asgoldian ale. 
*Use coins on your Asgarnian ales to get Asgoldian ales.
*Go to the tunnel under White Wolf Mountain.
*Talk to "An old Dwarf" located in the bar and give him Asgoldian ales until he agrees to make a dwarven rock cake.
*Talk to him 3 times and he will place a dwarven rock cake on the table. (His name will change to Rohak)
*If you have ice gloves, equip them and pick up the cake. Otherwise either telegrab the cake or equip other gloves and pick it up, then kill an icefiend (at Ice Mountain) to cool the cake.
*Give the dwarven rock cake to the dwarf in Lumbridge.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Right-click "Sober-Up" Skippy south-east of Rimmington (bucket of water required). 
*Right-click use the nettle tea on Skippy. (Do not accidentally drink it!)
*Talk to Skippy
*Use the chocolate dust on the bucket of milk.
*Use the snape grass on the chocolatey milk (Do not accidentally drink the milk!)
*Use the hangover cure on Skippy.
*Congratulations, miniquest complete!

*Inspect Skrach Uglogwee. 
*Talk to Rantz . (You can use the fairy ring code and run east)
*Go South-East to the transportation icon on the minimap and talk to Rantz by the coast. 
*Use your woodcutting axe on the fallen tree twice.
*Talk to him again. 
*Collect a raw chompy the same way you did in Big Chompy Bird Hunting, except this time drop the inflated toad to the west as Rantz doesn't want you hunting on his turf. If you have a low cooking level, collect several.
*Go to Karamja and find the tree with an arrow in it (by transportation icon west of Tai Bwo Wannai).
**You can use the fairy ring code  and run north along the coast to the west to find it, or teleport to the Brimhaven house portal and run south. It's just west of the Tai Bwo Wannai Trio quest icon on the world map.
*Light a fire next to the tree, use your iron spit on a raw chompy, then cook it.
*Board the ogre boat.
*Talk to Rantz south-east near the coast. 
*Collect several bloated toads from the nearby swamp (in case you fail). Refill ogre bellows.
*Mine several rocks from the Pile of Rock east of Rantz' cave.
*Use the ogre bellows on the bloated toad for a balloon toad.
*Drop the balloon toad and kill the Jubbly with ogre arrows.
*Cook the Jubbly on Rantz's spit-roast. If you burn the Jubbly, repeat the process. 
*Give the Cooked jubbly to Skrach Uglogwee in Lumbridge.
*Congratulations, section complete!

*Inspect the Lumbridge Guide. 
*Talk to Wizard Traiborn on the of the Wizards' Tower. 
*Talk to him again to enchant the egg by identifying 3 mystery NPCs. 
**Man with ponytail and book - Reldo
**Ghostly green woman - Velorina
**Man with desert robes and white beard - Ali Morrisane
**Elf - Islwyn
**Man with purple shirt - Unferth
**Man with brown vest - Professor Gronigen
**Woman with pink top - Gertrude
**Woman (green witch) - Hetty
**Man (hooded) - Pirate Pete
**Man with a crown - King Lathas
*Talk to him again to enchant the milk by answering trivia. 
**Defence requirements to wear a Mystic hat - 20
**Ingredients in a cake - Flour, egg, milk
**Combat level of Goblins near Lumbridge - 2
**GP to bribe an Al Kharid gate guard - 10
**What is the nearest guild to the Fishing Platform (as the seagull flies) - Legends'
**What doesn't lie between Morytania and Asgarnia - Keep Le Faye
**Gold ring is to 5 as a holy symbol is to - 16
**Glass vial is to 33 as a glass orb is to - 46
**Guild closest to Fishing Platform - Legends'
**I'm in a bar west of Pollnivneach. Where am I? - Bandit Camp
**The River Salve runs from - north to south
**I can hear howling in one direction and buzzing in the other—where am I? - Catherby
**If I'm going to need glass, first I will need - Sand, bucket, soda ash, glassblowing pipe
**Which tower is closest to the Crafting Guild - Dark Wizards' Tower
**Take the number of fire runes required to cast Fire Strike, and multiply by the number of air runes used to cast Wind Strike before adding the number of earth runes used to cast Earth Wave - 10
*Talk to him a third time to enchant the flour with a memory test. 
*Once you have taken a screenshot for reference, close the interface via the X button to answer the questions.
**Do not use the ESC key to close the interface as it will reset that portion of the test!
*Cook the cake (use the milk on the cake tin and then on a range) and give it to the Lumbridge guide.
*Congratulations, section complete!

*Inspect Sir Amik.
*Ask the cook how you helped Sir Amik Varze. 
*Use milk on cream.
*Use the pot of cornflour on the milky mixture to receive cornflour mixture.
*Pick a vanilla pod in the Kharazi Jungle (SW of the pool used in Legends' Quest), add it to the cornflour mixture.
*Talk to the Wise Old Man in Draynor, ask about strange beasts, then the Evil Chicken. Make sure you finish the dialogue or you will not be able to proceed. If you have started Swan Song you will have to travel to Piscatoris Fishing Colony and talk to him in the shack. Bank the brulee as it will be lost if you die in the next step. 

*Use a raw chicken on the Evil Chicken shrine in northern Zanaris (where you arrive from the swamp.)
*Run north past the dragons and kill the Evil Chicken, pick up its egg and add it to the brulee.
*Kill a black dragon, there is a safespot to the east, pick up the dragon token.
*Grind a dramen branch with a pestle and mortar to make cinnamon, add it to the brulee.
*Equip ice gloves then rub the token. (It will still work if you don't have ice gloves however you will take some damage) 
*Give the Brulee supreme to Sir Amik in Lumbridge.
*Congratulations, section complete!

*Inspect Evil Dave
*Talk to Doris (House west of Edgeville bank). 
*Talk to Evil Dave in Edgeville (Down the trapdoor). 
*Talk to Doris upstairs.
*Use your cat to catch hell-rats. (Right-click chase). Using a fully grown cat is much more efficient, but using a kitten still works.
*Collect spices from hell-rats there are 4 spices to collect: yellow, orange, red, brown. You only need a maximum of 6 doses of each colour.
**The spicy stew required to free Evil Dave consists of all 4 different colour spices, 1-3 dose(s) of spice of each colour need to be added to the stew.
**Add 1 dose of one colour and give it to Evil Dave. If he says "Hmm... I think you've got the amount of one spice right, but the others are wrong" then make a note that it is 1 dose of that colour. 
**If he doesn't say this then try again with 2 doses of the same colour, if he says "Hmm... I think you've got the amount of one spice right, but the others are wrong" then make a note that it is 2 doses of that colour. If he doesn't say this then make a note that it is 3 doses of that colour. 
**Repeat this process with the other 3 colours.
*When you have made a note of the amount of the 4 colours individually, add these amounts to the same stew and give it to Evil Dave (he will not consume it), then give him the spicy stew in Lumbridge.
*Congratulations, section complete!

*Inspect one of the goblin generals in Lumbridge Castle dining room.
*Go to the Goblin Village and climb down the ladder in the north-east building.
*Talk to the Goblin Cook., then talk to him again and give him the charcoal. 
*Talk to the Goblin Cook again. 
**Slice an orange and add blue, green, or purple dye. (Doesn't matter which)
**Use spice on a fishing bait.
**Use a bucket of water on bread.
*Talk to the Goblin Cook again. 
*Give the slop of compromise to the generals in Lumbridge.
*Congratulations, section complete!

*Inspect Pirate Pete.
*Talk to the cook in the next room about protecting the pirate. 
*Go through all 5 chat options. 
*Use your pestle and mortar on the raw cod.
*Use your knife on the bread to make breadcrumbs.
*Talk to Murphy in Port Khazard. (Fishing Trawler minigame teleport is the easiest way to get there - requires 15 Fishing)
*Talk to Murphy again.

*Equip your fishbowl helmet and diving apparatus, Bring the needle and three bronze wire. Agree to go diving.
*Pick some kelp. (It's highly recommended to pick at least 3 kelp as the fishcake can burn).
** If you don't have at least 5 inventory spaces, skip this until leaving as you must gather 5 hide.
*Go north and talk to Nung.
*Go west and pick up 5 rocks, then enter the cave.
*Kill 5 mudskippers (level 30/31) for 5 hides.
** You can give the hide in more than one trip
*Talk to Nung twice.
*Enter the crab pen, kill a crab and take its meat. (It's highly recommended to get at least 3 Crab meat as the fishcake can burn).
*Grind the kelp and crab meat with a pestle and mortar.
* Teleport away, or go south and climb the anchor
*Talk to the Cook in Lumbridge about freeing the pirate again. 
*Use the ingredients on each other then cook the fishcake.
*Give the fishcake to Pirate Pete in Lumbridge.
*Congratulations, section complete!

*Inspect Awowogei at Lumbridge Castle.
*Travel to Ape Atoll, equip any monkey greegree and M'speak amulet. Speak to Daero in the Grand Tree to get there quickly.
*Speak to an Elder Guard to be let into Awowogei's Palace. Talk to Awowogei south of the temple. 
*If you need a banana and monkey nuts, buy them from the food store now.
*Talk to all of the 3 monkeys in the north-west corner of the temple. 
*Use your banana and monkey nuts on any of them. (Ensure you use both your Banana and Monkey nuts on them or else the Tchiki nuts will not appear on the bush.)

*If you already have a gorilla, ninja, and zombie monkey greegree then skip this part. See the in-depth guide for more details on where to find each type of monkey.
**Buy 3 blank monkey talismans from the rune store.
**Kill a monkey archer in the market and take its bones.
**Kill a Monkey Guard in the temple and take its bones.
**Kill a zombie monkey under the temple and take its bones.
**Bring the bones and talismans to Zooknock at the end of the Ape Atoll Dungeon.

*In the upcoming steps, take at least 3 snake corpses, red bananas, and tchiki nuts in case you burn the stuffed snake (use the drop trick for the nuts and the banana).
*Travel to Crash Island.
*It is strongly recommended to turn on Protect from Melee before entering the pit (especially for Hardcore Ironmen). Climb down, and kill at least 3 level 84 big snakes for their corpses.

*Return to Ape Atoll and find the red banana tree north-west of the big gate (by the shore).
*Equip your gorilla greegree and use a rope on the tree to get some red bananas. Take at least 3 using the drop trick.
*Equip your ninja greegree and enter the Ape Atoll agility course. Note: you cannot bring a pet or follower.
*After swinging the rope, enter the hole and pick some tchiki nuts from the bush. The rope obstacle is right next to fairy ring . Take at least three using the drop trick.
*Grind the tchiki nuts with a pestle and mortar, slice the red banana with a knife, and add them to the snake corpses.
**Ensure you grind the nuts and slice the banana before adding them to the snake, or you will ruin both and have to get more!
**If you forgot a knife, there is an Iron Scimitar in the most north-western crate of the storage building right behind the scimitar shop (where you obtain M'amulet mould/Monkey Dentures in Monkey Madness I). This can be used in place of a knife.
*Equip your zombie greegree and enter the temple dungeon.
*Go through the crack down the cliff between the two ramps.
*Lay your stuffed snake on the rock to cook it (requires 70 cooking).
*Give the cooked stuffed snake to Awowogei in Lumbridge. Make sure you are wearing your M'speak Amulet when you do so.
*Congratulations, section complete!

This route requires you to enable Authenticator so you can claim the 2000 coins from the first level of the Stronghold of Security. Here is a quick guide on how to do that. If this is too annoying, you can alternatively grab 8 pairs of steel platelegs from the wilderness at the start of the run and sell them at the Lumbridge General store.

*Navigate to the Create Your Account page
*Enter an actual email address for your login name. You do need to verify your email.
**An easy way to do this for multiple accounts while using only one gmail account is to put a +# somewhere in the address.
**Any email of the format + @gmail.com will send the email to @gmail.com
**So if your email is cow1337killer@gmail.com, you can create an account with the name cow1337killer+1@gmail.com or cow1337killer+A@gmail.com and the confirmation email will arrive at your cow1337killer@gmail.com inbox.
*Fill out the rest of your account details and press Play Now.
*Wait for the verification email to arrive, then click to verify your email. Do this before logging in to the website.
*Click 'Account' on runescape.com or 'Account Settings' on oldschool.runescape.com and log in to the new account.
*Set a display name first.
*Set up your Authenticator by scanning the code with an authenticator app and entering the code it gives you on the website.
*Log in to the Oldschool Runescape client and enter your authentication code. Press "remember me for 30 days" and you will not have to type it again.
*Timer starts when you press accept on the character creation screen.

*Talk to the RuneScape Guide. 
*Click the settings panel.
*Talk to the RuneScape Guide again.
*Click the door to exit the starting building
*Complete the Survival Expert segment.
*As you have time running around, enable shift click drop.
*Drop your items as you can to not run out of run.
*Finish the cooking, quest, and mining guide segments.
*Complete the combat guide segment, using accurate for melee and rapid for ranged.
*Complete the bank segment.
*Skip the poll booth segment by:
**Clicking the poll both, keeping a "Open Door" prompt open.
**Clicking that prompt when the camera view changes.
*Complete the account and prayer guide segment.
*Become an Ironman by talking to Paul. 
**Select the "Standard Iron Man" option, and setup bank pin now.
**You will need to enter a bank pin twice here, and the pin cannot be too simple or it will be rejected.
*Finish the magic guide segment.
*[[File:Lumbridge_Teleport.png]] Teleport off of Tutorial Island.

*Walk to the Lumbridge general store.
**On the way, drop [[File:Bronze_axe.png]] axe, [[File:Tinderbox.png]] tinderbox, [[File:Small_fishing_net.png]] net, [[File:Shrimps.png]] shrimps, [[File:Bread.png]] bread, [[File:Pot.png]] pot, [[File:Bronze_arrow_5.png]] arrows, [[File:Earth_rune.png]] earth runes, [[File:Body_rune.png]] body runes.
**Type ::toggleroofs into the chat box to avoid having to go in the menu. Roofs are automatically toggled on when finishing the tutorial, so you cannot do this any earlier.
**Sell: [[File:Bronze_dagger.png]] Dagger, [[File:Bronze_sword.png]] Sword, [[File:Wooden_shield.png]] Shield, [[File:Shortbow.png]] Bow
**Buy: [[File:Spade.png]] Spade
**
*Run to Veos in The Sheared Ram to start X Marks the Spot. 
*Enter the church from the north and talk to Father Aereck to start The Restless Ghost. 
*[[File:Spade.png]] Dig north of the house connected to Bob's Axes for X Marks the Spot (north of the west window).
*[[File:Transportation_icon.png]] Talk to Count Check in the graveyard to teleport to the Stronghold of Security. 
*Enter the Stronghold of Security and complete the first level only and claim the 2000gp.
**Take the far north path.
**The questions are randomized, but if you spam click the doors you will eventually get no question and be allowed straight through.
**If you cannot claim the 2000gp, reread the top of this guide for info on how to enable Authenticator.
*[[File:Bank_icon.png]] Deposit all items except for your spade at the Varrock west bank deposit box.
* Talk to Romeo to start Romeo_%26_Juliet
*Talk to Juliet upstairs after running west. 
*[[File:Skull_(status)_icon.png]] Die to a guard.

*[[File:Spade.png]] Dig outside of the back Lumbridge castle door for X Marks the Spot (west of the crate).
*Pick [[File:Onion.png]] 5 onions from behind Farmer Fred's house.
*[[File:Spade.png]] Run to the north of Draynor Jail and dig for X Marks the Spot (brown patch of earth north of bush).
*Talk to Morgan to start Vampyre Slayer 
*Go upstairs in Morgan's house and take a [[File:Garlic.png]] garlic from his cabinet.
*[[File:Bank_icon.png]] Bank at Draynor bank.
**Deposit: [[File:Onion.png]] 4 onions, [[File:Garlic.png]] garlic.
**Withdraw: All coins, bronze pickaxe, bucket, letter
**
*Head into Draynor Market.
**Optional for safety: Buy up to [[File:Jug_of_wine.png]] 5 wines from Fortunato.
**Buy: [[File:Teleport_card.png]] 7 chronicle cards and a [[File:Chronicle.png]] chronicle from Diango.
**Money here is tight, so buy 2 cards, then buy the chronicle, then buy 5 cards.
**If you accidentally spend a bit too much, you can just buy fewer of each rune later, or sell a few water runes to the general store.
*[[File:Spade.png]] Dig in the Draynor pig pen for X Marks the Spot.
*Run to the north Port Sarim dock.
*Talk to Redbeard Frank to start Pirate's Treasure. 
*Use the casket on Veos to finish X Marks the Spot and use the rewarded lamp on Magic.
*[[File:Transportation_icon.png]] Take the boat to Karamja by talking to either Seaman Lorris, Captain Tobias, or Seaman Thresnor. 
**[[File:Tap-to-drop_mode.png]] Drop [[File:Clue_scroll_(beginner).png]] Clue scroll (beginner) and [[File:Spade.png]] spade.
*Go to Zembo.
**Buy: [[File:Beer.png]] 3 Beer, [[File:Karamjan_rum.png]] 1 Rum, [[File:Jug_of_wine.png]]1 Wine (Wine is optional safety).
*Pick 10 bananas from the plantation.
*Talk to Luthas. 
*Right click and "Fill" the crate with bananas.
*Put the rum in the crate.
*Talk to Luthas again to get your payment and send the crate.
*[[File:Transportation_icon.png]] Take the boat back to Port Sarim. 
*Take a [[File:White_apron.png]] White apron from the fishing shop and equip it.
*Go to Wydin's Food Store.
**Buy: [[File:Pot_of_flour.png]] 2 pots of flour, [[File:Raw_beef.png]] 1 raw beef.
**Hop worlds if the flour is out of stock due to bots.
*Click the door to the back room to get in. 
*Take your [[File:Karamjan_rum.png]] rum from the banana crate.
*[[File:Bank_icon.png]] Use the deposit box by the Monks of Entrana to deposit all [[File:Pot_of_flour.png]] pots of flour, [[File:Jug_of_wine.png]] wines, and [[File:Beer.png]] beers. 
**[[File:Tap-to-drop_mode.png]] Drop [[File:White_apron.png]] white apron.
*Talk to Redbeard Frank again and trade your rum for a key.
*Go to Betty's Magic Emporium.
**Buy: [[File:Air_rune.png]] 50 Air runes, [[File:Mind_rune.png]] 50 Mind runes, [[File:Water_rune.png]] 50 Water runes, [[File:Eye_of_newt.png]] Eye of newt
**If you plan to buy a beginner staff and backup wines, buy 10 fewer air runes to ensure you have enough coins for later.
*Enter Rimmington mine from the north.
**Mine [[File:Copper_ore.png]] copper [[File:Clay.png]] clay [[File:Tin_ore.png]] tin.
*Go to Rimmington.
**[[File:Tap-to-drop_mode.png]] Drop the [[File:Bronze_pickaxe.png]] bronze pickaxe.
*Burn your [[File:Burnt_meat.png]] meat on the range in the north-eastern house (cook it again if it cooks successfully).
*Fill your [[File:Bucket_of_water.png]] bucket in the sink.
**Use it to [[File:soft_clay.png]] wet your clay.
*Talk to Hetty to start Witch's Potion. 
*Kill a rat in the ranging shop with wind strikes and pick up its [[File:Rat%27s_tail.png]] tail.
*Pick up a [[File:Logs.png]] log in the ranging shop.
*Go back to Hetty and complete Witch's Potion by talking to her then clicking the cauldron.
*[[File:Chronicle.png]] Chronicle teleport.
*[[File:Skull_(status)_icon.png]] Die to a Dark wizard.

*Go through every dialogue option with Death, then leave. 
*Run west out of Lumbridge castle to Draynor jail.
*Talk to Lady Keli to get the key print 
*Go to Father Urhney's shack in Lumbridge swamp.
*Talk to him to get the ghostspeak amulet. 
*[[File:Chronicle.png]] Chronicle teleport.
*Grab the [[File:Bones.png]] bones from where you died before.
*Run east through the Dark wizards to the berry bushes.
*Pick a [[File:Cadava_berries.png]] cadava berry and [[File:Redberries.png]] 4 Redberries.
*[[File:Chronicle.png]] Chronicle teleport.
*[[File:Death%27s_Office_icon.png]] Reclaim your gravestone. If you skip this, your ores will end up in death's office.
*[[File:Skull_(status)_icon.png]] Die to a Dark wizard (We do this to restore our run energy).
*[[File:Chronicle.png]] Chronicle teleport.
*[[File:Death%27s_Office_icon.png]] Reclaim your gravestone again.
*Go to the Blue Moon Inn.
*Talk to the bartender to buy [[File:Beer.png]] beer. 
*Go upstairs and open the chest at the end of the hall.
*Read the [[File:Pirate_message.png]] message message and [[File:Tap-to-drop_mode.png]] drop it.
*Go back downstairs.
*Talk to Dr. Harlow. 
*Talk to Dr. Harlow again to give the beer and get the stake.
*Go to Thesselia's Fine Clothes
**Buy: [[File:Pink_skirt.png]] Pink skirt. 
*Talk to Aris. 
*Screenshot the Delrith incantaction in the cutscene.
*Go to Zaff's Staffs. (Optional, but recommended for beginners) (if money doesn't work out after this then sell some runes to the general store)
**Buy: [[File:Staff.png]] Staff.
*Talk to Romeo until he takes the letter.
*Go to Horvik's Armour shop.
**Buy: [[File:Iron_chainbody.png]] Iron chainbody.
*Go to Varrock Castle.
*Fill up your [[File:Bucket_of_water.png]] bucket with water from the castle's fountain.
*Talk to Sir Prysin. 
*Talk to Captain Rovin on the of the castle's north-west corner. 
*Go to the castle kitchen and pour water down the drain outside.
*Refill your [[File:Bucket_of_water.png]] bucket at the castle's fountain.
*Go to Varrock's north-east church.
*Talk to Father Lawrence.
*Enter the sewers and grab the [[File:Silverlight_key_(Sir_Prysin).png]] second key from the west path.
*[[File:Minigame_icon.png]] Minigame teleport to Clan wars, taking you to Ferox Enclave.

*[[File:Bank_icon.png]] Deposit all items.
*Enter the white portal to refresh your run energy.

*Maximising damage on Count Draynor: with garlic in inventory, your first attack will deal 10 additional damage and lower his stats. The count also has a 6x health regen rate.
**The garlic effect only triggers on punches or auto-casts, and will not trigger if only manual casting in the safespot.  It also only deals the 10 damage if the Count is at full health.
**A consistent way to work with this is to turn off auto-retaliate before the fight, use the staff to autocast and start attacking only after the safespot is set up completely.
**Otherwise, punch draynor once immediately and make sure not to drop any ticks manual casting while setting up the safespot, only healing if absolutely necessary.

*Wait one tick (walking towards the guide works) then talk to the guide. If you do not wait a tick then your chat box will be cancelled out.
*Choose any chat option, they do not make a difference.
*After the option, hold space and wait for 2 chat boxes to go by. (I count in my head 1, 2, 3, and click settings on the 3)
*Click settings, then quickly click Gielinor Guide. This can be done in the same game tick.
*If you're holding space, you can walk away the tick that the text box appears. This is a main tech throughout the run - once the text for the last chat box appears, you can click to move to the next place.
*Click the door right when the text box appears.

* Turn on shift click to drop while running towards Survival expert.
*Click away immediately when the first text box appears (you do not need to be holding space).
*You have to click the backpack before you can actually fish. If you click on the fishing spot, then open the backpack before you reach it, you don't need to click on the fishing spot again.
*There's a set time for fishing, wait until you receive the shrimp
*If multilogging, you can use another player's fire to cook your shrimp at this point. If you don't burn it, you can progress to the next section through the gate.
*Open the skills tab and talk to the Survival Expert again
*You must be holding space, but you can walk away as soon as the first text box appears.
*Walk south of the tree, chop it, immediately light the log (moves you west), immediately cook the shrimp, spam click the gate.
*Drop all items

Master Chef:
*Walk to the Chef's house. Do not click on the door from far away, otherwise it takes much longer to pass through. Instead, click to walk to the tile directly in front of the door, then open the door slightly before you reach it.
*Hold space and walk to the range as soon as the second text box appears.
*Use the Pot of flour on the Bucket of water, and click on the Range to cook them. This can be done in the same game tick.
*Pass through the door once you cook the bread
*Drop all items

Quest guide:
*Follow the path to the quest guide.
*Again, click to walk to the tile in front of the door, and then open it slightly before you reach it.
*Talk to the quest guide, open the Quest tab after 1 tick, and talk to him again.
*After you see the dialogue with a Quest symbol picture, you can click on the ladder on the next game tick.
*Climb down the ladder.

* Enable "Esc closes current interface" in F-Keys settings while running to the Mining instructor
*Talk to Mining instructor. Walk away when third text box appears.
*Mine each ore. You can spam click during them to the next ore or furnace.
*Use one of the ores on the furnace to smelt them
*Talk to Mining instructor while holding space and immediately USE your Bronze bar on the Anvil, and smith a Bronze dagger.
*You cannot spam click while smithing the dagger. When it appears in your inventory click the gate and drop your other items. Do NOT drop the dagger.

Vannaka:
*Talk to Vannaka. After 2 ticks, open the Equipment tab, then after 1 tick open the "Worn equipment" screen, then after another tick equip the Bronze dagger and press Escape (or close the interface normally).
*Talk to Vannaka and immediately walk away to the gate. Equip sword and shield. Click combat styles.
*Leave your attack style on accurate. Aggressive does not increase your max hit.
*Kill the rats (This section is heavily RNG dependent). On accurate style, there is a 56% chance of hitting each time. The chance of hitting 3 times in a row is approximately 17.5%.
*Talk to Vannaka, after 2 chat boxes run back towards the gate, equip bow and arrows.
*Try to kite the rat over to the ladder. A lot of the time you won't be able to but you can still try. A good spot for this is directly south-west of the ladder, you will normally be able to hit any rat from that position.
*Climb the ladder, un-equip bow, drop everything you can.

If multilogging, the rats can be pre-damaged with alternate accounts.

*Click on either of the bank booths, they make no difference.

*Right click the door to the Account guide room.
*Hold spacebar. When your camera angle changes in the poll booth dialogue (2 game ticks), click the option to open the door to the Account guide room.
*Talk to the Account guide and on the 5th chat box click the account tab, then talk again.
*Wait until you see "Anyway, thats everything..." and you can open the door to continue. This is 12 game ticks.

Prayer Tutor

*The third time you talk to him, you can click on the door after 2 game ticks.

Magic Tutor
*Talk to the Magic Tutor. After 2 game ticks, open the magic tab and click on the Tutor again.
*Click Air Strike while holding space, when you see the images of Mind and Air runes in the chat you can cast Air Strike on a chicken close to the fence (the far ones can drag you away).
*Talk to the Magic Tutor again, choose option 1 both times to be sent to the mainland. 
*End timer when the Loading appears or the main land appears.

1:
*Speak to Aubury at the rune shop in Varrock. 
*Return to Ali Morrisane and talk to him.
*Open a casket. Note: You do not have to purchase the unknown runes to unlock them in Ali's store.
**Be aware to fully unlock the store, you must complete BOTH types of caskets at least once.
*If you wish to unlock elemental runes for purchase from Ali, speak to him and open a small casket. 
**For those with high Strength, force open the casket. 
**For those with high Thieving, pick the lock. 
*If you wish to unlock catalytic runes for purchase from Ali, speak to him and open a large casket. 
**You CANNOT force or pick-lock large caskets. When you examine the lock, you will be met with a Sudoku puzzle of runes. No two runes of the same type are allowed in the same row, column, or 3x3 grid. 
**Solve the puzzle, then click on "open casket" when finished. Check the Rogue Trader in-depth guide for assistance.
***A quick way to solve this puzzle is to assign each different rune a number (i.e. air = 1, water = 2, etc.) and then plug the initial runes into an automatic Sudoku solver. Alternatively, if using RuneLite, use the Runedoku Helper plugin from the Plugin Hub

list:
Ali cannot sell both offensive and defensive blackjacks at the same time. The following process unlocks defensive blackjacks for sale.
*Travel to Pollnivneach.
*Talk to the blackjack seller. 
*Talk to the street urchin and pay him 100 coins. 
*Talk to the blackjack seller again.
*Travel back to Al Kharid. Talk to Ali Morrisane; he will now have defensive blackjacks for sale. Buy whatever defensive blackjacks you need now. (They won't be available after the next section; you'll have to repeat this section to get them again.)
The following process unlocks offensive blackjacks for sale.
*Return to the blackjack seller and talk to him. He will attempt to knock you out twice; this will damage the player. If you get knocked out, keep talking to him. 
*Travel back to Al Kharid. Talk to Ali Morrisane. He will now have offensive blackjacks for sale.
To switch between offensive and defensive blackjacks, repeat their respective steps.

* Speak to Siamun in Sophanem
*Speak to Ali Morrisane
*Talk to Siamun again (2)

Revisiting Siamun with dyes or hides will swap between two different lines of clothing

**NW will say the number it is next to. This is the item to place on the W pillar.
**NE will say what it is opposite. This is the item to place on the NW pillar.
**E will say what number it isn't next to. This is the item to place on the E pillar itself.
**SE will say what it isn't. This is the item to place on the NE pillar.
**1 - Nature rune
**2 - Flowers/Irit leaf
**3 - Black knife/dagger
**4 - Wine of Zamorak/Zamorak brew
**5 - Adamant chainbody
**6 - Cabbage (be careful not to eat the cabbage!)

*Return to Lletya.
*Talk to Arianwyn.
*Talk to Elena near the pond.
*Plant the Cadantine seed in the nearby farming patch. (Note: if you have unlocked Barbarian Farming, you do not need a Seed dibber.)
*Speak with Baxtorian in the central building, north of the bank, and ask how to find Lord Amlodd to get a crystal seed.
*Ask how to find Lady Trahaearn to receive her clue.
*Bring the crystal seed to Eluned, found just south of Lletya Archery Shop, north of the pond.
*Travel north of Lletya to the cave entrance of the Underground Pass, accessible from the east side of Tirannwn, and go inside.
*Walk south of the Well of Voyage and inspect the blocked crevice.
*Use a pickaxe to break through the crevice and enter.
*Use the hammer and runite bar to fix the exoskeleton of the Elderly Elf.
*Talk to Lady Tangwen Trahaearn.
*Rub the crystal seed, taking you to the Enchanted Valley.
*Speak to the Mysterious Figure and choose any option to return with Lord Ieuan Amlodd to Lletya.
*Talk to Elena and get the elder cadantine.
*Talk to Arianwyn to get the old crystal.
*Use the pestle and mortar on the crystal to get crystal dust.
*Use the elder cadantine on a vial of water to create the elder cadantine potion (unf).
*Use the crystal dust on the unfinished potion to create the inversion potion.
*Speak to Arianwyn.

*Return to Lletya, and speak with Arianwyn.
*Speak with Baxtorian. Be sure you ask about how to find BOTH Lord Crwys and Lady Hefin or else the option to chop the tree and jump on the skipping stones will not appear.
*Exit Lletya and run south past the magic trees and continue until you reach the Poison Waste. Cross stepping stones until you reach Lady Hefin (initially Elf Hermit). Talk to her.
*Go to the western side of Isafdar, south of the Iorwerth Camp, use the Iorwerth camp teleport to get there quickly. Be cautious as Iorwerth elves will attack you now. Pass the stick trap to get to the clearing then chop the dead tree north of the pond, talk to Lord Crwys.
*Return to Lletya and speak with Baxtorian.

*Equip yourself with combat gear and go to the Iorwerth Camp.
*Enter the cave on the north side of camp, and slay the two guards within. You can trap the warrior behind the archer and kill them one at a time, taking no damage as long as you use the correct protection prayers.
**Kill the Iorwerth Archer (level 90).
**Kill the Iorwerth Warrior (level 108).
*Search the chest and receive the orb of light.
*Return to Lletya and speak with Baxtorian.

*Speak with Elena near the pond.
*Exit out of Lletya's entrance north-west.
*Inspect the mushrooms near the entrance.
*Follow the footsteps, inspecting rocks, mushrooms and lamps along the way. They should lead you to a spot near the whiteberry spawn in the centre of Isafdar.
*Speak with Ysgawyn.

*Enter the house to the south and search the east table to find Eoin.
*Go up the ladder and search the Cooking Pots by the South Cooking Range to find Iona.
*You will now have to fight Arianwyn.
**Range or melee are suggested, as magic is inaccurate against him
**Protect from Range will completely nullify his normal attacks
**Purple arrows will turn off any prayers, so make sure to turn them back on.
**Orange arrows are 1x1 bombs, and will hit high amounts of damage even through prayer. Move to a different tile after the arrow starts flying to avoid them.
Note: If you die during this fight, you can collect your items from the Rebel Scout outside of Lletya for 80,000 coins. Using a teleport crystal to teleport back doesn't restart the fight, but places you next to the Rebel Scout.

Warning: Dying again before collecting your items from the Rebel Scout will delete your items.

Near death Arianwyn will animate an arrow which will lead to a cutscene.

*Talk to Baxtorian to receive a clue scroll.
*Search Lletya for the five glowing symbols on the walls:
**First symbol is inside the bank on west wall, glowing white.
**Second symbol is inside the building north of Elena in the south-west section.
**Third symbol is on the south wall of the general store to the north.
**Fourth symbol is in the upper floor of the general store, on the north wall.
**Fifth and final symbol is on the west wall of the upper floor prayer altar room.
*Take the limestone bricks, hammer, and saw, and build the statue in the centre of the village. (Make sure to finish the dialogue or you won't be able to continue the next part)
*Speak with Lady Ithell at her statue on Lletya.
*Bank the hammer/saw and get the rest of your supplies now. (You will still need your spade!)
*Go to the south of Isafdar, near the swamp, and dig there. (see picture)
*Dig two steps north of the STASH unit near Zul-Andra ( and run east, 76 Agility OR Zul-andra teleport OR charter a ship to Port Tyras and run South East)
*Dig outside the south gates of Prifddinas (Iorwerth camp teleport)
*Spin outside the western entry to the Underground Pass with nothing equipped (Teleport Crystal to Lletya).
*Bank now if you did not bring combat gear

*Enter the Underground Pass from the Isafdar side, and enter the Well of voyage. Proceed south along the winding path (see dungeon map for path from Iban chamber to stairs, eventually travelling through a cave to dwarf camp at the ground level.
*Speak with Baxtorian.
*Speak with Elena.
*Fill the seven holes outside of the camp with the Explosive potions.
*Speak with Baxtorian.
*Defend the Dwarf camp for four minutes.
**You do not need to kill every attacker, simply keep them from destroying the barricade. A new archer/melee spawns randomly after killing one.
**Attack any elf that is attacking the barricade, to draw their attention towards you instead. Alternatively you can kill off all the rangers until there's only melee attackers left and block the path to the gate.
**Protect from Melee is recommended, to protect from the higher levelled Elf warriors, switch to Protect from Missiles once the warriors pile up and stop attacking you.
*Defeat Essyllt.
**Protect from Melee will nullify most of his damage. Can quickly change to Protect from Range after his stun attack to avoid all damage.
**After his potion attack, drink a restore to counteract the stat drain.

*After a cutscene, you will automatically enter the Temple of Light. If you are not equipped for this fight immediately teleport out, you can re-enter the Temple of Light through the Underground Pass, through the same crack that you entered the Dwarven camp with.
*Defeat the Fragment of Seren.
**Magic is the only form of combat that is effective against the Fragment.
**Protect from Range reduces most of its damage from normal attacks.
**Equipment lost on death while in the instance can be reclaimed from an elf NPC standing outside of the cave entrance for the cost of 80,000 coins. If the player dies elsewhere before reclaiming their items, their unclaimed items will be permanently lost.
**Magic attack and damage bonus should be prioritised. High-level magic equipment such as Ancestral robes, Ahrim's robes, or void knight equipment along with the trident of the swamp and Ancient Magicks blood spells are an effective combination.
**The Fragment has four special attacks that always occur in the following order, repeating until The Fragment is defeated:
***1. An orb that teleports you to The Fragment. Simply run away after being teleported to maintain a safe distance from a melee attack.
***2. The Fragment will split into multiple parts, and you must attack the correct one. The real Fragment will have crystals underneath it, and a lighter shade of aura.
***3. The Fragment will summon healing spells. Simply attack the spells once with any attack to defeat them. Fast-hitting weapons such as throwing knives or darts are excellent here. Chinchompas are a great choice as their long range makes it easier to stay out of melee range while only being 1 tick slower than knives/darts.
***4. The Fragment will teleport you to one place and freeze you there while she winds up an attack. Then, she will unleash a heavy attack that hits for 99% of your max hp. If your hitpoints are at or below 99% of your max hp, you will be killed in 1 shot. It is highly recommended to bring Saradomin brews or anglerfish to heal above 100% health prior to the attack landing to avoid being killed.
*After defeating the Fragment of Seren, Baxtorian will invite you into Prifddinas.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Talk to Brother Aimeri in the southern part of the Forthos Dungeon (by the entrance to Sarachnis).
**Quick travel there includes: Watson teleport scroll, Xeric's Talisman to Xeric's Glade, Kourend Castle Teleport and Skills Necklace to the Woodcutting Guild.
*Use all 5 pieces of your food on him.
*Talk to Brother Aimeri again, and ask who are you to start the miniquest. 
*Protect from Magic and then run west through the long hallway to the room with Undead Druids.
*Search the bookshelves until you have all three tomes:
**Tome of the moon
**Tome of the sun
**Tome of the temple
* Collect 4 of each tattered sun, moon and temple page by killing any monsters in the Forthos Dungeon. Put them in the corresponding tomes.
**One suggested strategy that is fast, and somewhat AFKable, is to kill Temple spiders using multi-hit Ancient Magicks or a fast weapon, such as the Toxic Blowpipe, with Protect from Melee activated making sure to reset aggression every 10 minutes.
*Go to the Arceuus Library
*Use the tomes on Logosia
*Congratulations, miniquest complete!

*Head to the south-east room directly east of the entrance.
*Rotate the mirrors to reflect light to the end of the puzzle. Solution shown here:
Song of the Elves - The Seal of Ithell puzzle solution.png 
*Investigate the Seal of Ithell on the east side of the room.

*Return to the centre room.
*Collect the seven hand mirrors (these stack) and red crystal from the Crystal Dispenser.
*Walk north-west from the dispenser and follow the magenta light beam north. (Mirror #1 on the map)
*At the last pillar before the light hits the books and stops, use Mirror #1 to reflect the light east.
*Following the magenta light east, at the next pillar, use Mirror #2 to reflect the light down, indicated by the pillar's base glowing magenta.
*Take some nearby stairs down to the bottom floor.
*Use Mirror #3 on the pillar near the stairs, redirect the light south.
*Follow the light as it turns blue and enters the southern room containing the Seal of Cadarn.
*Use Mirror #4 on the first pillar in the room, redirecting the light west.
*Use Mirror #5 on the north-west pillar in the room, redirecting the light south.
*Use the red crystal on the west pillar in the room, turning the light magenta.
*Use Mirror #6 the south-west pillar in the room, redirecting the light east.
*Use Mirror #7 on the south pillar in the room, redirecting the light south into the Seal of Cadarn.
*Interact with the Seal of Cadarn.

*Return to the centre room.
*Pull the lever on the crystal dispenser.
*Collect the ten hand mirrors and four crystals from the crystal dispenser.
*Walk to the north-west corner of the centre room, and follow the magenta light beam north.
*Following the light, at the first pillar you come to, use Mirror #1 to reflect the light west.
*At the next pillar, use Mirror #2 to reflect the light north.
*At the next pillar, use Mirror #3 to reflect the light west.
*At the next pillar, use the fractured crystal to split the light.
*Following the light west, use Mirror #4 at the next pillar to reflect the light north.
*Following the light, use the green crystal on the pillar, turning the magenta light into white light.
*Head into the room north of the Seal of Crwys. The white light should be hitting the pillar in the north-west corner of the room.
*At that north-west pillar, use Mirror #5 to reflect the light down into the bottom floor.
*Use the nearby stairs to travel down to the bottom floor.
*At the north-west pillar on the bottom floor, use Mirror #6 to reflect the light east.
*Following the light, at the north pillar on the bottom floor, use Mirror #7 to reflect the light upwards.
*Use the stairs to travel to the middle floor.
*Place the cyan crystal in the north pillar on the middle floor. The cyan light will continue to travel upwards to the top floor.
*Use the stairs to travel to the top floor.
*Place Mirror #8 on the north pillar on the top floor, reflecting the light south.
*Following the light, place Mirror #9 on the south pillar on the top floor, reflecting the light down to the middle floor.
*Use the stairs to travel to the middle floor.
*Place Mirror #10 in the south pillar on the middle floor, reflecting the light south towards the Seal of Crwys.
*Interact with the Seal of Crwys.

*Return to the centre room.
*Pull the lever on the crystal dispenser.
*Collect the 16 hand mirrors and four crystals from the crystal dispenser.
*Walk to the north-west corner of the centre room, and follow the magenta light beam north.
*Following the light, at the first pillar you come to past the intersection, use the fractured crystal to split the light west and north.
*Following the light west, at the next pillar use Mirror #1 to reflect the light north.
*At the next pillar, use the red crystal to turn the light red.
*Following the light north, at the next pillar use Mirror #2 to reflect the light east.
*At the next pillar, use Mirror #3 to reflect the light north.
*At the next pillar, use Mirror #4 to reflect the light west.
*Run around the pit to get across to the west where the light goes.
*The red light will be shining into the south-east pillar of the north-west room.
*Use Mirror #5 to reflect the light down to the bottom floor.
*Use the stairs to travel to the bottom floor.
*Use Mirror #6 to reflect the light south across the gap into the room with the Seal of Amlodd.
*Travel up the stairs, and go back to where you placed the fractured crystal (the first crystal).
*Following the magenta light north, use Mirror #7 on the next pillar to reflect the light east.
*At the next pillar, use a Mirror #8 to reflect the light down to the bottom floor.
*Use stairs to get down to the bottom floor.
*Use Mirror #9 on the pillar close to the stairs to reflect the light south.
*Follow the light as it turns blue, and enters the room with the Seal of Cadarn.
*At the next pillar, use Mirror #10 to reflect the light west.
*At the next pillar, use Mirror #11 to reflect the light south.
*At the next pillar, use Mirror #12 to reflect the light west.
*At the next pillar, use Mirror #13 to reflect the light north.
*At the next pillar, place the green crystal, turning the blue light into cyan light. (The cyan crystal does not fit.)
*Go around via the centre of the map to cross the pit, entering the room containing the Seal of Amlodd. The cyan light should be entering on the south-west side of the room.
*In the south-west pillar in this room, place the yellow crystal and turn the light green.
*Following the light, reflect the light east using Mirror #14 into the pillar directly in front of the Seal of Amlodd.
*Head to the pillar directly north of this mirror. The red light should be entering the north-west corner of this room.
*Place Mirror #15 to reflect the light east.
*Use a Mirror #16 on the next pillar to reflect the light south, to the pillar directly in front of the Seal of Amlodd.
*The Seal of Amlodd should be unlocked. Click on the Seal of Amlodd.

*Return to the centre room.
*Pull the lever on the crystal dispenser.
*Collect the 18 hand mirrors and five crystals from the crystal dispenser.
*Walk to the north-west corner of the centre room, and follow the magenta light beam north.
*At the last pillar before the light hits the books and stops, use Mirror #1 to reflect the light east.
*Following the magenta light east, at the next pillar, use Mirror #2 to reflect the light down.
*Take the nearby stairs down to the bottom floor.
*Use Mirror #3 on the pillar near the stairs to reflect the light south.
*Follow the light as it turns blue and enters the southern room containing the Seal of Cadarn.
*At the next pillar, use Mirror #4 to reflect the light west.
*At the next pillar, use Mirror #5 to reflect the light south.
*At the next pillar, use Mirror #6 to reflect the light west.
*At the next pillar, use Mirror #7 to reflect the light north.
*At the next pillar, use Mirror #8 to reflect the light west, across the gap.

*Then, run south-west, following the magenta light west to the south-west stairs and go to the bottom floor.
*On the bottom floor, the blue light should be entering from the east side.
*On the pillar the blue light is striking, use Mirror #9 to reflect the light north.
*At the next pillar, use Mirror #10 to reflect the light upwards.
*Use the stairs to return to the middle floor.
*In the pillar the blue light is flowing through, place the red crystal, turning the light magenta as it travels to the top floor.
*Use the stairs to travel to the top floor.
*At the pillar with magenta light flowing into it, place Mirror #11 to reflect the light north, into the pillar next to the Seal of Meilyr.
*Return to the middle floor to the intersection labelled "Mirror #12" in the picture. This intersection is directly north-east of the Seal of the Forgotten.
*Place Mirror #12 and direct the light upwards.
*Run due east and take the east stairs to the top floor, and run back to the pillar with yellow light around its base.

*Place Mirror #18 in the pillar to direct the yellow light west.
