*Return to the centre room.
*Pull the lever on the crystal dispenser.
*Collect the 20 hand mirrors and five crystals from the crystal dispenser.
*Follow the magenta light all the way to the north.
*Where the magenta light hits the pile of books, use Mirror #1 to reflect the light east.
*Use Mirror #2 to reflect the beam down.
*Go down via the stairs.
*Use Mirror #3 to reflect the light south.
*The light will change to blue through the nearby pillar.
*In the pillar just south of that, use Mirror #4 to reflect the light west.
*Use Mirror #5 to reflect the light south.
*Use Mirror #6 to reflect the light west.
*Use Mirror #7 to reflect the light north.
*Use Mirror #8 to reflect the light west across the gap. This light beam will be continued later.

*Use Mirror #11 to reflect the light north across the gap.
*Across the gap, the light turns green.
*To get to the other side of the gap, you need to run back to where the magenta light is and then head west.
*On the other side of the gap, you should see the green light.
*Use Mirror #12 to reflect that light down.
*Use the nearby stairs just to the east to get to the bottom floor.
*On the bottom floor, there should be both a green and blue light.
*Go to the green light in the south-west corner.
*Use Mirror #13 to reflect the green light east.
*Use Mirror #14 to reflect the green light up.
*Now, head to the blue light in the middle-eastern part of the room.
*Use Mirror #15 to reflect the blue light north.
*Use Mirror #16 to reflect the blue light west.
*Use Mirror #17 to reflect the blue light up.
*Use the stairs to go up TWO floors to the top floor.
*Here, there should be a green and blue light.
*Go to the green light in the south-east corner of this room.
*Use Mirror #18 to reflect the green light north.
*At the next light pillar, reflect the green light west with Mirror #19 to send it to the pillar in front of the Seal of Hefin.
*Lastly, in the north-west corner of the room, you should see the blue light.
*Use Mirror #20 to reflect the blue light south to the pillar in front of the Seal of Hefin.

*Pull the lever on the crystal dispenser.
*Collect the 22 hand mirrors and six crystals from the crystal dispenser.

*Add Mirror #1 to the first pillar to reflect the light south.
*Add Mirror #2 to the next pillar to reflect the light west.

*Run back to the centre room and follow the magenta light west to find the green beam again after the gap.
*Add Mirror #4 to the second pillar after the gap to reflect the light down.
*Go down a level.
*Add Mirror #5 to the pillar to reflect the light east.
*Add Mirror #6 to the pillar to reflect the light up.
*Go up TWO floors to the top floor.
*Add Mirror #7 to reflect the light north.
*Add Mirror #8 to reflect the light east.
*Go back to the middle floor.
*Go all the way to the south-east corner to the south-east stairs, where the Seal of Ithell is located.
*Go up via the stairs to the top floor.
*Go to the west side of the room, and cross the floating books Agility shortcut. If you fail, try again.
*Run north-west until you see the green light.
*Place Mirror #9 on the pillar to reflect the light south.
*At the next pillar, use Mirror #10 to reflect the light east.
*Place the blue crystal at the next pillar that is just to the west of the agility shortcut. The light should turn cyan as it crosses over the gap.

*Right across, use Mirror #11 to reflect the light south.
*At the next pillar, use Mirror #12 to reflect the light east.
*At the next pillar, use Mirror #13 to reflect the light north.
*At the next pillar, use Mirror #14 to reflect the light west.
*At the next pillar, use Mirror #15 to reflect the light north.
*Head back to the middle floor and go to the yellow light in the east side of the floor.
*At the east-most point of the yellow light (near a tower of books), place Mirror #16 to reflect the light north.
*At the next pillar, use Mirror #17 to reflect the light east.
*At the next pillar, use Mirror #18 to reflect the light up.
*Use the stairs slightly east to go to the top floor.
*At the pillar where the yellow comes up, use Mirror #19 to reflect the light east.
*At the next pillar, use Mirror #20 to reflect the light north.
*At the next pillar, use Mirror #21 to reflect the light west.
*At the next pillar, use Mirror #22 to reflect the light south to the Seal of Trahaearn.

*Head to the south-east room directly east of the entrance.
*Rotate the mirrors to reflect light to the end of the puzzle. Solution shown here:

*Pull the lever on the crystal dispenser then collect the 26 hand mirrors and 7 crystals from the crystal dispenser.
*Near the yellow lights, place the Cyan crystal, turning the yellow light green.

*Buy 2 kegs of beer from Thora in the Longhall before you start the quest to save time later. (bank them when you have the chance to reduce weight while running around)
*Talk to Brundt in the Longhall to start the quest. or  
*Go north and talk to Freygerd in the house south of the sandpit.
*Equip your mirror shield (to avoid taking damage and stat drain), then search the sandpit (to the north) and kill the Basilisk Youngling (level 53). 
*Pick up the Unsealed letter and read it.
*Search the rockslide west of the house to get the Fang.
*Search the boxes south of the house to get the Venom gland.
*Talk to Freygerd to give her the items.
*Return to Brundt to receive a note, read it, then talk to him again for a cutscene.  or 
*Go south-east of Rellekka, following the dirt path, and talk to Brundt. Go through all chat options to learn how to restore V's shield.

*Obtain a Fremennik shield (this is not the tradeable Neitiznot shield).
**Option 1: Go to Waterbirth Island and kill dagannoth until they drop the shield (uncommon drop).
**Option 2: Go to Rellekka and kill Market Guards or Warriors until they drop the shield (rare drop).
**Option 3: Travel to Bardur deep in the Waterbirth Dungeon and wear a Ring of charos (a) to get the shield for free. Without the ring it will cost.

*Go to Baba Yaga on Lunar Isle to turn your molten glass into molten glass (i). or  if using lunar spellbook and Ourania teleport is not unlocked.
*Head north-east of the town to Lunar Isle mine and mine stalagmites for 3 lunar ore.
*Leave the mine and travel to the Astral Altar with 100 astral runes in your inventory and craft on the altar to obtain Lunar glass. Then return to Rellekka.
**Optional: Destroy the Seal of passage and talk to the Oneiromancer to be teleported there. This guide will remind you later to re-obtain it at a convenient moment.
*Smelt 3 lunar bars in a furnace (Rellekka is convenient) or you can use Superheat Item.
*Smith the V sigil on an anvil (Rellekka is convenient).
*Talk to the Fossegrimen to enchant the sigil. (Found by summoning at the Strange altar south-west of Rellekka).

*Head east of Rellekka to the Mountain Camp
*Follow the path north of the Mountain Camp and inspect the Large Geyser. Use your pet rock on the Geyser. 
*Go to Rellekka and talk to Peer the Seer found south-west of the Rellekka market.
*Return to the geyser and wear the ice gloves, if you forget you may re-equip them and try again.
*Inspect the large geyser to the west to get the polishing rock.
*Use any of the components together while having a glassblowing pipe in the inventory to create V's shield.

*Talk to Brundt south-east of Rellekka.
**If you destroyed your Seal of passage to return to Rellekka quickly, now is a good time to ask for another one and then talk to Brundt again.
*Return to the Longhall and talk to Brundt again.
*Wield V's shield and fight the basilisks until you reach 100%. You have to hit a basilisk at least once to make its death count towards completion.
**Monstrous Basilisk (level 135) counts for 10% completion.
**Basilisk (level 61) counts for 3.33% completion.
*Travel on the Fremennik Boat to the Island of Stone.

*Speak with Brundt to explain the cave door puzzle.
*Solve the cave door puzzle (Mastermind).
**Each red check means one rune is correct but in the wrong position.
**Each green check means one rune is correct and in the right position.

*Equip V's shield and keep it equipped for the full fight.
*Enter the cave.
*Fight Typhor (level 218)
**Pray against either Magic or Melee, depending on which attack style you are weaker against.
*There is a checkpoint after Typhor is defeated. You may wish to teleport out between fights to resupply. If you do, you can return to the Island of Stone by talking to Haskell on the western-most pier in Rellekka (the same one the Waterbirth Island boat is on)
*Fight The Jormungand (level 363). There are two special attacks to avoid:
**When the screen turns red, click to face away from the attack (hits around 40 damage and drains your stats a little).
**When frozen in rock, click to attack repeatedly to break free (otherwise take 30+ damage as the rock explodes).
**Pray Protect from Magic.
**It is weak to crush attacks.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

* Rose
* Kourend map
* Demonic incantations
* Order form
* Delivery confirmation
* Bloody knife
* Receipt
* Bone
* Cultist robe

* Lord Arceuus is found in the upper level of the Tower of Magic, north-west of Arceuus. Players can use the Arceuus Library Teleport spell or tablet and run west, or using a fairy ring (code ) and running south-west. Players can also use Kharedst's memoirs ("A Dark Disposition" teleport) and run north-west past the Library.
* Lord Hosidius is found in the family mansion in Hosidius, north-west of the vinery. Xeric's talisman ("Xeric's Glade" teleport) brings players a short distance from the mansion; players can also use Kharedst's memoirs ("Lunch by the Lancilliums" teleport) and run south, east across the bridge, and south again.
* Lady Lovakengj is found in the Lovakengj Assembly in Lovakengj. Players can use Kharedst's memoirs ("Jewellery of Jubilation" teleport) and run westwards, or use Xeric's talisman ("Xeric's Inferno" teleport) and travel south.
* Lady Piscarilius is found in The Warrens under Port Piscarilius. Players can use Kharedst's memoirs ("The Fisher's Flute" teleport) to teleport close to the entrance.
* Lord Shayzien is found in the upper level of the War Tent in the Shayzien Encampment. Players can use a fairy ring (code ) and run south-east, or use Kharedst's memoirs ("History and Hearsay" teleport) and run north, past the city.

*Speak to Santa in the centre of Varrock.
*Talk to "Worried Baker" South-west of Santa (south of Apothecary)
*Talk to Santa again.
*Get teleported by Santa; Talk to Anti-Santa.
*Watch Jack Frost & Anti-Santa cut-scene.
*Enter the storage room to the south.
**Get 3 festive pots
**Get 3 festive flour
**Get 3 cinnamon sticks
**Get 3 ginger powder
**Get 3 festive eggs
*Add all ingredients to the receiver (centre room).
*Pull the lever next to the receiver.
*Pick up the "Gingerbread Shield" that came out of the machine.
*Equip shield, enter Icelords cell.
*Pick up "Storage Key"
*Exit cell, and use key on the cell to the East to free Mary and Paul.
*Talk to Paul.
*Talk to Santa Claus.
*Congratulations, event complete!
*Talk to the Odd Old Man north of the Digsite, north of the Limestone mine

*Talk to Fortunato located in Draynor marketplace and buy 27 jug of vinegar.
*Use all of the jugs of vinegar with all the pots to make 27 pots of vinegar.
*Use all of the bones with your pots of vinegar to get 27 bones in vinegar.
*Withdraw a tinderbox and either logs or an axe. Each bones in vinegar will require 1 set of logs. There are trees nearby that can be cut for logs.
*Return back to the Odd Old Man and talk to him.
*For each bone in vinegar do the following:
**Place a set of logs on the pot-boiler next to the old man.
**Use a bone in vinegar with the pot-boiler.
**Light the set of logs with your tinderbox.
**Wait 12 seconds until the fire is consumed and remove the pot from the pot-boiler. (Alternatively, hop worlds after lighting the logs for them to be finished when you log back in)
*Talk to the Odd Old Man.
*Congratulations, quest complete!
*Speak with Hosa by the statue of King Rada I in Great Kourend to start the miniquest.

*Gain 100% favour with Arceuus.
**Assist library customers in the Arceuus Library until you have 90% Arceuus Favour (continue searching for books until you find Transportation incantations to unlock the Kourend Castle Teleport spell).
**Complete The Ascent of Arceuus for the final 10% of favour. 
*Gain 100% favour with Hosidius.
**Plough the fields in Hosidius until you reach 5% (bring a hammer).
**Buy 850 saltpetre and compost and combine them together. Place them in your bank and talk to Clerk to reach 90% favour.
**Complete The Depths of Despair for the remaining 10% favour.
*Gain 100% favour with Lovakengj.
**Mine volcanic sulphur until you reach 65% favour (bring a face mask, gas mask or slayer helmet).
**Complete The Forsaken Tower for an additional 10% favour.
**Talk to Miriam and deliver the five minecart control scrolls to the minecart operators to reach 100% favour.
*Gain 100% favour with Port Piscarilius.
** Complete Client of Kourend. Distribute the rewarded 20% favour to Piscarilius.
**Complete The Queen of Thieves for another 10%.
**Hunt sandworms until you reach 100% in Piscarilius.
*Gain 100% favour with Shayzien.
**Heal wounded soldiers in the Shayzien infirmary until you have 5% favour in Shayzien.
**Kill lizardmen until you reach 30% in Shayzien (try to obtain Xeric's talisman by killing lizardmen if you haven't already).
**Complete Tale of the Righteous for another 10%.
**At 40% favour, tackle organised crime until you reach 100% favour. It is much faster than killing lizardmen, and you can hop worlds once you find a meeting to easily earn more favour.

*Speak with Arcis after earning 100% favour with Arceuus.
*Speak with Hosa after earning 100% favour with Hosidius.
*Speak with Lovada after earning 100% favour with Lovakengj.
*Speak with Piliar after earning 100% favour with Port Piscarilius.
*Speak with Shayda after earning 100% favour with Shayzien.
*Speak with one of the architects at the statue of King Rada I.

*Talk to Charlie the Tramp located near the south entrance of Varrock. 
*Go down the alley (the door to the west) and enter the Black Arm Gang headquarters.
*Talk to Katrine. 
*Trade your partner for a weapon store key.
*Go to the south-east corner of Varrock and look for a small room with a ladder. It's connected to the west side of the building with the Chaos Altar in it.
*Use the key on the door and climb up the ladder.
*Kill the Weaponsmaster, or use Telekinetic Grab to pick up two Phoenix crossbows without fighting him.
*Pick up both Phoenix crossbows.
*Take two Phoenix crossbows to Katrine.
You are now a member of the Black Arm Gang.
*Go upstairs in the headquarters and open the cupboard to the south of the stairs to find the right half of the Shield of Arrav.

*Talk to Baraek, the fur trader in Varrock Square, and ask about the Phoenix Gang. 
*Make your way to the Phoenix Gang Hideout in the south-east corner of Varrock in the building with a ladder to the basement, west of the Mage of Zamorak altar. (Look for the [[File:Dungeon map link icon.png]] icon)
*Talk to Straven. 
*Kill Jonny the beard, located in Varrock's Blue Moon Inn, and pick up the Intel report.
*Report back to Straven.
You are now a member of the Phoenix Gang.
*Open the chest in the south-west corner of the hideout to find half of the Shield of Arrav.
*Trade the Weapon store key to your partner. (Ironmen: Use the key on your partner.)

*Talk to Veliaf Hurtz, outside of the church in Slepe.
*Talk to Hameln the Jester inside the church.

*Talk to Carl in the pub south-east of the church.
*Inspect the barrel south of the pub to follow Carl to his supplier.
** Go through the church and hide at the north doors, wait there until he passes the doors.
** Proceed to the hollow tree just north of the graves, and hide on the eastern side.
** When he reaches the centre square of the town, hide at the northern side of the hollow tree directly next to the gallows.
** Once he approaches the graveyard, hide at the western side of the hollow tree to the west of the graveyard.
*After the cutscene, kill Kroy. Kroy does not have to be killed with the Ivandis flail, and can instead be killed with normal weapons.
**Use Protect from Magic, and dodge his potion-throw attack.
**Stand behind a lab table and attack him with ranged to negate all his damage.
*Destroy both lab tables.
*Leave the lab by clicking the southern gate.
*Talk to Veliaf in the Slepe church graveyard.
*Talk to Veliaf Hurtz next to Drezel at Paterdomus. (Fairy ring, Salve Graveyard Teleport tablet, Slayer ring)
*Talk to Ivan Strom south of Fenkenstrain's Castle. (Fenkenstrain's Castle Teleport tablet)

*Talk to Ivan Strom east of Paterdomus (north of fairy ring ) to begin the trek.
**Cut three vines from the swamp tree to the north-east.
**Use the vines on each other to make a long vine.
**Use the long vine on the swamp tree branch.
**Swing across the water and continue the trek by clicking the last tile.
**Kill the Nail beasts, use food on Ivan if his health becomes too low, and continue the trek.
**Use your logs on the bridge (chop 3 logs if you didn't bring any. If you forgot your axe, kill the zombie for one.)
**Cross the bridge and continue the trek.
**Before the dialogue ends, attack the easternmost Vampyre (the one in-front of Ivan) so that it doesn't attack Ivan.
**Use your Ivandis Flail to kill these Vampyres.
**Continue the trek to end up in Burgh de Rott.
**Talk to Ivan and complete the dialogue to send him to the boathouse.
**After completing the trek, bank and prepare for the next step.

*Head south-east of Burgh de Rott to the boat house and talk to Ivan Strom.
*Board the boat and head to the Icyene graveyard.
*Talk to Veliaf Hurtz.
*After the cutscene, talk to Vanescula Drakan 
*Unlock the mausoleum door north of you.
*Solve the Mausoleum Door's puzzle.
*Talk to everyone in this order:
**Vertida Sefalatis.
**Kael Forshaw.
**Radigad Ponfit.
**Polmafi Ferdygris.
**Ivan Strom.
**Veliaf Hurtz.
*Finish the conversation with Vanescula Drakan.
*Use Drakan's medallion to teleport to Ver Sinhaza and ask the Vyrewatch next to the bank to send you to the mines.
*Mine 15 Daeyalt ore and place them in the cart. (If you forgot a pickaxe, talk to any miner for a bronze one.)
*Talk to the Vampyre Juvinate.
*Head south-east to the house with the slashed tapestry and the statue.
*Walk through the tapestry.
*Go down the staircase.
*Talk to Safalaan.
*Kill the Mutated Bloodveld.
*Talk to Safalaan again.
*Search the bookshelf on the western wall inside the room filled with mutated bloodvelds.
*Talk to Safalaan.
*Head back to Burgh de Rott. (Morytania legs 3, Mort'ton teleport or Shades of Mort'ton minigame teleport and run south-east to the boat or Drakan's Medallion and run south-west to the boat.)

*Take the boat back to the Icyene Graveyard.
*Talk to Veliaf at the eastern part of the graveyard.
*Use your Drakan's medallion to teleport to Ver Sinhaza.
*Exit to the west towards Meiyerditch.
**If you don't have the Vyrewatch outfit head to Trader Sven's house south of Old Man Ral's house, near the shore. Trade him and buy a Vyrewatch outfit. (Do not equip the outfit)
*Go down the trapdoor in Old Man Ral's house to the west.
*Talk to Polmafi Ferdygris. (Make sure to upgrade the outfit to Noble)
*Make your way back to Icyene Graveyard by either:
**Climbing back up, going south-west to the wall, climb the wall and navigate to the boat
**Or go back to Burgh de Rott to get to the boat
*Talk to Vanescula Drakan.
*Take the boat to Slepe.

*Talk to Veliaf at the graveyard.
*Kill Damien Leucurte.
**Wield your Ivandis Flail.
**Use Protect from Magic.
**Drink your antipoison when poisoned.
**Stomp out the magical fires Damien periodically spawns.
* Talk to Veliaf.
*Use your Drakan's Medallion to teleport to Ver Sinhaza and prepare for the next step.

*Go back to the Icyene Graveyard (Use Morytania legs 3 or Drakan's Medallion and take the boat to the north or Mort'ton teleport and take the boat south-east of Burgh de Rott). 
*Talk to Vanescula Drakan.
*Equip the Vyre noble clothing.
*Use your Drakan's medallion to teleport to Ver Sinhaza.
*Talk to the Vyrewatch right next to the bank and ask to be sent to the mines.
*Talk to a Vampyre Juvinate to exit the mine. You do not have to mine Daeyalt ore this time.
*Go through the crack north of the mining hole.
*Head to the Arboretum. (The tree icon east of the bank in Darkmeyer.)
*Finish the dialogue with the guard Desmodus Lasiurus.
*Head to the house with a water symbol north-east of the furnace, along the east wall near the crack. 
*Talk to Mordan Nikazsi.
*Head to the prison in the northern part of Darkmeyer, north of the Arboretum.
*Talk to Maria Gadderanks.
*Head to the Arboretum and enter it.
*Search the toppled shelves for an old note.
*Read it, and take note of how many gallons the tree requires to be cut.
*Look up the required gallons in the solution table and set the north and south valve to the given values.

*Cut eight blisterwood logs.
*Head back to the Icyene Graveyard.
*Speak to Veliaf/Vanescula.
*Use your Drakan's medallion to teleport to Ver Sinhaza.

*Head back to the underground lair under Old Man Ral's house in Meiyerditch.
*Talk to Vertida Sefalatis and give him 7 Blisterwood logs.
*Search the nearby crate for a silver sickle (b).
*Use the ruby on the sickle.
*Enchant the ruby sickle (b).
*Use the blisterwood log on the enchanted ruby sickle (b).
*Use your Ivandis flail on the blisterwood sickle.
*Prepare for the fight with Vanstrom Klause.

*Go back to the Icyene Graveyard.
*Talk to Vanescula Drakan.
*Run north-east of the graveyard.
*Talk to Safalaan Hallow.
*Kill Vanstrom Klause, use Protect from Magic.
**Vanstrom uses three special attacks. He will use a special attack every 8-10 attacks, and will never use the same one twice in a row. He can also use an attack that lowers your Attack level similar to Shadow Spells.
*** - Acidic Bloodveld is spawned and will explode on the player for high damage. Kill with ranged.
*** - A blood orb spawns that periodically heals Vanstrom. Walking on top of it (3x3 area) damages the player, but Vanstrom can be lured on top to damage him.
*** - Heavy damage is taken if the player is facing Vanstrom. The attack gives very little warning and is near impossible to avoid on reaction. It is recommended that the player keep a count of how many attacks Vanstrom has done and turn around preemptively. 
**After you deplete his hitpoints, he will heal himself 200 hitpoints and stop using his special attacks.
***Turn off protection prayers to save on prayer points as they no longer have any effect, but continue using Piety or other buffing prayers
***Vanstrom summons lightning to strike tiles with a max hit of 46. Tiles that are about to be struck will have a dark circle on them and should be avoided.
***Consider turning off RuneLite's 117 HD plugin if enabled, as it makes it much harder to see where the lightning will strike.
**Note: You can speak to Veliaf if you wish to re-attempt the fight.
*Watch the cutscene.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Talk to Marlo in the house of the Varrock Estate Agent in north-east Varrock. 
** Pick up a saw here if you didn't bring one.
*Talk to Old Man Yarlo in his house south-west of Aubury's Rune Shop.
*Remove all of the old furniture in the house, for a total of 7 hotspots: 6 pieces of furniture and a rug.
**one broken chair
**one rotten carpet
**two broken stools
**two broken tables
**one campbed
*Talk to Old Man Yarlo again. 
* Search the crates with the black symbol on them west of the range for 3 waxwood logs.
*Go to the Varrock sawmill and talk to the Sawmill operator. 
** Make 3 waxwood planks using the waxwood logs.
** Make 10 planks now if you don't already have them.
** Purchase your steel nails and five bolts of cloth now if you need them.
*Go to Old Man Yarlo's home and build the new furniture (all white translucent objects).
**Talk to Old Man Yarlo for a hammer and a saw if you didn't bring them. 
*Talk to Old Man Yarlo.
*Talk to Marlo to claim your reward. 
*Congratulations, miniquest complete!

*Check the noticeboard on the wall behind the Wine Stall in the Draynor Village market. 
*Talk to Sarah located near the loom at the South Falador Farm north of Port Sarim. 
**(Optional) Trade Sarah to complete an easy Falador Diary task.
*Go to the crossroads north of Draynor Village and south of Draynor Manor.
*Follow the cabbages and carrots on the ground north-east towards the strange hole.
*Use your rope on the strange hole, then climb down.
*Follow the cave to the end and investigate the skeleton.
*After the cut-scene, talk to Spria to receive reinforced goggles.
*Equip the goggles and return to the hole in the ground and kill Sourhog (level 37).
*Remove the foot from the dead Sourhog.
*Return to Sarah at Falador farm. 
*Return to Spria in Draynor Village.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

* Bob in Bob's Axes – an outraged monkey who is a paying customer and demands to speak to the manager.
* Father Aereck in Lumbridge Church – a religious monkey who sends his thoughts and prayers to Marimbo.
* Donie outside the Lumbridge General Store – a brave monkey taking on Lumbridge's goblins
* A sheep in Fred the Farmer's sheep pen (north-east corner) – a mathematically inclined monkey with the hard job of calculating the totals of Fred's sheep stock.
* A cow inside the cow field north of the Mill Lane Mill (south-east corner) – a frustrated monkey with inverted controls.
* The unicorn to the west of Lumbridge Swamp (north-west corner) – a rampaging monkey riding his stallion.

* Lumbridge — Recommended to buy a spade for the X Marks the Spot quest.
* Al Kharid — Recommended to start Prince Ali Rescue while in the city.
* Varrock — Recommended to visit Thessalia's clothes store across the street for the FashionScape achievement.
* Edgeville — Can be reached by going around the west wall of the Grand Exchange
* Falador — Walk south-west from Edgeville to reach Falador.
* Rimmington — Continue south from Falador. Recommended to craft air runes on the way to Rimmington to complete the Breath of Fresh Air achievement.
* Karamja — Take the boat from Port Sarim ( coins). Also the location for the Fisherman's Friend achievement.
*Talk to Willow on the path south of Ice Mountain, north of Falador.

*Speak to Checkal in Barbarian Village near the pottery oven building.
*Speak to Atlas in The Long Hall tavern in Barbarian Village and complete training. 
**Take some cooked meat and a beer from the tables in The Long Hall if you do not have them already.
*Return to Checkal and use the Flex emote when prompted.

*Speak to Charlie the Tramp south of the Varrock Swordshop. 
*Speak to the cook in the east room of Blue Moon Inn in Varrock. 
*Create a steak sandwich by using a knife on cooked meat while having bread in your inventory.
*Speak to Marley in Edgeville at the yew trees with the steak sandwich in your inventory.

*Speak to Burntof in the Rising Sun Inn in Falador.
**If you do not have a beer, buy any beer for 3 coins by talking to Emily or Kaylee. 
*Choose any option in the game of rock paper scissors.

*Go to the entrance of the Ruins of Camdozaal, at the west side of the Ice Mountain, and talk to Willow (dungeon icon on minimap). 
*After the cutscene, kill the level 25 Ancient Guardian by attacking it or mining the 4 structural pillars in the corners.
*Congratulations, quest complete!
**After the quest is complete, your character will speak with Ramarno, an Imcando dwarf found in the ruins.

*Talk to the Mysterious Stranger by the entrance to the Theatre of Blood.
**No Theatre of Blood raids completed:
**Completed at least 1 Theatre of Blood raid:
*Go down the stairs to the north-east of the Mysterious Stranger. Bring a saw and blisterwood flail.
*Kill a vyrewatch for a key.
*Unlock the gate to the south and open the coffin.
*Return to the Mysterious Stranger with Ranis' head and watch the cutscene. 
*Go to the dungeon (cave) north of Darkmeyer (south of Port Phasmatys).
*Follow the path north, then east to the egg sac.
*Search the nearby skeleton.
*Read the sticky note.
*Speak to Daer Krand in the Sisterhood Sanctuary to obtain sulphuric acid. 
**The entrance is located south of the graveyard in Slepe.
**To reach Daer Krand, make your way toward the centre of the sanctuary, then follow the path east, then north. He is located upstairs.
*Return to the dungeon (cave) north of Darkmeyer.
*Use sulphuric acid on the egg sac. You do not need to kill any spiders.
**The spiders here can envenom you. Drink a dose of anti-venom or two doses of anti-poison to cure it.
*Return to the Mysterious Stranger  with the strange spider eggs. Watch two cutscenes.

*With ghostspeak amulet or Morytania legs 2+ (and druid pouch to protect food), go to the Nature Grotto (fairy ring ), and speak to the Nature Spirit Filliman Tarlock inside the grotto. 
*Go to the island on the east side of Mort Myre (directly east of the grotto, just west of Castle Drakan).
**Look for the island north of the Shades of Mort'ton minigame symbol.
*Cross the stepping stone and kill the hespori and chop it afterwards to obtain hespori bark.
*Return to the Mysterious Stranger. Watch two cutscenes.

*Complete a Theatre of Blood raid (any mode works, although entry mode is recommended). See this page for details on mechanics of the bosses.
*Talk to the Mysterious Stranger again after completing the raid. Watch two cutscenes.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

* Go speak to Martin Holt east of the Kourend Castle and start the quest. 
* Go to the ground floor of the Kourend Castle and speak to Commander Fullore. A short cutscene will occur. 
* Once the cutscene is over, you will be south of a little house that you will need to investigate.
* Go in the house, go up the stairs, and search the drawers in the eastern room. Read the receipt.
* Go down the stairs and talk to Tomas Lawry by the roses.
* Go to the Lovakengj pub north-west of the Kourend Castle and speak to Fuggy.  
* Go to Veos's boat in the south-eastern corner of Port Piscarilius and talk to Cabin Boy Herbert.  A short cutscene will occur. 
** Warning: Combat will immediately follow the cutscene.
* After the cutscene you will need to defeat the level 168 demon Judge of Yama. Dodge the fire waves like Galvek by standing away from the fire and running to the boss to melee him. He will have protect from magic & protect from missiles overhead during the entire fight.
** A good tactic is to use protect from melee and dodge the flames until you get in melee range. Tanking the flames to get into melee range is also a viable option.
* After the boss has been killed a cutscene inside Kourend Castle will occur.
* Go south-west to speak to Commander Fullore outside of the castle after the cutscene. She will be standing just south of the castle, directly north of the Shayzien mine.
* Speak to Martin Holt again a bit east of Kourend Castle entrance where you started the quest.
* Head to the ground floor of the Arceuus Library and Right-click teleport on Archeio.
* Pickpocket Istoria for a Bluish key.
* Search the pink case in the south-east corner of the room to retrieve Rose's diary.
* Go back and speak to Martin Holt again with Rose's Diary. A note will fall out of the diary. 
* Read the note and speak to Martin again.

* Go to the Forthos Ruins, northeast of Woodcutting guild.
* Speak to Martin Holt. 
* Search the Stone Piles around the ruins to find a combination of numbers for the panel. Note of these (unique to each player).
* Cut the vines to the west, squeeze-through the vines, and use the unique combination for 'ROSE' on the panel on the wall. 
** For example, if the piles tell you the following: R - 1, O - 3, S - 3, E - 7, your code will be '1337'.
* Read the note then show it to Martin Holt. 
* Go to the Settlement Ruins, south-west of Wintertodt.
* Speak with Martin Holt in the north-west building after running past the Ice Spiders, Ice Giants, and Ice Wolves.
* Kill the assassin that spawns.
* Cast fire bolt (or above) on the ice chunks south-west of Martin, search the melted ice chunk and open the panel on the western wall. 
* Read the note and speak to Martin.
* Go to The Legless Faun, in southern Piscarilius, on land, speak to Martin and climb the southern pillar.
* Check the panel upstairs. Note the order of each house.
* Go back down the wall and push the statue panels on the statues in the order specified from the panel.
* Check the panel upstairs again.
* After the cutscene, read the note.
* Head to the shack north-east of the farming guild, directly west of fairy ring, and search the bed.
* Read the tatty note, then inspect the crates in the north-western corner and climb down the trap door.

* Exit the shack and go south to Molch.
* Go east to the furthest dwelling in Molch and enter the Lizard dwelling.
* Go north and talk to Kaht B'alam. 
* Exit the temple by jumping in the hole to the west.
* Go south-west towards the Kebos Swamp and cross the stone bridge.
* Search the south-eastern Lizardman eggs, and you will be attacked by a level 75 lizardman brute. You do not need to kill it.
* Go back into the temple and give the Lizardman egg to Khat B'alam for the key. 
* Open the door that is located on the north wall of the main corridor, south-west of Khat B'alam. The door is indicated by a keyhole on the wall. 
* Kill the spirit boss Xamphur.
** Pray Protect from Magic throughout the fight.
** Kill summoned hands to avoid corruption and avoid the falling hand mechanic by walking in a straight line back and forth, similar to Vorkath mechanics.
* Search the northern table in the lab.
* Return to the shack north-east of the farming guild, directly west of fairy ring, and go downstairs by inspecting the crates again.
* After the cut-scene, go and talk with:
** Lord Trobin Arceuus - of the Tower of Magic, west of the Arceuus Library (Kharedst's memoirs - Arceuus or Arceuus Library Teleport).
** Lord Kandur Hosidius - In his home in Hosidius, south-east of the bank (Xeric's talisman - 2. Xeric's Glade)
** Lady Vulcana Lovakengj - South-western Lovakengj, in the Lovakengj Assembly at The Forsaken Tower quest icon (Kharedst's memoirs - Lovakengj or Xeric's talisman - 3. Xeric's Inferno)
** Lady Shauna Piscarilius - In The Warrens under Port Piscarilius (Kharedst's memoirs - Piscarilius)
** Lord Shiro Shayzien -  of the War Tent in the Shayzien Encampment, by the northern bank icon (Kharedst's memoirs - Shayzien)
* Go to Xeric's Lookout and talk to Commander Fullore (Xeric's talisman - 1. Xeric's Lookout)
* After the cut-scene, talk with all 5 Lords again. They are on different floors of the lookout house, including the basement. Lord Arceuus is just outside (make sure you receive the broken redirector from him).

* Talk to Commander Fullore at the Lookout and ask about Lady Lovakengj. 
* Go to Mount Karuulm, go down the elevator, and speak with Kaal-Mej-San.
* Create a sulphur potion (mix a defence potion with volcanic sulphur).
* Speak with Kaal-Mej-San again. They will enchant the sulphur potion into a shielding potion.
* Go to the Doors of Dinh at the Wintertodt Camp and pour the potion onto them.
* Go to the Barbarian camp in the Kourend Woodland (south-east of the Rada's blessing teleport), and go down the ladder to the south.
* A level 91 Barbarian Warlord will attack you. Kill him, and then talk to Phileas Rimor.
* Go to the prison just outside the Shayzien wall, west of the Graveyard of Heroes, and go down the staircase. (Kharedst's memoirs - Shayzien, then west down into a dungeon icon on the map)
* Talk to Martin Holt.
* Go to the Graveyard of Heroes in Shayzien and go to the south of the church. Talk to Jorra and kill the level 132 assassin that spawns (he attacks with melee and ranged). Speak to Jorra again to receive the declaration.
* Go to the Arceuus church (get the dark essence block beforehand if you don't already have it), climb up either of the two staircases, run all the way east, climb the stairs, and then talk to Mori. Bring her molten glass and dark essence block. She will give you a dark nullifier.
** To obtain a dark essence block: bring a pickaxe and a chisel (chisel obtainable at the location) east of the Dark Altar. Chip off the dense runestone to receive a dense essence block, then use it on the Dark Altar to receive a dark essence block.
* Go to the Chasm of Fire (north-west of fairy ring ). Try to go inside and complete the dialogue.
* Go to the Hosidius Vinery and inspect the eastern Wine barrel. Go inside  and picklock the chest to get a Shayzien journal.
* Go back to Xeric's Lookout and talk to all five of the lords.
* Talk with Commander Fullore. A cutscene will follow.
* Speak with Commander Fullore again.
* Go down the ladder and speak with Lord Hosidius.
* Return to Commander Fullore. There will be another long cutscene. 
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Talk to Kolodion at the Mage Arena bank located in level 53 Wilderness to receive an enchanted symbol.

*Use the enchanted symbol in various areas in the Wilderness by process of "hot & cold", to find the location a follower spawns in. The location is random and different for each player, and changes occasionally.

*Bring the appropriate god staff for the first follower you choose to kill and enough runes for at least 50 casts of the respective god spell.
*Go to the location of the follower you choose to kill and use the enchanted symbol to spawn the follower.
*Kill the follower that spawns and pick up the remains it drops.
*Go to Kolodion and give him the remains. This can be done one at a time or all at once. 
*At the bank, refill your runes and supplies and switch to the god staff that matches your next follower. Repeat the above for the remaining two followers, going to Kolodion after each kill to give the dropped remains.
*Congratulations, miniquest complete!

*After the completion of the Desert Treasure I quest, a messenger will randomly appear to deliver an important letter.
*Read the letter to start the miniquest, then destroy it.
*Kill all four God Wars Dungeon generals once each, to obtain their pieces of the frozen key.
**Kree'arra (Frozen key piece (armadyl))
**General Graardor (Frozen key piece (bandos))
**Commander Zilyana (Frozen key piece (saradomin))
**K'ril Tsutsaroth (Frozen key piece (zamorak))
*Assemble the key pieces into the frozen key, by using the 'assemble' option on any of them while they are all in the inventory.
*Travel to the Frozen Door, located in the southern part of the God War Dungeon, just east of the entrance to Armadyl's Eyrie.
*Use the key to open the door.
*Talk to Ashuelot Reis.
*Congratulations, miniquest complete!

* Talk to Grubfoot in the Dorgeshuun Mines, right outside the main entrance to Dorgesh-Kaan. 
* Enter Dorgesh-Kaan and head north-west to Oldak's laboratory.
* Talk to Zanik in the laboratory.

* Head north-west to the temple entrance stairs blocked by two goblin guards.
** Pick a black mushroom if you don't already have black dye.
* Talk to the guards for Zanik to pass.
* Head over and talk to the Makeover Mage south-west of Falador using a skills necklace to the crafting guild or a falador teleport. 
* Pick the pharmakos bush outside the building and use the berries on an unfinished toadflax potion to create a goblin potion.

* Return to the Goblin Cave located nearby the Fishing Guild by any means, most commonly a skills necklace to the fishing guild.
* In front of the goblin guards, drink the goblin potion (pick any goblin appearance).
* Create a black dye if needed, by using a pestle and mortar on a black mushroom with a vial in inventory.
** Pick a black mushroom by the entrance if you don't already have black dye.
* Climb down the entrance. 
* Use black dye on your goblin mail and wear it. Search the crates in the main temple room for a free goblin mail.
* Enter the north-eastern room.
* Search the crate in the room for a Dorgesh-kaan sphere to free Zanik.
* Talk to Zanik in the prison cell with a Dorgesh-kaan sphere in inventory.
* Head back to the main room, and talk to High Priest Bighead in the northern part of the temple and take the test. 
*Re-enter the north-eastern room where the goblins are wearing black goblin-mail and pickpocket the priest for his Huzamogaarb key.

* Leave the cave; you can equip a piece of equipment to be thrown out of the cave, then you can teleport.
* Talk to Aggie in Draynor Village. 
* Acquire a raw slimy eel and head to the Fishing Contest area in Hemenster with a fishing rod.
* Click the gate. 
* Catch a whitefish.
* Return to Aggie to receive a white goblin mail. 
* Prepare dyes and return to the Goblin Temple wearing the white goblin mail. Do not teleport out of the temple if your inventory is full or you will lose your goblin mail.
* Steal the Saragorgak key from the priest in the western room of the temple. 
** Remove the goblin mail to leave the room quicker.
* Repeat the operation of stealing keys and dying your mail in the following order:
** Yellow (north-west)
** Purple (south-west)
** Orange (south-east)
** Blue (east)
* Before you leave, unlock the crypt with the six keys to give you more inventory space.

*Prepare for a fight
* Enter the crypt (large door north of the temple).
* Use the "Say-name" option on each of the graves. After defeating them, talk to them.
** South-west: Snothead 
** South-east: Snailfeet 
** North-west: Mosschin 
** North-east: Redeyes 
** North: Strongbones (ignore the skoblins and use Protect from Magic) 
* Ensure you ask Strongbones where Yu'biusk is before leaving.

* Return to Dorgesh-Kaan and speak to Zanik in Oldak's laboratory.
* With a light source, go to Oldak in Dorgesh-Kaan South Dungeon located beneath the agility course which is in the south end of Dorgesh-Kaan.
** Option 1: If the player has access to fairy rings, use the code .
** Option 2: Use a Dorgesh-kaan sphere and go south into the agility course, and go down the ladder. Follow the path east in the dungeon.
** Option 3: Run south to the south end of Dorgesh-Kaan to the agility course, and go down the ladder. Follow the path east in the dungeon.
* Speak to Oldak.
* Click on the machines next to Oldak; use the combination 9-4-1 to activate the machine.
* Open the strange box in the north-western part of Yu'biusk for a cutscene.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

* Speak with Wizard Persten west of the Emir's Arena to obtain the eye amulet. 
* Go to the Mage of Zamorak at the Altar of Chaos in south-eastern Varrock; use the eye amulet on him.
* Speak to the Tea Seller at the eastern entrance to Varrock. 
**Note: Do not steal from the Tea stall or you won't be able to continue for 10 minutes of in-game time.
* Use the strong cup of tea on the Mage of Zamorak, and accept the teleport to the Abyss. 
* Use the eye amulet on the Dark Mage.
* Now there will be runic energies surrounding the rift. Touch each colour until they all turn white; the order is random for every player. Remember the order as you try out different combinations as it will reset with each failed order.
* Speak to the Dark Mage to receive an abyssal incantation.

* Go back to Wizard Persten in Al Kharid (Recommend exiting the abyss via Fire Altar, will place you just east of Persten) and accept the teleport to the Wizards' Tower. 
* Go to the basement and use the abyssal incantation on Archmage Sedridor.
* Climb up the ladder and stairs once, then speak to Wizard Traiborn. 
* Speak with the three apprentice wizards on the of the wizards tower,Apprentice Felix, Tamara, and Cordelia, in no particular order and view their riddles.
* Speak to Traiborn, and answer 11 when prompted. 
* Speak to Archmage Sedridor or Wizard Persten in the basement.

* Speak to each of the apprentices in no particular order.
* Speak to Wizard Persten. The Guardians of the Rift tutorial begins after this step.
* Speak to Apprentice Cordelia.
* Speak to Apprentice Felix, then take a weak cell from the table.
* Speak to Apprentice Tamara, then place the weak cell on the inactive cell tile near her.
* Speak to Apprentice Felix.
* Take a weak cell from the table, then click on the essence pile to assemble a guardian.
* Repeat the previous step for the other essence pile.
* Speak to Apprentice Tamara.
* Mine five guardian fragments from the guardian remains.
* Speak to Apprentice Felix.
* Work at the workbench to turn guardian fragments into guardian essence.
* Speak to Apprentice Tamara.
* Take an uncharged cell from the table.
* Enter the Mind Altar and click the altar.
* Speak to Apprentice Tamara.
* Click the weak cell tile, then power-up The Great Guardian.
* Speak to Apprentice Tamara.
* Repeat the process of mining five guardian fragments and turning them into guardian essence.
* Enter the Water Altar and click the altar
* Power-up The Great Guardian.
* Speak to Apprentice Tamara.
* Click on the Essence pile again to assemble another guardian. 
* Speak to Apprentice Tamara.
* Repeat the process of mining guardian fragments and turning them into guardian essence.
* Take an uncharged cell from the table and use the water portal talisman on the water guardian.
* Click the Water Altar.
* Leave the altar and speak to Apprentice Tamara.
* Place the cell you made on the cell tile.
* Speak to Apprentice Tamara.
* Power-up The Great Guardian.
* Upon completion of the tutorial, you will automatically exit and speak to Archmage Sedridor.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

* Talk to Jamila in Sophanem ([[File:Crafting shop icon.png]] icon on the minimap) to start the quest. 
* Read the message she gives you. 
* Make your way to the campsite, east of Sophanem, directly north of the small mining site by the cliffs.
**For a quicker journey, exit from the south-eastern gate in Sophanem.
**After entering the Necropolis for the first time, players with level 62 Agility can reach it once more by way of fairy ring using the code . 
* Talk to Maisa 
** If you have a Pharaoh's sceptre, commune with the obelisk directly north of the necropolis mine to allow teleportation back here, via the "Jaltevas" teleport option on the sceptre.
* Inspect the blocked entry at the Jaltevas Pyramid.
* Talk to either a citizen or Menaphite Guard.
* Fight the Head Menaphite Guard. Do not use Protect from Melee, or he will damage you for 1/3rd of your total hitpoints. Boosting prayers like piety can still be used.
*Talk to Maisa

* Go back to Maisa's camp and talk to her.
* If you need a tinderbox, you can search the camping equipment by the tent to get one. A spade can be found at the north side of the campsite.
* From the campsite, head south, east around the cliffs, and then north to a set of stairs to the Ruins of Ullek.
* Use the coal and tinderbox on the furnace (marked on the minimap) to ignite it.
* Search the well to receive a stone tablet. Read it.
** This is a good time to refill waterskins at the well. 
* Head back down the stairs and head south to the southernmost ritual pillar. Dig in front of it.
* Open the chest with the passcode "1118513".
* Return to the furnace with the scarab mould and iron bar, and craft a scarab emblem.
* Go further north to the pillar, and insert the emblem.
* Rotate the scarab on the emblem so that it faces downward (pincers facing upward).
* Climb down the stairs and defeat the two Scarab Mages. (Logging out will place you outside the cave.)
* Climb down the stairs again.
* Avoid the projectiles and run west to the junction, south, and east to the lever.
* Pull the lever at the end and run as fast as you can back to the junction, then follow the path north and east.
** Warning: There is approximately one minute before it resets the lever.
* At the other end, pull the other lever. If successful, the traps will be disabled.
* Go through the door west of the junction

* Inspect the south-western plaque to get four emblems.
* Inspect the north-western plaque and read it.
* The solution to the puzzle is different for everyone. Refer to the table below to solve this puzzle.
** – Place the emblem corresponding to item 1 in the centre-south urn.
**  – Place the emblem corresponding to item 2 in the southernmost urn.
**  – Place the emblem corresponding to god 1 in the northernmost urn and the emblem corresponding to god 2 in the centre-north urn.

* Pull the lever to the south-west and continue to the next area.
* Speak to the Spirit.
* Take the rusty key from the urn in the back of the room.

* Prepare for the next boss fight, who is best fought with ranged. Resupply now if necessary. (Make sure to either bring the rusty key or unlock the door first.)
* Return to the room where you faced the Scarab Mages, and open the door (it only needs to be unlocked once).
* Defeat the Champion of Scabaras. It will attack with magic, or melee when next to the player. It is recommended to use Protect from Magic and stay out of melee range of the boss. After several normal attacks, it will use one of three special attacks.
** Shadow Burst - The Champion will cast a shadow beneath itself, then proceed to send out a burst of shadow magic. This reaches for 4 tiles, and can hit over 40 damage multiple times (less if further away from the champion). It is advised to stay out of melee range of the Champion throughout the fight to avoid this attack, as you cannot freeze him.
** Shadow Rift - The Champion will summon a Shadow Rift within the arena. The rift has 20 Hitpoints and will explode, dealing 35+ damage, so it is recommended to quickly destroy it.
** Shadow Flames - The Champion will shout "We are children of the shadows!", and a poisonous scarab swarm will appear. The swarm has 5 hp, and leaves dark fire in its path, which will hurt when stood upon. It is advised to kill the swarm as fast as possible as the fire will linger and hinder movement if left unattended.
* Talk to the High Priest of Scabaras.

* Go to Nardah and talk to Maisa or Zahur in the building directly south of the fountain.
* If you don't already have raw beef or cooked meat, purchase one from the Nardah General Store.
* Head west until you reach the River Elid and see an island with lilies growing on it.
* Attempt to jump to the stepping stones, and throw the meat to the crocodile.
* Pick the Lily of the Elid.
* Go back to Zahur.
* Warm up her chemistry equipment by adjusting the individual heats until the overall temperature is at the marked level.
** Solution: Increase the middle and right-hand bars to their maximum capacities. Then drop the right-hand bar to half way. Finally, lower the middle bar until the puzzle is completed.
* Talk to Zahur to receive the cure crate then bring it to High Priest in Sophanem.
* Before leaving for the necropolis, gear up for a fight against a level-351 boss using melee equipment.

* Go to the necropolis and talk to Maisa, located directly south of the south-eastern gate of Sophanem by the bend in the path.
* At the end of the cutscene, defeat the Menaphite Akh. The Menaphite Akh attacks using melee, and will occasionally use special attacks. 
** When she twitches, she will perform a lightning bolt attack and direct it in front of her. This attack can hit 70+ if not evaded. Always be prepared to walk behind or beside her to avoid this attack.
** During the fight she will also summon a Menaphite Shadow that attacks with ranged or magic. Run to attack it quickly (but still watch out for the lightning attack). If not killed promptly, the shadow can switch places with the Akh, and the player must attack the real one or suffer large amounts of damage.
**If you leave the fight, speak to Osman just outside Maisa's camp to restart the fight. If players die during the fight, they can return here to reclaim their items.
* Go back to Sophanem and talk to Maisa or the High Priest.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

* Minigame Teleport to "Giants' Foundry"
* Speak to Kovac (strike the Hill Giant) in the Giants' Plateau. 
* Go inside the Giants' Foundry.
* Repair the polishing wheel, grindstone, and trip hammer using the required items.
* Speak to Kovac twice.
* Search the crate for items.
* Deposit all the items into the crucible (large bucket) hanging to the east by the bank. Different items are input separately.

* Speak to Kovac to learn how to select the moulds (in red text).
* Select the fitting mould Kovac described for the forte, blade and tip at the mould jig.
* Speak to Kovac again. He will tell you to pour the metal.
* Pour the metal from the crucible into the mould.
* Get a bucket of water (grab a bucket from the pile of buckets and use it on the waterfall), and pour it on the sword. You can also use ice gloves for this step. Your hands must be free to pick up the preform.
* Heat the preform to maximum by using it on the lava pool. The "Heat-preform" option will increase the heat by small increments, while the "Dunk-preform" option will heat it faster. The temperature should be red.
* Hit the preform with the Trip Hammer repaired earlier, repeating until progress bar is onto the yellow section. Be sure to keep the temperature in the red while doing this, otherwise the quality of the sword will decrease. Using the Trip Hammer will cool the preform.
* Cool the preform using the waterfall until its temperature is almost green. The "Cool-preform" option will cool the preform slowly, while the "Quench-preform" option cools is more quickly.
* Use the preform on Grindstone repaired earlier, repeating until progress is onto green section. Be sure to watch the temperature as the Grindstone will heat the preform during use.
* Cool the preform in the waterfall until its temperature is high green.
* Use the preform on the Polishing Wheel, repeating until the sword is complete. The Polishing Wheel will cool the preform during use, so be sure to watch the temperature.
* Speak to Kovac.
*Congratulations, quest complete!

*Speak to the Bank Camel by using a camulet on it and going through the dialogue options until it requests you to "restore what is lost". 
* Complete the following in any order:
** Use a bucket of water on the scarab dung to get a dawn scarab egg.
*** Bring the dawn scarab egg to the High Priest of Scabaras beneath the Ruins of Ullek.
** Use the big banana on Awowogei.
** Use the eldritch ashes on the High Priest of Sophanem.
** With a spade and the fang, dig at the island where players acquired the Lily of the Elid during Beneath Cursed Sands.
*Speak to the Bank Camel with the camulet again for the key.

* Talk to the Cook in Lumbridge Castle's kitchen. 
*Pick up a pot from next to the Cook.
*Buy a compost from Fayeth at the farming patch west of the castle. Empty the compost to receive a bucket.
*Run north to Fred the Farmer and grab the Egg that spawns in front of his house.
*Head north to the Mill Lane Mill next to the cow pens and pick some grain from outside. Climb up to the top floor of the mill and use the grain with the hopper, then pull the lever. Climb down and take the flour from the flour bin with an empty pot.
*Run north into the cow pen and milk the dairy cow.
*Begin casting Lumbridge Home Teleport as soon as the milk appears in your inventory, and run to the cook.
*Talk to the Cook.

*Go upstairs in Morgan's house and open the cupboard. Then go back downstairs.
*Decide on which weapon to use for the final fight. The most viable options are:
**Goblin paint cannon, a 3-tick Melee weapon without stats. It is fast and the quickest to obtain as it can be bought from Diango together with the Chronicle, but not as powerful as the other options. Potentially the fastest option.
**Adamant sword, the strongest option. While the strongest option, it takes the longest to obtain as it has to be bought in the Varrock Sword Shop.
**Training Bow, a Ranged alternative which can be claimed from the Ranged combat tutor along the path to the general store.

*Talk to Morgan in Draynor Village about a vampyre. 
*Go upstairs in Morgan's house and take garlic from the cupboard.
*Go back downstairs and run to Diango in Draynor Village Market and purchase a Chronicle and a Teleport Card.
**If choosing to fight Count Draynor with melee using a Goblin paint cannon, buy it from Diango now (Skip claiming the bow and arrows from the Ranged combat tutor later on).
**Use the Teleport Card on the Chronicle to give it 1 charge.
*Teleport using the chronicle to go to the Champions Guild.
**If choosing to fight Count Draynor with melee using an adamant sword, buy it from the sword shop across the street from the Blue Moon Inn now (Skip claiming the bow and arrows from the Ranged combat tutor later on).
*Go to the Blue Moon Inn and buy a beer from the Bartender. 
*Talk to Dr Harlow . After he asks for a beer the second time, you can safely click out of the dialogue.
*Talk to Dr Harlow again and receive a stake.
*Cast Lumbridge Home Teleport and go to the Ranged combat tutor and claim items.
*After receiving your Training Bow purchase a hammer from the Lumbridge General Store.
*Run to Draynor Manor and enter through the back entrance.
**Make sure to equip your bow and arrows or Goblin paint cannon while running there.
**The back door entrance is on the south-east side of Draynor Manor and leads directly into the kitchen.
*Go downstairs directly next to the kitchen.
*Open the coffin and kill Count Draynor. (You do not need to use the hammer/stake on him. Just kill him with them in your inventory)
**This part is RNG dependent. It is recommended to put your bow on Rapid and activate Hawk Eye prayer or your Goblin paint cannon on Accurate and activate Improved Reflexes prayer.

*Talk to Veronica. 
*Start moving towards the door and drop the two tuna in your inventory.
*Pick up the fish food on the, in the room south of the stairs containing the ghost.
*Pick up poison from the room south of the kitchen, on the west side of the .
*Use the fish food on the poison to make poisoned fish food.
*Search the bookcase on the western .
*Climb down the ladder and complete the lever puzzle.
**Pull levers B then A down.
**Pull lever D down.
**Pull levers B, then A up.
**Pull levers E, then F down.
**Pull lever C down.
**Pull lever E up.
**Pick up the oil can.
***Finish the Energy Potion at any point while completing the long runs to follow.
*Go up the ladder and pull the lever to exit the bookcases.
*Pick up the spade in the far eastern room on the .
*Exit out the back door in the same room.
*Go north around the back of the manor to the west to the compost heap.
*Search the compost heap to get a key.
*Drop the spade to save run energy
*Go south and use the poisoned fish food on the fountain in the south-west corner of the grounds.
*Search the poisoned fountain to retrieve a pressure gauge. (There is dialogue here while searching so hold space bar). 	
*Return to the manor and pick up the rubber tube in the room north of the stairs on the containing an aggressive skeleton.
*Climb up the stairs, then climb up the spiral staircase to the west.
*Talk to Professor Oddenstein. 
*Talk to him again to give him the items.
* Once Oddenstein has stopped talking, change your attack style to skip Ernest's dialogue and instantly complete the quest.

*Talk to Aris just south-west of Varrock Square.
*Note: Make sure you note down the incantation said during the cutscene! The order will also change with every reset. The speedrunning timer will not start until the cutscene ends.
**It can be helpful to note the sequence dialogue option numbers corresponding to the incantation as well: 1 - Carlem; 2 - Aber; 3 - Camerinthum; 4 - Purchai; 5 - Gabindo. 
*Run north to the Varrock Castle past the courtyard, dropping your tuna on the way there.
*Talk to Sir Prysin in the south-west room of the castle with the training dummy. 
*Run north-west to the corner of the castle and take the stairs upwards two times to the, then talk to Captain Rovin to receive the first key , then climb back down to the .
*Run to the kitchen to the north-east, then climb up the western stairs, grab the bucket on the floor two tiles east, and climb back downstairs.
*Use the bucket on the kitchen sink to fill it up, and then use the bucket of water on the drain outside of the kitchen wall. Drop the bucket and run southwards through the castle to the eastern entrance.
*Climb down the manhole to the Varrock Sewers east of the castle, outside the wall.
*Follow the path slightly west, then start running north. While running, select Soul Wars from the Grouping tab and drink an energy potion. Drop any empty vials. Continue down to the end and pick up the rusty key from the floor. Hit space bar quickly to dismiss the dialogue when picking up the key.
**The rusty key can be hard to spot. It is located in the first divot to the west, before the water, on a pentagon-shaped tile.
*Teleport to Soul Wars using the Grouping (minigame) tab.
*Use the Soul Wars bank chest to deposit both the rusty key and first key.
*Exit the portal to Edgeville . Enter Edgeville Dungeon through the trapdoor in the south-eastern corner of the building directly south of the Edgeville bank.
*Drink another energy potion and drop the vials. You should now have 25 empty inventory spaces, coins, and 2 energy potions.
*Run briefly north, and collect the three bones against the walls.
**The bones are located in the south-west corner, slightly north along the wall, and just east before the northern passage. Turn your camera to see the bones in the south-west corner if you are having difficulty.
*Run east to reach a small room with 3 Giant rats and four bone spawns. Pick them up and prepare to hop worlds. Be careful not to attack the Giant rats as you will not be able to world-hop immediately!
**The four bone spawns include two to the north, one to the west, and one to the east.
**Note: The timer does not stop when hopping worlds.
*Hop worlds and continue to collect the 4 bones until you have 25. Immediately use Lumbridge Home Teleport.
*Run west through the Lumbridge Castle to get to Draynor Village, drinking any extra energy potions and dropping empty vials if you can. 
*While running/walking to Draynor Village bank, set up your offensive quick prayers such as Superhuman Strength and Improved Reflexes. Walk for approximately 8-10 seconds since the weight of the bones will drain run energy faster. Keeping 5-10 run energy by walking here is recommended if you want more consistent timing against the fight with Delrith while resetting aggression from the Dark wizards.
*Use the Draynor Village bank and withdraw both the rusty key and first key.
*Run to Diango and drop 3 bones before trading with him.
*Buy a Chronicle and two teleport cards. Add the teleport charges to the Chronicle and wield it. 
*Drop your coins, then pick up the 3 bones you dropped.
**You should now have a Chronicle with 2 charges wielded, the rusty key and first key, 25 bones, and you may have 1 energy potion left.
*Run to the Wizards' Tower directly south of Draynor Village bank.
*Climb the spiral staircase once upwards to the , then talk to Wizard Traiborn in the eastern room. . 
*Use one of the bones on him to complete the delivery.
*As soon as you get the third key, use your wielded Chronicle to teleport to the Champions' Guild.
*Run back to Sir Prysin in Varrock Palace in the south-west room with the training dummy. Talk to him; a brief stall will occur while he gets retrieves it from the cabinet nearby. He will give you Silverlight and it will automatically equip.
*Teleport with the wielded Chronicle once again to the Champions' Guild and begin running east.
**The upcoming fight takes place in a single-way combat zone. Any attack by the Dark wizards will prevent you from attacking Delrith. Read below for more information, and be prepared to reset aggression multiple times if needed.
*Run to the Stone Circle south of Varrock. Stay to the south.
*Activate your quick prayers when you get close to the stone circle. Run along the eastern edge of the southern-most section of the circle, on top of the stones, to begin a cutscene. Complete all cutscene dialogue or you will have to re-watch it!
*Initiate combat with Delrith while avoiding the Dark wizards.
**If you are attacked by a Dark wizard, you can leave the cutscene area and reenter to lose aggression. See the image below for the best tiles. 
*As soon as you can, select Banish on Delrith, and then recite the incantation you learned in the initial cutscene.

** If choosing to use an adamant sword, buy it from the Varrock Swordshop now (Skip buying the studded armour, bow, and arrows later on).
*Talk to Guildmaster in Champions' Guild.

**Optional: Adamant sword - From Horvik's Armour Shop buy a studded body and studded chaps. Don't equip until after Melzar's Maze.

*Run to the Lumberyard, buy 3 planks and 100 steel nails.
*Teleport to Falador, buy a wizard's mind bomb from the Rising Sun Inn 
*Run to the Estate Agent and buy a house 
*Teleport outside of your player-owned house, then run north-west to Melzar's Maze, drop the construction guide. Drop the maze key after entering.
*Kill the small zombie rat with a long tail (melee/ranged works best) to get the key and enter the north-western door and climb up the ladder.
*Kill the ghost wearing a hood, a tube top, and no cape (Crumble Undead works best) to get the key and enter the second door from the north on the eastern wall and climb up the ladder.
*Kill the skeleton with the round shield (Crumble Undead works best) to get the key and enter the westmost door on the southern wall and climb down the ladder 3 times.
*Kill the zombies (Crumble Undead works best) to get the key and enter the blue door.
*Kill Melzar the Mad (melee/ranged works best) to get the key and enter the purple (magenta) door. Consider flicking Eagle Eye/Ultimate Strength + Incredible Reflexes to help kill him faster.
*Kill the lesser demon with Water Blast to get the key and enter the green door (finish the kill with melee/ranged if needed). Search the chest for the map part.
*Teleport to House, run south-east and take the bronze pickaxe from on top of the table in the building.
**Adamant sword - Equip studded body and chaps if purchased earlier. 
*Run north to Rimmington Mine and mine 1 clay, then use your bucket of water on it. Drop the empty bucket and pickaxe.
**Maple shortbow - Drop any remaining chaos runes you have.
**Adamant sword - Keep the chaos runes to use against Wormbrain, then drop them after grabbing his map part.
*From Gerrant's Fishy Business, buy a lobster pot.
*Run south to the Port Sarim jail. Kill Wormbrain with ranged/bolt spells and Telekinetic Grab his map part. 
*Talk to Klarense in the southern docks of Port Sarim by the Void Outpost boat and pay him 2,000 coins. 
*Go on board, climb down the ladder and repair the hole 3 times.
*Teleport to Lumbridge, head toward the cemetery while dropping your remaining coins, any remaining nails and your hammer.
*Talk to Count Check and have him teleport you 
*At Barbarian Village use the pottery wheel to make an unfired bowl.
*Run to the Oracle on Ice Mountain 
*Enter the Dwarven mine and use silk, lobster pot, unfired bowl, wizard's mind bomb on the magic door at the north-east side of the mine. You should automatically enter the door.
*Enter the magic door, open the chest, and search the chest to receive a map part. Press space or ensure that you finish the dialogue.
*Teleport to Lumbridge, drop your empty beer glass. Run to Draynor Village.
*Talk to Ned with the map in your inventory. 
**Optional: Consider withdrawing more lobsters from the bank.
*Teleport to House and return to the boat you previously repaired in Port Sarim. Board the ship and talk to Captain Ned. 
*Climb on top of the volcano and enter the hole.
*Head south and kill Elvarg. 
** Maple shortbow - Pray Protect from Magic and Eagle Eye, and alternate equipping your shield when Elvarg attacks in between bow shots to avoid taking high damage from the dragonfire. Stepping under her after attacking will give you more time to equip the shield.
** Adamant sword - Equip your anti-dragon shield, and pray Protect from Magic, Ultimate Strength, and Incredible Reflexes.
** Note: If you are not finished with the fight by 17:50:00, you will have to restart the speedrun.
*Teleport to Falador as soon as Elvarg dies, before the animation of removing her head. Run to Edgeville.
*Talk to Oziach in Edgeville.

* Head north to the Mill Lane Mill and pick some grain outside. Climb up to the top floor of the mill and use the grain with the hopper, then pull the lever. Climb down and take the flour from the flour bin with the pot.

** – Place the emblem corresponding to god 1 in the northernmost urn and the emblem corresponding to god 2 in the centre-north urn.

* At the end of the cutscene, defeat the Menaphite Akh. The Menaphite Akh attacks using melee, and will occasionally use special attacks. 
** When she twitches, she will perform a lightning bolt attack and direct it in front of her. This attack can hit 70+ if not evaded. Always be prepared to walk behind or beside her to avoid this attack.
** During the fight she will also summon a Menaphite Shadow that attacks with ranged or magic. Run to attack it quickly (but still watch out for the lightning attack). If not killed promptly, the shadow can switch places with the Akh, and the player must attack the real one or suffer large amounts of damage.

Tip: Whenever a Vyrewatch is nearby, open a chat interface by attempting to activate the Augury prayer while pathing to your desired destination. When an interface is open the Vyrewatch will not stop you.

* Read Flaygian's notes.
* Search the nearby crates to find a silver sickle (b) and a chain.
* Attach the emerald to the sickle to create an emerald sickle (b).
* Use the enchant emerald or jade tablet on it.
* Use the chain on the Rod of Ivandis to create the Ivandis flail.
* Equip the flail and speak to Safalaan.
* Make your way to Ver Sinhaza, and resupply at the bank if necessary.
* Speak to Kael Forshaw .
* Defeat Ranis Drakan. He will use melee and magic attacks that can hit up to 20. He can also cast Blood Barrage, which can heal him for half of the damage dealt. Occasionally, he will charge an attack and explode, hitting up to 30. The damage can be reduced by running away from him when he is charging the attack.
**After he reaches 65% and 25% of his health, he'll summon two level 87 vyrewatch and will fly airborne. He will regularly launch blood bombs at your current square, which can hit up to 30; you can simply walk backwards one square to lure the vyrewatch to the affected square, so the bombs hurt them instead.
**After killing them, he will go berserk and attack the player. During this last phase, his attacks are much faster and accurate, but only have a max hit of 6. Using Protect from Melee will easily defeat him in the last phase.
* Speak to Safalaan at Old Man Ral's house.

* Talk to Veliaf Hurtz. 
*Talk to Hameln the Jester inside the church. 
*Talk to Carl in the pub south-east of the church. 
*Inspect the barrel south of the pub to follow Carl to his supplier.
** Go through the church and hide at the north doors, wait there until he passes the doors.
** Proceed to the hollow tree just north of the graves, and hide on the eastern side.
** When he reaches the centre square of the town, hide at the northern side of the hollow tree directly next to the gallows.
** Once he approaches the graveyard, hide at the western side of the hollow tree.
*After the cutscene, kill Kroy with the abyssal whip. Use Protect from Magic and Piety, and dodge his potion-throw attack.
*Destroy both lab tables.
*Leave the lab by clicking the southern gate.
*Talk to Veliaf in the Slepe church graveyard. 
*Home teleport to Lumbridge.
*Run to Bob's Axes and purchase a Steel axe.
* Use the ectophial and run westward to Paterdomus
* Talk to Veliaf Hurtz at Paterdomus. 
* Use the ectophial and run westwards to Fenkenstrain's Castle.
* Talk to Ivan Strom south of the castle.
* After the cutscene, run westwards to the Canifis General Store.
* At the store, purchase a hammer, chisel, and knife. Sell your Bandos tassets (the coins are needed later).
* Return to east of Paterdomus and talk to Ivan. 
** Cut three vines from the swamp tree to the north-east.
** Use the vines on each other to make a long vine.
** Use the long vine on the swamp tree branch.
** Swing across the water and continue the trek.
** Kill the Nail beasts, use food on Ivan if his health becomes too low, and continue the trek.
** Chop three logs and use them on the bridge.
** Cross the bridge and continue the trek. Keep the axe!
** Before the dialogue ends, attack the easternmost Vampyre (the one in-front of Ivan) so that it doesn't attack Ivan. Use your Ivandis Flail.
** Continue the trek to end up in Burgh de Rott.
** Talk to Ivan and complete the dialogue to send him to the boathouse.
* Head south-east of Burgh de Rott to the boat house and talk to Ivan Strom.
* Board the boat and head to the Icyene graveyard. 
* After the cutscene, finish the dialogue with Vanescula Drakan.
* Unlock the mausoleum door north of you using this external website. Input the numbers as seen in-game.
* Talk to everyone in this order:
** Vertida Sefalatis.
** Kael Forshaw.
** Radigad Ponfit.
** Polmafi Ferdygris.
** Ivan Strom.
** Veliaf Hurtz.
* Finish the conversation with Vanescula Drakan.
* Use Drakan's medallion to teleport to Ver Sinhaza.
* Exit westwards and purchase the vyrewatch outfit from Trader Sven.
* Equip the vyrewatch outfit to minimise the chances of vyrewatch disruption.
* Run to the laboratory entrance, using the shortcut doors on the rooftop route.
* Head downstairs to the laboratory entrance (south-eastwards from the mine, in the house with the slashed tapestry)
* Re-equip your Bandos armour and primordial boots, then talk to Safalaan. 
* Kill the Mutated Bloodveld.
* Talk to Safalaan again.
* Search the bookshelf on the western wall inside the room filled with mutated bloodvelds.
* Talk to Safalaan. 
* Teleport to Ver Sinhaza, then exit westwards.
* Climb the wall at the south-west corner, climb the floor, and then the rocks to reach the boat.
* Board the boat. 
* Talk to Veliaf at the eastern part of the graveyard.
* Teleport to Ver Sinhaza, and go down the trapdoor in Old Man Ral's house to the west.
* Talk to Polmafi Ferdygris. 
* Return to the Icyene Graveyard via the Meiyerditch boat. 
* Talk to Vanescula Drakan.
* Use the ectophial and travel to Slepe via Andras up north.
* Wield your Ivandis Flail if you haven't already, and drink a dose of your superantipoison.
* Talk to Veliaf at the graveyard. 
* Kill Damien Leucurte. Use Protect from Magic and Piety, and stomp out the magical fires that periodically spawn.
* Talk to Veliaf.
* Use the ectophial and travel to Slepe via Andras up north.
* Upon arrival, return to the Icyene Graveyard via the other boat. 
* Talk to Vanescula Drakan.
* Wear the vyre noble clothing.
* Teleport to Ver Sinhaza. 
* Bank to clear 8 inventory spaces by depositing your potions and food. Keep the axe.
* Ask the vyrewatch by the bank to send you to the mines. 
* Talk to a Vampyre Juvinate to exit the mine.
* Go through the crack north of the mining hole.
* Head to the Arboretum. (The tree icon east of the bank in Darkmeyer.)
* Finish the dialogue with the guard Desmodus Lasiurus.
* Head to the house with a water symbol north-east of the furnace, along the east wall near the crack. 
* Talk to Mordan Nikazsi.
* Head to the prison in the northern part of Darkmeyer, north of the Arboretum.
* Talk to Maria Gadderanks.
* Talk to Desmodus Lasiurus.
* Enter the Arboretum.
* Search the toppled shelves for an old note.
* Read it, and take note of how many gallons the tree requires to be cut. Set the north and south valve to the given values in accordance to the table below.

* Cut eight blisterwood logs.
* Use the ectophial and travel to Slepe via Andras up north, then sail back to the Icyene Graveyard via the Slepe dock up north. 
* Speak to Veliaf/Vanescula.
* Teleport to Ver Sinhaza.
* Exit westwards, and go down the trapdoor in Old Man Ral's house.
* Talk to Vertida Sefalatis and give him 7 Blisterwood logs.
* Create the blisterwood flail.
** Search the nearby crate for a silver sickle (b).
** Use the ruby on the sickle.
** Use the enchant ruby or topaz tablet on the ruby sickle (b).
** Use the blisterwood log on the enchanted ruby sickle (b).
** Use the Ivandis flail on the blisterwood sickle.
* Teleport to Ver Sinhaza. Withdraw the adamant darts and combat supplies from the bank. Do not deposit your coins.
* Use the ectophial and travel to Slepe via Andras up north, then go back to the Icyene Graveyard via the Slepe dock. 
* Talk to Veliaf Hurtz.
* Talk to Safalaan Hallow, north-east of the graveyard. 
* After the cutscene, kill Vanstrom Klause whilst using Protect from Magic and Piety. He uses three special attacks, doing so every 8-10 attacks, and never uses the same one twice in a row.
**"My pets will feast on your corpse!" - Acidic Bloodveld is spawned and will explode on the player for high damage. Use your adamant darts to kill it quickly.
**"Blood will be my strength!" - A blood orb spawns that periodically heals Vanstrom. Walking on top of it (3x3 area) damages the player, but Vanstrom can be lured on top to damage him.
**"Stare into darkness!" - Heavy damage is taken if the player is facing Vanstrom. The attack gives very little warning and is near impossible to avoid on reaction. It is recommended that the player keep a count of how many attacks Vanstrom has done and turn around preemptively. 
**After you deplete his health, he will heal himself 200 hitpoints and stop using his special attacks.
***Protection prayers are no longer effective; use Piety and Redemption.
***Vanstrom summons lightning to strike tiles with a max hit of 46. Tiles that are about to be struck will have a dark circle on them and should be avoided.
*Watch the cutscene to complete the quest.

* Start the quest by searching the tent for Kasonde's journal (Fairy ring with code and head south east). 
* Read the journal.
* Search the camping equipment to receive secateurs.
* Climb down the nearby hole.
* Search the stone table labelled "1" in the image below to receive the first stone tablet.
The Garden of Death - campsite dungeon searchable objects.png
* Read the stone tablet and take the note to receive the word translations scroll. 
* Read the word translations scroll and click "Attempt Translation". Input the following words and press enter for each: Island, Water, Time, Vessel, North.
* Climb-up the rope to exit the hole.
* Travel to Lake Molch via Boaty and select Molch Island. (Fairy ring with code  and head west.) 
* Enter the hole on Molch Island.
* Inspect the vines for a dirty note.
* Cut the vines with your secateurs and squeeze through them.
* Search the stone table labelled "1" in the image below to receive the second stone tablet.
The Garden of Death - Lake Molch Island searchable objects.png
* Read the stone tablet, then input the following words on the word translations scroll: West, Poison, Body, Food, Earth.
* Climb-up the rope to exit the hole.
* Travel to Xeric's Shrine.
** Board Boaty and select Molch. 
** Run west and then slightly south to the altar.
* Enter the hole at Xeric's Shrine.
* Search the stone table labelled "1" in the image below to receive the third stone tablet.
The Garden of Death - Xeric's Shrine searchable objects.png
* Read the stone tablet, then input the following words on the word translations scroll: Make, Yes, No, Move, Arrive, East, South.
* Make your way to the Ruins of Morra. Enter the hole there.
* Search the stone table labelled "1" in the image below to receive the final stone tablet.
The Garden of Death - Ruins of Morra searchable objects.png
