* Speak to Attala near the temple entrance at the southern base of Ralos' Rise to start the quest.
* Climb the rocks to the northeast (requires 47 agility) or walk back up Ralos' Rise and kill the Sulphur Nagua at the southeast ledge.
* Return to Attala. Cross the drawbridge and enter Cam Torum.
* Go directly north and attempt to speak with Jessamine.  A guard will interrupt you.  Speak with Jessamine in the northern part of the city. .
* Pass through the entrance to the north into the Neypotzli dungeon.  
* Speak to Attala, Zuma, and Jessamine, in that order.

* Take from the crate of building supplies just west of Jessamine. You will receive a hammer, saw, and three Building supplies.
* You will need to build the three camp sites by going through the various entrances in the corners of the dungeon.  Note that camp spots are marked on your mini map as a cooking range icon:
** Ancient Prison
*** Pass through the southwestern entrance in the dungeon
*** Be aware of the level 98 Sulphur Nagua in this area.  Protect from Melee will negate damage.
*** Run south, then west, then north through the large hallway to the northwest corner
*** Build the camp spot and return back to the Antechamber. You will need to go back the way you came in.
** Streambound Cavern
*** Pass through the northeastern entrance in the dungeon
*** Go north, then east across the bridge.  Follow the trail up the south stairs.  The camp spot is just south of the stairs.
*** Build the camp spot and return back to the Antechamber.  You will need to go back the way you came in.
** Earthbound Cavern
*** Pass through the northwestern entrance in the dungeon
*** Follow the trail west then south down the stairs.
*** Build the camp spot and return back to the Antechamber.  You can now drop the hammer and saw.

* Speak to Attala in the Antechamber to receive a Water talisman and Earth talisman
* Exit the Neypotzli to the south.  Go south to the magic shop and speak to Nahta.
* Go northeast to the furnace and speak to the blacksmith .
* Return to Attala in the Neypotzli to the north.
* Use the two infused talismans to locate Eyatlalli.  The direction in which the earth and water talismans point—north/south or east/west—is different for each player. You may need to enter one of the chambers in the 4 corners. You may also need to enter the ancient shrine, which is accessible through either the streambound cavern or the ancient prison.   Keep using the talisman until Eyatlalli appears. Like hot/cold clues.
** This location varies from player to player
* Return to the Antechamber and attempt to speak to any of the three.  Eyatlalli will appear again.  After the dialogue ends, speak with Eyatlalli again.

* Go to the Streambound Cavern to the northeast. Follow the path to the camp spot.
* Optionally, grab supplies from the Supply crate or make a cup of tea to restore run energy at the Cooking stove.
* Collect from a Grubby sapling to the east of the camp spot.  Use the Moonlight grub on a Pestle and mortar to receive a Moonlight grub paste
* Go to the river southeast of the camp spot, and fish the fishing spot up the stairs on the bridge to catch a Raw bream. Use a knife on the bream to receive Bream scales.
* Walk north down the stairs, and enter the small entrance.
* Walk west to reach some rocks that you can trap.  Click on 2 separate rocks to set a trap and then Rustle a bush to trap a moss lizard. 
* Pick up the Raw moss lizard.  Use a knife on the lizard to receive a Moss lizard tail.
* Exit the Earthbound Cavern to return to the Antechamber. 
* Speak to Eyatlalli with the three items to begin the ritual.

* Prepare to battle three Moons of Peril located in the three chambers of the dungeon. The southeastern entrance is inaccessible.
* During the boss fights, you will need to stand in the highlighted circle to safely deal damage to the boss.  The highlighted circle occasionally changes in a clockwise direction.
* When the highlighted circle reaches the full and empty moon circles, the boss will use one of their unique special attacks.
* Each boss has a melee attack style that they are weak to.  However, high level players may not find this to be an issue.  The Moons have very high magic and range defence and are immune to poison and venom.  Damage cannot be negated with protection prayers.
* Damage dealt during a special attack phase counts towards the overall boss damage.
* After a boss fight ends, you will be teleported to a camp in another chamber so you can quickly move onto the next encounter.
** The Blue Moon
*** Note: This boss is weak to crush
*** Enter the northwestern chamber and follow the trail past the camp spot.  Go east past the camp spot until you reach another entrance to enter the boss encounter.
*** The Blue Moon uses two special attacks:
**** Weapon freeze - The Moon unequips your weapon and puts it in a block of ice. Punch the ice to deal damage to release it. The Moon will periodically spawn ice spikes on the floor around the block of ice which must be avoided by stepping off of them.
**** Brazier - The Moon extinguishes the two braziers at the edges of the room, similar to the braziers in Wintertodt. Run to each brazier in the room and reignite it while avoiding the moving tornadoes that deal damage and turn off your run energy.
** The Blood Moon
*** Note: This boss is weak to slash
*** Enter the southwestern chamber and follow the path to the boss entrance.
*** The Blood Moon uses two special attacks:
**** Raining Blood - The Moon will disappear and rain blood from above, forming pools of blood throughout the room. Move off of the blood pools on the floor to avoid standing on them.
**** Blood Jaguar - Blood jaguars spawn around the room, along with a damaging square of blood pools. Run to Eyatlalli's glyph and attack the jaguar. Damage taken by stepping onto the pool too early or not stepping out of the jaguar's attack range will heal the Blood Moon for 3x the damage taken.
** The Eclipse Moon
*** Note: This boss is weak to stab
*** Enter the northeastern chamber and follow the path to the boss entrance.
*** The Eclipse Moon uses two special attacks:
**** Eclipse Shield - The Moon will spawn a moon shield and begins attacking rapidly with rays of light. Keep the moon shield between you and the boss to prevent damage from the attacks. The shield will move quickly around the boss in a circle.
**** Mimic - You are teleported to the centre of the room and frozen in place. Clones of the Moon will spawn around you, attacking you. You must face your character toward each clone as it spawns to prevent damage. One method is to click the tile below each clone as it spawns.  Reacting to the clone has no delay so it is advised to use your strongest weapon (Crystal Halberd), no matter the speed.

* After defeating the three Moons, return to the Antechamber.
* Speak to all three in the Antechamber.
* Speak to Eyatlalli to finish the quest.

* A pickaxe,
* A lockpick,
* An unpowered orb,
* Runes to cast an enchantment spell (3 cosmic runes and 30 elemental runes).
* An axe and machete to access the Kharazi Jungle, unless using the level 79 Agility shortcut.
* A spade, if doing a master clue scroll.

* Speak to Ivy Sophista in Taverley, in the building where the crystal chest is found. 
* Climb up the ladder to the east and speak with Thaerisk.
* Kill the two assassins that appear. Pray Protect from Missiles. Every few attacks the assassin that attacks you will say and launch an arrow towards you; swap to Protect from Melee after the arrow lands, and then focus back on the assassin.
** Note that there is currently a small glitch where the player may not be able to attack the second assassin, so let Thaerisk kill him off if this occurs. Thaerisk cannot die during this fight.
* Finish the conversation with Thaerisk.

* Head to the Fight Arena just north of Yanille.
* Speak to the Khazard Launderer at the laundry house, two buildings north of the Fight Arena Bar. Charm the launderer with either the ring of Charos(a) or bribe him with 500 coins for information on Movario. 
* Head to Feldip Hills (fairy ring code ), and talk to the Hunting Expert . ( if you're 99 Hunter)
* Set up a pit trap to the west and bait it.
* Dismantle the trap to receive an unconscious broav, then return to the expert to have her train it.
* With the trained broav, head to the run-down house in the battlefield  where a broken table will be found. Drop the broav and use the dirty shirt on the broav; once it *squeals*, you will be able to right-click "Search" on the broken table.
* Climb-down the trapdoor to Movario's base.
* Run north-west, and search the open chest for a number of runes.
* Climb down the stairs.
* Inspect the old battered door, and pay close attention to the word "PROHIBITED"; one of the letters is stylised after a rune, which is the rune you must use to open the door, which is different for every player. 
**Warning: Using an incorrect rune will result in the door dealing 20+ damage to you. However, if you do choose incorrectly, the spell's colour indicates the correct rune:

* Upon using the correct rune, open the door. NOTE: You must be above a certain weight. If you're wearing graceful/weight-reducing items, unequip them.
* Once inside, search the bookcases until the chatbox indicates that you hear a click as you pull a lever (or an audible click sound).
* From that initial bookcase, follow the floor wires that illuminate to search the subsequent bookcase, continuing to do so until the chatbox indicates the electric gate deactivating.
* Open the gate which is no longer electrified. Right-click search the spiral staircase to disable the trap, and then climb the spiral staircase.
* Search the desk to obtain Movario's notes (volume 1), and read through it (22 pages) (do not interact with the Treasure pile to the north west as it will deal 20+ damage to you).
* Pick up the waste-paper basket next to the desk, then search it for a ruby key.
* Use the key on the north-western most bookcase in the room, against the west wall.
* Climb the staircase and search the bed, then use the ruby key on the bed chest.
*  Search the bed chest to disable the trap, then attempt to open the bed chest. If you don't do this you will get hit for 18+ damage.
* Search the bed chest again, then open it for Movario's notes (volume 2); read through it.
* Head back downstairs and head to the southern side of the room and inspect the painting on the wall, pull the lever and cross over the broken wall.
* Inside, search the drawers to obtain some notes on pressure, and read through it.
* Check the pressure gauge, which displays a number in the unit of "tickits"; this value represents how much you weighed upon entering the room with the wires in the beginning.
* Check your weight in the Equipment Stats interface, and take from the pile of weights nearby with 1kg, 2kg, and 5kg being available.
* Pick out the weights as needed to match the pressure gauge's value. If you weigh more than the required tickit, place weights on the statue in the room by the desk. If you weigh less, pick up weights and keep it in the inventory. 
**If you weigh 11 kg, and the pressure gauge says 9 tickits. You need to pick up a 2 kg stone and place it on the stone statue. If the pressure gauge says 13 kg and you weigh 11 kg, pick up a 2 kg rock and keep it in your inventory.
* Exit via the eastern door and leave the base (you will be attacked by the Elite Khazard Guards again upon exit).

* Return to Thaerisk in Taverley with both volumes of Movario's notes.
* Head to McGrubor's Wood (fairy ring code ).
* Head to the building by way of the loose railing to the east to view a cutscene.
* Defeat the mercenaries and speak to Idria.
* Head to White Knights' Castle and speak to Akrisae who is on the ground floor to the east, until you receive a teleorb from him.
* Speak to Akrisae to receive a one-time teleport to Draynor Village. 
* Use the teleorb on any shady strangers in the vicinity. One can be found just south of Diango's Toy Store.
* After planting the teleorb, return back to White Knights' Castle and speak to Akrisae.
* After the cutscene, finish the conversation with Thaerisk and obtain the snapdragon seed from him, then accept his offer to teleport you to Port Sarim. 
* Head west to Betty's Magic Emporium. Purchase a pink dye from Betty in exchange for 20 coins. 
* Use the pink dye on the lantern lens for a rose-tinted lens.
* Speak to Betty again. 
* Stand in the doorway of the shop and use the lens on the counter to enrich the snapdragon seed.
* Take-from the counter to pick up the enriched snapdragon seed.
* Travel back to Falador and climb up the westernmost stairs of the castle all the way to the top.
* Plant the enriched snapdragon seed at the special patch.

* Speak to Idria.
* Cast NPC Contact and contact Turael, Mazchna, Cyrisus, and Duradel each; choose the option regarding Lucien. You can also go and visit Turael, Mazchna, and Duradel in person if necessary, though NPC Contact is needed for Cyrisus.
* Return to the White Knights' Castle and harvest the enriched snapdragon.
* Speak to Thaerisk and he'll give you some truth serum.
* Use the enriched snapdragon on the serum to create the super truth serum.
* You will now need to obtain charcoal and papyrus from the drawers just south of the jail cell.
* Enter the jail cell and use the super truth serum on the shady stranger.
* Once you create a suspect sketch, exit the jail cell and give it to Idria.
* Head to the Warriors' Guild and recruit Ghommal, Harrallak Menarous, and Sloane by asking about Lucien.
** Ghommal and Harrallak can be found right by the guild's entrance, whilst Sloane can be found one floor above to the north-east through the heavy door.
* Optional: If you do not already have a disguise to enter the Black Knights' Fortress, you can buy a bronze med helm and iron chainbody from the Warrior Guild Armoury on the while here.

* Return to Akrisae at the White Knights' Castle in Falador. Watch the ensuing cutscene with Hazelmere, then finish the conversation with Akrisae and accept his offer to teleport you to Black Knights' Fortress. If you didn't accept the teleport, Mind Altar Teleport, combat bracelet teleport to the Edgeville Monastery, and Lassar Teleport are the fastest ways to get there.
* Equip the disguise you brought (bronze med helm and iron chainbody or a black armour set) to enter the Black Knights' Fortress.
* Push the hidden wall directly ahead and climb down the ladder.
* Head south towards the tiled flooring, and inspect the carved tile with an orb symbol on it.
* Cast any charged orb spell on the carved tile, and enter the trapdoor to access the Black Knight Catacombs.
* Head immediately north to the western, broken bridge whilst praying Protect from Missiles, then jump across it.
* Pray Protect from Melee and kill the Elite Black Knight that is accompanied by Elite Dark Warriors until you have a full set of elite black armour.
* Wear the armour, then run to the north-east path and climb up the wall to the second level.
* Head north and around the barricades, then run north-west until you reach two solid doors. Use the western door to unlock a shortcut back to the Black Knight Catacombs' exit
* Enter the northern door to the Dark Squall's inner base.
* Search the wardrobe north of the entrance for a second set of elite black armour to give to Silif.
* Search the wardrobe to the south of the room for the Dark Squall's robes.
* Search the table with the lobster and restore potion to obtain the two items. If you have an additional three inventory spaces, take the strange teleorb alongside the death and law rune; otherwise, you can take them later.
* Search the key rack in the north wall for a cell key.
* Head back and use the long, eastern path and attempt to open the gate to Silif's cell.
* Use the lobster (any food works) and restore potion on Silif.
* Talk to Silif until you give him the elite black armour. You can equip the Dark Squall's robes now if needed and simply give Silif your set.
* With Silif following you, head back to the Dark Squall's inner base.
* Go to the Map board to the south, few steps east of the entrance and Silif will notice the map boards on the wall. Finish the conversation for a teleorb.
* With the Dark Squall's robes equipped, climb up the ladder at the eastern side of the room. Be prepared for a boss fight. (You can prepare and re-enter the Black Knights' Fortress by wearing the Dark Squall's robes and also prevent enemy aggression).
* Defeat Surok with Magic (He CANNOT BE FOUGHT with other styles). He has 450 Hitpoints and is immune to powered staves, so you cannot use weapons such as the trident of the seas and warped sceptre. Pray Protect from Magic to reduce damage taken. He still does chip damage, so take some food. 10-15 karambwans and 1 prayer pot is enough. Surok follows the same attack pattern as Vorkath, performing 6 regular attacks before using one of the special attacks below for every 7th attack.
** Henchmen: Surok will call in a subordinate that will attempt to bind player. The "agile" subordinate should be bound and the "strong" subordinate should be weakened via Weaken, or Surok will launch a spell that deals 40+ damage. Alternatively, his subordinate can be Entangled then killed before reaching the player.
** Explosive: Surok will throw an explosive orb around the player. This must be telegrabbed and then alched, or it will explode and deal 45+ damage. Picking it up will cause it to immediately explode.
** Surge attack: Surok will cast 1-4 elemental surges at the player. To nullify these attacks, the player must cast a spell of the opposite element on the incoming attack (ie. air for earth, water for fire, earth for air, and fire for water). Otherwise, they will deal significant damage (45+).
* Once defeated, plant the orb on Surok. 
* Finish the conversation and return to Akrisae at White Knights' Castle.
* Wear the Dark Squall's robes and enter the jail cell.
* If you didn't do so earlier, take the strange teleorb alongside the death and law rune from the desks downstairs.
* Run to the middle of the room and activate the strange teleorb whilst standing within the magic circle to teleport to Lucien's camp.
* Run along the north-east path until you are across the Chaos Temple, then climb up the ice wall and jump to the ledge. This will not take you into the Wilderness, and your items are safe.
* Walk towards the eastern side of the Chaos Temple's roof to view the cutscene.
* After the cutscene, return to White Knights' Castle.

* Talk to Idria.
* Head to the Chasm of Tears and speak to Movario whilst wearing the Dark Squall's robes.
* Use a lit sapphire lantern on a light creature to be transported into the chasm.
* Search the nearby skeletal remains for the following items: a spade, a hammer, and a chisel.
* Use the spade on the pile of rocks to uncover a brazier, then use the chisel on it to obtain a fire orb.
* Head further west and do the same to the lone pile of rocks for an earth orb.
* Head directly south, and use a chisel on the intact brazier there for an air orb.
* Head east, and use a chisel on the intact brazier there for a water orb.
* Head all the way south to reach three skull cavities.
* Examine each recessed block and use the each of the three corresponding orbs on them for the matching elemental block. (The first three recessed blocks are found right next to the cavity entrances)
* Climb up the walls next to the centre skull to find the last recessed block, and use the fourth orb on it for the block.
* Head back down and unequip items from your weapon and shield slots.
* Enter each of the skull nose cavities and crawl to the end, using the correct key on the door lock, based on its examine text. The specific positions are individual to each player.
* Climb back up to the fourth skull. Use the fire block on the recessed block.
* Inspect the stone cube and enter the cave opening in the skull. Drop the tools you obtained earlier if more space is needed.
* Make your way south to the central chamber where the stone table is found, split into multiple forked paths leading to statues.
* Search the skeleton to receive a silver sickle (b) and six druid pouches.
* There are 13 possible statues, with 8 being found at the end of these paths, differing between players. 
* Along the paths, use the druid pouch on the druid spirits to receive herblore ingredients that are used for a statue. These are a one-off reward, so make sure to have plenty of inventory space to pick them all up. If you run out of charges, cast Bloom while standing on the vines to get vine flowers for more charges. 
* Examine the statues and use the corresponding ingredients on them, using the table below. The druid spirits should give you the exact amount of ingredients needed.
** If you mess up or accidentally use the wrong working combination, teleport out to bank, teleport back to Tears of Guthix and finish the remaining statues.
* Once you receive all eight dolmens, use them on the stone table to open the huge door. ( you can use them one at a time to free up inventory space )

*Leave the temple and prepare for the last fight battles ahead. Bank the Dark Squall's robes and bring your best gear.
*Bring:
**Equipment for all 3 combat styles
**3-4 super restores
**1 Menaphite remedy (one dose before the fight begins and a second dose if you need more time)
**10-12 combo food (sharks and karambwan are fine)
**A sapphire lantern to attract a light creature to enter the chasm
**An emergency teleport (not runes, as the Elemental can lower your magic to 1 if you run out of supplies)
* Proceed past the huge door until you reach the Mysterious Stone.
* Upon arriving in the room, a small cutscene will happen and the fight with the Balance Elemental will then begin. It can use a magical, stat-lowering attack after every 3-4 attacks, then proceeding to change attack styles based on the player's protection prayer.
* Fight overview: 
** Fiery / Orange -> attacks with Ranged
** Airy / White -> attacks with Melee
** Watery / Blue -> attacks with Magic
** The Elemental will start praying against your attack styles at 50% of its hitpoints.
** At 25% the Elemental will attack faster, harder and have double prayers up. Be sure to correctly pray against the style it uses, since it can hit high 30s on a 2-tick speed attack whilst switching attack styles as well.
**Make sure you drink your restores if the Elemental reduces your stats or bring a menaphite remedy and drink it before the fight starts so it will restore your stats when weakened.
**It is recommended that you use one of the pillars at 25% since you can exchange hits 1:1 and take your time to have the right prayer protection up. Or focus on prayers first, and then your switches, as you only have 1 tick to react. If the attack hits you off prayer it will drain your stats and prayer. (You are able to use the pillar the entire fight if you are a lower level/hardcore who is worried about death)
* If you die while fighting the Balance Elemental, your grave will appear at the top of the chasm at Tears of Guthix.
* Upon defeating it, search the Stone again to view a cutscene.
* Fight the two Tormented Demons alongside the Guardians of Armadyl.
** They are surrounded by a flame shield that reduces damage done by non-demonbane weapons/spells and non-abyssal weapons by 20%, though this should not be an issue for this fight thanks to the extremely high boost from the Stone of Jas.
** They can use protection prayers, switching prayers after taking a certain amount of damage.
** They can also switch attack styles based on the player's protection prayers every 16 seconds or so.
** Sitting behind the south-western column and waiting for the Guardians of Armadyl to finish off the demons is viable and completely removes any combat from the encounter if you do so wish. (Slow, but completely safe for HCIM)
* Upon defeating the demons, speak to Idria and have her teleport you to White Knights' Castle.
* Speak to Idria again to complete the quest.
* Congratulations, quest complete!

* Talk to Patzi to start the quest.
* Break into the house north of Patzi, west of the general store, via the southern House Window. Wait for the guard to move away. 
* Take uniform from the wardrobe on the ground floor
* Speak to Patzi again 
** Make sure to finish the dialogue, otherwise you cannot continue the quest

* Equip both pieces of the uniform.
* Head east up the stone steps, then south and speak to the Head Butler to enter the house. He will hold onto all of your items in the meantime.
* Speak to Patzi
* Speak to Constantinius, Cozyac, Pavo and Xocotla
* Speak with Patzi again

* Enter the cellar entrance. It is located just outside of the house, immediately north of the house's east exit.
* Go all the way south and investigate the Antique wine against the wall.
* Check on the man on the south end of the room to the east.

* Speak to Constantinius, Cozyac, Pavo and Xocotla.
* Head back inside the wine cellar and investigate:
** Jug by the stairs
** South room's Small box
** South room's Broken stool
** East room's Broken pottery
** East room's Livius, on the floor
** East room's Wine storage, by the exit

* Speak to the guards Stradius and Hutza to discuss your clues.
* Pickpocket Adala, Patzi, Constantinius, Cozyac, Pavo and Xocotla.
* Inspect the Wine labels, Threatening note, Shipping contract and Drinking flask
* Speak to one of the guards, either Stradius or Hutza.
* Speak to all the suspects, then accuse Adala, and she'll fight you (level 49). Once defeated, she'll claim she's too weak to have killed anyone.

* Once Adala has been taken away, speak to Stradius, then head back to the ground floor, south to the cliff, round and climb up the Loose rocks shortcut, and speak to Stradius again.
* Head down the stairs to the east, enter the backstage entrance, and question the Costumer.
* Search the crate next to the stairs to discover it is full of poison.
* Search the bookshelf on the west wall to uncover a secret passage to the wine cellar.
* Search the costume rack along the north wall to discover a wine-stained costume.
* Ask the Costumer about the actors, hidden passage, stained costume and the poison.
* Go up the stairs and speak to Stradius again. Accuse Naiatli.
* Confront Naiatli on stage and attack her when she runs away.
* Speak to Stradius or Hutza to end the quest.

* Speak to the Head Butler after the quest to claim a range of masks, and the Butler's tray.
* Speak to the Costumer after the quest to claim your Costume needle.
* Pickpocket Constantinius for a chest key. After using it to open the fancy chest in the south room of the cellar, the fountain to the south-west of Villa Lucens can be searched to find an icon.
* Use the icon on the statue at the most north-eastern tip of Aldarin (Statue Holds bowl of blue fluid), and get your reward. (1 water rune, Pendant of ates teleport location)

* Talk to Emelio in south-east Outer Fortis
* Talk to the Spice Merchant in the Bazaar about missing delivery
* Open the box using the code 2546.
* Talk to Alba at the north of Ortus Farm just outside the western entryway of the city. In the building north of the Buffalo pen.
* Go west of the farm to the wolf den and inside the cave and kill the Dire Wolf Alpha. Bring food, as this fight takes place in a multicombat area with both melee and magic damage being dealt simultaneously.
* Return to Alba.
* Return to Emelio
* Talk to Emelio again and give him these numbers:
** 4 portions of meat
** 2 portions of salad
** 1 portion of spice
** 3 portions of sauce
* Give the test kebab to Vincens, Renata or Lucas outside.
* Talk to Emelio again.
* Talk to Lelia inside the Fortis Colosseum. She can be found in the southern room.
* Fight and defeat the Minotaur.
** Protect from Melee. When he says "Moo!" switch to Protect from Magic. 
** When he says "Moooo!", he will attack 1 tick faster.
** If you die or escape, talk to Lelia to re-enter the fight.
** Occasionally, the Minotaur will yell "moo" and attack with Melee.
* Talk to Lelia after defeating the minotaur.
* Talk to Emelio to finish the quest.

* Talk to Prince Itzla Arkan at the Teomat to start the quest. 
* Talk to him again after the cutscene.
* Travel to the Quetzacalli Gorge (There is a Quetzal landing site that is automatically unlocked).
* Talk to the bartender in the south-west pub and ask to rent the room for 30 coins. 
* Enter the south-eastern room in the same building (there is no basement) and rest on the bed.
* Talk to the Prince.
* Talk to the shopkeeper in the general store east of the pub about help. 
* Return to the rented room in the pub and talk to the Prince again.
* Go through the large gate to the north and run all the way east to the Tower of Ascension and talk to the Prince  (just outside the entrance to the tower with the dungeon icon on the minimap).
** Optionally, build the Unbuilt Landing Site in the Salvager Overlook on your way there if you haven't already done so.
* Talk to the nearby recruits, Nova, Sergius, Felius, and Caritta.
* Talk to the Prince again  (make sure you don't have a pet following you, or you'll be unable to proceed)
* Enter the tower to the west and talk to Forebearer Janus and climb the stairs.

* Pickpocket the Emissary Ascended in the caged area on the for a tower key.
* Use the key to open the south-eastern gate, open the chest to receive a book and scrap of paper
* Open the south-western chest with a keyword. The solution is different for each player.
**  The solution can be found by connecting the first letter of each highlighted word in the book
* Read the poem, then talk to Prince Itzla
* Open the north-western chest with the code, the code is unique for each person.
** Transcribe the marked words from the poem into directions: Takam: East, Makt: North, Silam: West, Uitt: South
* Combine the scraps of paper to reveal the passcode.
* Speak the passcode to Forebearer Janus on the current floor. Do not go downstairs to speak with him as this will reset the trial.

* This is a wave-based combat trial, with melee and mage enemies attacking two at a time, then four at a time. Some of them do a 3x3 AOE attack which can be dodged. Use the bandages from the medical boxes around the room to heal Prince Itzla by left click Healing him during the fight as needed.
* Speak to Forebearer Janus again to start the next trial.

*Talk to the prince
* You must question each member of the cult to work out who the traitor is. Choose the person who mentions anything about Mictl as this is not part of the Emissaries' beliefs.
* Once you question each one, you'll be given the option to accuse them while talking to them. 
** If none of the members are the traitor you may need to exit and re-enter the floor.

* Go up the stairs.
* Fight Prince Itzla. 
** Pray melee against his basic attacks.
**He has two special attacks, both of which he warns you about. The sword swipe turns off any protection prayers, but you can turn them straight back on. The other is an AOE attack, once he warns you he is going to do it, run behind him immediately to dodge.
**He is immune to special attacks.
* Talk to Forebearer Janus.
* Search the chest south to obtain a set of emissary robes.
* Equip the emissary robes, speak to Prince Itzla to have him follow you, and then enter the temple to the east.
* After the cutscene, speak with Prince Itzla and then speak with Forebearer Fides.
* Enter the ruins south of the temple and go down the stairs.

* Take a pickaxe from the barrel near the entrance.
* Mine the rocks.
* Run past the Frost Nagua and the spikes (you can run past them by run-tricking) and pull the first lever.
* Climb-Down the Ledge, run past the frost crabs while avoiding the traps. 
** Throughout the cave, several traps deal 10 Hitpoints of damage. You can avoid them or tank the damage.
* Slide along the icy ledge, and then enter the room in the north-east and pull the second lever.
* Continue through the cave and jump over the frozen platforms to get to the west side. 
* Climb down another ledge, and run into the north-western room with stone chests to pull the third lever
* Walk south-west to the large gate and pull the fourth lever located on the northern wall next to the gate. Note: If you forgot a lever, not all braziers will be lit and the gate will be closed.
** Pull the chain before continuing, as this will allow you to climb up and down it in the future.

* Walk west through the gate and search urns to collect three coloured icons. 
** Level 104 Frost Nagua will continue to spawn and attack you while searching. Protect from Magic will negate the damage from their regular attacks.
* Fix the broken statues in the western area with the corresponding coloured icons.
* Inspect the four markings in the four corners of the area. The first word describes the order in which to activate the four statues to open the frozen door.
** Different for every player: check the murals and they will have Zema (1), Oma (2), Yeya (3), or Naui (4). Touch the statues in the order determined by the markings (1-4).
* Go through the door, prepared to fight the final boss.

* Fight the Amoxliatl.
** Pray magic
** Step away from the spikes
** Avoid standing on the ice pools
** Re-enable protect from mage when it is disabled
** The blocks she summons will deal area damage and heal her, melee them to destroy them. (higher level players can leave these and just attack with fire spells) 
* Head to the Sunrise Palace and speak to Servius, Teokan of Ralos to finish up the quest.

* Inspect the empty display case in the north-east corner of the Grand Museum in Civitas illa Fortis to start the quest
* Talk to Curator Herminius in the middle of the museum. Talk about the empty display case
* Investigate the tools behind the display case.
* Inspect the display case again.
* Talk to the citizens, academics, and tourists around the room about their suspicions until one mentions a mysterious individual.
* Talk to Regulus Cento by the quetzals south-west of the museum
* Go east and talk to a Trader Crewmember (charter ship crewmember) about the suspicious man (1 inventory space required) 
* Go to the crafting shop south-east and get the sail repaired by Artima
* Go back to the Trader Crewmember and talk about the suspicious man again
* Head to Port Sarim talk to Trader Stan or any of the Trader Crewmembers who are located at the most south dock
* Talk to Betty in the runeshop in north-west Port Sarim
* Read the note you receive
* Talk to Curator Haig Halen in Varrock Museum about Xerna's Diadem - Option 2 if Bone Voyage is complete
* Pickpocket him for the storeroom key.
* Open the storeroom in the north-east part of the museum and search the crates.
* Go back and talk to Haig Halen selecting option 1 to begin the scene - Option 2 if Bone Voyage is complete
* Select options that will shame Haig Halen
* Return to the Grand Museum in Civitas illa Fortis and talk to Curator Herminius to complete the quest

* Head to Uzer Oasis and talk to Elias White. The quickest way to reach it is via fairy ring code .
* Enter the Uzer Mastaba to the south, on top of the hill.
* Head immediately south to the cave beyond the first room. Search the southernmost skeleton for a mastaba key.
* Head to the central room with the stone boat. Search the skeleton north-west of it for a second mastaba key.
* Head to the south-easternmost part of the area, and search the odd markings on the wall to disable a set of traps, then pull the lever.
* Head to the north-easternmost part of the area (east of the imposing doors) and do the same.
* Open the imposing doors to the west and kill the golem guard. When the game screen shakes, it will stand in place and perform a prayer-piercing attack that hits up to 28 three times in succession. Simply move one tile away from the golem to avoid this.
* Climb the stairs and cross the coloured tiles by walking over either the blue and green or yellow and red tiles on the south side; if the wrong pair of tiles are stepped on after starting the crossing, the player will take moderate damage.
* Pull the lever on the other side of the coloured tiles to disable them.
* Enter the burial chamber and search the shelves in the north of the room to get a canopic jar.
* Enter the room to the south with the Tumeken statue and inspect the southern mural.
* Use 3 dwellberries on the canopic jar, then use the ring of life on it afterward.
* You can log out and log back in to quickly exit the mastaba.

* Talk to Elias.
* Make your way to Trollheim. Take the path just northwest of Trollheim (towards the ice gate), then enter the Trollweiss Dungeon directly west of the ice gate. Activate Protect from Melee. 
* Follow the tunnel north until you can enter a crevasse to get to the summit of Trollweiss Mountain. Once you've exited the crevasse, run directly east and enter the cave.
* Mine the rubble within the caves to clear the path. Each pile of rubble can only be mined once from each side, so you may have to run around the cave to mine the same rubble from different directions in order to clear it.
* Mine your way to the end of the dungeon, then head up the stairs and speak to Arrav.
* Use the unlocked door in the east and search the tapestry in the room for the base plans and base key.

* Head back to Elias at the Uzer Oasis with the plans and key.
* Make your way to the entrance of Zemouregal's Base north of the Digsite and talk to Elias again.
* Enter the base and run through the dungeon until you reach the kitchen (marked by the Cooking range icon.png icon). Enter the kitchen through the gate.
* Wear your insulated boots, then enter the sewer system via the pipe on the southern wall.
* Enter the other end of the pipe at the very end of the path.
* Head into the southern room and search the western table for some decoder strips.
* Open the chest for the code key. Read it and take note of the four-letter code.
* Head back and attempt to open the metal doors to the east. 
*Enter your code key in order on the decoder strips in the interface that pops up. 
**Each strip will be associated with a number, 0-9, and will have an order, 1-4 on the left hand side of the strip. Use the up and down arrows to enter the number, using the right arrow to enter each number once picked.
* Equip your crossbow and mith grapple, then click on the metal bars above the fire traps to climb over them.
* Attempt to take Arrav's heart to begin a cutscene, after which you'll fight him. Activate Protect from Melee to reduce his damage.
** Every three attacks, Arrav will swing his axe in the direction he's facing, dealing up to 26 damage; move adjacent or behind him and resume attacking. You can also unequip your weapon and position yourself to face Arrav whilst being behind the axe; this results in you catching the axe and dealing additional damage.
** Armoured zombies will also spawn with 10 Hitpoints each, leaving behind venom pools wherever they walk. Stepping on these will inflict venom and deal up to 4 damage every tick if not moving.
* Upon defeating Arrav, finish watching the cutscene and the ensuing dialogue afterward to complete the quest.

* Pickpocket Constantinius for a chest key.
* Open the fancy chest in the Villa's wine cellar.
* Search the south-western fountain near the Villa.

*Complete Tutorial Island.
*(Optional) If you want an easier and safer early game, consider utilizing the boneyard method or early blue dragons (slower but less tedious) to get 43 Prayer right at the start of your account. The guide is written assuming you don't do this so if you want to jump right into the action you can skip it. 
*Speak with Father Aereck at the church in Lumbridge to start The Restless Ghost.
*Sell everything to Lumbridge General Store but your:
**Bucket
**Pot
**Coins
*Buy a bucket and spade from the general store. You should have 2 buckets total.
*Head north to Fred the Farmer's chicken coop and pick up an egg from one of the spawn locations.
*Head north-west and pick some wheat from the field.
*Grind the wheat into a pot of flour at the mill north-east.
*Fill your buckets with milk from the dairy cow north of the mill.
*Head south and start X Marks the Spot by speaking with Veos in the pub.
*Head back south to the castle area and complete the first 2 clues for the X Marks the Spot quest.
*Return to Lumbridge Castle and speak with the cook to complete the Cook's Assistant quest.
*Speak with Duke Horacio to start Rune Mysteries and receive an air talisman.
*Continue south-west to Lumbridge Swamp and speak with Father Urhney to continue The Restless Ghost and receive the ghostspeak amulet.
*Grab the leather gloves from their spawn location in Father Urhney's house. Equip the gloves and the ghostspeak amulet.
*Head to the south-east side of the Lumbridge Swamp and complete Misthalin Mystery.
*Destroy the notes. Drop the knife and tinderbox. Keep the bucket of water, and gems.
*Head back north to the Lumbridge graveyard. Open the coffin and speak with the ghost to continue The Restless Ghost.
*Sell the uncut gems to Lumbridge General Store.
*Inventory check:

*Head west and then south to the Wizards' Tower.
*Enter the basement and speak with Archmage Sedridor to continue Rune Mysteries and get the research package.
*Enter the room to the east and search the altar for the Ghost's Skull to continue The Restless Ghost. Run from the skeleton.
*Leave the Wizards' Tower. Head north and dig for the third clue in Draynor Village to continue X Marks the Spot.
*Enter the house north-west and speak to Morgan to start Vampyre Slayer. Do not worry about the garlic for now.
*Head into the pig pen in the market and dig the fourth clue for X Marks the Spot.
*Continue west then south to Port Sarim and speak with Veos to complete X Marks the Spot.
*Drop the spade and the clue. Save the antique lamp for later.
*Head west and buy an eye of newt from Betty's Magic Emporium.
*Head south and buy a raw sardine from Gerrant's Fishy Business.
*Continue heading south and buy from Wydin's Food Store.
**1 cheese
**3 redberries
**1 raw beef
*Head west and pick 3 onions from the patch north of Rimmington.
*Head south and complete Witch's Potion.
**Use the raw beef on the nearby range or fireplace to obtain burnt meat. If you successfully cook the raw beef, use the cooked meat on the fire again to burn it.
*Head north into Falador. Speak with Wyson the gardener in Falador Park and buy 2 woad leaves.
*Go to Falador Castle and speak with the Squire to begin The Knight's Sword.
*Minigame teleport to Soul Wars. Exit the portal.
*Walk south to Barbarian Village.
*Complete the Stronghold of Security to receive 10,000 coins. (Level 3 Stronghold is as far as you need to go for the coins)
**You can pick up a few cooked meat in north barbarian village for food.
**You don't need fighting boots or fancy boots, but you are welcome to get either one. 
*Head east and speak to Gertrude to start Gertrude's Cat.
*Pick up a doogle leaf south of Gertrude's house and use it on your raw sardine.
*Head into Varrock Square and buy a staff of fire from Zaff and equip it.
*Speak with Wilough in the north-east section of the square. Pay him for information to continue Gertrude's Cat.
*Head north-east and speak with Marlo near the Estate Agent to start Daddy's Home.
*Pick up a Saw from the spawn near Marlo
* Make a small detour and complete the Natural history quiz.
*Buy a hammer from Varrock General Store.
*Head south to the Blue Moon Inn and buy a beer for Dr Harlow to continue Vampyre Slayer. Make sure you get the stake from Dr Harlow.
*Head to Old Man Yarlo in the house east of the Blue Moon Inn.
*Speak with Old Man Yarlo, then remove his old furniture. 
*Speak with him again and go through the cutscene. 
*After the cutscene search the crates for 3 waxwood logs.
*Head north-east out of Varrock to the Sawmill.
*Speak to the Sawmill operator and get 3 waxwood planks.
*Buy 5 bolt of cloth and 100 steel nails from the sawmill operator.
**You will likely need to hop worlds for the nails. 
*Complete the lumberyard section of Gertrude's Cat.
*Drop the empty bucket.
*Head back into varrock to Old Man Yarlo's house.
*Build his carpet and bed. 
*Head east to Aubury's Rune Shop and give the research package to Aubury to continue Rune Mysteries.
**Make sure to speak with him twice to get the notes.
*Head back north-east to the Lumberyard.
*Pick up 10 logs from the spawns.
*Speak with the sawmill operator and make 10 planks.
*Head back into varrock to Old Man Yarlo's house.
*Build the rest of his furniture.
*Speak with Old Man Yarlo.
*Head north to Marlo and complete Daddy's home.
*Drop the Construction Guide.
*Head west into castle and speak with Reldo and continue The Knight's Sword.
*Pick up a pie dish from the kitchen to the east.
*Head south to the general store. 
*Open Marlo's Crate.
*Sell items to the general store. If you don't hop worlds for the cloth and planks you will be short on money later. 
**4 bolts of cloth
**5 oak planks
**The 5 steel bars
**The 50 mithril nails
*Hop worlds, then sell the remaining 4 bolts of cloth and 5 oak planks.
*Head south-east to Aubury and buy
**300 mind runes
**600 air runes
**100 water runes
**200 earth runes.
*Head back out west of varrock and complete Gertrude's Cat.
**Keep the food, but not the kitten. 
*Inventory check:

*Home teleport to Lumbridge.
*Go to the Lumbridge graveyard and complete The Restless Ghost. Keep the ghostspeak amulet.
*Head to Bob's Brilliant Axes and buy a steel axe from Bob.
*Head west to the Wizards' Tower and finish Rune Mysteries. Drop the air talisman.
*Go north into Draynor Village.
*Have Aggie make you a yellow dye, a red dye, and a blue dye. Use the ingredients on her to make them faster.
**Use the red and yellow dye together to make orange dye.
*Buy a few jugs of wine from Fortunato at Draynor Seed Market. Five jugs should be enough with your other food.
**Make sure to hold on to at least 1 of these jugs as you will need it later.
*Buy the Chronicle from Diango and 3 teleport cards. Equip the Chronicle.
*Enter Morgan's house and search the cupboards upstairs for garlic.
*Run north to Draynor Manor.
*Enter the manor and go down the stairs to the east.
*Defeat Count Draynor using Magic spells. 
** Safespot him in the corner: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ACUWxB0Skyo
*Drop the garlic.
*Use a teleport to house tab, then exit your house.
*Use up the noted planks by unnoting them at Phials and building chairs in your house.
**This will take a few trips, you can drop some items for a short time for extra space.
**You only really need level 10 Construction so if you run out of nails before all your planks get used that is fine if you got level 10. 
*Exit your house, drop the extra nails, hammer, and saw. 
*Head east to Port Sarim.
*Buy one redberries and a pot of flour from Wydin's Food Store.
*Make a redberry pie
**Use the pot of flour with your bucket of water to create pastry dough.
**Use the pastry dough on your pie dish to make a pie shell.
**Use the redberry on the pie shell to make an uncooked berry pie.
**Head north and cook the pie on the range.
***If you burn the pie, empty the pan and repeat the steps from before to try again. There is a water source for the bucket to the north.
*Drop the pot(s) and empty bucket once you have the redberry pie.
*Go to Wydin's Food Store and buy one raw beef.
**(Optional) Buy 1-2 extra cheese in case you make a mistake during Witch's House.
*Kill a giant rat to the west. Take the raw rat meat.
*Head south to Thurgo. Give him the pie and speak with him to continue The Knight's Sword.
*Use a teleport to house tab and exit your house.
*Take a boat to Ardougne from Captain Barnaby in Rimmington (not the charter ships in Port Sarim) for 30 coins.
*Kill a chicken to the east and take the raw chicken.
*Head north and safespot a bear. Take the raw bear meat.
*If you are low on food buy some cake at the stall in Ardougne
*Use the Falador teleport tab.
*Return to Falador Castle. Talk to the squire to continue The Knight's Sword.
*Go upstairs and take the portrait for The Knight's Sword.
*Run north to the Goblin Village and complete Goblin Diplomacy. 3 crates in the area have the goblin mail needed.
*Drop the gold bar.
*Head west to Taverley and complete Witch's House. Drop the leather gloves and 2 keys afterwards.
** First 2 forms safespot: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bDB351j-qZI&t=180s
*Complete Druidic Ritual.
**Use all random event lamps on Herblore from now on.
*Use the antique lamp from X Marks the Spot on Herblore.
*Use a teleport to house tab, then exit your house.
*Head to the peninsula to the west of the Crafting Guild. Pick up one snape grass.
*Head south to Rimmington and take a boat to Ardougne from Captain Barnaby.
*Inventory check:

*Fill your empty jug at the sink just west of the boat.
*Head to the chapel.
*Complete Sheep Herder.
*Drop the plague clothes and cattleprod.
*Buy an iron axe and a rope from Aemad's Adventuring Supplies, south of the church.
** You cannot use the steel axe with only 1 Woodcutting! 
*Chop a tree for some logs.
*Drop the iron axe.
*Run west across the bridge, then south of the castle.
*Complete Hazeel Cult. Side with Hazeel.
*Drop the key and the mark.
*Head south-east and complete Monk's Friend.
*If you are low on food, go steal some cakes in the market. 
*Head south-west and complete Fight Arena.
*Drop the armour from Fight Arena.
*Run east to Port Khazard and sell the law runes and buy a tinderbox at the general store. 
*Chop and burn logs in the area with your steel axe until you reach 30 Firemaking. Drop your remaining food for inventory space.
*Buy swamp paste from the general store.
*Take the boat at the Ardougne docks back to Rimmington.
*Go to Betty's Magic Emporium and buy 300 mind runes and 600 air runes.
*Take the boat back to Ardougne.
*Head to Witchaven and complete Sea Slug.
**(Optional) Buy a small fishing net from the fishing shop and complete the medium diary step during the completion of Sea Slug.
*Head north to the Temple of Ikov (dungeon) and pick up the Boots of Lightness. Wear them.
** Your steel axe is the slash weapon for the web.
*Return to Ardougne and sell the pearls to the general store.
*Drop the torch, sticks, glass, and small fishing net (if you picked one up earlier). 
*Steal cakes until 25 Thieving.
**Complete Tribal Totem once you have 21 Thieving for a bit of quick xp.
**Keep 8 cakes for some food.
*Head north and complete Dwarf Cannon until you have to visit Ice Mountain. Captain Lawgof will provide a hammer at the start of the quest.
*Head north to the Barbarian Outpost.
*Speak with Captain Cain to unlock the minigame teleport to Barbarian Assault. (Say you are an expert already.)
*Run south and start Waterfall Quest.
*Complete Waterfall Quest until you have to visit Tree Gnome Village.
*Drop the book you obtained.
*Run south then west and enter the Gnome Stronghold.
*Run north and speak to King Narnode to start the The Grand Tree.
*Go upstairs, then head west and north to find Hudo.
*Buy from Hudo:
**1 dwellberries
**1 bucket of milk
**1 chocolate dust 
*Be careful not to eat the dwellberries.
*Use the chocolate dust on the bucket of milk.
*Use your snape grass on the bucket of chocolate milk to make the hangover cure.
*Minigame teleport to the Fishing Trawler.
*Run south towards Yanille.
*Head to the island to the east of Yanille.
*Go upstairs in the building and speak with Hazelmere to continue The Grand Tree. 
*Drop the translation book but keep the scroll.
*After getting the message, head to the Gnome Maze.
*Proceed through the maze and go down the ladder right before you get reach the railing in the center.
*Search the off-coloured crate in the east room for a key.
*Use the key on the door to the west path and speak to Golrie for Glarial's Pebble.
*Exit the dungeon.
*Squeeze through the railing to get into the center area of the maze.
*Complete Tree Gnome Village.
*Drop the gnome amulet.
*Use the spirit tree to teleport to The Battlefield of Khazard.
*Steal cakes if you are low on food from bakery stalls at the Ardougne Market. Get plenty, as you will soon be taking a lot of damage.
*Head north of the Flying Horse Inn and speak with Edmond.
*Complete Plague City.
*Read the scroll, drop the gas mask, hammer, spade, and empty bucket. 
*Buy another rope from the general store. 
*Inventory check

*Minigame teleport to Clan Wars.
*Exit the Ferox Enclave to the north, then pick up 2 iron bars from their spawn location to the north-west. Hop worlds to circumvent the respawn time.
**This is dangerous, but the chances of dying are low. Pick up the bars on free-to-play worlds for safety.
*Return to Ferox Enclave when you have the bars.
*Switch back to a pay-to-play world and home teleport.
*Go to the Lumbridge basement and pick up a cabbage.
*Use a teleport to house tab, pick up the bronze pickaxe spawn in the nearby building.
*Head south to the Asgarnian Ice Dungeon.
*Travel through the dungeon and mine a blurite ore.
**Beware of the monsters. If you need food, buy some from Wydin's Food Store in Port Sarim.
*Speak with Thurgo west of the dungeon to get the blurite sword.
*Drop the bronze pickaxe.
*Head north to Falador.
*Head to the castle and speak to the squire to complete The Knight's Sword.
*Climb the stairs to the west twice and speak to Sir Amik Varze to start Black Knights' Fortress.
*Chronicle teleport to the Champions' Guild.
*Head north to Horvik's Armour Shop at Varrock Square and buy an iron chainbody from Horvik.
*Run west to Barbarian Village.
*Buy a bronze med helm from Peska. Equip it, along with the iron chainbody.
*Head north then west to the dwarf base.
*Speak to Nulodion to continue Dwarf Cannon.
*Head north and complete Black Knights' Fortress until you must return to Falador.
*Drop the bronze med helm and the iron chainbody.
*Minigame teleport to Soul Wars.
*Exit the portal to Edgeville.
*Pull the wilderness lever twice to get to Ardougne.
*Pull the lever again, then back to Ardougne (lock in the diary task).
*Run north across the river.
*Climb the stairs to the top of the Tourist Information Centre.
*Place any combat items you have on the table in the south-east part of the room. This should be your runes, staff, and axe. 
**You could also just drop them in front of the tomb.
**These will stay on the table for up to 10 minutes since they are on a table rather than the ground.
**If you have boots from the Stronghold of Security, destroy them.
*Exit the building and run north east.
*Retrieve Glarial's urn and Glarial's amulet from Glarial's tomb.
*Go back and pick up your items from the table.
*Run back north-east and finish Dwarf Cannon.
*Head north and complete Waterfall.
*Drop the key, urn, rope, and pebble.
*Home teleport to Lumbridge. 
**If your teleport cooldown has not yet finished, chop and burn logs until it is. Alternatively, teleport with the Chronicle and walk to Lumbridge.
*Drop your tinderbox.
* Sell the diamonds and  gold bars to the general store, as well as the mithril seeds. 
*Inventory check.

*Head west to the jail east of Draynor Village.
*Pull up a timer. Set it for 60 minutes.
*Attack a guard. Do not kill him. Lure him a short distance away from the jail and let him kill you. You can pick some nettles to die quicker. (You are "death piling" for Recruitment Drive.)
**The death pile allows your items to remain on the ground for up to 60 minutes before despawning (Without other players being able to loot it). Use your timer to keep track of how long you have left. You should have plenty of time. The timer only runs when you are logged in.
*After dying, return to your deathpile and pick up your last house tablet.
*Use the teleport to house tab.
*Go to Falador Castle and speak to Sir Amike Varze to finish Black Knights' Fortress.
*Speak with him again to start Recruitment Drive.
*Drop the coins.
*Go to Falador Park and complete Recruitment Drive, sell the Initiate Sallet next time you're near a General Store.
*Head east from the park.
*Head north-east to the Dwarven Mine.
*In the mine, go north, west, south, then back up north to Nurmof's Pickaxe Shop.
*Buy a steel pickaxe from Nurmof.
*Mine 6 clay, 4 copper, and 2 iron ore. Rocks of each type can be found south-east of the shop.
*Exit the Dwarven Mine and north-west of Falador.
*Speak with Doric and complete Doric's Quest.
*Head west and die to a druid to get back to Lumbridge.
**If at any point during this guide you think you may have wasted money on something not specifically mentioned, you should probably just walk back to your death pile and keep the coins reward. The guide is extremely tight on money, and it is very easy to run out if any extra money was spent somewhere. 
*Pick up the knife in the kitchen.
*Collect your items from the death pile.
*Restock on wines if you are low on food. Leave 8 slots open.
*Buy a new Chronicle and a few charges. 3 should be fine.
*Head east to Lumbridge Castle.
*Cut trees and fletch the logs into 900 arrow shafts.
*Drop the knife and steel axe.
*Head east into Al-Kharid, then south to Shantay Pass.
*Buy 900 feathers from Shantay.
*Fletch 900 headless arrows to reach level 10 Fletching. Drop them afterwards.
*Complete The Tourist Trap. Buy the required items from Shantay.
**You should be able to tank and kill the captain with wines, but there is a safe spot if you are concerned. His max hit is 5.
**Put both skill rewards into Agility.
*Chronicle teleport.
*Head north to the Grand Exchange.
*Take the spirit tree in the north-east corner to the Gnome Stronghold.
*Head north and speak to King Narnode. Continue and complete The Grand Tree. Use a chronicle teleport to Varrock, then use the Grand Exchange Spirit tree again to get back from Karamja.
*Clean up your inventory:
*Getting Started Section final status check.
**If you did not start the guide from the beginning, this will let you know what is expected to have been completed.

*Quick check: 27 Quests completed, 51 quest points.
*Black Knights' Fortress
*Cook's Assistant
*Doric's Quest
*Goblin Diplomacy
*The Knight's Sword
*Misthalin Mystery
*The Restless Ghost
*Rune Mysteries
*Vampyre Slayer
*Witch's Potion
*X Marks the Spot
*Druidic Ritual
*Dwarf Cannon
*Fight Arena
*Gertrude's Cat
*The Grand Tree
*Hazeel Cult
*Monk's Friend
*Plague City
*Recruitment Drive
*Sea Slug
*Sheep Herder
*The Tourist Trap
*Tree Gnome Village
*Tribal Totem
*Waterfall Quest
*Witch's House
*Daddy's Home (Miniquest)
*Natural history quiz (Miniquest)

*Do Varrock Rooftop Course course until 40 Agility.
* Buy a mithril sword from the Varrock Swordshop.
*Home teleport
*Get a bronze pickaxe from the tower
*Head to Draynor Village and buy some wine, 10 should be enough.
* Buy 5 more charges for your Chronicle from Diango.
*Chronicle teleport.
*Complete Priest in Peril. Mine your own rune essence, 
**Just do 3 trips for the essence.
**Don't forget to grab a bucket during the quest. 
*Drop your fire staff, mithril sword, and extra food for weight. 
*Head into Canifis and do the Canifis Rooftop Course until 50 Agility.
**Do not stay at the Canifis course past level 50, it isn't worth the slower xp.
**You can wield the Wolfbane dagger to prevent yourself from attacking someone and making them a werewolf.
*Minigame teleport to Burthorpe Games Room and buy the some of the graceful outfit from Grace in the Rogues' Den.
*Head over to Falador and do the Falador Rooftop Course until 60 Agility.
*Minigame teleport to Burthorpe Games Room and buy some of the graceful outfit from Grace in the Rogues' Den.
*Head over to Seers' Village and do the Seers' Village Rooftop Course until you have 260 marks of grace (including those you have already spent on pieces).
**You can buy meat pies for a low price in the Seer's pub, as fail rate can be quite high at 60.
*Minigame teleport to Burthorpe Games Room and buy the full graceful outfit from Grace in the Rogues' Den.
*Clean up your inventory. Drop your runes and anything else you are holding on to in your inventory other than coins.
*Home teleport to Lumbridge and head to Shantay Pass.
*Buy waterskins(4) and a shantay pass. Leave 8 slots open for wine.
*Head into the desert, take the carpet to Pollnivneach, then fill your inventory with wine from the guy in the pub.
*Take the carpet to Nardah and head west to the Agility Pyramid.
*Do Agility Pyramid until you reach 70 Agility.
**When you need supplies walk to Nardah, take the carpet to Pollnivneach, buy waterskins from the general store, and wines in the bar. Adjust your waterskin/wine ratio as you level up. You can fill the waterskins to 4 at the fountain in the middle of town.
***Another option is simply buying choc-ice from Rokuh in Nardah, which weigh almost nothing and serve as both food and water.

*Clean out the waterskins and wines from your inventory. You should just have coins now, wearing your graceful.
*Home Teleport. Walk to Port Sarim. Take the boat to Kourend by speaking to Veos.
*Go to Hosidius. 
*Thieve fruit stalls until 30 Thieving. Save any strange fruit you get and use them as you go for energy.
**Optionally go to 43 Thieving instead so you don't have to come back later. The Feud should push you to 45 so you can blackjack once you get rogues.
*Chronicle teleport to Varrock and buy a fire staff, 200 mind and 400 air runes.
*Home teleport.
*Complete The Feud. Both fights can be safespotted. Buy wine for food from the bar. Look in the Discussion tab of this page if you don't know how to safespot the fights.
*Complete the rune section of Rogue Trader.
**Use the Runedoku plugin on Runelite for the puzzle (Plugin hub).
*Drop your mind runes for some space. 
*Buy runes from Ali. You can open large caskets from Ali using the Runeduku plugin to get cosmic runes faster. Buy all cosmic, law, and nature runes from the chests as they cost less this way.
**400 law runes.
**1,200 Nature runes.
**500 Cosmic runes.
**500 air runes.
**500 Earth Runes.
**500 Water Runes.
*Do Mage Training Arena for Bones to Peaches. Leave yourself 1 extra telekinetic, 1 alchemist, 1 Graveyard, and 15 Enchantment points. (You will want a mud rune later).
**Do the enchantment room with ruby enchant when you get the level for it.
**When you need to do the alchemist room, clan wars teleport and put your money in the bag there, then home teleport back to Mage Training Arena. Pick up your cash again once done with the room. Use low level alchemy, it is still great xp and gives the same points.
**201 Telekinetic points
**301 Alchemist points
**201 Graveyard points
**2,015 Enchantment points

*Clan wars teleport and do Last Man Standing until you can purchase a rune pouch. Given the current state of Last Man Standing (Bots everywhere) you should go into each game and try to win the first fight. If you win, hide/run until there are 9 people remaining then suicide. This gives 2 points per fight you win. It is not worth trying to win the match as you will eventually run into an overpowered bot almost every game. If at any point you fight a bot, just let it kill you and report it, it isn't worth the time to fight it.
**Even if you hate PvP, the rune pouch is an extremely important item for Ultimate Ironman that you will need eventually. The only other option for it is Slayer points boosting, which would be difficult this early in your account (You can't use the high level Slayer masters for points). 

*(Optional but recommended): Now that you have 55 Magic, you can do also do Last Man Standing for rune arrows to high level alchemy as you quest. This guide involves a lot of time walking, so this gives you something to do. How efficient doing this is depends on how many points you can get per hour. If you can get at least 15 points an hour, then this is a great way to make some extra cash and work on Magic xp (you need level 82 eventually). The guide will not be reminding you to do this, so it is on you.

**This quest's difficulty is very random depending on the items you have to collect. Some items are easy to collect while others are harder to obtain, such as a nature talisman.
***If you do happen to get tasked to collect a nature talisman, the most viable option is to do Enter the Abyss and kill the abyssal leechs or complete Temple of the Eye too and do Guardians of the Rift until you acquire 50 abyssal pearls from the rewards. There is a safespot for them at a specific part of the Abyss. Killing them is extremely difficult though as getting into the safespot is very hard with our current stats, and if you die there it will be difficult to get your items back. It is worthwhile to simply go off the guide path and get 43 Prayer now. Safespot blue dragons with fire strike then use the bones on the wilderness altar. Death pile your items to be safe when using the bones. This is a slow, but vastly better than wiping in the abyss. Note that you can also change your respawn location to Falador. You will also need to get some sort of prayer restoration since the Abyss drains your prayer. Starting Zogre Flesh Eaters is potential way to get this. Or just don't be unlucky next time.
